original: rigs kyi rtags kyi dge ba'i chos de dag dang ldan par 'gyur la /
analyzed: rigs kyi rtags kyi dge ba'i chos de dag dang ldan par 'gyur la /
translated: They are endowed with these virtuous qualities that are the signs of the family.

original: gang gi tshe nye ba'i nyon mongs pa can du gyur pa de'i tshe de dkar po'i chos de dag la yang mi snang la ngan song dag tu yang skabs 'ga' skye bar 'gyur ba'i nye ba'i nyon mongs pa bzhi po de dag dang ma bral ba ste /
analyzed: gang gi tshe nye ba'i nyon mongs pa can du gyur pa de'i tshe de dkar po'i chos de dag la yang mi snang la ngan song dag tu yang skabs 'ga' skye bar 'gyur ba'i nye ba'i nyon mongs pa bzhi po de dag dang ma bral ba ste /
translated: But when they become afflicted, they are not even interested in these virtuous qualities, and they are not free from the four secondary afflictions that sometimes cause them to be born in the lower realms.

original: dkar po'i chos dang mi mthun pa'i nye ba'i nyon mongs pa bzhi po de gang zhe na /
analyzed: dkar po'i chos dang mi mthun pa'i nye ba'i nyon mongs pa bzhi po de gang zhe na /
translated: What are the four secondary afflictions that are incompatible with virtuous qualities?

original: sngon bag med par gyur cing nyon mongs pa drag po dang / nyon mongs pa yun ring ba 'di ni nye ba'i nyon mongs pa dang po'o //
analyzed: sngon bag med par gyur cing nyon mongs pa drag po dang / nyon mongs pa yun ring ba 'di ni nye ba'i nyon mongs pa dang po'o //
translated: The first secondary affliction is to have previously been heedless, to have had strong afflictions, and to have had the afflictions for a long time.

original: blun zhing mi mkhas la sdig pa'i grogs po la brten pa 'di ni nye ba'i nyon mongs pa gnyis pa'o //
analyzed: blun zhing mi mkhas la sdig pa'i grogs po la brten pa 'di ni nye ba'i nyon mongs pa gnyis pa'o //
translated: The second secondary affliction is to be stupid, unskilled, and to rely on bad friends.

original: bla ma dang / rje dpon dang / rgyal po dang / chom rkun dang / phyir rgol ba la sogs pas nan gyis mnan te /
analyzed: bla ma dang / rje dpon dang / rgyal po dang / chom rkun dang / phyir rgol ba la sogs pas nan gyis mnan te /
translated: The third secondary affliction is to be forced by a guru, a master, a king, a thief, an adversary, and so on,

original: bdag la dbang med pa dang / sems 'khrul pa 'di ni nye ba'i nyon mongs pa gsum pa'o //
analyzed: bdag la dbang med pa dang / sems 'khrul pa 'di ni nye ba'i nyon mongs pa gsum pa'o //
translated: The absence of control over one's own mind and the confusion of the mind are the third secondary defilement.

original: yo byad med cing 'tsho ba la lta ba 'di ni nye ba'i nyon @112b mongs pa bzhi pa ste /
analyzed: yo byad med cing 'tsho ba la lta ba 'di ni nye ba'i nyon @112b mongs pa bzhi pa ste /
translated: The lack of material goods and the lack of concern for one's livelihood are the fourth secondary defilement.

original: nye ba'i nyon mongs pa bzhi po de dag dang ma bral ba'i phyir sgrib pa yongs su ma dag pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: nye ba'i nyon mongs pa bzhi po de dag dang ma bral ba'i phyir sgrib pa yongs su ma dag pa zhes bya'o //
translated: Because they are not free from these four secondary defilements, they are said to have 'unpurified obscurations'.

original: rgyud yongs su ma smin pa ni rgyud yongs su ma smin pa zhes bya bas bstan te /
analyzed: rgyud yongs su ma smin pa ni rgyud yongs su ma smin pa zhes bya bas bstan te /
translated: 'The mindstream that is not fully matured' is explained by 'the mindstream that is not fully matured'.

original: de yang byang chub sems dpa' rigs yang dag par bsgrub pa de nyid kyi gnas skabs na rigs la gnas shing /
analyzed: de yang byang chub sems dpa' rigs yang dag par bsgrub pa de nyid kyi gnas skabs na rigs la gnas shing /
translated: Moreover, the bodhisattva who has accomplished the lineage, in that very situation, abides in the lineage.

original: sgrib pa yongs su dag tu zin kyang /
analyzed: sgrib pa yongs su dag tu zin kyang /
translated: Even though the obscurations have been purified,

original: rgyu bzhis bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub thob par mi nus pa'i rgyud de dag dang ma bral ba ste /
analyzed: rgyu bzhis bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub thob par mi nus pa'i rgyud de dag dang ma bral ba ste /
translated: because they are not free from those mindstreams that are unable to attain unsurpassed perfect enlightenment due to four causes,

original: bzhi gang zhe na /
analyzed: bzhi gang zhe na /
translated: What are the four?

original: 'di la byang chub sems dpa' dang po nyid nas kyang dge ba'i bshes gnyen nam sangs rgyas sam byang chub sems dpa' byang chub kyi lam phyin ci ma log pa ston pa dang ma phrad pa 'di ni rgyu dang po'o //🔽gzhan yang byang chub sems dpa' dge ba'i bshes gnyen dang phrad du zin kyang byang chub sems dpa'i bslab pa dag la phyin ci log tu 'dzin cing phyin ci log tu slob pa 'di ni rgyu gnyis pa'o //🔽gzhan yang byang chub sems dpa'i dge ba'i bshes gnyen dang yang phrad la /
analyzed: 'di la byang chub sems dpa' dang po nyid nas kyang dge ba'i bshes gnyen nam sangs rgyas sam byang chub sems dpa' byang chub kyi lam phyin ci ma log pa ston pa dang ma phrad pa 'di ni rgyu dang po'o // gzhan yang byang chub sems dpa' dge ba'i bshes gnyen dang phrad du zin kyang byang chub sems dpa'i bslab pa dag la phyin ci log tu 'dzin cing phyin ci log tu slob pa 'di ni rgyu gnyis pa'o // gzhan yang byang chub sems dpa'i dge ba'i bshes gnyen dang yang phrad la /
translated: Here, the first cause is that the bodhisattva, from the very beginning, does not meet with a spiritual teacher, a Buddha or a bodhisattva who can show the unerring path to enlightenment.🔽The second cause is that, even if the bodhisattva does meet with a spiritual teacher, he or she misapprehends the bodhisattva trainings and trains in a distorted way.

original: byang chub sems dpa'i bslab pa dag la phyin ci log tu mi slob tu zin kyang sbyor ba de la sbyor ba g-yel zhing le lo byed pa yin te /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa'i bslab pa dag la phyin ci log tu mi slob tu zin kyang sbyor ba de la sbyor ba g-yel zhing le lo byed pa yin te /
translated: The third cause is that, even if the bodhisattva does meet with a spiritual teacher and does not misapprehend the bodhisattva trainings, he or she is lax and lazy in the practice of them.

original: shas cher rgyun du brtson pa dang mi ldan pa 'di ni rgyu gsum pa'o //
analyzed: shas cher rgyun du brtson pa dang mi ldan pa 'di ni rgyu gsum pa'o //
translated: He or she is not generally diligent and persistent.

original: gzhan yang byang chub sems dpa' dge ba'i bshes gnyen dang yang phrad la /
analyzed: gzhan yang byang chub sems dpa' dge ba'i bshes gnyen dang yang phrad la /
translated: Furthermore, a bodhisattva may have met with a spiritual master,

original: byang chub sems dpa'i bslab pa dag la yang phyin ci ma log par slob cing sbyor ba de dag la brtson 'grus brtsam du zin kyang /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa'i bslab pa dag la yang phyin ci ma log par slob cing sbyor ba de dag la brtson 'grus brtsam du zin kyang /
translated: and may be training without error in the bodhisattva trainings, and may be striving in those practices,

original: byang chub kyi phyogs kyi chos rnams yun ring du nyams 'og tu chud par ma byas pas dbang po yongs su ma smin pa dang byang chub kyi tshogs yongs su ma rdzogs pa 'di ni rgyu bzhi pa ste /
analyzed: byang chub kyi phyogs kyi chos rnams yun ring du nyams 'og tu chud par ma byas pas dbang po yongs su ma smin pa dang byang chub kyi tshogs yongs su ma rdzogs pa 'di ni rgyu bzhi pa ste /
translated: but if the faculties have not matured because the factors of enlightenment have not been cultivated for a long time, and the accumulations for enlightenment have not been completed, this is the fourth cause.

original: rgyu bzhi po de dag dang ma bral ba'i phyir rgyud yongs su ma smin pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: rgyu bzhi po de dag dang ma bral ba'i phyir rgyud yongs su ma smin pa zhes bya'o //
translated: Because they are not free from these four causes, it is called an unripened continuum.

original: sems ma bskyed pa ni mos pa mi mang bas bstan te /
analyzed: sems ma bskyed pa ni mos pa mi mang bas bstan te /
translated: The generation of the mind is taught by the lack of interest.

original: de yang byang chub sems dpa' rigs yang dag par bsgrubs nas rigs la gnas shing sgrib pa yongs su dag la rgyud yongs su smin du zin kyang /
analyzed: de yang byang chub sems dpa' rigs yang dag par bsgrubs nas rigs la gnas shing sgrib pa yongs su dag la rgyud yongs su smin du zin kyang /
translated: And even though a bodhisattva has accomplished the lineage, abides in the lineage, has purified obscurations, and has ripened the continuum,

original: de'i 'og tu dang po byang chub tu sems ma bskyed pa'i gnas skabs na byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyis mos pa'i khams sangs rgyas kyi chos rnams la thob par nus pas yid ches pas rab tu phye ba mos pa'i gnas @113a * //
analyzed: de'i 'og tu dang po byang chub tu sems ma bskyed pa'i gnas skabs na byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyis mos pa'i khams sangs rgyas kyi chos rnams la thob par nus pas yid ches pas rab tu phye ba mos pa'i gnas @113a * //
translated: After that, in the period when they have not yet aroused bodhicitta, bodhisattvas are able to acquire the element of interest in the Buddha's teachings and so they are classified according to their confidence.

original: brgyad po mchog gi gnas dang / rgya che ba'i gnas dang / zab pa'i gnas dang / rgyu rig pa'i gnas dang / 'bras bu rig pa'i gnas dang / rtogs par bya ba'i gnas dang / bsgrub par bya ba'i gnas dang / bshad par bya ba'i gnas dang /
analyzed: brgyad po mchog gi gnas dang / rgya che ba'i gnas dang / zab pa'i gnas dang / rgyu rig pa'i gnas dang / 'bras bu rig pa'i gnas dang / rtogs par bya ba'i gnas dang / bsgrub par bya ba'i gnas dang / bshad par bya ba'i gnas dang /
translated: There are eight levels of interest: the level of the supreme, the level of the vast, the level of the profound, the level of knowing the cause, the level of knowing the result, the level of what is to be understood, the level of what is to be accomplished and the level of what is to be explained.

original: dkon mchog gsum gyi yon tan dang / sangs rgyas dang byang chub sems dpa'i mthu dang / de kho na'i don dang / lam la gnas pa dang / 'bras bu thob pa dang / bla na med pa'i byang chub dang / byang chub sems dpa'i bslab pa dang /
analyzed: dkon mchog gsum gyi yon tan dang / sangs rgyas dang byang chub sems dpa'i mthu dang / de kho na'i don dang / lam la gnas pa dang / 'bras bu thob pa dang / bla na med pa'i byang chub dang / byang chub sems dpa'i bslab pa dang /
translated: The qualities of the Three Jewels, the powers of the buddhas and bodhisattvas, the meaning of thatness, abiding on the path, attaining the result, unsurpassable enlightenment and the bodhisattva training.

original: legs par gsungs pa'i chos mdo sde la sogs pa la mos pa'i khams brtas par byed pa'i rgyu gnyis po mos pa la goms pa lan mang du byed pa dang / bzod pa drag po med pas ma brtas pa ste /
analyzed: legs par gsungs pa'i chos mdo sde la sogs pa la mos pa'i khams brtas par byed pa'i rgyu gnyis po mos pa la goms pa lan mang du byed pa dang / bzod pa drag po med pas ma brtas pa ste /
translated: The cause for the growth of the element of devotion to the well-spoken Dharma of the Sutras and so on is the repeated practice of devotion, but it does not grow without the cause of intense patience.

original: de ni mos pa mi mang ba zhes bya'o //
analyzed: de ni mos pa mi mang ba zhes bya'o //
translated: This is called the lack of abundant devotion.

original: shes rab yongs su ma smin pa ni bsod nams dang ye shes kyi tshogs yang dag par ma grub pa zhes bya bas bstan te /
analyzed: shes rab yongs su ma smin pa ni bsod nams dang ye shes kyi tshogs yang dag par ma grub pa zhes bya bas bstan te /
translated: Immature wisdom is taught by the line, “the accumulation of merit and wisdom is not complete.”

original: de yang byang chub sems dpa'i rigs yang dag par bsgrubs nas rigs la gnas shing sgrib pa yongs su dag pa rgyud yongs su smin cing de'i 'og tu sems bskyed du zin kyang /
analyzed: de yang byang chub sems dpa'i rigs yang dag par bsgrubs nas rigs la gnas shing sgrib pa yongs su dag pa rgyud yongs su smin cing de'i 'og tu sems bskyed du zin kyang /
translated: Even though one has established the lineage of a Bodhisattva, and has the lineage, and has purified the obscurations, and has matured the mindstream, and then has generated the Thought,

original: sems bskyed pa de'i gong du byang chub sems dpa'i spyod pa la sbyor ba'i gnas skabs na pha rol tu phyin pa drug gis bsdus pa'i bsod nams dang ye shes kyi tshogs dang / bsod nams dang ye shes kyi rgyu dang / bsod nams dang ye shes thob pa dang /
analyzed: sems bskyed pa de'i gong du byang chub sems dpa'i spyod pa la sbyor ba'i gnas skabs na pha rol tu phyin pa drug gis bsdus pa'i bsod nams dang ye shes kyi tshogs dang / bsod nams dang ye shes kyi rgyu dang / bsod nams dang ye shes thob pa dang /
translated: Prior to the generation of bodhichitta, during the stage of training in the bodhisattva deeds, there are six factors that contribute to the accumulation of merit and wisdom: the accumulation of merit and wisdom subsumed under the six perfections, the causes of merit and wisdom, the attainment of merit and wisdom,🔽the increase of merit and wisdom, the concordant conditions that are not discordant, the prior habituation to merit and wisdom, and the result of merit and wisdom.

original: gnas pa dang 'phel bar 'gyur ba la 'dun pa dang / mthun la mi mthun pa med pa'i rkyen dang / sngon yang bsod nams dang ye shes la goms pa dang / bsod nams dang ye shes kyi 'bras bu bsod nams la brten nas byang chub sems dpa' gnod pa med par 'khor bar 'khor zhing /
analyzed: gnas pa dang 'phel bar 'gyur ba la 'dun pa dang / mthun la mi mthun pa med pa'i rkyen dang / sngon yang bsod nams dang ye shes la goms pa dang / bsod nams dang ye shes kyi 'bras bu bsod nams la brten nas byang chub sems dpa' gnod pa med par 'khor bar 'khor zhing /
translated: The result of merit is that, on the basis of merit, the bodhisattva cycles in samsara without harm.

original: sdug bsngal dag gis shin tu gzir ba med pa dang / ci dga' mgur sems can gyi don dang / sems can la phan 'dogs nus par 'gyur ba dang / ye shes la brten nas byang chub sems dpa' yang dag par bsod nams yongs su 'dzin par byed kyi log pas ma yin pa dang /
analyzed: sdug bsngal dag gis shin tu gzir ba med pa dang / ci dga' mgur sems can gyi don dang / sems can la phan 'dogs nus par 'gyur ba dang / ye shes la brten nas byang chub sems dpa' yang dag par bsod nams yongs su 'dzin par byed kyi log pas ma yin pa dang /
translated: They are not overwhelmed by suffering, they are able to benefit sentient beings as they wish, they are able to benefit sentient beings, and they are able to take up the accumulations of merit and knowledge in the right way, not in the wrong way, in dependence on wisdom.

original: mkhas bar bya ba sna tshogs dpag tu med pa dag gis kyang bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu mngon par rdzogs par sangs rgyas pa'i bar du 'gyur ba dag yang dag par ma grub pas shes rab yongs su ma smin pa ste
analyzed: mkhas bar bya ba sna tshogs dpag tu med pa dag gis kyang bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu mngon par rdzogs par sangs rgyas pa'i bar du 'gyur ba dag yang dag par ma grub pas shes rab yongs su ma smin pa ste
translated: They are able to attain unsurpassed, perfect, complete awakening through the various kinds of wisdom that are beyond measure.

original: / @113b de ni bsod nams dang ye shes kyi tshogs yang dag par ma bsgrubs pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: / @113b de ni bsod nams dang ye shes kyi tshogs yang dag par ma bsgrubs pa zhes bya'o //
translated: That is called not having fully accomplished the accumulations of merit and knowledge.

original: las dang po ba'i mtshan nyid lnga po de dag las dang po gsum gyis ni rigs phun sum tshogs par ma gyur pa'i sgo nas las dang po bar bstan to //
analyzed: las dang po ba'i mtshan nyid lnga po de dag las dang po gsum gyis ni rigs phun sum tshogs par ma gyur pa'i sgo nas las dang po bar bstan to //
translated: From among those five characteristics of beginners, the first three indicate that they are beginners because they have not become perfect in lineage.

original: bzhi pas ni mos pa phun sum tshogs par ma gyur pa'i sgo nas las dang po par bstan to //
analyzed: bzhi pas ni mos pa phun sum tshogs par ma gyur pa'i sgo nas las dang po par bstan to //
translated: The fourth indicates that they are beginners because they have not become perfect in aspiration.

original: lnga pas ni shes rab phun sum tshogs par ma gyur pa'i sgo nas las dang po par bstan te /
analyzed: lnga pas ni shes rab phun sum tshogs par ma gyur pa'i sgo nas las dang po par bstan te /
translated: The fifth indicates that they are beginners because they have not become perfect in wisdom.

original: de lta bu'i las dang po bdag gis ngo bo nyid gsum ngo bo nyid kyis tha dad par ma mthong bas /
analyzed: de lta bu'i las dang po bdag gis ngo bo nyid gsum ngo bo nyid kyis tha dad par ma mthong bas /
translated: Such beginners do not see the three natures as different by intrinsic reality.

original: de'i phyir bcom ldan 'das kyis ngo bo nyid med pa nyid gsum gdags par mdzad cing chos bstan pa na gzhi de la brten nas rnam par byang ba'i phyogs dang mthun pa'i lam sgrub par byed pa ni bstan pa'i gzhi dang ldan pa'i sgrub pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: de'i phyir bcom ldan 'das kyis ngo bo nyid med pa nyid gsum gdags par mdzad cing chos bstan pa na gzhi de la brten nas rnam par byang ba'i phyogs dang mthun pa'i lam sgrub par byed pa ni bstan pa'i gzhi dang ldan pa'i sgrub pa zhes bya'o //
translated: Therefore, the Bhagavat designated the three kinds of realitylessness and when he taught the Dharma, he established the path that is conducive to purification in dependence on that basis. This is called “establishment that possesses the basis of teaching.”

original: de dag la ni nga skye ba ngo bo nyid med pa nyid las brtsams nas chos ston te zhes bya ba ni sngar sems can gyi khams na sems can rnams kyis gzhan gyi dbang gi ngo bo nyid ngo bo nyid kyis tha dad par mthong na ni de'i
analyzed: de dag la ni nga skye ba ngo bo nyid med pa nyid las brtsams nas chos ston te zhes bya ba ni sngar sems can gyi khams na sems can rnams kyis gzhan gyi dbang gi ngo bo nyid ngo bo nyid kyis tha dad par mthong na ni de'i
translated: This is saying that if sentient beings in the realm of sentient beings saw the essential difference of the dependent nature,

original: phyir skye ba ngo bo nyid med pa nyid mi 'dogs kyi /
analyzed: phyir skye ba ngo bo nyid med pa nyid mi 'dogs kyi /
translated: then the essential emptiness of arising would not be imputed.🔽But since they do not see it, it is imputed.

original: ma mthong bas 'dogs so zhes smos pa la ji ltar ma mthong ba sngar grub pa'i bye brag mdor bstan pa'i skabs su bstan nas der ma mthong bas /
analyzed: ma mthong bas 'dogs so zhes smos pa la ji ltar ma mthong ba sngar grub pa'i bye brag mdor bstan pa'i skabs su bstan nas der ma mthong bas /
translated: How they do not see it was previously explained in the section on the brief presentation of the proofs.🔽Since they do not see it, the essential emptiness of arising is imputed.

original: de'i phyir skye ba ngo bo nyid med pa nyid 'dogs so zhes ji ltar 'dogs pa bstan to //
analyzed: de'i phyir skye ba ngo bo nyid med pa nyid 'dogs so zhes ji ltar 'dogs pa bstan to //
translated: This explains how it is imputed.

original: 'on kyang skye ba ngo bo nyid med pa nyid de la mtshan nyid ngo bo nyid med pa nyid dang / don dam pa ngo bo nyid med pa rnam pa gnyis yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin du mi shes pas zhes bya ba la skye ba ngo bo nyid de la mtshan nyid med pa nyid yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin du mi shes pas zhes bya
analyzed: 'on kyang skye ba ngo bo nyid med pa nyid de la mtshan nyid ngo bo nyid med pa nyid dang / don dam pa ngo bo nyid med pa rnam pa gnyis yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin du mi shes pas zhes bya ba la skye ba ngo bo nyid de la mtshan nyid med pa nyid yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin du mi shes pas zhes bya
translated: With regard to the intrinsic unreality of production, they do not understand the intrinsic unreality of identity as it is in reality,

original: ba ni gzhan gyi dbang gi ngo bo nyid la kun brtags pa'i ngo bo nyid gtan med par mi shes pa'o //
analyzed: ba ni gzhan gyi dbang gi ngo bo nyid la kun brtags pa'i ngo bo nyid gtan med par mi shes pa'o //
translated: which means that they do not understand that the imagined reality is utterly nonexistent in the relative reality.🔽With regard to that intrinsic unreality of production, they do not understand the two kinds of ultimate unreality as they are in reality,

original: skye ba ngo bo nyid med pa de la don dam pa ngo bo nyid med pa nyid rnam pa gnyis yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin du mi shes pas zhes bya ba ni gzhan gyi dbang gi ngo bo nyid de nyid rnam par dag pa'i dmigs pa
analyzed: skye ba ngo bo nyid med pa de la don dam pa ngo bo nyid med pa nyid rnam pa gnyis yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin du mi shes pas zhes bya ba ni gzhan gyi dbang gi ngo bo nyid de nyid rnam par dag pa'i dmigs pa
translated: which means that they do not understand that the very relative reality is the object of purification.

original: ma yin par don dam pa'i ngo bo nyid med cing kun rdzob tu sgyu ma byas pa dang 'dra bar kun nas nyon mongs pa'i mtshan nyid du mi shes pa dang de nyid gnas bsgyur cing rnam par dag pa'i dmigs pa don dam pa ngo bo nyid med🔽pa nyid chos bdag med pa sa rab tu phye ba rnam @114a * //
analyzed: ma yin par don dam pa'i ngo bo nyid med cing kun rdzob tu sgyu ma byas pa dang 'dra bar kun nas nyon mongs pa'i mtshan nyid du mi shes pa dang de nyid gnas bsgyur cing rnam par dag pa'i dmigs pa don dam pa ngo bo nyid med pa nyid chos bdag med pa sa rab tu phye ba rnam @114a * //
translated: It is not that they are ultimately natureless and that they are not known to be characterized by defilement, like a magical creation, but that they are transformed and serve as the focal object of the pure state, which is the ultimate naturelessness that is distinguished by the selflessness of phenomena.🔽

original: par byang ba'i mtshan nyid kyis chos thob par bya ba mi shes pa'o //🔽yang de bzhin gshegs pa de dag la 'di lta ste /
analyzed: par byang ba'i mtshan nyid kyis chos thob par bya ba mi shes pa'o // yang de bzhin gshegs pa de dag la 'di lta ste /
translated: It is not the ultimate naturelessness, but rather the thoroughly afflicted character of things, which is like an illusion, that is not understood. And it is the ultimate naturelessness, which is the object of the transformation and purification of that, which is distinguished by the selflessness of phenomena, that is not understood as the character of complete purification, as the object to be attained.🔽Again, the Tathāgatas, beginning with the naturelessness of character and the ultimate naturelessness, etc.,

original: mtshan nyid ngo bo nyid med pa nyid dang / don dam pa ngo bo nyid med pa nyid las brtsams nas zhes bya ba la sogs pas ni sngar sems can gyi khams na sems can rnams kyis kun brtags pa'i ngo bo nyid ngo bo nyid kyis tha dad par mthong zhing yongs su grub pa'i ngo bo nyid
analyzed: mtshan nyid ngo bo nyid med pa nyid dang / don dam pa ngo bo nyid med pa nyid las brtsams nas zhes bya ba la sogs pas ni sngar sems can gyi khams na sems can rnams kyis kun brtags pa'i ngo bo nyid ngo bo nyid kyis tha dad par mthong zhing yongs su grub pa'i ngo bo nyid
translated: previously, in the realm of sentient beings, sentient beings saw the imagined nature as essentially different, and the dependent nature as essentially the same.

original: kyang ngo bo nyid kyis tha dad par mthong na ni de'i phyir mtshan nyid ngo bo nyid med pa nyid dang / don dam pa ngo bo nyid med pa nyid mi 'dogs kyi ma mthong bas 'dogs so zhes smos pa las ji ltar ma mthong ba sngar bsgrub pa'i bye brag mdor bstan pa'i skabs su bstan nas de ltar ma mthong bas de'i phyir 'dogs so zhes ji ltar 'dogs🔽pa bstan to //
analyzed: kyang ngo bo nyid kyis tha dad par mthong na ni de'i phyir mtshan nyid ngo bo nyid med pa nyid dang / don dam pa ngo bo nyid med pa nyid mi 'dogs kyi ma mthong bas 'dogs so zhes smos pa las ji ltar ma mthong ba sngar bsgrub pa'i bye brag mdor bstan pa'i skabs su bstan nas de ltar ma mthong bas de'i phyir 'dogs so zhes ji ltar 'dogs pa bstan to //
translated: How one does not see them is taught in the section on the brief indication of the particulars of the proof, and thus it is taught that because one does not see them in that way, one imputes them.

original: de dag gis chos de thos nas zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni sngar sgrub pa'i bye brag mdor bstan pa'i skabs su kun nas nyon mongs pa'i phyogs dang mthun pa'i sgrub pa ji skad bstan pa las bzlog pa yin no //
analyzed: de dag gis chos de thos nas zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni sngar sgrub pa'i bye brag mdor bstan pa'i skabs su kun nas nyon mongs pa'i phyogs dang mthun pa'i sgrub pa ji skad bstan pa las bzlog pa yin no //
translated: Having heard this doctrine, they, etc. is the opposite of the proof that was previously taught in the section on the brief indication of the particulars of the proof in the section on the side of the thorough afflictions.

original: tshe 'di la shes pa'i stobs bskyed pa zhes bya ba ni mtshan ma rnam par bshig pa'i phyir dang / gnas ngan len spangs pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: tshe 'di la shes pa'i stobs bskyed pa zhes bya ba ni mtshan ma rnam par bshig pa'i phyir dang / gnas ngan len spangs pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The power of knowledge in this life is the power of knowledge of the elimination of contaminants.

original: phyi ma la rgyud yang dag par chad pas zhes bya bas ni tshe 'di la mtshan ma dang gnas ngan len spangs pa'i phyir phyi mar gzhan gyi dbang yang 'byung ba'i rgyu med pa'o //
analyzed: phyi ma la rgyud yang dag par chad pas zhes bya bas ni tshe 'di la mtshan ma dang gnas ngan len spangs pa'i phyir phyi mar gzhan gyi dbang yang 'byung ba'i rgyu med pa'o //
translated: In the latter, it is said that “the continuum is completely severed,” because the sign and the negative reflex are abandoned in this life, the other-dependent will not arise in the future, because there is no cause.

original: 'gog par byed de zhes bya ba ni gnas 'gyur bar byed pa'o //
analyzed: 'gog par byed de zhes bya ba ni gnas 'gyur bar byed pa'o //
translated: “It is stopped” means that it is transformed.

original: lam 'di nyid dang sgrub pa 'di nyid kyis zhes bya ba ni rnam grangs te /
analyzed: lam 'di nyid dang sgrub pa 'di nyid kyis zhes bya ba ni rnam grangs te /
translated: “By this very path and by this very practice” is a synonym,

original: ngo bo nyid med pa nyid gdags pa mdzad pa 'di nyid kyis so //🔽rnam par dag pa'i lam gcig pa yin la zhes bya ba ni nyon mongs pa'i sgrib pa las rnam par grol bar 'gyur ba'i lam thun mong yin pa'o //
analyzed: ngo bo nyid med pa nyid gdags pa mdzad pa 'di nyid kyis so // rnam par dag pa'i lam gcig pa yin la zhes bya ba ni nyon mongs pa'i sgrib pa las rnam par grol bar 'gyur ba'i lam thun mong yin pa'o //
translated: by this very designation of realitylessness.🔽“There is the one path of purification” means that it is the common path for becoming liberated from the obstacle of the passions.

original: rnam par dag pa yang gcig ste zhes bya ba ni nyon mongs pa'i sgrib pa las rnam par grol ba'i 'bras bu'i dbang du mdzad de /
analyzed: rnam par dag pa yang gcig ste zhes bya ba ni nyon mongs pa'i sgrib pa las rnam par grol ba'i 'bras bu'i dbang du mdzad de /
translated: “There is the one purification” means that it is the result of becoming liberated from the obstacle of the passions.

original: kun brtags pa'i ngo bo nyid kyi chos bdag med pa rtogs pa ni nyan thos dang rang sangs rgyas la yang yod pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: kun brtags pa'i ngo bo nyid kyi chos bdag med pa rtogs pa ni nyan thos dang rang sangs rgyas la yang yod pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because the realization of the selflessness of the imagined nature of phenomena also exists for the śrāvakas and pratyekabuddhas.🔽If that is so, then why would it not be the knowledge of all aspects?

original: 'o na ci'i phyir rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid yin par mi 'gyur zhen shes bya'i rnam par shas par bya ba ni de tsam du zad pa ma yin te /
analyzed: 'o na ci'i phyir rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid yin par mi 'gyur zhen shes bya'i rnam par shas par bya ba ni de tsam du zad pa ma yin te /
translated: The knowledge of the varieties of objects of knowledge is not limited to that,

original: gzhan gyi dbang gi ngo bo nyid kyi bye brag shes @114b par bya ba du ma yod pa de dag da dung mi shes pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: gzhan gyi dbang gi ngo bo nyid kyi bye brag shes @114b par bya ba du ma yod pa de dag da dung mi shes pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because the varieties of the dependent nature are still not known.🔽And it is not the case that there are no sentient beings with various dispositions,

original: sems can gyi rigs sna tshogs can dag kyang med pa ni ma yin no zhes bya ba ni dbang po'i rim pa las theg pa rnam gsum gyi rigs su gdags pa dag kyang med pa ni ma yin no zhes bya ba'i tha tshig ste /
analyzed: sems can gyi rigs sna tshogs can dag kyang med pa ni ma yin no zhes bya ba ni dbang po'i rim pa las theg pa rnam gsum gyi rigs su gdags pa dag kyang med pa ni ma yin no zhes bya ba'i tha tshig ste /
translated: which means that it is not the case that there are no sentient beings who are designated as having the lineage of the three vehicles based on the levels of their faculties.

original: de ni bstan pa'i gzhi dang ldan pa'i sgrub pa'i bye brag bstan pa yin no //
analyzed: de ni bstan pa'i gzhi dang ldan pa'i sgrub pa'i bye brag bstan pa yin no //
translated: This is the explanation of the basis of the teaching and the different types of practice.

original: de'i 'og tu rigs kyi gzhi dang ldan pa'i sgrub pa'i bye brag bstan pa'i tshig gi don la sogs pa bshad par bya ste /
analyzed: de'i 'og tu rigs kyi gzhi dang ldan pa'i sgrub pa'i bye brag bstan pa'i tshig gi don la sogs pa bshad par bya ste /
translated: Then, after that, the specific practices that are the basis of the lineage should be explained, such as the meaning of the words.

original: rigs kyi gzhi dang ldan pa'i sgrub pa zhes bya ba ni sems can nyan thos kyi theg pa mngon par rtogs pa'i rigs can dag de bzhin gshegs pas ngo bo nyid med pa nyid rnam pa gsum gdags pa mdzad cing chos bstan pa ni rang gi rigs kyi
analyzed: rigs kyi gzhi dang ldan pa'i sgrub pa zhes bya ba ni sems can nyan thos kyi theg pa mngon par rtogs pa'i rigs can dag de bzhin gshegs pas ngo bo nyid med pa nyid rnam pa gsum gdags pa mdzad cing chos bstan pa ni rang gi rigs kyi
translated: The practice that is the basis of the lineage is that the Tathāgata, in order to teach the doctrine, designates the three kinds of realitylessness for sentient beings who are of the lineage that realizes the vehicle of the disciples.

original: gzhi la brten nas /
analyzed: gzhi la brten nas /
translated: In dependence on the basis of their lineage,

original: nyan thos kyi theg pas rnam par byang ba'i phyogs dang mthun pa'i lam sgrub par byed pa ste /
analyzed: nyan thos kyi theg pas rnam par byang ba'i phyogs dang mthun pa'i lam sgrub par byed pa ste /
translated: they practice the path that is conducive to purification by the vehicle of the disciples.

original: de'i phyir de bstan pa'i dbang du mdzad nas /
analyzed: de'i phyir de bstan pa'i dbang du mdzad nas /
translated: Therefore, in order to teach that,

original: don dam yang dag 'phags nyan thos kyi rigs can gang zag zhi ba'i bgrod pa gcig pu pa ni zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs so //
analyzed: don dam yang dag 'phags nyan thos kyi rigs can gang zag zhi ba'i bgrod pa gcig pu pa ni zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs so //
translated: it is said, “The ultimate, O Sublime One, for the person of the lineage of the disciples who is of the one-way vehicle of peace.”

original: de la rigs zhes bya ba ni skal ba dang ldan pa'i gzhi yin te /
analyzed: de la rigs zhes bya ba ni skal ba dang ldan pa'i gzhi yin te /
translated: There, “lineage” is the basis of good fortune.

original: de yang mdor bsdu na rnam pa gnyis te /
analyzed: de yang mdor bsdu na rnam pa gnyis te /
translated: Moreover, in brief, it is twofold:

original: rang bzhin gyis gnas pa dang yang dag par bsgrubs pa'o //
analyzed: rang bzhin gyis gnas pa dang yang dag par bsgrubs pa'o //
translated: the naturally existing gene and the developed gene.

original: de la rang bzhin gyis gnas pa'i rigs ni skye mched drug gi khyad par thog ma med pa'i dus nas brgyud de 'ongs pa chos nyid kyis thob pa gang yin pa ste /
analyzed: de la rang bzhin gyis gnas pa'i rigs ni skye mched drug gi khyad par thog ma med pa'i dus nas brgyud de 'ongs pa chos nyid kyis thob pa gang yin pa ste /
translated: The naturally existing gene is the special quality of the six sensespheres that has come down from beginningless time, obtained naturally.

original: de yang rkyen gang dang ldan pa de nyid kyi 'bras bu thob pa'i skal pa dang ldan pa'i gzhi rnam par shes pa nyid yin no //
analyzed: de yang rkyen gang dang ldan pa de nyid kyi 'bras bu thob pa'i skal pa dang ldan pa'i gzhi rnam par shes pa nyid yin no //
translated: It is the basis of consciousness that has the fortune to obtain the result of whatever conditions it meets.

original: yang dag par bsgrubs pa'i rigs ni sngon dge ba'i rtsa ba goms par byas pa las thob pa gang yin pa ste /
analyzed: yang dag par bsgrubs pa'i rigs ni sngon dge ba'i rtsa ba goms par byas pa las thob pa gang yin pa ste /
translated: The developed gene is that obtained from cultivating the roots of virtue.

original: de yang rang bzhin gyis gnas pa'i rigs de la dang po kho nar rkyen gang yang dag par bsgrubs pa de'i 'bras bu thob pa'i skal pa dang ldan pa'i gzhi yod pa gang yin pa'o //
analyzed: de yang rang bzhin gyis gnas pa'i rigs de la dang po kho nar rkyen gang yang dag par bsgrubs pa de'i 'bras bu thob pa'i skal pa dang ldan pa'i gzhi yod pa gang yin pa'o //
translated: Moreover, it is the basis that has the fortune to obtain the result of whatever conditions are developed, in the naturally existing gene.

original: de la yang bzhin gyis gnas pa'i rigs ni yang dag par bsgrub mi dgos par sems can thams cad la rang bzhin gyis yod pa yin no //
analyzed: de la yang bzhin gyis gnas pa'i rigs ni yang dag par bsgrub mi dgos par sems can thams cad la rang bzhin gyis yod pa yin no //
translated: The naturally existing lineage does not need to be accomplished. It naturally exists in all sentient beings.

original: yang dag par bsgrubs pa'i rigs ni yang dag par ma bsgrubs kyi bar du mi thob @115a * //
analyzed: yang dag par bsgrubs pa'i rigs ni yang dag par ma bsgrubs kyi bar du mi thob @115a * //
translated: The developed lineage is not attained until it is developed,

original: la / yang dag par bsgrubs na thob pa yin no //
analyzed: la / yang dag par bsgrubs na thob pa yin no //
translated: but when it is developed, it is attained.🔽The naturally existing lineage is the support of the first seven members of enlightenment, because it is the cause of the members of enlightenment.🔽The developed lineage is the support of the last three members of enlightenment, because it is the result of the members of enlightenment.

original: de la rang bzhin gyis gnas pa'i rigs ni kun gzhi'i rnam par shes pa'i 'jug pa rnam par gzhag pa'i tshul gyis ni 'khor ba'i mtha' ji srid kyi bar du rgyun rtag par gnas te /🔽nam yang med par mi 'gyur /
analyzed: de la rang bzhin gyis gnas pa'i rigs ni kun gzhi'i rnam par shes pa'i 'jug pa rnam par gzhag pa'i tshul gyis ni 'khor ba'i mtha' ji srid kyi bar du rgyun rtag par gnas te / nam yang med par mi 'gyur /
translated: The naturally existing lineage is the support of the first seven members of enlightenment, because it is the cause of the members of enlightenment.🔽The developed lineage is the support of the last three members of enlightenment, because it is the result of the members of enlightenment.🔽The naturally existing lineage is the support of the first seven members of enlightenment, because it is the cause of the members of enlightenment.🔽The developed lineage is the support of the last three members of enlightenment, because it is the result of the members of enlightenment.

original: la kun gzhi rnam par shes pa'i ldog pa rnam par gzhag pa'i tshul gyis ni gnyen pos gnas bsgyur nas gnas gyur pas bsdus pa yang dag pa'i shes pa chos kyi dbyings kyis klas par ngo bo nyid rtag par gnas te /
analyzed: la kun gzhi rnam par shes pa'i ldog pa rnam par gzhag pa'i tshul gyis ni gnyen pos gnas bsgyur nas gnas gyur pas bsdus pa yang dag pa'i shes pa chos kyi dbyings kyis klas par ngo bo nyid rtag par gnas te /
translated: The naturally existing lineage is the support of the first seven members of enlightenment, because it is the cause of the members of enlightenment.🔽The developed lineage is the support of the last three members of enlightenment, because it is the result of the members of enlightenment.

original: nam yang med par mi 'gyur bar rig par bya'o //
analyzed: nam yang med par mi 'gyur bar rig par bya'o //
translated: It should be understood that it never becomes nonexistent.

original: yang dag par bsgrubs pa'i rigs ni yang dag par bsgrubs te thob phyin chad de dang mthun pa'i rkyen gyis yang dang yang du bsnan na ni phyir zhing phyir zhing ches 'od gsal ba dang / ches mthu dang ldan par 'gyur zhing /
analyzed: yang dag par bsgrubs pa'i rigs ni yang dag par bsgrubs te thob phyin chad de dang mthun pa'i rkyen gyis yang dang yang du bsnan na ni phyir zhing phyir zhing ches 'od gsal ba dang / ches mthu dang ldan par 'gyur zhing /
translated: The family that is properly accomplished, once it is attained through proper accomplishment, if it is repeatedly enhanced by conditions that are in accordance with it, it will become brighter and brighter and more and more powerful.

original: rigs bzang po phun sum tshogs pa dag mang du snang la /
analyzed: rigs bzang po phun sum tshogs pa dag mang du snang la /
translated: The excellent and abundant family will appear more and more.

original: sems bskyed pa la sogs pa 'bras bu yang dag par 'grub pa yang dus nye bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: sems bskyed pa la sogs pa 'bras bu yang dag par 'grub pa yang dus nye bar 'gyur ro //
translated: The time for the proper accomplishment of the results of generating the thought of enlightenment, etc., will be near.

original: de dang mthun pa'i rkyen gyis ma bsnan na yang kun gzhi rnam par shes pa la yang rigs bzang po yang dag par bsgrubs pa /
analyzed: de dang mthun pa'i rkyen gyis ma bsnan na yang kun gzhi rnam par shes pa la yang rigs bzang po yang dag par bsgrubs pa /
translated: If it is not enhanced by conditions that are in accordance with it, then the family that is properly accomplished in the fundamental consciousness,

original: dper na rdo ba'i phrag na gser phye yod pa dang 'dra bar gnas par byas pa de tshe rabs thams cad du rgyun mi 'chad cing /
analyzed: dper na rdo ba'i phrag na gser phye yod pa dang 'dra bar gnas par byas pa de tshe rabs thams cad du rgyun mi 'chad cing /
translated: like gold ore that contains gold, will be maintained without interruption in all lives.

original: nam 'bras bu ma grub kyi bar du gzhan du mi 'gyur bar gnas la /
analyzed: nam 'bras bu ma grub kyi bar du gzhan du mi 'gyur bar gnas la /
translated: Until the result is established, it remains without changing into anything else.

original: 'bras bu grub nas gal te des bsgrubs pa'i 'bras bu de mthar thug pa'i 'bras bu bla na med pa nyid yin na ni de las gong du bsgrub tu yang med do //
analyzed: 'bras bu grub nas gal te des bsgrubs pa'i 'bras bu de mthar thug pa'i 'bras bu bla na med pa nyid yin na ni de las gong du bsgrub tu yang med do //
translated: If the result that is established by that is the ultimate, unsurpassed result, then there is nothing to be established above that.

original: gal te bla na med pa nyid ma yin na de'i gong du yang rang bzhin gyis gnas pa'i rigs de la mthar thug pa'i 'bras bu bla na med pa 'grub pa'i rkyen khyad par can yang dag par bsgrubs pa'i rigs thob cing /
analyzed: gal te bla na med pa nyid ma yin na de'i gong du yang rang bzhin gyis gnas pa'i rigs de la mthar thug pa'i 'bras bu bla na med pa 'grub pa'i rkyen khyad par can yang dag par bsgrubs pa'i rigs thob cing /
translated: If it is not the unsurpassed, then above that, in the naturally existing potential, one obtains the special conditions for establishing the ultimate, unsurpassed result.

original: des mthar thug pa'i 'bras bu bla na med pa 'grub par 'gyur la /
analyzed: des mthar thug pa'i 'bras bu bla na med pa 'grub par 'gyur la /
translated: That establishes the ultimate, unsurpassed result.

original: de 'grub pa na rigs snga ma de gtan spong bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de 'grub pa na rigs snga ma de gtan spong bar 'gyur ro //
translated: When that is established, the former potential is completely abandoned.

original: de bas na mdo sde las rigs lngar gsungs pa yang rang bzhin gyis gnas pa'i rigs ni lnga char la yang 'dra bar yod de /
analyzed: de bas na mdo sde las rigs lngar gsungs pa yang rang bzhin gyis gnas pa'i rigs ni lnga char la yang 'dra bar yod de /
translated: Therefore, the teaching of the five potentials in the sutras is the same for all five in terms of the naturally existing potential.

original: sems can thams cad la kun gzhi'i rnam par shes pa yod par 'dra ba'i phyir ro //🔽de yang 'gro ba lngar 'khor ba'i rkyen dang theg ba gsum gyis yongs su mya ngan las 'da' @115b bar 'gyur ba'i rkyen de dag gis rkyen ji lta ba bzhin du bkrir rung bas rang bzhin gcig tu nges pa ma yin te /
analyzed: sems can thams cad la kun gzhi'i rnam par shes pa yod par 'dra ba'i phyir ro // de yang 'gro ba lngar 'khor ba'i rkyen dang theg ba gsum gyis yongs su mya ngan las 'da' @115b bar 'gyur ba'i rkyen de dag gis rkyen ji lta ba bzhin du bkrir rung bas rang bzhin gcig tu nges pa ma yin te /
translated: because all sentient beings are similar in having foundation consciousness.

original: chos thams cad rang bzhin gcig tu nges pa med par gsungs pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: chos thams cad rang bzhin gcig tu nges pa med par gsungs pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Moreover, since it can be directed by conditions in accordance with conditions, it is not definite as a single nature, because it is said that all phenomena are not definite as a single nature.

original: yang dag par bsgrubs pa'i rigs ni lnga char la 'dra bar yod pa ma yin te /
analyzed: yang dag par bsgrubs pa'i rigs ni lnga char la 'dra bar yod pa ma yin te /
translated: The type that is correctly established is not similar in the five types,

original: de dag la las ni ma bsgrubs /
analyzed: de dag la las ni ma bsgrubs /
translated: because some establish karma,

original: la las ni cha mnyam par bsgrubs /
analyzed: la las ni cha mnyam par bsgrubs /
translated: some establish a homogeneous collection,

original: la las ni tha dad par bsgrubs pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: la las ni tha dad par bsgrubs pa'i phyir ro //
translated: and some establish a different type.

original: de yang 'bras bu ma grub kyi bar du ni gzhan du mi 'gyur bar gnas la /
analyzed: de yang 'bras bu ma grub kyi bar du ni gzhan du mi 'gyur bar gnas la /
translated: Moreover, until the result is established, it remains without changing into something else.

original: 'bras bu grub nas gal te des bsgrubs pa'i 'bras bu de mthar thug pa'i 'bras bu bla na med pa nyid ma yin la de'i 'og tu yang rang bzhin gyis gnas pa'i rigs de la mthar thug pa'i 'bras bu bla na med pa 'grub pa'i rkyen khyad par
analyzed: 'bras bu grub nas gal te des bsgrubs pa'i 'bras bu de mthar thug pa'i 'bras bu bla na med pa nyid ma yin la de'i 'og tu yang rang bzhin gyis gnas pa'i rigs de la mthar thug pa'i 'bras bu bla na med pa 'grub pa'i rkyen khyad par
translated: When the result is achieved, if the result that is accomplished is not the ultimate, unsurpassed result, then after that, one should accomplish the special conditions for achieving the ultimate, unsurpassed result in the naturally existing potential.

original: can gzhan yang dag par bsgrubs pa'i rigs 'thob cing /
analyzed: can gzhan yang dag par bsgrubs pa'i rigs 'thob cing /
translated: One obtains the potential that is accomplished in that way.

original: des mthar thug pa'i 'bras bu bla na med pa nyid 'grub par 'gyur la /
analyzed: des mthar thug pa'i 'bras bu bla na med pa nyid 'grub par 'gyur la /
translated: Through that, one achieves the ultimate, unsurpassed result.

original: de grub pa na rigs snga ma de gtan spong bar 'gyur bas rang bzhin gcig tu nges pa ma yin no //
analyzed: de grub pa na rigs snga ma de gtan spong bar 'gyur bas rang bzhin gcig tu nges pa ma yin no //
translated: When that is achieved, the former potential is permanently abandoned, so it is not definitely the same nature.

original: mthar thug pa'i 'bras bu bla na med pa nyid 'grub pa'i rigs de ni sngar kun gzhi'i rnam par shes pa'i ldog pa rnam par gzhag pa'i tshul bstan pa dang 'dra bar chos kyi dbyings kyis klas pa'i bar du ngo bo nyid rtag par gnas te /
analyzed: mthar thug pa'i 'bras bu bla na med pa nyid 'grub pa'i rigs de ni sngar kun gzhi'i rnam par shes pa'i ldog pa rnam par gzhag pa'i tshul bstan pa dang 'dra bar chos kyi dbyings kyis klas pa'i bar du ngo bo nyid rtag par gnas te /
translated: That potential for achieving the ultimate, unsurpassed result is like the former explanation of the mode of positing the aspect of the foundation consciousness, which is the essence that always exists, as far as the realm of reality.

original: nam yang med par mi 'gyur bar rig par bya'o //
analyzed: nam yang med par mi 'gyur bar rig par bya'o //
translated: It should be understood that it never becomes nonexistent.

original: de la rigs med pa zhes bya ba gang zhe na /
analyzed: de la rigs med pa zhes bya ba gang zhe na /
translated: What is called “lacking the potential”?

original: rang bzhin gyis gnas pa'i rigs ni yod la /
analyzed: rang bzhin gyis gnas pa'i rigs ni yod la /
translated: The naturally existing potential exists,

original: theg pa gsum gyis yongs su mya ngan las 'da' ba'i rkyen yang dag par bsgrubs pa'i rigs ni med pa ste /
analyzed: theg pa gsum gyis yongs su mya ngan las 'da' ba'i rkyen yang dag par bsgrubs pa'i rigs ni med pa ste /
translated: but the developed potential that is the condition for attaining nirvana through the three vehicles does not exist.

original: gang gi tshe rkyen med pa de'i 'bras bu skye ba mi srid pas /
analyzed: gang gi tshe rkyen med pa de'i 'bras bu skye ba mi srid pas /
translated: When there are no conditions, it is impossible for a result to arise.

original: de yang de'i tshe na theg pa gsum gyis yongs su mya ngan las 'da' ba'i rkyen med pas rigs med pa zhes bya bar zad kyi nam du yang mya ngan las 'da' bar 'gyur ba'i skal ba med par nges pa ni ma yin te /
analyzed: de yang de'i tshe na theg pa gsum gyis yongs su mya ngan las 'da' ba'i rkyen med pas rigs med pa zhes bya bar zad kyi nam du yang mya ngan las 'da' bar 'gyur ba'i skal ba med par nges pa ni ma yin te /
translated: Therefore, at that time, because there are no conditions for attaining nirvana through the three vehicles, it is called “lacking the potential.” But it is not definite that one will never have the good fortune to attain nirvana.

original: sems can thams cad de bzhin gshegs pa'i snying po dang ldan pas gang gi tshe theg pa gsum po gang gis yongs su mya ngan las 'da' ba'i rkyen rnyed pa de'i tshe yongs su mya ngan las 'da' bar yang 'gyur ro //
analyzed: sems can thams cad de bzhin gshegs pa'i snying po dang ldan pas gang gi tshe theg pa gsum po gang gis yongs su mya ngan las 'da' ba'i rkyen rnyed pa de'i tshe yongs su mya ngan las 'da' bar yang 'gyur ro //
translated: Since all sentient beings possess the essence of the Tathāgata, when they find the conditions for attaining nirvāṇa through any of the three vehicles, they attain nirvāṇa.

original: rkyen rnyed par 'gyur ba de la ni nges pa med de /🔽la las ni dus nye bar rnyed par 'gyur /
analyzed: rkyen rnyed par 'gyur ba de la ni nges pa med de / la las ni dus nye bar rnyed par 'gyur /
translated: There is no certainty about finding those conditions.🔽Some find them in a short time,

original: la las ni yun ring pos rnyed par 'gyur /
analyzed: la las ni yun ring pos rnyed par 'gyur /
translated: some find them after a long time.

original: @116a * // la las ni rkyen rnyed par 'gyur ram mi 'gyur ma nges te /
analyzed: @116a * // la las ni rkyen rnyed par 'gyur ram mi 'gyur ma nges te /
translated: It is not certain whether or not some will find the conditions.

original: chos rnams kyi tshogs pa gcig tu nges pa med par gsungs pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: chos rnams kyi tshogs pa gcig tu nges pa med par gsungs pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because it is said that the collection of phenomena is not ascertained as one.

original: rkyen rnyed par 'gyur ram mi 'gyur ma nges pa de la ni gtan rigs med pa yin no zhes gcig tu nges par bstan du mi rung ste /
analyzed: rkyen rnyed par 'gyur ram mi 'gyur ma nges pa de la ni gtan rigs med pa yin no zhes gcig tu nges par bstan du mi rung ste /
translated: It is not suitable to teach with certainty that “there is no definite reason for finding or not finding the conditions”🔽for those who have not found the conditions.

original: bcom ldan 'das kyis sems can gyi rang bzhin gcig tu nges pa med pa dang / ma nges pa'i chos kyang ma nges par yong par gsungs pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyis sems can gyi rang bzhin gcig tu nges pa med pa dang / ma nges pa'i chos kyang ma nges par yong par gsungs pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because the Bhagavān has said that the nature of sentient beings is not definite, and that indefinite phenomena are indefinite.

original: rkyen rnyed par 'gyur ram mi 'gyur ma nges pa des phyis nam zhig na rkyen rnyed dam mi rnyed pa yang 'khor ba mtha' med pa dang / sems can gyi las dang rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba'i tshogs pa bsam gyis mi khyab pas des na gcig tu chad par byar mi rung ngo //
analyzed: rkyen rnyed par 'gyur ram mi 'gyur ma nges pa des phyis nam zhig na rkyen rnyed dam mi rnyed pa yang 'khor ba mtha' med pa dang / sems can gyi las dang rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba'i tshogs pa bsam gyis mi khyab pas des na gcig tu chad par byar mi rung ngo //
translated: Since it is indefinite whether or not conditions will be found, it is not suitable to say that at some point later on they will or will not be found, because samsara is endless and the collection of sentient beings’ karma and dependent origination is inconceivable.

original: de ltar rkyen rnyed par 'gyur ram mi 'gyur ma nges pa de la ni phyis kyang mi rnyed pas rigs med pa zhes byar mi rung ste /
analyzed: de ltar rkyen rnyed par 'gyur ram mi 'gyur ma nges pa de la ni phyis kyang mi rnyed pas rigs med pa zhes byar mi rung ste /
translated: Since it is indefinite whether or not conditions will be found, it is not suitable to say that they will not be found later on, and therefore it is not suitable to say that they are not of the lineage.

original: de'i phyir bcom ldan 'das kyis rigs rnam par gzhag pa'i skabs su rigs 'bras bus yang dag par 'grub pa ni 'bras bu dang bcas pas rags pa yin la rigs 'bras bu yang dag par ma grub pa ni 'bras bu med pas cha phra ba yin te /
analyzed: de'i phyir bcom ldan 'das kyis rigs rnam par gzhag pa'i skabs su rigs 'bras bus yang dag par 'grub pa ni 'bras bu dang bcas pas rags pa yin la rigs 'bras bu yang dag par ma grub pa ni 'bras bu med pas cha phra ba yin te /
translated: Therefore, the Lord, in the context of the establishment of the lineages, said that the lineage that is established by the effect is gross because it has the effect, and the lineage that is not established by the effect is subtle because it is without effect.

original: de ni de bzhin gshegs pa nyag gcig gi spyod yul yin gyi /
analyzed: de ni de bzhin gshegs pa nyag gcig gi spyod yul yin gyi /
translated: That is the domain of the Tathagata alone.

original: gzhan gyis dpag pa'i yul ma yin no zhes gsungs so //
analyzed: gzhan gyis dpag pa'i yul ma yin no zhes gsungs so //
translated: It is not the domain of inference for others.

original: de bas na rigs med pa zhes bya ba ni da ltar rkyen ma rnyed pa'i re zhig gi dus las dgongs pa yin gyi /
analyzed: de bas na rigs med pa zhes bya ba ni da ltar rkyen ma rnyed pa'i re zhig gi dus las dgongs pa yin gyi /
translated: Therefore, the statement that there is no lineage is from the point of view of the present time when the conditions are not met.

original: gtan du rigs med par gcig pu nges pa ma yin te /
analyzed: gtan du rigs med par gcig pu nges pa ma yin te /
translated: It is not a definite, absolute nonexistence of lineage.

original: des phyis rigs yang dag par bsgrubs pa'i rigs 'thob pa dang mi 'thob pa ni gcig pu ma nges par rig par bya'o //
analyzed: des phyis rigs yang dag par bsgrubs pa'i rigs 'thob pa dang mi 'thob pa ni gcig pu ma nges par rig par bya'o //
translated: One should understand that the attainment or nonattainment of the lineage that is later established by the lineage is not a definite absolute.

original: ma nges pa'i rigs can zhes bya ba ni sems can rang bzhin gyis gnas pa'i rigs can de dag kha cig gi theg pa gsum gyis yongs su mya ngan las 'da' ba'i rkyen yang dag par bsgrubs pa'i rigs can mnyam par 'thob cing byang chub rnam gsum mngon
analyzed: ma nges pa'i rigs can zhes bya ba ni sems can rang bzhin gyis gnas pa'i rigs can de dag kha cig gi theg pa gsum gyis yongs su mya ngan las 'da' ba'i rkyen yang dag par bsgrubs pa'i rigs can mnyam par 'thob cing byang chub rnam gsum mngon
translated: Those of unfixed potential are sentient beings who are by nature of unfixed potential. Some of them obtain the potential for perfect accomplishment of the conditions for attaining nirvana through the three vehicles and manifest the three kinds of enlightenment.🔽

original: par rtogs par 'gyur ba'i skal ba dang ldan pa'i gzhi gsum char yod la /
analyzed: par rtogs par 'gyur ba'i skal ba dang ldan pa'i gzhi gsum char yod la /
translated: Those of indefinite potential are sentient beings who naturally have the potential for any of the three vehicles. They have the potential to achieve the conditions for attaining nirvana through any of the three vehicles and they have the basis for attaining the three kinds of enlightenment.

original: da dung theg pa gang du yang sems ma bskyed pa dang por byang chub rnam gsum gang 'thob pa ma nges pa gnas pa ste /
analyzed: da dung theg pa gang du yang sems ma bskyed pa dang por byang chub rnam gsum gang 'thob pa ma nges pa gnas pa ste /
translated: But they have not yet aroused bodhicitta in any of the three vehicles and it is not certain which of the three kinds of enlightenment they will attain.🔽They are in the state of abiding in the potential.

original: de ni sems bskyed khar theg pa rnam gsum las dang por gang gi rkyen gzhan gcig dang phrad pa de'i dbang du gyur pa yin pas gdon mi @116b za bar gcig rkyen rnyed par 'gyur zhing /
analyzed: de ni sems bskyed khar theg pa rnam gsum las dang por gang gi rkyen gzhan gcig dang phrad pa de'i dbang du gyur pa yin pas gdon mi @116b za bar gcig rkyen rnyed par 'gyur zhing /
translated: When they arouse bodhicitta, they will come under the influence of whichever of the three vehicles they first encounter and they will certainly find the conditions for that vehicle.

original: yongs su mya ngan las 'da' bar nges pa kho na yin te /
analyzed: yongs su mya ngan las 'da' bar nges pa kho na yin te /
translated: They are certain to attain nirvana.

original: rkyen gzhan rnyed par 'gyur pa la dus nges pa ni med par rig par bya'o //
analyzed: rkyen gzhan rnyed par 'gyur pa la dus nges pa ni med par rig par bya'o //
translated: But it should be understood that there is no fixed time for acquiring other conditions.

original: ma nges pa'i rigs can de gal te dang por nyan thos sam rang sangs rgyas kyi theg pas yongs su mya ngan las 'da' bar gyur na yang ring por mi thogs par bla na med pa'i byang chub mngon par sangs rgyas pa'i rkyen rnyed par 'gyur zhing byang🔽chub tu yongs su 'gyur bar nges pa kho na yin te /
analyzed: ma nges pa'i rigs can de gal te dang por nyan thos sam rang sangs rgyas kyi theg pas yongs su mya ngan las 'da' bar gyur na yang ring por mi thogs par bla na med pa'i byang chub mngon par sangs rgyas pa'i rkyen rnyed par 'gyur zhing byang chub tu yongs su 'gyur bar nges pa kho na yin te /
translated: If those of unfixed potential first attain nirvana by the sravaka or pratyekabuddha vehicle, they will soon acquire the conditions for manifesting unsurpassable enlightenment and they will definitely become buddhas.

original: ji tsam gyis 'gyur ba'i dus ni nges pa med do //
analyzed: ji tsam gyis 'gyur ba'i dus ni nges pa med do //
translated: But there is no fixed time for when they will become buddhas.

original: nyan thos dang rang sangs rgyas byang chub tu yongs su 'gyur ba de yang la la ni slob par gyur pa kho na'i tshe nyan thos dang rang sangs rgyas kyi smon lam las ldog cing byang chub chen por yongs su 'gyur ba yang yod /
analyzed: nyan thos dang rang sangs rgyas byang chub tu yongs su 'gyur ba de yang la la ni slob par gyur pa kho na'i tshe nyan thos dang rang sangs rgyas kyi smon lam las ldog cing byang chub chen por yongs su 'gyur ba yang yod /
translated: Some who have become sravakas or pratyekabuddhas turn away from the aspirations of sravakas and pratyekabuddhas and become fully enlightened buddhas while they are still in training.

original: la la ni mi slob par gyur nas dbang po'i rim pa dang rkyen gyi rim pa la ltos nas ldog cing yongs su 'gyur bar byed de /
analyzed: la la ni mi slob par gyur nas dbang po'i rim pa dang rkyen gyi rim pa la ltos nas ldog cing yongs su 'gyur bar byed de /
translated: Some who become nonlearners regress and transform in reliance on the stage of intellectual faculty and the stage of conditions.

original: mi slob par gyur nas ldog cing yongs su 'gyur ba de yang phung po'i lhag ma med pa'i mya ngan las 'das pa'i dbyings su mya ngan las mi 'da' bar phung po'i lhag ma dang bcas pa'i mya ngan las 'das pa'i dbyings la gnas shing tshe'i 'du byed
analyzed: mi slob par gyur nas ldog cing yongs su 'gyur ba de yang phung po'i lhag ma med pa'i mya ngan las 'das pa'i dbyings su mya ngan las mi 'da' bar phung po'i lhag ma dang bcas pa'i mya ngan las 'das pa'i dbyings la gnas shing tshe'i 'du byed
translated: Those who regress and transform after becoming nonlearners do not attain nirvana in the dhātu of nirvana without residual aggregates but abide in the dhātu of nirvana with residual aggregates and extend the formation of life.

original: bsrings te / dbang po'i lus byin gyis brlabs nas sprul pa'i lus kyi chos mthun pa pa gzhan dag la bdag nyid phung po'i lhag ma med pa'i mya ngan las 'das pa'i dbyings su yongs su mya ngan las 'da' bar ston par byed de /
analyzed: bsrings te / dbang po'i lus byin gyis brlabs nas sprul pa'i lus kyi chos mthun pa pa gzhan dag la bdag nyid phung po'i lhag ma med pa'i mya ngan las 'das pa'i dbyings su yongs su mya ngan las 'da' bar ston par byed de /
translated: They bless their physical faculties and through a body that is a transformation body, they demonstrate to others who are similar to themselves that they attain nirvana in the dhātu of nirvana without residual aggregates.

original: des na gzhan dag 'di snyam du de ni phung po'i lhag ma med pa'i mya ngan las 'das pa'i dbyings su yongs su mya ngan las 'das so snyam du sems par zad kyi /
analyzed: des na gzhan dag 'di snyam du de ni phung po'i lhag ma med pa'i mya ngan las 'das pa'i dbyings su yongs su mya ngan las 'das so snyam du sems par zad kyi /
translated: Therefore, others think that he has passed into parinirvāṇa in the realm of nirvāṇa without any remainder of the aggregates.

original: de'i dbang po'i lus yongs su mya ngan las 'das pa ni ma yin no //🔽de dbang po'i lus byin gyis brlabs pa des 'dzam bu'i gling 'di la sogs pa gar dga' bar ci nas kyang lha rnams kyis kyang mi mthong na /
analyzed: de'i dbang po'i lus yongs su mya ngan las 'das pa ni ma yin no // de dbang po'i lus byin gyis brlabs pa des 'dzam bu'i gling 'di la sogs pa gar dga' bar ci nas kyang lha rnams kyis kyang mi mthong na /
translated: But his body of faculties has not passed into parinirvāṇa.

original: sems can phal pa gzhan dag gis lta smos kyang ci dgos pa de lta bu'i lus kyis rab tu dben par gnas shing /
analyzed: sems can phal pa gzhan dag gis lta smos kyang ci dgos pa de lta bu'i lus kyis rab tu dben par gnas shing /
translated: By his mastery of the body of faculties, he dwells in solitude in a body that even the gods cannot see, let alone other ordinary beings.

original: 'jig rten gyi khams rab 'byams de dang de dag tu de bzhin gshegs pa dang byang chub sems dpa' rnams la bsnyen bkur bya ba dang / byang chub kyi phyogs kyi lam la sbyor bar @117a * //
analyzed: 'jig rten gyi khams rab 'byams de dang de dag tu de bzhin gshegs pa dang byang chub sems dpa' rnams la bsnyen bkur bya ba dang / byang chub kyi phyogs kyi lam la sbyor bar @117a * //
translated: In that body, he goes to various world systems to serve the tathāgatas and bodhisattvas and to apply himself to the path of awakening.

original: byed do // de de ltar sbyor ba na yang sngon nyon mongs pa shas che ba dang dbang po rtul ba'i shugs kyis mya ngan las 'da' ba la mngon par dga' ba dang / de bzhin gshegs pa dang byang chub sems dpa' rnams la bsnyen bkur bya ba dang /
analyzed: byed do // de de ltar sbyor ba na yang sngon nyon mongs pa shas che ba dang dbang po rtul ba'i shugs kyis mya ngan las 'da' ba la mngon par dga' ba dang / de bzhin gshegs pa dang byang chub sems dpa' rnams la bsnyen bkur bya ba dang /
translated: Thus, even though he is engaged in that way, by the force of his previous great afflictions and dull faculties, he is inclined to nirvana,

original: byang chub sems dpa'i tshogs kyi lam bsgoms pa la yang bag med pa skye ste /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa'i tshogs kyi lam bsgoms pa la yang bag med pa skye ste /
translated: and he becomes heedless in serving the Tathagatas and Bodhisattvas and in cultivating the path of the Bodhisattva's collection.

original: de'i tshe na sangs rgyas dang byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyis yang dang yang du yang dag par bskul bar mdzad do //
analyzed: de'i tshe na sangs rgyas dang byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyis yang dang yang du yang dag par bskul bar mdzad do //
translated: At that time, the Buddhas and Bodhisattvas repeatedly exhort him.

original: yang dag par bskul ba na yang de yang dang yang du bag yod pa la rnal 'byor du byed cing rim gyis chos zab mo la bzod pa yang 'thob par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: yang dag par bskul ba na yang de yang dang yang du bag yod pa la rnal 'byor du byed cing rim gyis chos zab mo la bzod pa yang 'thob par 'gyur ro //
translated: When he is exhorted, he repeatedly practices heedfulness and gradually attains the acceptance of the profound Dharma.🔽Thus, the Bodhisattva, having attained the acceptance of the non-arising of dharmas, is called a Bodhisattva who is irreversible from the Great Vehicle.

original: de ltar sangs rgyas kyis la bsam pa nges pa /
analyzed: de ltar sangs rgyas kyis la bsam pa nges pa /
translated: He is called one who is fixed on perfect enlightenment.🔽He is called one who is fixed on the Great Vehicle.

original: nyon mongs pa thams cad spangs pa /🔽chos kyi dbyings rtogs pa /
analyzed: nyon mongs pa thams cad spangs pa /🔽chos kyi dbyings rtogs pa /
translated: He is called one who is fixed on the stage of non-regression.

original: chos zab mo la bzod pa thob pa de la de bzhin gshegs pas sangs rgyas su 'grub par lung ston te /
analyzed: chos zab mo la bzod pa thob pa de la de bzhin gshegs pas sangs rgyas su 'grub par lung ston te /
translated: The Tathagata then predicts that the bodhisattva will attain buddhahood.

original: de de'i tshe na byang chub sems dpa' sa brgyad pa la gnas pa rnam par mi rtog pa lhun gyis 'grub par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de de'i tshe na byang chub sems dpa' sa brgyad pa la gnas pa rnam par mi rtog pa lhun gyis 'grub par 'gyur ro //
translated: At that time, the bodhisattva abiding on the eighth ground attains non-conceptuality spontaneously.

original: de ltar gyur pa dang yang srid pa gzhan len pas byang chub sems dpa'i spyad pa spyod cing /
analyzed: de ltar gyur pa dang yang srid pa gzhan len pas byang chub sems dpa'i spyad pa spyod cing /
translated: Having become that, he takes up another existence and practices the bodhisattva conduct.

original: sems can yongs su smin par bya ba dang / bdag nyid kyi sangs rgyas kyi chos yongs su smin par byed pa'i rim gyis bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu mngon par rdzogs par 'tshang rgya bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: sems can yongs su smin par bya ba dang / bdag nyid kyi sangs rgyas kyi chos yongs su smin par byed pa'i rim gyis bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu mngon par rdzogs par 'tshang rgya bar 'gyur ro //
translated: Through the process of bringing sentient beings to maturity and maturing his own buddha qualities, he will fully awaken to unsurpassed, perfect enlightenment.

original: gang gi tshe bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub mngon par rdzogs par sangs rgyas pa'i tshe na de bzhin gshegs pa nyid du gyur nas /
analyzed: gang gi tshe bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub mngon par rdzogs par sangs rgyas pa'i tshe na de bzhin gshegs pa nyid du gyur nas /
translated: When he fully awakens to unsurpassed, perfect enlightenment, he becomes a tathagata.

original: dgos pa'i dbang du phung po'i lhag ma med pa'i mya ngan las 'das pa'i dbyings su yongs su mya ngan las 'das pa ston par yang 'gyur ro //
analyzed: dgos pa'i dbang du phung po'i lhag ma med pa'i mya ngan las 'das pa'i dbyings su yongs su mya ngan las 'das pa ston par yang 'gyur ro //
translated: In terms of necessity, he will also demonstrate the parinirvana in the dhatu of nirvana without remainder of the aggregates.

original: de ltar mi slob par gyur nas byang chub sems dpa' sa brgyad par gyur ba de srid pa gzhan len par byed pa'i rgyu gang zhe na /
analyzed: de ltar mi slob par gyur nas byang chub sems dpa' sa brgyad par gyur ba de srid pa gzhan len par byed pa'i rgyu gang zhe na /
translated: What is the cause for the bodhisattva who has become a non-learner to take another birth?

original: de ni stobs rnam pa gnyis te /
analyzed: de ni stobs rnam pa gnyis te /
translated: It is the two kinds of power:

original: rkyen gyi stobs dang / rgyu'i stobs so //
analyzed: rkyen gyi stobs dang / rgyu'i stobs so //
translated: the power of conditions and the power of causes.

original: de la rkyen gyi stobs ni de mi slob par gyur te /
analyzed: de la rkyen gyi stobs ni de mi slob par gyur te /
translated: Among them, the power of conditions is that, having become a non-learner,🔽when abiding in suchness, which is the transformation of the foundation consciousness, he attains the transformation through abandoning all afflictive obstructions, but because he has not abandoned the obstructions to omniscience, the subtle latent tendencies of ignorance without afflictions

original: kun gzhi rnam par shes pa'i gnas gyur pa'i de bzhin nyid la gnas ba na nyon mongs pa'i sgrib pa thams cad spangs pas gnas gyur pa thob kyang shes bya'i sgrib pa ma spangs @117b pas nyon mongs pa med pa'i ma rig pa'i bag chags phra mo ma
analyzed: kun gzhi rnam par shes pa'i gnas gyur pa'i de bzhin nyid la gnas ba na nyon mongs pa'i sgrib pa thams cad spangs pas gnas gyur pa thob kyang shes bya'i sgrib pa ma spangs @117b pas nyon mongs pa med pa'i ma rig pa'i bag chags phra mo ma
translated: are not abandoned.

original: spangs pa ni srid pa gzhan len pa'i rkyen gyi stobs yin no //
analyzed: spangs pa ni srid pa gzhan len pa'i rkyen gyi stobs yin no //
translated: This is the power of conditions for taking another birth.

original: rgyu'i stobs ni 'khor ba'i rgyu byed la dge ba'i rtsa ba dang mtshungs par ldan pa'i nyon mongs pa rnams te /
analyzed: rgyu'i stobs ni 'khor ba'i rgyu byed la dge ba'i rtsa ba dang mtshungs par ldan pa'i nyon mongs pa rnams te /
translated: The power of cause is the afflictions concomitant with the roots of virtue that act as the cause of samsara.

original: de dag kyang gang zhe na /
analyzed: de dag kyang gang zhe na /
translated: What are they?

original: bsod nams kyi tshogs btsal bas yongs su mi ngoms pa dang / bsams bzhin du srid par skye ba yongs su 'dzin pa dang / sangs rgyas dang phrad par smon pa dang / sems can yongs su smin par bya ba la yongs su mi skyo ba dang /
analyzed: bsod nams kyi tshogs btsal bas yongs su mi ngoms pa dang / bsams bzhin du srid par skye ba yongs su 'dzin pa dang / sangs rgyas dang phrad par smon pa dang / sems can yongs su smin par bya ba la yongs su mi skyo ba dang /
translated: They are not being satisfied with seeking the accumulation of merit, taking up birth in samsara as one wishes, aspiring to meet with the buddhas, not being discouraged about bringing sentient beings to full maturity,

original: dam pa'i chos yongs su 'dzin pa la brtson pa dang / sems can gyi bya ba ci yod snyam pa la spro ba dang / chos 'dod pa'i bag la nyal mi 'dor ba dang / pha rol tu phyin pa la sbyor ba yongs su mi gtong ba ste /
analyzed: dam pa'i chos yongs su 'dzin pa la brtson pa dang / sems can gyi bya ba ci yod snyam pa la spro ba dang / chos 'dod pa'i bag la nyal mi 'dor ba dang / pha rol tu phyin pa la sbyor ba yongs su mi gtong ba ste /
translated: striving to uphold the sublime Dharma, being enthusiastic about whatever needs to be done for sentient beings, not abandoning the latent tendency to desire the teachings and not forsaking the practice of the transcendent perfections.

original: dge ba'i rtsa ba rnam par smin pa'i bdag nyid du yongs su bsgyur ba de dag ma rig ba'i bag chags kyi rkyen gyi dbang gis brtas par gyur na yang srid par lus mngon par grub pa'i rgyur 'gyur bas rgyu rkyen de gnyis kyang srid pa len par
analyzed: dge ba'i rtsa ba rnam par smin pa'i bdag nyid du yongs su bsgyur ba de dag ma rig ba'i bag chags kyi rkyen gyi dbang gis brtas par gyur na yang srid par lus mngon par grub pa'i rgyur 'gyur bas rgyu rkyen de gnyis kyang srid pa len par
translated: When those roots of virtue, which have been transformed into the nature of maturation, increase through the power of the condition of the latent tendencies of ignorance, they become the cause for the establishment of the body in existence. Thus, those two causes and conditions also bring about the taking of existence.

original: byed do // de ltar mi slob par gyur nas byang chub tu yongs su 'gyur ba de'i tshe'i 'du byed du bsrings su zin kyang dbang po rtul ba dang / mya ngan las 'das ba la mngon par dga' ba'i phyir bla na med pa'i byang chub tu shin tu bul ba yin pas bskal pa grangs med pa gsum gyis nges par 'byung ba ni ma nges te /
analyzed: byed do // de ltar mi slob par gyur nas byang chub tu yongs su 'gyur ba de'i tshe'i 'du byed du bsrings su zin kyang dbang po rtul ba dang / mya ngan las 'das ba la mngon par dga' ba'i phyir bla na med pa'i byang chub tu shin tu bul ba yin pas bskal pa grangs med pa gsum gyis nges par 'byung ba ni ma nges te /
translated: In that way, having become a non-learner, when that transformation into enlightenment has occurred, even if the formative forces of life are extended, because of the dull faculties and the delight in nirvana, it is very slow in unsurpassed enlightenment. Therefore, it is not definite that one will definitely emerge in three incalculable aeons.

original: byang chub sems dpa' las dang po pa yang de bas ches mgyogs par rig par bya'o //
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' las dang po pa yang de bas ches mgyogs par rig par bya'o //
translated: It should be understood that even a beginner bodhisattva is much faster than that.

original: sems can ma nges pa'i rigs can de theg pa chen pos yongs su mya ngan las 'da' bar 'gyur ba'i rkyen gzhan rnyed na ni dang po nyid nas bla na med pa'i byang chub tu sems bskyed cing /
analyzed: sems can ma nges pa'i rigs can de theg pa chen pos yongs su mya ngan las 'da' bar 'gyur ba'i rkyen gzhan rnyed na ni dang po nyid nas bla na med pa'i byang chub tu sems bskyed cing /
translated: If those of indefinite lineage find other conditions for attaining nirvana by the Mahayana, they generate the first generation of the Mahayana mind of enlightenment and

original: byang chub sems dpa'i sa'i rim gyis bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu mngon par rdzogs par 'tshang rgya ste /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa'i sa'i rim gyis bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu mngon par rdzogs par 'tshang rgya ste /
translated: they fully awaken to unsurpassed perfect buddhahood by the stages of the levels of bodhisattvas.

original: de yang sems bskyed pa nas sa dang po'i bar du 'jig rten pa'i lam la ni shin tu dbang po rtul ba dang / nyon mongs pa shas che ba dang / mi brtson pa'i shas che bas bskal pa grangs med pa dang pos nges par 'byung bar ma nges so //🔽sa dang po thob pa yan chad ni mi brtson pa mi srid pas bskal ba grangs med pa gnyis kyis nges par @118a * //
analyzed: de yang sems bskyed pa nas sa dang po'i bar du 'jig rten pa'i lam la ni shin tu dbang po rtul ba dang / nyon mongs pa shas che ba dang / mi brtson pa'i shas che bas bskal pa grangs med pa dang pos nges par 'byung bar ma nges so // sa dang po thob pa yan chad ni mi brtson pa mi srid pas bskal ba grangs med pa gnyis kyis nges par @118a * //
translated: Moreover, from the generation of the first generation of the mind of enlightenment up to the first level, it is not definite that they will attain emancipation in the first incalculable eon because they have extremely dull faculties, they have a preponderance of afflictions and they have a preponderance of non diligence.

original: 'byung bar nges pa yin no //
analyzed: 'byung bar nges pa yin no //
translated: From the attainment of the first level onward, it is definite that they will attain emancipation in the second incalculable eon because it is impossible for them to be non diligent.

original: de ltar na ma nges pa'i rigs can zhes bya ba yang sngar ni theg pa gsum gyis yongs su mya ngan las 'da' ba'i rkyen yang dag par bsgrubs pa'i rigs cha mnyam par thob pa yin la /
analyzed: de ltar na ma nges pa'i rigs can zhes bya ba yang sngar ni theg pa gsum gyis yongs su mya ngan las 'da' ba'i rkyen yang dag par bsgrubs pa'i rigs cha mnyam par thob pa yin la /
translated: Thus, those called “those of unfixed potential” previously obtain the potential for complete nirvana through the three vehicles and they are of equal parts.🔽Later, when they generate the thought, they become subject to the conditions of any vehicle.

original: phyis sems bskyed pa'i gnas skabs na ni theg pa gang yang rung ba'i rkyen gzhan gcig gi dbang du 'gyur ba tsam la dgongs pa yin pas sems can gyi ris na gcig tu de ltar ngas pa'i sde tshan du chad pa ni med de /
analyzed: phyis sems bskyed pa'i gnas skabs na ni theg pa gang yang rung ba'i rkyen gzhan gcig gi dbang du 'gyur ba tsam la dgongs pa yin pas sems can gyi ris na gcig tu de ltar ngas pa'i sde tshan du chad pa ni med de /
translated: Thus, there is no class of sentient beings who are absolutely fixed in one class.

original: de yang rang bzhin gcig tu ma nges pa yin par rig par bya'o //
analyzed: de yang rang bzhin gcig tu ma nges pa yin par rig par bya'o //
translated: Also, they should be understood as not definitely of one nature.

original: nyan thos dang rang sangs rgyas dang / de bzhin gshegs pa'i theg pa mngon par rtogs pa'i rigs can zhes bya ba gsum ni tshul 'dra ste /
analyzed: nyan thos dang rang sangs rgyas dang / de bzhin gshegs pa'i theg pa mngon par rtogs pa'i rigs can zhes bya ba gsum ni tshul 'dra ste /
translated: Those of the three potentials for realizing the sravaka, pratyekabuddha and tathagata vehicles are similar in method.

original: sems can rang bzhin gyis gnas pa'i rigs can de dag las gang gis nyan thos kyi thag pas mya ngan las 'da' ba'i rkyen yang dag par bsgrubs pa'i rigs 'ba' zhig thob pa ni nyan thos kyi theg pa mngon par rtogs pa'i rigs can zhes bya /🔽gang gis rang sangs rgyas kyi theg pas mya ngan las 'da' ba'i rkyen yang dag par bsgrubs pa'i rigs 'ba' zhig thob pa ni rang sangs rgyas kyi theg pa mngon par rtogs pa'i rigs can zhes bya /
analyzed: sems can rang bzhin gyis gnas pa'i rigs can de dag las gang gis nyan thos kyi thag pas mya ngan las 'da' ba'i rkyen yang dag par bsgrubs pa'i rigs 'ba' zhig thob pa ni nyan thos kyi theg pa mngon par rtogs pa'i rigs can zhes bya / gang gis rang sangs rgyas kyi theg pas mya ngan las 'da' ba'i rkyen yang dag par bsgrubs pa'i rigs 'ba' zhig thob pa ni rang sangs rgyas kyi theg pa mngon par rtogs pa'i rigs can zhes bya /
translated: Those who have obtained only the potential that is the condition for attaining nirvana by the śrāvaka vehicle are called those with the potential for realizing the śrāvaka vehicle.🔽Those who have obtained only the potential that is the condition for attaining nirvana by the pratyekabuddha vehicle are called those with the potential for realizing the pratyekabuddha vehicle.

original: gang gis theg pa chen pos mya ngan las 'da' ba'i rkyen yang dag par bsgrubs pa'i rigs 'ba' zhig thob pa ni de bzhin gshegs pa'i theg pa mngon par rtogs pa'i rigs can zhes bya ste /
analyzed: gang gis theg pa chen pos mya ngan las 'da' ba'i rkyen yang dag par bsgrubs pa'i rigs 'ba' zhig thob pa ni de bzhin gshegs pa'i theg pa mngon par rtogs pa'i rigs can zhes bya ste /
translated: Those who have obtained only the potential that is the condition for attaining nirvana by the Mahayana are called those with the potential for realizing the vehicle of the Tathāgata.

original: de dag kyang yang dag par bsgrubs pa'i rigs kyi rkyen ji lta ba bzhin rang rang gi theg pa mngon par rtogs shing /🔽de'i 'bras bu so so'i byang chub thob par nges pa yin no //
analyzed: de dag kyang yang dag par bsgrubs pa'i rigs kyi rkyen ji lta ba bzhin rang rang gi theg pa mngon par rtogs shing / de'i 'bras bu so so'i byang chub thob par nges pa yin no //
translated: They are the conditions for the accomplishment of the family, and they are the realization of their respective vehicles.🔽And it is certain that they will attain their respective enlightenment, which is the result of that realization.

original: byang chub thob nas kyang de bzhin gshegs pa ni mthar thug pa'i 'bras bu mngon par rtogs pa bla na med pa yin pas de las gong du la zlar yang med do //
analyzed: byang chub thob nas kyang de bzhin gshegs pa ni mthar thug pa'i 'bras bu mngon par rtogs pa bla na med pa yin pas de las gong du la zlar yang med do //
translated: And when they attain enlightenment, the Tathagata is the realization of the ultimate result, and there is nothing higher or more advanced than that.

original: nyan thos dang rang sangs rgyas kyi byang chub thob pa ni 'jig rten las 'das pa'i lam gyis rab tu phye ba gnas gyur ba thob pa'i chos nyid kyis na phyir sa 'og mar mi ltung bar nges pa dang / gong du mthar thug pa'i 'bras bu bla na med pa'i byang chub nges par 'thob pa kho na yin pas mjug tu ni thams cad kyang bla na med pa'i @118b sangs rgyas nying du 'grub par rig par bya'o //
