analyzed: nyan thos dang rang sangs rgyas kyi byang chub thob pa ni 'jig rten las 'das pa'i lam gyis rab tu phye ba gnas gyur ba thob pa'i chos nyid kyis na phyir sa 'og mar mi ltung bar nges pa dang / gong du mthar thug pa'i 'bras bu bla na med pa'i byang chub nges par 'thob pa kho na yin pas mjug tu ni thams cad kyang bla na med pa'i @118b sangs rgyas nying du 'grub par rig par bya'o //
translated: And in the end, all of them definitely attain the ultimate result, unsurpassable enlightenment.

original: de la bye brag tu na nyan thos kyi theg pa mngon par rtogs pa'i rigs can gyis nyan thos kyi byang chub thob pa ni zhi ba'i bgrod pa gcig pu ba zhes bya ste /
analyzed: de la bye brag tu na nyan thos kyi theg pa mngon par rtogs pa'i rigs can gyis nyan thos kyi byang chub thob pa ni zhi ba'i bgrod pa gcig pu ba zhes bya ste /
translated: In particular, the attainment of sravaka enlightenment by those of the sravaka lineage who realize the sravaka vehicle is called the solitary path of peace.

original: de ni dang po nas kyang dbang po rtul ba dang / snying rje chung ba dang / sdug bsngal gyis 'jigs pa'i rang bzhin can yin par nyan thos kyi theg pas mya ngan las 'das pa'i rkyen yang dag par bsgrubs pa'i rigs 'ba' zhig thob pa yin la /
analyzed: de ni dang po nas kyang dbang po rtul ba dang / snying rje chung ba dang / sdug bsngal gyis 'jigs pa'i rang bzhin can yin par nyan thos kyi theg pas mya ngan las 'das pa'i rkyen yang dag par bsgrubs pa'i rigs 'ba' zhig thob pa yin la /
translated: They obtain only the potential that is the correct condition for attaining nirvana through the Śrāvaka Vehicle.

original: nyan thos kyi theg pas nyan thos kyi byang chub thob pa'i dus na yang dbang po rtul ba dang / snying rje shin tu chung ba dang / sdug bsngal gyis shin tu 'jigs pa yin te /
analyzed: nyan thos kyi theg pas nyan thos kyi byang chub thob pa'i dus na yang dbang po rtul ba dang / snying rje shin tu chung ba dang / sdug bsngal gyis shin tu 'jigs pa yin te /
translated: When they attain the enlightenment of śrāvakas through the Śrāvaka Vehicle, they have dull faculties, very little compassion, and are terrified of suffering.

original: dbang po rtul bas ni myur du bla na med pa'i byang chub mngon par 'tshang rgya ba'i rkyen yang dag par bsgrubs pa'i rigs mi 'thob la /
analyzed: dbang po rtul bas ni myur du bla na med pa'i byang chub mngon par 'tshang rgya ba'i rkyen yang dag par bsgrubs pa'i rigs mi 'thob la /
translated: Because of their dull faculties, they do not obtain the potential that is the correct condition for quickly attaining the unsurpassed enlightenment.

original: snying rje chung bas ni sems can gyi don bya ba la mi phyogs par 'gyur /
analyzed: snying rje chung bas ni sems can gyi don bya ba la mi phyogs par 'gyur /
translated: Because of their little compassion, they turn away from working for the welfare of sentient beings.

original: sdug bsngal gyis 'jigs pas na 'du byed mngon par 'du bya ba thams cad la mi phyogs par 'gyur te /🔽de ltar bla na med pa'i byang chub mngon par 'tshang rgya ba'i rkyen yang dag par bsgrubs pa'i rigs ma thob pa dang / sems can gyi don bya ba la shin tu mi phyogs pa dang / 'du byed mngon par 'du bya ba thams cad la shin tu mi phyogs pa de ni de'i tshe na bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub mngon par rdzogs par sangs rgyas ba'i skal ba dang ldan pa'i gzhi med pa kho na yin pas bla
analyzed: sdug bsngal gyis 'jigs pas na 'du byed mngon par 'du bya ba thams cad la mi phyogs par 'gyur te / de ltar bla na med pa'i byang chub mngon par 'tshang rgya ba'i rkyen yang dag par bsgrubs pa'i rigs ma thob pa dang / sems can gyi don bya ba la shin tu mi phyogs pa dang / 'du byed mngon par 'du bya ba thams cad la shin tu mi phyogs pa de ni de'i tshe na bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub mngon par rdzogs par sangs rgyas ba'i skal ba dang ldan pa'i gzhi med pa kho na yin pas bla
translated: Because of fear of suffering, one turns away from all the compositional activity of karma.

original: na med pa'i byang chub kyi rigs med pa zhes bya ste /
analyzed: na med pa'i byang chub kyi rigs med pa zhes bya ste /
translated: Thus, when one has not obtained the lineage that is the condition for attaining manifest, complete enlightenment, when one is completely averse to working for the welfare of sentient beings and when one is completely averse to all compositional activity, at that time one is not at all a suitable vessel for attaining manifest, complete enlightenment and one is said to lack the lineage for unsurpassable enlightenment.

original: de'i tshe na ni dper na nor bu mching bu byi dor byas kyang yid bzhin gyi nor bu rin po cher mi 'gyur ba dang 'dra bar /
analyzed: de'i tshe na ni dper na nor bu mching bu byi dor byas kyang yid bzhin gyi nor bu rin po cher mi 'gyur ba dang 'dra bar /
translated: At that time, just as a piece of glass, even when polished, is not a precious wish fulfilling jewel,

original: sangs rgyas thams cad brtson pa dang ldan par gyur kyang byang chub kyi snying po la gzhag ste /
analyzed: sangs rgyas thams cad brtson pa dang ldan par gyur kyang byang chub kyi snying po la gzhag ste /
translated: Even if all the buddhas were to exert themselves, they would be unable to place him in the essence of enlightenment and cause him to attain

original: bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs ba'i byang chub thob par mi nus so //
analyzed: bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs ba'i byang chub thob par mi nus so //
translated: unsurpassed perfect enlightenment.🔽If he were to remain in that result, which is the solitary path of peace, then due to the condition of his slight compassion and fear of suffering, he would quickly enter into the expanse of nirvana without any remaining aggregates.

original: de zhi ba'i bgrod pa gcig pu pa'i 'bras bu de nyid la gnas na snying rje chung ba dang / sdug bsngal gyis 'jigs pa'i rkyen de nyid kyis myur ba kho nar phung po'i lhag ma med pa'i mya ngan las 'das pa'i dbyings su yongs su mya ngan las 'da' zhing dbyings de ni kun gzhi rnam par shes pa gnas gyur pa'i de bzhin nyid la gnas te
analyzed: de zhi ba'i bgrod pa gcig pu pa'i 'bras bu de nyid la gnas na snying rje chung ba dang / sdug bsngal gyis 'jigs pa'i rkyen de nyid kyis myur ba kho nar phung po'i lhag ma med pa'i mya ngan las 'das pa'i dbyings su yongs su mya ngan las 'da' zhing dbyings de ni kun gzhi rnam par shes pa gnas gyur pa'i de bzhin nyid la gnas te
translated: That expanse is the suchness that is the transformation of the foundation consciousness.

original: / khams dang 'gro ba @119a * //
analyzed: / khams dang 'gro ba @119a * //
translated: The realms and migrations

original: dang skye gnas su gtogs pa'i sems can gyi rigs gang gi khongs su yang mi bgrang bar zag pa med pa'i dbyings na so so rang rig pa'i shes pa tha snyad thams cad yang dag par chad pas gnas so //
analyzed: dang skye gnas su gtogs pa'i sems can gyi rigs gang gi khongs su yang mi bgrang bar zag pa med pa'i dbyings na so so rang rig pa'i shes pa tha snyad thams cad yang dag par chad pas gnas so //
translated: It is not counted among any of the types of sentient beings who belong to the realms of existence, but abides in the uncontaminated realm, the knowledge of individual intuitive awareness, which is completely free from all conventions.

original: kun gzhi rnam par shes pa gnas gyur pa'i de bzhin nyid la gnas pa dang / nyon mongs pa'i sgrib pa thams cad spangs pas gnas gyur pa thob kyang shes bya'i sgrib pa ma spangs pas nyon mongs pa med pa'i ma rig pa'i bag chags phra mo rgyud la yod pa'i rkyen dang /
analyzed: kun gzhi rnam par shes pa gnas gyur pa'i de bzhin nyid la gnas pa dang / nyon mongs pa'i sgrib pa thams cad spangs pas gnas gyur pa thob kyang shes bya'i sgrib pa ma spangs pas nyon mongs pa med pa'i ma rig pa'i bag chags phra mo rgyud la yod pa'i rkyen dang /
translated: It abides in suchness, which is the transformation of the consciousness of the ground of all, and although it has attained the transformation that is the abandonment of all afflictive obscurations, it has not abandoned the cognitive obscurations, so it has the subtle latent dispositions of nonafflictive ignorance in its continuum.🔽The conditions for that are the transformation of the consciousness of the ground of all, which is the path of realizing the lack of an objective self, the imagined nature.

original: sngon kun brtags pa'i ngo bo nyid kyi chos bdag med pa rtogs pa'i lam gyi kun gzhi rnam par shes pa de nas gyur pa'i sngar de bzhin gshegs pa'i snying po khams bzang po yod pa'i rgyu'i stobs kyang brtas nas nam zhig na zag pa med pa'i dbyings
analyzed: sngon kun brtags pa'i ngo bo nyid kyi chos bdag med pa rtogs pa'i lam gyi kun gzhi rnam par shes pa de nas gyur pa'i sngar de bzhin gshegs pa'i snying po khams bzang po yod pa'i rgyu'i stobs kyang brtas nas nam zhig na zag pa med pa'i dbyings
translated: When the power of the cause, the good element of the essence of the tathagatas, increases, at that time, in the uncontaminated realm, the transformation of the consciousness of the ground of all, which is the path of realizing the lack of an objective self, the imagined nature, is attained.

original: de ni so sor rig pa'i shes pa tha snyad thams cad yang dag par chad pa de sngon kun brtags pa'i ngo bo nyid kyis chos bdag med par rtogs pa'i rjes su rtogs pa'i dus kyang yod skabs kyang yod do //
analyzed: de ni so sor rig pa'i shes pa tha snyad thams cad yang dag par chad pa de sngon kun brtags pa'i ngo bo nyid kyis chos bdag med par rtogs pa'i rjes su rtogs pa'i dus kyang yod skabs kyang yod do //
translated: That is the individually realized consciousness, which has completely eliminated all conventional expressions. It is the time and the occasion when one realizes the emptiness of the self of phenomena, which was previously imagined.

original: de'i dus na de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad kyi byin gyi rlabs bsam gyis mi khyab pas yang dag par bskul nas zag pa med pa'i dbyings de nas langs te /
analyzed: de'i dus na de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad kyi byin gyi rlabs bsam gyis mi khyab pas yang dag par bskul nas zag pa med pa'i dbyings de nas langs te /
translated: At that time, having been inspired by the inconceivable blessings of all the Tathāgatas, one arises from the uncontaminated realm.

original: yid las byung ba'i lus byin gyis rlob cing lus de sngar byang chub tu yongs su 'gyur ba'i skabs su ji skad bshad pa'i tshul bzhin du bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub mngon par rdzogs par 'tshang rgya bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: yid las byung ba'i lus byin gyis rlob cing lus de sngar byang chub tu yongs su 'gyur ba'i skabs su ji skad bshad pa'i tshul bzhin du bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub mngon par rdzogs par 'tshang rgya bar 'gyur ro //
translated: One blesses the body that is born of mind, and that body, in the same way as previously explained in the context of the transformation into enlightenment, will fully awaken to unsurpassed, perfect, complete enlightenment.

original: rang sangs rgyas ma nges pa'i rigs can dang / rang sangs rgyas kyi theg pa mngon par rtogs pa'i rigs can gyis rang byang chub thob pa ni rnam pa gsum ste /
analyzed: rang sangs rgyas ma nges pa'i rigs can dang / rang sangs rgyas kyi theg pa mngon par rtogs pa'i rigs can gyis rang byang chub thob pa ni rnam pa gsum ste /
translated: Those of unfixed potential for the Rhinoceros-like and those of the type who realize the vehicle of the pratyekabuddhas who obtain the result of a pratyekabuddha are of three types:

original: nges par 'byed pa'i cha dang mthun pa thob pa sngon du btang ba dang / mngon par rtogs pa sngon du btang ba dang / sngon du ma btang ba'o //
analyzed: nges par 'byed pa'i cha dang mthun pa thob pa sngon du btang ba dang / mngon par rtogs pa sngon du btang ba dang / sngon du ma btang ba'o //
translated: those who obtain the result of a pratyekabuddha after previously obtaining the factors conducive to penetrative insight, those who obtain it after previously obtaining the realization of the result and those who obtain it without previously obtaining them.

original: de la nges par 'byed pa'i cha dang mthun pa thob pa sngon du btang ba ni dang por rang byang chub kyi theg par sems bskyed nas nges par 'byed pa'i cha dang mthun pa'i dge ba'i rtsa ba bzhi thob pa la brten nas /
analyzed: de la nges par 'byed pa'i cha dang mthun pa thob pa sngon du btang ba ni dang por rang byang chub kyi theg par sems bskyed nas nges par 'byed pa'i cha dang mthun pa'i dge ba'i rtsa ba bzhi thob pa la brten nas /
translated: Those who obtain the result of a pratyekabuddha after previously obtaining the factors conducive to penetrative insight are those who first generate the enlightenment mind of the pratyekabuddha vehicle and then, on the basis of obtaining the four roots of virtue that are factors conducive to penetrative insight,

original: slob pa'i sa bdun po gang yang mi thob par thal byung du mi slob pa'i sa rang byang chub kyi 'bras bu nyid thob pa ste /
analyzed: slob pa'i sa bdun po gang yang mi thob par thal byung du mi slob pa'i sa rang byang chub kyi 'bras bu nyid thob pa ste /
translated: they obtain the result of a pratyekabuddha, the level of no more learning, without obtaining any of the seven levels of learning.

original: de ni 'jig rten pa'i sa dang / mi slob pa'i sa ni yod la /
analyzed: de ni 'jig rten pa'i sa dang / mi slob pa'i sa ni yod la /
translated: They have the mundane level and the level of no more learning.

original: slob pa'i sa ni med pa yin no //
analyzed: slob pa'i sa ni med pa yin no //
translated: The stage of training does not exist.

original: mngon @119b par rtogs pa sngon du btang ba ni dang por rang byang chub kyi theg par sems bskyed nas nges par 'byed pa'i cha dang mthun pa'i dge ba'i rtsa ba bzhi yang thob bo //
analyzed: mngon @119b par rtogs pa sngon du btang ba ni dang por rang byang chub kyi theg par sems bskyed nas nges par 'byed pa'i cha dang mthun pa'i dge ba'i rtsa ba bzhi yang thob bo //
translated: Those who have previously had direct realization first generate the intention to achieve pratyekabuddha enlightenment and then obtain the four roots of virtue that are conducive to penetrative insight.

original: slob pa'i sa bdun po dag mngon par rtogs pa yang thob pa la brten nas /
analyzed: slob pa'i sa bdun po dag mngon par rtogs pa yang thob pa la brten nas /
translated: Then, on the basis of obtaining direct realization of the seven stages of training,

original: mi slob pa'i sar ba byang chub kyi 'bras bu nyid thob pa ste /
analyzed: mi slob pa'i sar ba byang chub kyi 'bras bu nyid thob pa ste /
translated: they obtain the result of pratyekabuddha enlightenment, the stage of no more training.

original: de ni 'jig rten pa'i sa dang / slob pa'i sa dang / mi slob pa'i sa gsum char yod pa yin no //
analyzed: de ni 'jig rten pa'i sa dang / slob pa'i sa dang / mi slob pa'i sa gsum char yod pa yin no //
translated: This stage has three parts: the mundane stage, the stage of training, and the stage of no more training.🔽Those who have not previously had direct realization first generate the intention to achieve pratyekabuddha enlightenment in the pratyekabuddha vehicle.

original: sngon du ma btang ba ni dang por rang byang chub kyi theg par sems bskyed nas thar pa'i cha dang mthun pa'i dge ba'i rtsa ba de nyid la brten nas /
analyzed: sngon du ma btang ba ni dang por rang byang chub kyi theg par sems bskyed nas thar pa'i cha dang mthun pa'i dge ba'i rtsa ba de nyid la brten nas /
translated: Then, on the basis of those very roots of virtue that are conducive to liberation,

original: bskal ba brgyar tshogs bsags te /
analyzed: bskal ba brgyar tshogs bsags te /
translated: they accumulate the collections for one hundred eons.

original: nges par 'byed pa'i cha dang mthun pa yang mi thob /
analyzed: nges par 'byed pa'i cha dang mthun pa yang mi thob /
translated: They do not obtain the roots of virtue that are conducive to penetrative insight.

original: slob pa'i sa yang mi thob par thal byung du mi slob pa'i sa rang byang chub kyi 'bras bu nyid thob pa ste /
analyzed: slob pa'i sa yang mi thob par thal byung du mi slob pa'i sa rang byang chub kyi 'bras bu nyid thob pa ste /
translated: It follows that they do not attain the learner’s stage, but directly attain the nonlearner’s stage, the result of a pratyekabuddha’s enlightenment.

original: de ni 'jig rten pa'i sa thar ba'i cha dang mthun pa'i dge ba'i rtsa ba dang / mi slob pa'i sa ni yod la /
analyzed: de ni 'jig rten pa'i sa thar ba'i cha dang mthun pa'i dge ba'i rtsa ba dang / mi slob pa'i sa ni yod la /
translated: They have the mundane stage, the roots of virtue that are conducive to liberation, and the nonlearner’s stage.

original: 'jig rten pa'i sa nges par 'byed pa'i cha dang mthun pa dang / slob pa'i sa ni med pa yin no //
analyzed: 'jig rten pa'i sa nges par 'byed pa'i cha dang mthun pa dang / slob pa'i sa ni med pa yin no //
translated: They do not have the mundane stage that is conducive to penetrative insight, nor the learner’s stage.

original: de la dang po gnyis kyis ni rang rgyal ba tshogs na spyod par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de la dang po gnyis kyis ni rang rgyal ba tshogs na spyod par 'gyur ro //
translated: The first two of those become pratyekabuddhas who live in a group.

original: tha mas ni bse ru lta bur 'gyur te /
analyzed: tha mas ni bse ru lta bur 'gyur te /
translated: The last becomes a pratyekabuddha who is like a rhinoceros.

original: de dag las byang chub tu yongs su 'gyur ba dang / zhi ba'i bgrod pa gcig pu par gdags pa dang / sgo de gnyis la ji ltar bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub mngon par rdzogs par 'tshang rgya ba'i tshul ni nyan thos dang 'dra ba kho nar rig par bya'o //
analyzed: de dag las byang chub tu yongs su 'gyur ba dang / zhi ba'i bgrod pa gcig pu par gdags pa dang / sgo de gnyis la ji ltar bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub mngon par rdzogs par 'tshang rgya ba'i tshul ni nyan thos dang 'dra ba kho nar rig par bya'o //
translated: From among those, the way of fully turning toward enlightenment and the way of being designated as having the single passage to peace and the way of fully awakening to unsurpassed, perfect, complete enlightenment through those two doors should be understood to be exactly the same as for śrāvakas.

original: de ltar na nyan thos dang rang sangs rgyas dang / de bzhin gshegs pa'i theg ba mngon par rtogs pa'i rigs can zhes bya ba gsum yang theg pa so sos yongs su mya ngan las 'da' ba'i rkyen yang dag par bsgrubs pa'i rigs kyis rkyen gyi dbang gis 'gyur bar zad kyi /
analyzed: de ltar na nyan thos dang rang sangs rgyas dang / de bzhin gshegs pa'i theg ba mngon par rtogs pa'i rigs can zhes bya ba gsum yang theg pa so sos yongs su mya ngan las 'da' ba'i rkyen yang dag par bsgrubs pa'i rigs kyis rkyen gyi dbang gis 'gyur bar zad kyi /
translated: Thus, the three types of persons who are classified as having the potential for the sravaka vehicle, the pratyekabuddha vehicle and the Tathagata vehicle are merely so called because of the different conditions that they have correctly established for attaining nirvana by means of their respective vehicles.

original: sems can gyi ris na de ltar nges pa'i sde tshan du chad pa ni med de /
analyzed: sems can gyi ris na de ltar nges pa'i sde tshan du chad pa ni med de /
translated: But there is no such fixed division of sentient beings into such categories.

original: de dag kyang rang bzhin gcig tu ma nges pa yin par rig par bya'o //
analyzed: de dag kyang rang bzhin gcig tu ma nges pa yin par rig par bya'o //
translated: And it should be understood that these are not definitely of one single nature.

original: de ltar na mdo sde las rigs lngar gsungs pa yang rang bzhin du gnas pa'i rigs ni thams cad la yang 'dra bar yod la /
analyzed: de ltar na mdo sde las rigs lngar gsungs pa yang rang bzhin du gnas pa'i rigs ni thams cad la yang 'dra bar yod la /
translated: Thus, the five potentials mentioned in the sutras are the same in all beings in that they have the naturally existing potential.

original: yang dag par bsgrubs pa'i rigs kyi bye brag las re zhig pa'i tshul gyis rnam pa lngar dbye bar zad kyi /
analyzed: yang dag par bsgrubs pa'i rigs kyi bye brag las re zhig pa'i tshul gyis rnam pa lngar dbye bar zad kyi /
translated: But the classification into five types is merely a temporary way of dividing the potential that is correctly practiced into different types.

original: gtan du so sor nges ba ni ma yin par shes par bya'o //
analyzed: gtan du so sor nges ba ni ma yin par shes par bya'o //
translated: It should be understood that they are not definitely separate forever.

original: de dag ni rigs rnam par gzhag pa spyir bstan pa yin gyi /
analyzed: de dag ni rigs rnam par gzhag pa spyir bstan pa yin gyi /
translated: This is the general presentation of the classification of lineages.

original: @120a * // skabs 'dir rigs kyi gzhi dang ldan pa zhes bya ba ni nyan thos kyi theg par mngon par rtogs pa'i rigs can zhi ba'i bgrod pa gcig pu pa nyi tshe gzung bar bya'o //
analyzed: @120a * // skabs 'dir rigs kyi gzhi dang ldan pa zhes bya ba ni nyan thos kyi theg par mngon par rtogs pa'i rigs can zhi ba'i bgrod pa gcig pu pa nyi tshe gzung bar bya'o //
translated: But in this context, “endowed with the basis of lineage” means that one should be understood as a person of the śrāvaka lineage who is of the type that is destined for parinirvāṇa through the śrāvaka vehicle alone.

original: de ltar spyi'i don bstan nas da ni de dag gi tshig gi don bshad par bya ste /
analyzed: de ltar spyi'i don bstan nas da ni de dag gi tshig gi don bshad par bya ste /
translated: Having presented the general meaning, now the meaning of the words will be explained.

original: zhi ba'i bgrod pa gcig pu pa zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: zhi ba'i bgrod pa gcig pu pa zhes bya ba la /
translated: “Destined for parinirvāṇa through the śrāvaka vehicle alone” means

original: zhi zhes bya ba ni nyon mongs pa'i sgrib pa las rnam par grol ba'o //
analyzed: zhi zhes bya ba ni nyon mongs pa'i sgrib pa las rnam par grol ba'o //
translated: “śrāvaka” is one who is liberated from the afflictive obstructions.

original: bgrod pa zhes bya ba ni lam dang 'bras bu ste /
analyzed: bgrod pa zhes bya ba ni lam dang 'bras bu ste /
translated: “Vehicle” means the path and the result,

original: nyan thos kyi theg pa'i lam dang / rnam par grol ba'i 'bras bu'o //
analyzed: nyan thos kyi theg pa'i lam dang / rnam par grol ba'i 'bras bu'o //
translated: the path of the śrāvaka vehicle and the result of liberation.

original: gcig pu pa zhes bya ba ni de'i tshe bla na med pa'i byang chub tu yongs su 'gyur ba'i rkyen yang dag par bsgrubs pa'i rigs ma thob cing /
analyzed: gcig pu pa zhes bya ba ni de'i tshe bla na med pa'i byang chub tu yongs su 'gyur ba'i rkyen yang dag par bsgrubs pa'i rigs ma thob cing /
translated: “Alone” means that at that time one has not obtained the lineage that is the condition for complete transformation into unsurpassed enlightenment.

original: nyan thos kyi rnam par grol ba dang mya ngan las 'das pa nyi tshe la gnas pa'o //
analyzed: nyan thos kyi rnam par grol ba dang mya ngan las 'das pa nyi tshe la gnas pa'o //
translated: The listeners and solitary realizers remain in the mere liberation of their own nirvāṇa.

original: sangs rgyas thams cad brtson pa dang ldan par gyur kyang byang chub kyi snying por gzhag ste /
analyzed: sangs rgyas thams cad brtson pa dang ldan par gyur kyang byang chub kyi snying por gzhag ste /
translated: Even if all the buddhas were to make an effort, they would not be able to place them on the seat of awakening and🔽cause them to attain unsurpassable, perfect enlightenment.

original: bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub thob par byar mi nus so zhes bya ba ni de'i tshe na de la bla na med pa'i byang chub tu yongs su 'gyur ba'i rkyen yang dag par bsgrubs pa'i rigs med pas /
analyzed: bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub thob par byar mi nus so zhes bya ba ni de'i tshe na de la bla na med pa'i byang chub tu yongs su 'gyur ba'i rkyen yang dag par bsgrubs pa'i rigs med pas /
translated: At that time, they lack the potential that is the correct condition for their transformation into unsurpassable enlightenment.🔽For example, even if you polish a piece of glass, it will never become a precious wish-fulfilling jewel.

original: dper na nor bu mching bu byi dor byas kyang yid bzhin gyi nor bu rin po cher mi 'gyur ba dang 'dra bar sangs rgyas thams cad kyis bskul kyang bla na med pa'i byang chub mngon par 'tshang rgya ba'i skal ba med pa las dgongs pa yin gyi
analyzed: dper na nor bu mching bu byi dor byas kyang yid bzhin gyi nor bu rin po cher mi 'gyur ba dang 'dra bar sangs rgyas thams cad kyis bskul kyang bla na med pa'i byang chub mngon par 'tshang rgya ba'i skal ba med pa las dgongs pa yin gyi
translated: In the same way, even if all the buddhas were to encourage them, they would lack the fortune to awaken to unsurpassable enlightenment.🔽This is what the Buddha had in mind.

original: gtan du de lta bu ni ma yin te /
analyzed: gtan du de lta bu ni ma yin te /
translated: But it is not forever.

original: nam zhig na bla na med pa'i byang chub tu yongs su 'gyur ba'i rkyen yang dag par bsgrubs pa'i rigs 'thob par 'gyur zhing /
analyzed: nam zhig na bla na med pa'i byang chub tu yongs su 'gyur ba'i rkyen yang dag par bsgrubs pa'i rigs 'thob par 'gyur zhing /
translated: At some point, they will obtain the family that is the correct condition for the attainment of unsurpassable enlightenment.

original: sngar rigs kyi skabs su bstan pa'i rim pa bzhin du bla na med pa'i byang chub mngon par rdzogs par 'tshang rgya bar ni nges pa kho na yin te /
analyzed: sngar rigs kyi skabs su bstan pa'i rim pa bzhin du bla na med pa'i byang chub mngon par rdzogs par 'tshang rgya bar ni nges pa kho na yin te /
translated: And in accordance with the stages explained in the section on the potential, they will definitely attain manifest, complete enlightenment in unsurpassable enlightenment.

original: 'jig rten las 'das pa'i lam gyis rab tu phye ba gnas gyur pa thob pa'i chos nyid kyis na phyir sa 'og mar mi ltung bar nges pa dang / gong du mthar thug pa'i 'bras bu bla na med pa'i byang chub 'thob pa nges pa kho na yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: 'jig rten las 'das pa'i lam gyis rab tu phye ba gnas gyur pa thob pa'i chos nyid kyis na phyir sa 'og mar mi ltung bar nges pa dang / gong du mthar thug pa'i 'bras bu bla na med pa'i byang chub 'thob pa nges pa kho na yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because of the nature of having attained the transformation that is revealed by the supramundane path, they are definitely not going to fall back to a lower level and they are definitely going to attain the ultimate goal of unsurpassable enlightenment.

original: de'i tshe na nor bu mching bu dang 'dra ba'o zhes bya ba'i dpe gsungs pa yang de'i gnas gyur pa'i sems kyi rang bzhin mching bu dang 'dra bar gzhan du bsgyur du mi rung ba ni ma yin gyi /
analyzed: de'i tshe na nor bu mching bu dang 'dra ba'o zhes bya ba'i dpe gsungs pa yang de'i gnas gyur pa'i sems kyi rang bzhin mching bu dang 'dra bar gzhan du bsgyur du mi rung ba ni ma yin gyi /
translated: The example of a glass marble given at that point is not saying that the nature of the mind that has been transformed is like a glass marble and cannot be changed into something else.

original: nyan thos theg pas bsdus pa'i bsam pa dang / mos pa'i khams dang / bag la nyal te mching bu dang 'dra bar bla na med pa'i byang chub kyi rgyu ma yin pa las dgongs pa yin te /
analyzed: nyan thos theg pas bsdus pa'i bsam pa dang / mos pa'i khams dang / bag la nyal te mching bu dang 'dra bar bla na med pa'i byang chub kyi rgyu ma yin pa las dgongs pa yin te /
translated: The intention is that the element of aspiration and the latent propensities included in the Śrāvaka Vehicle are not the cause of unsurpassed enlightenment, like a piece of glass.

original: nyan thos kyi theg pa nyid bla na med pa'i byang chub kyi mngon sum gyi rgyu ma yin @120b pas rgyu mi 'dra ba las 'bras bu mi skye'o zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: nyan thos kyi theg pa nyid bla na med pa'i byang chub kyi mngon sum gyi rgyu ma yin @120b pas rgyu mi 'dra ba las 'bras bu mi skye'o zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: The Śrāvaka Vehicle itself is not the cause of the direct realization of unsurpassed enlightenment. The meaning is that a result does not arise from a dissimilar cause.

original: don de nyid bstan pa'i phyir de ci'i phyir zhe na zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs so //
analyzed: don de nyid bstan pa'i phyir de ci'i phyir zhe na zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs so //
translated: In order to demonstrate just this meaning, he says, “Why is this?” and so on.

original: rang bzhin gyis rigs dman pa kho na yin pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba ni nyan thos kyi theg pa'i rkyen yang dag par bsgrubs pa'i rigs glo bur ba de la bla na med pa'i byang chub kyi rgyu med pas rang bzhin gyis dman pa kho na yin🔽pa la bya'i /
analyzed: rang bzhin gyis rigs dman pa kho na yin pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba ni nyan thos kyi theg pa'i rkyen yang dag par bsgrubs pa'i rigs glo bur ba de la bla na med pa'i byang chub kyi rgyu med pas rang bzhin gyis dman pa kho na yin🔽pa la bya'i /
translated: The meaning of “because it is naturally inferior” is that the sudden arising of the potential for the Śrāvaka Vehicle is not the cause of unsurpassed enlightenment. Therefore, it is naturally inferior.

original: de'i kun gzhi rnam par shes pa gnas gyur pa'i ngo bo nyid la ni rang bzhin gyis dman par gcig tu nges pa med de /
analyzed: de'i kun gzhi rnam par shes pa gnas gyur pa'i ngo bo nyid la ni rang bzhin gyis dman par gcig tu nges pa med de /
translated: In the nature of the transformation of the store-consciousness of that person, there is no certainty of inferiority,

original: bla na med pa'i byang chub kyi sa bon yang de la yod pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: bla na med pa'i byang chub kyi sa bon yang de la yod pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because the seed of unsurpassed enlightenment exists in that person.🔽He becomes extremely averse to working for the welfare of sentient beings,

original: sems can gyi don bya ba la shin tu mi phyogs par 'gyur ro zhes bya ba ni sems can yongs su smin par mi byed pa'o //
analyzed: sems can gyi don bya ba la shin tu mi phyogs par 'gyur ro zhes bya ba ni sems can yongs su smin par mi byed pa'o //
translated: that is, he does not bring sentient beings to maturity.🔽He becomes extremely averse to all the perfections of the formative forces,

original: 'du byed mngon par 'du bya ba thams cad la shin tu mi phyogs par 'gyur ro zhes bya ba ni bdag nyid kyi sangs rgyas kyi chos yongs su smin par mi byed pa'o //
analyzed: 'du byed mngon par 'du bya ba thams cad la shin tu mi phyogs par 'gyur ro zhes bya ba ni bdag nyid kyi sangs rgyas kyi chos yongs su smin par mi byed pa'o //
translated: that is, he does not bring about the maturity of his own qualities of a Buddha.

original: bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu ngas ma bstan to zhes bya ba ni bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub kyi rgyu ni sems can yongs su smin par byed pa dang / bdag nyid kyi sangs rgyas kyi chos yongs su smin par byed pa yin na /
analyzed: bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu ngas ma bstan to zhes bya ba ni bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub kyi rgyu ni sems can yongs su smin par byed pa dang / bdag nyid kyi sangs rgyas kyi chos yongs su smin par byed pa yin na /
translated: I have not taught unsurpassed, perfect enlightenment to those who do not bring beings to maturity and do not bring the Buddha qualities to maturity.

original: de gnyis mi byed pa de la ni de'i tshe na ni de'i rgyu med pa'i phyir te /
analyzed: de gnyis mi byed pa de la ni de'i tshe na ni de'i rgyu med pa'i phyir te /
translated: Because at that time, they lack the cause of unsurpassed, perfect enlightenment.

original: de yang sbyor ba'i bye brag tsam du zad kyi /
analyzed: de yang sbyor ba'i bye brag tsam du zad kyi /
translated: Moreover, that is merely a difference in application.

original: sems kyi ngo bo nyid las gyur pa ni ma yin no //
analyzed: sems kyi ngo bo nyid las gyur pa ni ma yin no //
translated: It is not due to a difference in the nature of mind.🔽Therefore, it is called the solitary path of peace.

original: de'i phyir zhi ba'i bgrod pa gcig pu zhes bya'o zhes bya ba ni ji srid du bla na med pa'i byang chub kyi rkyen yang dag par bsgrubs pa'i rigs ma thob cing /
analyzed: de'i phyir zhi ba'i bgrod pa gcig pu zhes bya'o zhes bya ba ni ji srid du bla na med pa'i byang chub kyi rkyen yang dag par bsgrubs pa'i rigs ma thob cing /
translated: As long as one has not obtained the spiritual lineage that is the condition for unsurpassed enlightenment and does not make an effort,

original: rtsol bar mi byed pa de nyid kyi bar du zhes bya bar dgongs pa ste /
analyzed: rtsol bar mi byed pa de nyid kyi bar du zhes bya bar dgongs pa ste /
translated: it is the intention that one is not a bodhisattva.

original: de ni rigs kyi gzhi dang ldan pa'i bsgrub pa'i bye brag bstan pa yin no //
analyzed: de ni rigs kyi gzhi dang ldan pa'i bsgrub pa'i bye brag bstan pa yin no //
translated: This teaches the specific practice that is based on the foundation of lineage.

original: de'i 'og tu rkyen gyi gzhi dang ldan pa'i bsgrub pa'i bye brag bstan pa'i tshig gi don la sogs pa bshad par bya ste /
analyzed: de'i 'og tu rkyen gyi gzhi dang ldan pa'i bsgrub pa'i bye brag bstan pa'i tshig gi don la sogs pa bshad par bya ste /
translated: Next, the specific practice that is based on the foundation of conditions should be explained, beginning with the meaning of the words.

original: rkyen gyi gzhi dang ldan pa zhes bya ba ni sems can ma nges pa'i rigs can nyan thos kyi theg pas nyan thos kyi byang chub thob pa dag de bzhin gshegs pas ngo bo nyid med pa nyid rnam pa gsum bstan pa mdzad cing chos bstan pa na
analyzed: rkyen gyi gzhi dang ldan pa zhes bya ba ni sems can ma nges pa'i rigs can nyan thos kyi theg pas nyan thos kyi byang chub thob pa dag de bzhin gshegs pas ngo bo nyid med pa nyid rnam pa gsum bstan pa mdzad cing chos bstan pa na
translated: The phrase “based on the foundation of conditions” refers to those beings of unfixed lineage who attain the enlightenment of śrāvakas through the Śrāvaka Vehicle. When the Tathāgata teaches the three types of unreality and the Dharma,

original: / de bzhin gshegs pas yang dag par bskul ba'i rkyen gyi gzhi la brten nas bla na med pa'i byang chub tu yongs su 'gyur ba'i lam sgrub par byed pa ste /
analyzed: / de bzhin gshegs pas yang dag par bskul ba'i rkyen gyi gzhi la brten nas bla na med pa'i byang chub tu yongs su 'gyur ba'i lam sgrub par byed pa ste /
translated: they are inspired by the Tathāgata and, based on the foundation of conditions, they practice the path that leads to unsurpassed enlightenment.

original: de'i phyir de bstan pa'i dbang du mdzad nas /
analyzed: de'i phyir de bstan pa'i dbang du mdzad nas /
translated: Therefore, in order to teach that, the root text says:

original: nyan thos byang chub tu yongs su 'gyur ba gang yin pa de ni ngas rnam grangs kyis byang chub sems dpa' yin par @121a * //
analyzed: nyan thos byang chub tu yongs su 'gyur ba gang yin pa de ni ngas rnam grangs kyis byang chub sems dpa' yin par @121a * //
translated: I have taught that those who become śrāvakas are bodhisattvas in a sense.

original: bstan te zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs so //
analyzed: bstan te zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs so //
translated: And so on.

original: nyan thos byang chub tu yongs su 'gyur ba 'di'i tshul bshad pa ni sngar rigs kyi rnam par gzhag pa bstan pa'i skabs su bshad pa kho na bzhin du rig par bya'o //
analyzed: nyan thos byang chub tu yongs su 'gyur ba 'di'i tshul bshad pa ni sngar rigs kyi rnam par gzhag pa bstan pa'i skabs su bshad pa kho na bzhin du rig par bya'o //
translated: The explanation of the way in which śrāvakas become bodhisattvas should be understood just as it was explained in the section on the presentation of the spiritual gene.

original: 'dir tshig gi don bshad par bya ste /🔽rnam grangs kyis byang chub sems dpa' yin par bstan te zhes bya ba ni de de'i tshe kho na na /
analyzed: 'dir tshig gi don bshad par bya ste / rnam grangs kyis byang chub sems dpa' yin par bstan te zhes bya ba ni de de'i tshe kho na na /
translated: Here the meaning of the words should be explained.

original: nyan thos yin yang de ma thag tu byang chub sems dpa'i sa brgyad pa la gnas par 'gyur ba'i phyir byang chub sems dpa'i grangs su yang bstan to zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: nyan thos yin yang de ma thag tu byang chub sems dpa'i sa brgyad pa la gnas par 'gyur ba'i phyir byang chub sems dpa'i grangs su yang bstan to zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: I have taught that they are bodhisattvas in a sense means that at that time they are śrāvakas, but because immediately after that they will abide in the eighth bodhisattva stage, they are also counted as bodhisattvas.

original: de la ci'i phyir byang chub tu yongs su 'gyur ba zhes bya zhe na /
analyzed: de la ci'i phyir byang chub tu yongs su 'gyur ba zhes bya zhe na /
translated: Why are they called those who become bodhisattvas?

original: de'i phyir 'di ltar de ni nyon mongs pa'i sgrib pa las grol nas de bzhin gshegs pa rnams kyis bskul na shes bya'i sgrib pa las sems rnam par grol bar byed pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba gsungs te /
analyzed: de'i phyir 'di ltar de ni nyon mongs pa'i sgrib pa las grol nas de bzhin gshegs pa rnams kyis bskul na shes bya'i sgrib pa las sems rnam par grol bar byed pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba gsungs te /
translated: Therefore, it is said that “having been liberated from the affliction-obstruction, if urged by the Tathāgatas, he liberates his mind from the knowledge-obstruction.”

original: 'di ni mi slob par gyur nas nyan thos kyi smon lam las ldog cing de bzhin gshegs pa rnams kyis bskul ba'i rkyen gyis phung po'i lhag ma dang bcas pa'i lus des bla na med pa'i byang chub mngon par rdzogs par 'tshang rgya ba dang sbyar ro //
analyzed: 'di ni mi slob par gyur nas nyan thos kyi smon lam las ldog cing de bzhin gshegs pa rnams kyis bskul ba'i rkyen gyis phung po'i lhag ma dang bcas pa'i lus des bla na med pa'i byang chub mngon par rdzogs par 'tshang rgya ba dang sbyar ro //
translated: This is applied to the case of one who, having become a non-learner, turns away from the śrāvaka’s aspiration and, by the condition of being urged by the Tathāgatas, with that body which has a remainder of aggregates, fully awakens to unexcelled enlightenment.

original: 'o na de ci'i phyir nyan thos zhes bya zhe na /
analyzed: 'o na de ci'i phyir nyan thos zhes bya zhe na /
translated: Well then, why is he called a śrāvaka?

original: de'i phyir de ni dang por bdag gi don la sbyor ba'i rnam pas nyon mongs pa'i sgrib pa las rnam par grol te /
analyzed: de'i phyir de ni dang por bdag gi don la sbyor ba'i rnam pas nyon mongs pa'i sgrib pa las rnam par grol te /
translated: Therefore, it is said that “he is first liberated from the affliction-obstruction by the aspect of applying himself to his own aim.

original: de'i phyir de bzhin gshegs pas de nyan thos kyi rigs su 'dogs so zhes bya ba gsungs te /
analyzed: de'i phyir de bzhin gshegs pas de nyan thos kyi rigs su 'dogs so zhes bya ba gsungs te /
translated: Therefore, the Tathāgata designates him as the śrāvaka type.”

original: dang po ma nges pa'i rigs can yin yang bar du nyan thos kyi theg pas nges par 'byung bas /
analyzed: dang po ma nges pa'i rigs can yin yang bar du nyan thos kyi theg pas nges par 'byung bas /
translated: Although they are of indefinite type at first, in the middle they are liberated by the vehicle of the śrāvakas.

original: ji srid du bla na med pa'i byang chub tu yongs su ma gyur gyi bar du nyan thos kyi rigs su 'dogs so zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: ji srid du bla na med pa'i byang chub tu yongs su ma gyur gyi bar du nyan thos kyi rigs su 'dogs so zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: As long as they do not transform into unsurpassed enlightenment, they are designated as the śrāvaka type.

original: bsgrub pa'i bye brag rgyas par bshad pa'i tshig gi don la sogs pa bshad zin to /
analyzed: bsgrub pa'i bye brag rgyas par bshad pa'i tshig gi don la sogs pa bshad zin to /
translated: The meaning of the words of the brief teaching on the different types of interest of individuals who practice it has been explained.🔽The meaning of the words of the brief teaching on the different types of interest

original: // / de'i 'og tu de la spyod pa'i gang zag gi mos pa'i bye brag mdor bstan pa'i tshig gi don la sogs pa bshad par bya ste /
analyzed: // / de'i 'og tu de la spyod pa'i gang zag gi mos pa'i bye brag mdor bstan pa'i tshig gi don la sogs pa bshad par bya ste /
translated: After that, the meaning of the words of the brief teaching on the different types of interest of individuals who practice it should be explained.🔽The brief teaching on the different types of interest

original: mos pa'i bye brag mdor bstan pa zhes bya ba ni de ltar bcom ldan 'das kyis ngo bo nyid med pa nyid rnam pa gsum gdags par mdzad pa 'di la sems can rnams kyi mos pa'i bye brag rnam pa du ma yod pa dang por mdor bsdus te🔽bstan pa gang yin pa'o //
analyzed: mos pa'i bye brag mdor bstan pa zhes bya ba ni de ltar bcom ldan 'das kyis ngo bo nyid med pa nyid rnam pa gsum gdags par mdzad pa 'di la sems can rnams kyi mos pa'i bye brag rnam pa du ma yod pa dang por mdor bsdus te🔽bstan pa gang yin pa'o //
translated: The different types of interest of sentient beings in this threefold designation of the lack of entityness by the Bhagavat are taught first in brief.

original: de'i phyir de bstan pa'i dbang du mdzad nas /
analyzed: de'i phyir de bstan pa'i dbang du mdzad nas /
translated: Therefore, in order to teach that,🔽the Sutra of the Questions of Paramārthasamudgata says:

original: don dam yang dag 'phags 'di ltar nga'i chos 'dul ba legs par gsungs pa shin tu gya nom pa /
analyzed: don dam yang dag 'phags 'di ltar nga'i chos 'dul ba legs par gsungs pa shin tu gya nom pa /
translated: “Paramārthasamudgata, it is thus. In my teaching, the discipline is well-spoken, very refined,

original: bsam pa shin tu rnam par dag pa ston pa /
analyzed: bsam pa shin tu rnam par dag pa ston pa /
translated: and teaches with a very pure thought.

original: chos legs par bstan pa la ni @121b sems can rnams kyi mos pa'i rim pa yang snang ste zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs so //
analyzed: chos legs par bstan pa la ni @121b sems can rnams kyi mos pa'i rim pa yang snang ste zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs so //
translated: In the well-taught teaching, the stages of the inclination of sentient beings also appear.”

original: de la chos 'dul ba zhes bya ba ni sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das kyi bstan pa 'phags pa'i lam yan lag brgyad pa dang ldan pa nyid la bya ste /
analyzed: de la chos 'dul ba zhes bya ba ni sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das kyi bstan pa 'phags pa'i lam yan lag brgyad pa dang ldan pa nyid la bya ste /
translated: In this passage, the “discipline” is the teaching of the Bhagavan Buddha, which is endowed with the eightfold noble path.

original: yang dag pa'i lta ba dang / rtog pa dang / dran pa dang / ting nge 'dzin ni chos yin no //
analyzed: yang dag pa'i lta ba dang / rtog pa dang / dran pa dang / ting nge 'dzin ni chos yin no //
translated: Right view, thought, mindfulness, and concentration are the Dharma.

original: yang dag pa'i ngag dang / las kyi mtha' dang / 'tsho ba ni 'dul ba yin no //
analyzed: yang dag pa'i ngag dang / las kyi mtha' dang / 'tsho ba ni 'dul ba yin no //
translated: Right speech, action, and livelihood are the discipline.

original: yang dag pa'i rtsol ba ni kun du 'gro ba yin no //
analyzed: yang dag pa'i rtsol ba ni kun du 'gro ba yin no //
translated: Right effort is the universal.

original: legs par gsungs pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni chos 'dul ba de nyid khyad par du bshad par bya ste /🔽legs par gsungs pa zhes bya ba ni thog mar dge ba /🔽bar du dge ba /
analyzed: legs par gsungs pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni chos 'dul ba de nyid khyad par du bshad par bya ste / legs par gsungs pa zhes bya ba ni thog mar dge ba / bar du dge ba /
translated: The phrase well spoken and so forth explains the distinctive qualities of that Dharma and Vinaya.

original: tha mar dge ba zhes gsungs so //🔽shin tu gya nom pa zhes bya ba ni don bzang po /
analyzed: tha mar dge ba zhes gsungs so // shin tu gya nom pa zhes bya ba ni don bzang po /
translated: The phrase well spoken refers to what is said to be virtuous in the beginning, virtuous in the middle, and virtuous in the end.

original: tshig 'bru bzang po ma 'dres pa zhes gsungs pa'o //
analyzed: tshig 'bru bzang po ma 'dres pa zhes gsungs pa'o //
translated: The phrase extremely sublime refers to what is said to be of good meaning and good words, and unadulterated.

original: bsam pa shin tu rnam par dag pa ston pa zhes bya ba ni yongs su rdzogs pa dang / yongs su dag pa dang / yongs su byang ba zhes gsungs pa'o ;
analyzed: bsam pa shin tu rnam par dag pa ston pa zhes bya ba ni yongs su rdzogs pa dang / yongs su dag pa dang / yongs su byang ba zhes gsungs pa'o ;
translated: The phrase teaching that is extremely pure in thought refers to what is said to be complete, pure, and cleansed.

original: / chos legs par bstan pa zhes bya ba ni lha dang mi'i bar dag la yang dag par bstan pa zhes gsungs pa'o //
analyzed: / chos legs par bstan pa zhes bya ba ni lha dang mi'i bar dag la yang dag par bstan pa zhes gsungs pa'o //
translated: The phrase well taught Dharma refers to what is said to be taught to gods and humans.

original: drang ba'i don gyi mdo brjod pa'i rnam pas zhes bya ba ni chos thams cad ngo bo nyid med pa zhes bya ba la sogs pas ston te /
analyzed: drang ba'i don gyi mdo brjod pa'i rnam pas zhes bya ba ni chos thams cad ngo bo nyid med pa zhes bya ba la sogs pas ston te /
translated: The phrase through the aspect of the verbal expression of a sutra of provisional meaning refers to what is taught by the words all phenomena are natureless and so on.

original: de yang mtshan nyid thams cad ngo bo nyid med pa thams cad kyis ngo bo nyid med pa ma yin gyi /🔽kun brtags pa'i mtshan nyid ni mtshan nyid ngo bo nyid med pa nyid kyis ngo bo nyid med pa dang / gzhan gyi dbang gi mtshan nyid ni skye ba ngo bo nyid med pa nyid dang / don dam pa ngo bo nyid med pa gcig gis ngo bo nyid med pa dang /
analyzed: de yang mtshan nyid thams cad ngo bo nyid med pa thams cad kyis ngo bo nyid med pa ma yin gyi / kun brtags pa'i mtshan nyid ni mtshan nyid ngo bo nyid med pa nyid kyis ngo bo nyid med pa dang / gzhan gyi dbang gi mtshan nyid ni skye ba ngo bo nyid med pa nyid dang / don dam pa ngo bo nyid med pa gcig gis ngo bo nyid med pa dang /
translated: Moreover, it is not that all characteristics are realityless in all ways,🔽but that the imagined characteristic is realityless in being realityless in nature, the relative characteristic is realityless in being realityless in origination, and the perfect characteristic is realityless in being realityless in the ultimate, which is distinguished by objective selflessness.

original: yongs su grub pa'i mtshan nyid ni don dam pa ngo bo nyid med pa nyid chos bdag med pas rab tu phye bas ngo bo nyid med pa las dgongs te gsungs pa dang / chos thams cad ma skyes pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni mtshan nyid ngo bo nyid med pa nyid dang don dam pa ngo bo nyid med pa nyid chos bdag med pas rab tu phye ba las dgongs te gsungs pa ni /
analyzed: yongs su grub pa'i mtshan nyid ni don dam pa ngo bo nyid med pa nyid chos bdag med pas rab tu phye bas ngo bo nyid med pa las dgongs te gsungs pa dang / chos thams cad ma skyes pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni mtshan nyid ngo bo nyid med pa nyid dang don dam pa ngo bo nyid med pa nyid chos bdag med pas rab tu phye ba las dgongs te gsungs pa ni /
translated: The statement that all things are unproduced and so on is made with the intention of the realitylessness in nature and the realitylessness in the ultimate, which are distinguished by objective selflessness.

original: drang ba'i don gyi mdo sde brjod pa'i rnam pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: drang ba'i don gyi mdo sde brjod pa'i rnam pa zhes bya'o //
translated: The sutra that is interpretable in meaning is called the “aspect of expression.”🔽The specific inclinations are explained in brief.

original: mos pa'i bye brag mdor bstan pa'i tshig gi don la sogs pa bshad zin to /
analyzed: mos pa'i bye brag mdor bstan pa'i tshig gi don la sogs pa bshad zin to /
translated: The meaning of the words, etc., have been explained.

original: // / de'i 'og tu de la spyod pa'i gang zag gi mos pa'i bye brag rgyas par bshad pa'i tshig gi don la sogs pa bshad par bya ste /🔽de ni rnam pa lnga ste rigs phun sum tshogs pa las gyur pa dang / mos @122a * //🔽pa phun sum tshos pa las gyur pa dang / shes rab phun sum tshogs pa las gyur pa dang / de la sems can gang dag dge ba'i rtsa ba chen po bskyed pa zhes bya ba nas /
analyzed: // / de'i 'og tu de la spyod pa'i gang zag gi mos pa'i bye brag rgyas par bshad pa'i tshig gi don la sogs pa bshad par bya ste / de ni rnam pa lnga ste rigs phun sum tshogs pa las gyur pa dang / mos @122a * // pa phun sum tshos pa las gyur pa dang / shes rab phun sum tshogs pa las gyur pa dang / de la sems can gang dag dge ba'i rtsa ba chen po bskyed pa zhes bya ba nas /
translated: The following is the extensive explanation of the specific inclinations of the person who practices them.🔽There are five kinds: that which comes from the perfection of lineage, that which comes from the perfection of inclination, that which comes from the perfection of wisdom, that which comes from the perfection of practice, and that which comes from the perfection of mastery.

original: dad pa 'thob par 'gyur ro zhes gsungs pa'i bar gyis bstan to //
analyzed: dad pa 'thob par 'gyur ro zhes gsungs pa'i bar gyis bstan to //
translated: The person who has planted the roots of virtue is the one who has the perfection of lineage.

original: rigs dang mos par ldan pa las gyur la /
analyzed: rigs dang mos par ldan pa las gyur la /
translated: The person who has the perfection of inclination is the one who has the perfection of inclination.🔽The person who has the perfection of wisdom is the one who has the perfection of wisdom.

original: shes rab dang bral ba ni gnyis pa ste de la sems can gang dag dge ba'i rtsa ba bskyed pa dang zhes bya ba nas gong du yang rgyud yongs su ma smin pa dag kyang yongs su smin par byed de zhes gsungs pa'i bar gyis bstan to //
analyzed: shes rab dang bral ba ni gnyis pa ste de la sems can gang dag dge ba'i rtsa ba bskyed pa dang zhes bya ba nas gong du yang rgyud yongs su ma smin pa dag kyang yongs su smin par byed de zhes gsungs pa'i bar gyis bstan to //
translated: The second is those who lack wisdom.

original: rigs dang mos pa las ldan par gyur pa dang / shes rab chung ngu las pa ni gsum pa ste /
analyzed: rigs dang mos pa las ldan par gyur pa dang / shes rab chung ngu las pa ni gsum pa ste /
translated: Those who have the potential and interest, but whose mindstreams are not fully ripened, are the third.

original: ji ste sems can de dag las sems can gang dag bsod nams dang ye shes kyi tshogs chen po'i bar du yang dag par grub pa ma yin yang zhes bya ba nas /🔽de dag gi las kyi sgrib pa chen po dang ldan par nga smra'o zhes gsungs pa'i bar gyis bstan to //
analyzed: ji ste sems can de dag las sems can gang dag bsod nams dang ye shes kyi tshogs chen po'i bar du yang dag par grub pa ma yin yang zhes bya ba nas / de dag gi las kyi sgrib pa chen po dang ldan par nga smra'o zhes gsungs pa'i bar gyis bstan to //
translated: Those who have not fully accomplished the great accumulations of merit and wisdom, up to and including the great accumulations of wisdom, are the fourth.

original: thams cad dang bral zhing bkri dgos pa las gyur pa ni bzhi pa ste /
analyzed: thams cad dang bral zhing bkri dgos pa las gyur pa ni bzhi pa ste /
translated: Those who have not fully accomplished the great accumulations of merit and wisdom, up to and including the great accumulations of wisdom, are the fourth.🔽Those who have none of these are the fifth.

original: don dam yang dag 'phags de la sems can gang dag dge ba'i rtsa ba ma bskyed pa zhes bya ba nas sems can rnams kyi mos pa'i rim pa de lta bu dag kyang snang ngo zhes gsungs pa'i bar gyis bstan to //🔽thams cad phun sum tshogs shing mgo glengs pas go ba las gyur pa ni lnga pa ste /🔽de nas de'i tshe bcom ldan 'das la byang chub sems dpa' don dam yang dag 'phags kyis 'di skad ces gsol to zhes bya ba nas /🔽don dam yang dag 'phags de bzhin te /

original: rigs phun sum tshogs pa zhes bya ba ni de bzhin gshegs pa'i theg pa mngon par rtogs pa'i rigs dang ldan pa ste /
analyzed: rigs phun sum tshogs pa zhes bya ba ni de bzhin gshegs pa'i theg pa mngon par rtogs pa'i rigs dang ldan pa ste /
translated: The excellence of lineage is the possession of the lineage that realizes the vehicle of the Tathagata.

original: de ni de la sems can gang dag dge ba'i rtsa ba chen po bskyed pa /
analyzed: de ni de la sems can gang dag dge ba'i rtsa ba chen po bskyed pa /
translated: This is indicated by those beings who have generated the great roots of virtue,

original: sgrib pa yongs su dag pa /
analyzed: sgrib pa yongs su dag pa /
translated: who have purified obscurations,

original: rgyud yongs su smin pa zhes bya bas bstan to //
analyzed: rgyud yongs su smin pa zhes bya bas bstan to //
translated: and whose mind streams are fully ripened.

original: de la dge ba'i rtsa ba chen po bskyed pa zhes bya ba ni rigs la gnas pa'i byang chub sems dpa' la rtags gang dag gis ni 'di ni byang chub sems dpa' yin no zhes gzhan dag gis de ltar shes par 'gyur ba /
analyzed: de la dge ba'i rtsa ba chen po bskyed pa zhes bya ba ni rigs la gnas pa'i byang chub sems dpa' la rtags gang dag gis ni 'di ni byang chub sems dpa' yin no zhes gzhan dag gis de ltar shes par 'gyur ba /
translated: As for the great roots of virtue that have been generated, the signs by which others know that a bodhisattva is a bodhisattva are the signs of the lineage of the bodhisattvas who abide in the lineage.

original: byang chub sems dpa'i @122b pha rol tu phyin pa rnams kyi rigs kyi rtags phun sum tshogs pa dang ldan pa ste /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa'i @122b pha rol tu phyin pa rnams kyi rigs kyi rtags phun sum tshogs pa dang ldan pa ste /
translated: The excellence of the lineage of the bodhisattvas' perfections is the possession of the signs of the lineage of the bodhisattvas' perfections.

original: de bzhin gshegs pa'i theg pa'i mngon par rtogs pa'i rigs yang dag par bsgrub pa de ni rang bzhin gyis yon tan dang ldan zhing bzang la dge ba dang / dkar po'i chos thams cad dang ldan pa'i phyir de bzhin gshegs pa'i go 'phang de tsam du bskyed par dka' ba /
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa'i theg pa'i mngon par rtogs pa'i rigs yang dag par bsgrub pa de ni rang bzhin gyis yon tan dang ldan zhing bzang la dge ba dang / dkar po'i chos thams cad dang ldan pa'i phyir de bzhin gshegs pa'i go 'phang de tsam du bskyed par dka' ba /
translated: Therefore, it is the cause for attaining the state of a Tathāgata, which is so difficult to attain,

original: gtso bor gyur pa /
analyzed: gtso bor gyur pa /
translated: which is preeminent,

original: bsam gyis mi khyab pa /
analyzed: bsam gyis mi khyab pa /
translated: which is inconceivable,🔽and which is unsurpassed and immovable.

original: mi g-yo ba bla na med pa de thob pa'i rgyur gyur pa yin pas na yang dag par bsgrubs pa'i rigs de thob ba ni dge ba'i rtsa ba chen po bskyed pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: mi g-yo ba bla na med pa de thob pa'i rgyur gyur pa yin pas na yang dag par bsgrubs pa'i rigs de thob ba ni dge ba'i rtsa ba chen po bskyed pa zhes bya'o //
translated: Thus, the attainment of that well-established spiritual gene is called the generation of the great roots of virtue.

original: sgrib pa yongs su dag pa zhes bya ba ni byang chub sems dpa'i rigs yang dag par bsgrubs pa de nyid kyi gnas skabs na rigs la gnas su zin kyang ji srid du dkar po'i chos dang mi mthun pa'i nyon mongs pa bzhi po dag las zad par
analyzed: sgrib pa yongs su dag pa zhes bya ba ni byang chub sems dpa'i rigs yang dag par bsgrubs pa de nyid kyi gnas skabs na rigs la gnas su zin kyang ji srid du dkar po'i chos dang mi mthun pa'i nyon mongs pa bzhi po dag las zad par
translated: The purification of obscurations refers to the fact that, even though one has already entered the spiritual gene of the bodhisattva and well established it, as long as one has not completely abandoned the four afflictions that are adverse to the good qualities,

original: ram / kha cig gi nye ba'i nyon mongs pa can du ma gyur pa de srid du rang bzhin gyis byang chub sems dpa' pha rol tu phyin pa rnams kyi rigs kyi rtags kyi dge ba'i chos de dag dang ldan par gyur la /
analyzed: ram / kha cig gi nye ba'i nyon mongs pa can du ma gyur pa de srid du rang bzhin gyis byang chub sems dpa' pha rol tu phyin pa rnams kyi rigs kyi rtags kyi dge ba'i chos de dag dang ldan par gyur la /
translated: Some say: As long as they are not afflicted, they are naturally endowed with those virtuous qualities that are the signs of the lineage of the bodhisattva perfections.

original: gang gi tshe nye ba'i nyon mongs pa can du gyur pa de'i tshe /
analyzed: gang gi tshe nye ba'i nyon mongs pa can du gyur pa de'i tshe /
translated: But when they become afflicted,

original: de dkar po'i chos de dag la yang mi snang la ngan song dag tu yang skabs 'ga' skye bar 'gyur ba'i nye ba'i nyon mongs pa bzhi po sngar bstan pa de dag dang bral ba'i sgrib pa yongs su dag pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: de dkar po'i chos de dag la yang mi snang la ngan song dag tu yang skabs 'ga' skye bar 'gyur ba'i nye ba'i nyon mongs pa bzhi po sngar bstan pa de dag dang bral ba'i sgrib pa yongs su dag pa zhes bya'o //
translated: they are said to be obscured, since they do not manifest those virtuous qualities and they are born in lower rebirths due to the four previously explained secondary afflictions.

original: rgyud yongs su smin pa zhes bya ba ni byang chub sems dpa'i rigs yang dag par bsgrubs pa de nyid kyi gnas skabs na rigs la gnas shing sgrib pa yongs su dag tu zin kyang rgyu bzhis bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub thob
analyzed: rgyud yongs su smin pa zhes bya ba ni byang chub sems dpa'i rigs yang dag par bsgrubs pa de nyid kyi gnas skabs na rigs la gnas shing sgrib pa yongs su dag tu zin kyang rgyu bzhis bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub thob
translated: The “fully matured being” is the bodhisattva who, in that very state of having accomplished the lineage, is endowed with the lineage, has already purified the obscurations, but is still unable to attain unsurpassed true and complete enlightenment due to four causes.

original: par mi nus pa'i rgyu bzhi sngar bstan pa de dag dang bral ba'i phyir rgyud yongs su smin pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: par mi nus pa'i rgyu bzhi sngar bstan pa de dag dang bral ba'i phyir rgyud yongs su smin pa zhes bya'o //
translated: The four causes that were previously taught are the causes for that. Because he is free from those, he is called the “fully matured being.”

original: mos pa phun sum tshogs pa zhes bya ba ni byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi mos pa'i khams sangs rgyas kyi chos rnams la 'thob par nus par yid ches pas rab tu phye ba'i khams brtas pa ste /
analyzed: mos pa phun sum tshogs pa zhes bya ba ni byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi mos pa'i khams sangs rgyas kyi chos rnams la 'thob par nus par yid ches pas rab tu phye ba'i khams brtas pa ste /
translated: The “one who is endowed with perfect devotion” is the bodhisattva whose element of devotion toward the teachings of the buddhas has been strengthened by the certainty that he is capable of attaining it.

original: de ni mos pa mang ba zhes bya bas bstan to //
analyzed: de ni mos pa mang ba zhes bya bas bstan to //
translated: This is indicated by the phrase “the one who has abundant devotion.”

original: de yang byang chub sems dpa'i rigs la gnas pa'i gong du dang po byang chub tu sems bskyed pa'i gnas skabs na mos pa'i gnas brgyad po sngar bstan pa dag la mos pa'i khams brtas par byed pa'i rgyu gnyis po sngar bstan pa dag yod pas mos pa'i🔽khams brtas pa ste /
analyzed: de yang byang chub sems dpa'i rigs la gnas pa'i gong du dang po byang chub tu sems bskyed pa'i gnas skabs na mos pa'i gnas brgyad po sngar bstan pa dag la mos pa'i khams brtas par byed pa'i rgyu gnyis po sngar bstan pa dag yod pas mos pa'i khams brtas pa ste /
translated: Furthermore, in the stage of first generating enlightenment mind, the bodhisattva who is established in the lineage of bodhisattvas has the two causes that increase the element of devoted interest in the eight previously explained objects of devoted interest.🔽Therefore, he increases the element of devoted interest.

original: de ni mos pa mang ba zhes bya'o //
analyzed: de ni mos pa mang ba zhes bya'o //
translated: This is called “having much devoted interest.”

original: shes rab phun sum tshogs pa zhes @123a * //
analyzed: shes rab phun sum tshogs pa zhes @123a * //
translated: “Having perfect wisdom”

original: bya ba ni chos rab tu rnam par 'byed pa dang / don dam pa'i bden pa 'dzin pa'i shes rab yongs su smin pa ste /
analyzed: bya ba ni chos rab tu rnam par 'byed pa dang / don dam pa'i bden pa 'dzin pa'i shes rab yongs su smin pa ste /
translated: is the full maturation of the wisdom that fully discerns phenomena and apprehends ultimate truth.

original: de ni bsod nams dang ye shes kyi tshogs chen po yang dag par grub pa zhes bya bas bstan to //
analyzed: de ni bsod nams dang ye shes kyi tshogs chen po yang dag par grub pa zhes bya bas bstan to //
translated: This is indicated by “accomplishing the great accumulations of merit and wisdom.”

original: de yang byang chub sems dpa' dang po sems bskyed pa'i gong du byang chub sems dpa'i spyod pa la sbyor ba'i gnas skabs na pha rol tu phyin pa drug gis bsdus pa'i bsod nams dang ye shes kyi tshogs dang / de'i rgyu dang 'bras bu sngar bstan pa dag yang dag par bsgrubs pa'i rim gyis shes rab yongs su smin pa ste /
analyzed: de yang byang chub sems dpa' dang po sems bskyed pa'i gong du byang chub sems dpa'i spyod pa la sbyor ba'i gnas skabs na pha rol tu phyin pa drug gis bsdus pa'i bsod nams dang ye shes kyi tshogs dang / de'i rgyu dang 'bras bu sngar bstan pa dag yang dag par bsgrubs pa'i rim gyis shes rab yongs su smin pa ste /
translated: Moreover, prior to the first generation of the thought of enlightenment, the bodhisattva, in the stage of application to the bodhisattva practice, accomplishes the accumulations of merit and knowledge comprised by the six perfections, and the causes and results of those that were previously taught.

original: de ni shes rab phun sum tshogs pa dang ldan par sbyar ro //
analyzed: de ni shes rab phun sum tshogs pa dang ldan par sbyar ro //
translated: In this way, he is endowed with the perfection of wisdom.

original: de ltar ji skad bstan pa'i rnam pa de dag gis ni rigs phun sum tshogs pa dang / mos pa phun sum tshogs pa dang / shes rab phun sum tshogs pa bstan to /

original: rigs phun sum tshogs pa ni skal ba dang ldan pa'i gzhi yin la /

translated: These three verses show the perfection of the cause.

translated: He quickly, quickly attains the ultimate perfection.🔽The perfection of the cause is the perfection of the lineage, the perfection of the aspiration, and the perfection of the understanding of the interpretable and the definitive.

original: dgongs te bshad pa yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin du rab tu shes pa'i rgyu phun sum tshogs pas ni bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub mngon par rdzogs par 'tshang rgya ba'i skal ba can du 'gyur zhing mthu yod par 'gyur bas

translated: The perfection of the lineage is the perfection of the cause for becoming a candidate for, and having the power for, the supreme enlightenment.

original: / de ni myur ba myur ba kho nang skal ba dang ldan pa'i shin tu mthar thug pa nyid rjes su 'thob par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: / de ni myur ba myur ba kho nang skal ba dang ldan pa'i shin tu mthar thug pa nyid rjes su 'thob par 'gyur ro //
translated: The perfection of the aspiration is the perfection of the cause for quickly attaining the supreme enlightenment.🔽The perfection of the understanding of the interpretable and the definitive is the perfection of the cause for quickly, quickly attaining the ultimate perfection.

original: mos pa phun sum tshogs pa'i gzhi la brten te chos de la mos par byed pa'i rgyu phun sum tshogs pas ni byang chub kyi phyogs kyi chos thams cad la sbyor bar 'gyur bas des ni myur ba myur ba kho nar byang chub sems dpa'i spyod pa la
