translated: On the basis of the perfection of aspiration, by the perfection of the cause of aspiration for that Dharma, one applies oneself to all the dharmas that contribute to enlightenment.

original: sbyar ba'i mthar thug pa nyid rjes su 'thob par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: sbyar ba'i mthar thug pa nyid rjes su 'thob par 'gyur ro //
translated: By that, one quickly attains the culmination of application in the bodhisattva conduct.

original: shes rab phun sum tshogs pa'i gzhi la brten te /🔽don de shes rab kyis yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin du rtogs pa'i rgyu phun sum tshogs pas bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub yongs su rdzogs par 'gyur bas des ni myur ba myur ba kho nar byang chub chen po yongs su
analyzed: shes rab phun sum tshogs pa'i gzhi la brten te / don de shes rab kyis yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin du rtogs pa'i rgyu phun sum tshogs pas bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub yongs su rdzogs par 'gyur bas des ni myur ba myur ba kho nar byang chub chen po yongs su
translated: On the basis of the perfection of wisdom,

original: rdzogs pa'i mthar thug pa nyid rjes su thob par 'gyur te /
analyzed: rdzogs pa'i mthar thug pa nyid rjes su thob par 'gyur te /
translated: by the perfection of the cause of understanding that meaning just as it is with wisdom, one perfects unsurpassed, true, complete enlightenment. By that, one quickly attains the culmination of the perfection of the great enlightenment.

original: de gsum gyis ni 'bras bu phun sum tshogs pa bstan to //
analyzed: de gsum gyis ni 'bras bu phun sum tshogs pa bstan to //
translated: Those three teach the perfection of result.

original: nga la yang aa la la bcom ldan 'das de ni yang dag par rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas yin te zhes bya ba la sogs pa'i dad pa 'thob par 'gyur ro zhes bya bas ni de dag gis de ltar gzhi phun sum tshogs pa rnam pa gsum la brten
analyzed: nga la yang aa la la bcom ldan 'das de ni yang dag par rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas yin te zhes bya ba la sogs pa'i dad pa 'thob par 'gyur ro zhes bya bas ni de dag gis de ltar gzhi phun sum tshogs pa rnam pa gsum la brten
translated: I too will obtain faith in the Bhagavan, the perfect complete Buddha, and so on.

original: te / rgyu phun sum tshogs pa rnam pa gsum gyis 'bras bu phun sum tshogs pa rnam pa gsum thob par 'gyur bar rjes su rtogs pa'i sgo nas de ston pa sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das kyi che ba nyid yang dag par rjes su mthong bas ston pa la yang🔽dad pa 'thob pa'i mos pa'i bye brag bstan pa yin te /
analyzed: te / rgyu phun sum tshogs pa rnam pa gsum gyis 'bras bu phun sum tshogs pa rnam pa gsum thob par 'gyur bar rjes su rtogs pa'i sgo nas de ston pa sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das kyi che ba nyid yang dag par rjes su mthong bas ston pa la yang dad pa 'thob pa'i mos pa'i bye brag bstan pa yin te /
translated: Thus, they realize that based on the three perfect bases, they obtain the three perfect results through the three perfect causes and they see the greatness of the teacher, the Bhagavan Buddha, and they obtain faith in the teacher.

original: de ni mos pa'i bye brag rgyas par bshad pa dang po yin no //
analyzed: de ni mos pa'i bye brag rgyas par bshad pa dang po yin no //
translated: This is the first extensive explanation of the different types of interest.

original: de'i 'og tu mos pa'i bye brag rgyas par bshad pa gnyis pa'i tshig gi don la sogs pa bshad par bya ste /
analyzed: de'i 'og tu mos pa'i bye brag rgyas par bshad pa gnyis pa'i tshig gi don la sogs pa bshad par bya ste /
translated: After that, the meaning of the words of the second extensive explanation of the different types of interest and so on should be explained.

original: rigs dang mos pa dang ldan pa zhes @124a * //
analyzed: rigs dang mos pa dang ldan pa zhes @124a * //
translated: Those who possess the potential and interest.🔽

original: bya ba ni de bzhin gshegs pa'i theg pa mngon bar rtogs pa'i rigs dang ldan la phun sum tshogs pa nyid ma yin pa dang / byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi mos pa'i khams dang ldan la brtas pa nyid ma yin pa ste /
analyzed: bya ba ni de bzhin gshegs pa'i theg pa mngon bar rtogs pa'i rigs dang ldan la phun sum tshogs pa nyid ma yin pa dang / byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi mos pa'i khams dang ldan la brtas pa nyid ma yin pa ste /
translated: Those who possess the potential and interest but are not fully endowed refers to those who possess the potential for realizing the vehicle of the tathiigatatas and those who possess the element of interest in the bodhisattvas but are not fully developed.

original: de ni de la sems can gang dag dge ba'i rtsa ba bskyed pa dang / sgrib pa yongs su dag pa dang / rgyud yongs su smin pa dang / mos pa chen po ma yin pa zhes bya bas bstan te /
analyzed: de ni de la sems can gang dag dge ba'i rtsa ba bskyed pa dang / sgrib pa yongs su dag pa dang / rgyud yongs su smin pa dang / mos pa chen po ma yin pa zhes bya bas bstan te /
translated: This is indicated by those sentient beings who have generated roots of virtue, who have purified obscurations, whose mind streams are fully ripened and who do not have great interest.

original: chen po ma yin zhes bya ba'i sgra ni dge ba'i rtsa ba chen po bskyed pa ma yin pa /🔽sgrib pa yongs su dag pa chen po ma yin pa /
analyzed: chen po ma yin zhes bya ba'i sgra ni dge ba'i rtsa ba chen po bskyed pa ma yin pa / sgrib pa yongs su dag pa chen po ma yin pa /
translated: The term not great refers to those who have not generated great roots of virtue,🔽who have not purified great obscurations,

original: rgyud yongs su smin pa chen po ma yin pa /
analyzed: rgyud yongs su smin pa chen po ma yin pa /
translated: whose mind streams are not fully ripened and🔽who do not have great interest.

original: mos pa mang ba chen po ma yin pa zhes bya bar thams cad dang sbyar te /
analyzed: mos pa mang ba chen po ma yin pa zhes bya bar thams cad dang sbyar te /
translated: This is applied to all.

original: des na rigs dang mos pa dang ldan la /
analyzed: des na rigs dang mos pa dang ldan la /
translated: Therefore, it is shown that one who has the lineage and has the aspiration

original: phun sum tshogs pa nyid ma yin par bstan pa yin no //
analyzed: phun sum tshogs pa nyid ma yin par bstan pa yin no //
translated: is not fully endowed.

original: de la dge ba'i rtsa ba chen po bskyed pa ma yin zhes bya ba ni rigs la gnas par byang chub sems dpa' la rtags gang gis ni 'di ni byang chub sems dpa' yin no zhes gzhan dag gis de ltar shes par 'gyur ba byang chub sems dpa'i
analyzed: de la dge ba'i rtsa ba chen po bskyed pa ma yin zhes bya ba ni rigs la gnas par byang chub sems dpa' la rtags gang gis ni 'di ni byang chub sems dpa' yin no zhes gzhan dag gis de ltar shes par 'gyur ba byang chub sems dpa'i
translated: Among them, one who has not generated the great roots of virtue is a bodhisattva who is abiding in the lineage. By what sign of a bodhisattva can others know that this one is a bodhisattva?

original: pha rol tu phyin pa rnams kyi rigs kyi rtags dang ldan la phun sum tshogs pa ma yin pa'o //
analyzed: pha rol tu phyin pa rnams kyi rigs kyi rtags dang ldan la phun sum tshogs pa ma yin pa'o //
translated: A bodhisattva who is endowed with the sign of the lineage of the perfections but is not fully endowed is one who has not generated the great roots of virtue.

original: sgrib pa yongs su dag pa chen po ma yin zhes bya ba ni byang chub sems dpa'i rigs yang dag par bsgrubs pa de nyid kyi gnas skabs na /
analyzed: sgrib pa yongs su dag pa chen po ma yin zhes bya ba ni byang chub sems dpa'i rigs yang dag par bsgrubs pa de nyid kyi gnas skabs na /
translated: One who has not attained great purity from obscurations is a bodhisattva who has properly accomplished that very lineage of a bodhisattva.

original: dkar po'i chos dang mi mthun pa'i nye ba'i nyon mongs pa bzhi po sngar bstan pa de dag dang shas cher bral la gtan bral ba ni ma yin no //
analyzed: dkar po'i chos dang mi mthun pa'i nye ba'i nyon mongs pa bzhi po sngar bstan pa de dag dang shas cher bral la gtan bral ba ni ma yin no //
translated: He is mostly free from the four secondary afflictions that are incompatible with virtuous qualities, as previously explained, but he is not completely free from them.

original: rgyud yongs su smin pa chen po ma yin pa zhes bya ba ni byang chub sems dpa'i rigs yang dag par bsgrubs pa de nyid kyi gnas skabs na rigs la gnas shing sgrib pa yongs su zad du zin kyang byang chub thob par mi nus pa'i rgyu bzhi
analyzed: rgyud yongs su smin pa chen po ma yin pa zhes bya ba ni byang chub sems dpa'i rigs yang dag par bsgrubs pa de nyid kyi gnas skabs na rigs la gnas shing sgrib pa yongs su zad du zin kyang byang chub thob par mi nus pa'i rgyu bzhi
translated: Those whose mindstreams are not fully ripened refers to those who have not attained the bodhisattva potential.🔽🔽Even though they have the potential, they are unable to attain enlightenment for four reasons.

original: po sngar bstan pa de dag dang shas che ra bral la gtan bral ba ma yin pa ste /
analyzed: po sngar bstan pa de dag dang shas che ra bral la gtan bral ba ma yin pa ste /
translated: Not having fully matured the continuum is the state of having fully accomplished the bodhisattva potential, but not having the four causes for attaining enlightenment that were previously explained, even though one has the potential and has eliminated obscurations.🔽One is not completely free of them, but is mostly free.

original: de dag gis rigs dang ldan la phun sum tshogs pa nyid ma yin pa bstan to //
analyzed: de dag gis rigs dang ldan la phun sum tshogs pa nyid ma yin pa bstan to //
translated: These show that one who has the potential is not perfect.

original: mos pa mang ba chen po ma yin pa zhes bya ba ni byang chub sems dpa'i rigs la gnas pa'i gong du dang po byang chub tu sems bskyed pa'i gnas skabs na /
analyzed: mos pa mang ba chen po ma yin pa zhes bya ba ni byang chub sems dpa'i rigs la gnas pa'i gong du dang po byang chub tu sems bskyed pa'i gnas skabs na /
translated: Not having great interest is the state of first generating the thought of enlightenment in the stage of having the bodhisattva potential.

original: mos pa'i gnas brgyad po sngar bstan pa dag la 'thob par nus par yid ches pas rab tu phye ba ri mos pa'i khams dang ldan la rgyu gnyis po sngar bstan pa med pas mos pa'i khams brtas pa nyid ma @124b yin pa ste /
analyzed: mos pa'i gnas brgyad po sngar bstan pa dag la 'thob par nus par yid ches pas rab tu phye ba ri mos pa'i khams dang ldan la rgyu gnyis po sngar bstan pa med pas mos pa'i khams brtas pa nyid ma @124b yin pa ste /
translated: The potential for interest is distinguished by the confidence of being able to acquire the eight objects of interest mentioned above. It is not the full development of the potential for interest because it is not accompanied by the two causes mentioned above.

original: des ni mos pa dang ldan la phun sum tshogs pa nyid ma yin pa bstan to //
analyzed: des ni mos pa dang ldan la phun sum tshogs pa nyid ma yin pa bstan to //
translated: This shows that one may have interest but not have the full complement of qualities.

original: shes rab dang bral ba zhes bya ba ni chos rab tu rnam par 'byed pa dang / don dam pa'i bden pa 'dzin pa'i shes rab yongs su ma smin pa ste /
analyzed: shes rab dang bral ba zhes bya ba ni chos rab tu rnam par 'byed pa dang / don dam pa'i bden pa 'dzin pa'i shes rab yongs su ma smin pa ste /
translated: Lacking in wisdom refers to the fact that the wisdom that fully discerns phenomena and apprehends the ultimate truth has not matured.

original: de ni bsod nams dang ye shes kyi tshogs chen po yang dag par ma grub pa zhes bya bas bstan te /
analyzed: de ni bsod nams dang ye shes kyi tshogs chen po yang dag par ma grub pa zhes bya bas bstan te /
translated: This is indicated by the words not fully accomplished in the great accumulations of merit and wisdom.

original: chen po zhes bya ba'i sgras dang po sems bskyed pa'i gong du byang chub sems dpa'i spyod pa la sbyor ba'i gnas skabs na /
analyzed: chen po zhes bya ba'i sgras dang po sems bskyed pa'i gong du byang chub sems dpa'i spyod pa la sbyor ba'i gnas skabs na /
translated: The word great refers to the stage of practice in the bodhisattva activities prior to the generation of the first level of the bodhisattva's mind.

original: bsod nams dang ye shes kyi tshogs dang de'i rgyu dang 'bras bu shas kyis yod kyang yongs su ma smin pa yin la /
analyzed: bsod nams dang ye shes kyi tshogs dang de'i rgyu dang 'bras bu shas kyis yod kyang yongs su ma smin pa yin la /
translated: It is said to be “immature” because the accumulations of merit and direct intuition and their cause and result are not fully matured.

original: 'bras bu yang mong rtul las shes rab dang bral ba zhes bya ste /
analyzed: 'bras bu yang mong rtul las shes rab dang bral ba zhes bya ste /
translated: And it is said to be “devoid of wisdom” because its result is weak and dull.

original: de'i phyir drang po dang drang po'i rang bzhin can /
analyzed: de'i phyir drang po dang drang po'i rang bzhin can /
translated: Therefore, it is said to be “straight” and “of the nature of straightness”.

original: rtog pa dang sel mi nus pa zhes bya ba gsungs so zhes bya ba ni rang bzhin gyi rnam pa'o //
analyzed: rtog pa dang sel mi nus pa zhes bya ba gsungs so zhes bya ba ni rang bzhin gyi rnam pa'o //
translated: It is said to be “incapable of investigation and scrutiny” because it is of the nature of the absence of discrimination.

original: drang po'i rang bzhin can zhes bya ba ni g-yer bag gi sbyor ba mi rtsom pa'o /🔽rtog pa zhes bya ba ni gnyen po dang mi mthun pa'i phyogs la rtog pa de mi nus pa'o //
analyzed: drang po'i rang bzhin can zhes bya ba ni g-yer bag gi sbyor ba mi rtsom pa'o / rtog pa zhes bya ba ni gnyen po dang mi mthun pa'i phyogs la rtog pa de mi nus pa'o //
translated: “Of the nature of straightness” means that it does not commence the application of frivolity.🔽“Investigation” means that it is incapable of investigating the counteragent and the counteracted.

original: sel ba zhes bya ba ni gnyen pos mi mthun pa'i phyogs sel ba de mi nus pa'o //
analyzed: sel ba zhes bya ba ni gnyen pos mi mthun pa'i phyogs sel ba de mi nus pa'o //
translated: “Scrutiny” means that it is incapable of scrutinizing the counteragent and the counteracted.

original: de ltar ji ltar bstan pa'i rnam pa de dag gis ni rigs dang ldan la phun sum tshogs pa ma yin pa dang / mos pa dang ldan la phun sum tshogs pa ma yin pa dang shes rab dang bral ba bstan te /
analyzed: de ltar ji ltar bstan pa'i rnam pa de dag gis ni rigs dang ldan la phun sum tshogs pa ma yin pa dang / mos pa dang ldan la phun sum tshogs pa ma yin pa dang shes rab dang bral ba bstan te /
translated: Thus, by these aspects as they have been taught, those who have the potential but are not perfect, those who have devotion but are not perfect, and those who are devoid of wisdom are taught.

original: des na skal ba dang ldan pa'i gzhi dang ldan la phun sum tshogs pa ma yin pa dang / byang chub sems dpa'i spyod pa la sbyor ba'i gzhi dang ldan la phun sum tshogs pa ma yin pa dang / byang chub chen po yongs su rdzogs par 'gyur ba'i gzhi dang bral bar bstan pa yin no //🔽rigs dang mos pa dang ldan pa las gyur pa zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: des na skal ba dang ldan pa'i gzhi dang ldan la phun sum tshogs pa ma yin pa dang / byang chub sems dpa'i spyod pa la sbyor ba'i gzhi dang ldan la phun sum tshogs pa ma yin pa dang / byang chub chen po yongs su rdzogs par 'gyur ba'i gzhi dang bral bar bstan pa yin no // rigs dang mos pa dang ldan pa las gyur pa zhes bya ba la /
translated: Therefore, it is shown that they are devoid of the basis of good fortune, devoid of the basis of application to the bodhisattva practice, and devoid of the basis of the perfection of great enlightenment.🔽Those who have the potential and devotion are of two kinds:

original: gyur la zhes bya ba'i sgra yang gzhi de gnyis las byung ba'i mos pa'i bye brag ces bya bar sbyar ro //
analyzed: gyur la zhes bya ba'i sgra yang gzhi de gnyis las byung ba'i mos pa'i bye brag ces bya bar sbyar ro //
translated: those who have the potential and devotion but are not perfect, and those who have the potential and devotion and are perfect.

original: mos pa'i bye brag ces bya ba'i sgra skabs 'dir ni chos dang don la dad pas mos pa zhes bya ba'i don du gzung ste /
analyzed: mos pa'i bye brag ces bya ba'i sgra skabs 'dir ni chos dang don la dad pas mos pa zhes bya ba'i don du gzung ste /
translated: The term “specific aspiration” in this context refers to the faith and aspiration that one has in the Dharma and its meaning.

original: de'i phyir rang gi lta ba mchog tu 'dzin par mi gnas pa zhes bya ba gsungs te /
analyzed: de'i phyir rang gi lta ba mchog tu 'dzin par mi gnas pa zhes bya ba gsungs te /
translated: Therefore, the root text states, “they do not abide in the belief that their own view is supreme.”

original: lta ba nyid dad pas mos pa'i rnam pa yin par sbyar ro //
analyzed: lta ba nyid dad pas mos pa'i rnam pa yin par sbyar ro //
translated: The word “view” should be connected with the term “faith and aspiration.”

original: de dag kyang gang zhe na /
analyzed: de dag kyang gang zhe na /
translated: What are they?

original: chos de thos na nga'i dgongs te bshad pa yang yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin du rab tu mi shes mod kyi zhes bya ba ni rigs dang ldan pa las gyur pa ni mos @125a * //
analyzed: chos de thos na nga'i dgongs te bshad pa yang yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin du rab tu mi shes mod kyi zhes bya ba ni rigs dang ldan pa las gyur pa ni mos @125a * //
translated: “When they hear that Dharma, they do not understand my teachings that were given with an underlying thought in the way that they were intended.”

original: pa'i bye brag bstan te /
analyzed: pa'i bye brag bstan te /
translated: This passage teaches the specific types of aspiration that are based on possessing the spiritual lineage.🔽Those who possess the spiritual lineage are said to have a basis for good fortune.

original: rigs dang ldan pas skal ba dang ldan pa'i gzhi yod pa'i phyir ni snga ma ltar chos de thos par 'gyur la rigs phun sum tshogs pa ma yin pas skal ba dang ldan pa'i gzhi phun sum tshogs pa ma yin pa'i phyir ni snga ma ltar dgongs te
analyzed: rigs dang ldan pas skal ba dang ldan pa'i gzhi yod pa'i phyir ni snga ma ltar chos de thos par 'gyur la rigs phun sum tshogs pa ma yin pas skal ba dang ldan pa'i gzhi phun sum tshogs pa ma yin pa'i phyir ni snga ma ltar dgongs te
translated: Those who do not possess the spiritual lineage are said to have a basis for misfortune.

original: bshad pa yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin du rab tu mi shes par sbyar ro //
analyzed: bshad pa yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin du rab tu mi shes par sbyar ro //
translated: and the explanation is not applied correctly, just as it is.🔽Nevertheless, one has faith in that Dharma and attains confidence.

original: 'on kyang chos de la mos pa byed cing dad pa yang thob ste zhes bya bas ni bsgom pa'i rnam pas sbyor bar ni mi nus so zhes bya ba'i bar gyis ni mos pa dang ldan pa las gyur pa'i bye brag bstan te /
analyzed: 'on kyang chos de la mos pa byed cing dad pa yang thob ste zhes bya bas ni bsgom pa'i rnam pas sbyor bar ni mi nus so zhes bya ba'i bar gyis ni mos pa dang ldan pa las gyur pa'i bye brag bstan te /
translated: Up to: one is not able to apply oneself by way of cultivation. This teaches the difference that comes from having faith.

original: mos pa dang ldan pas byang chub sems dpa'i spyod pa la sbyor ba'i gzhi yod pa'i phyir ni snga ma ltar chos de la mos par 'gyur ba mos pa phun sum tshogs pa ma yin pas byang chub sems dpa'i spyod pa la sbyor ba phun sum tshogs pa
analyzed: mos pa dang ldan pas byang chub sems dpa'i spyod pa la sbyor ba'i gzhi yod pa'i phyir ni snga ma ltar chos de la mos par 'gyur ba mos pa phun sum tshogs pa ma yin pas byang chub sems dpa'i spyod pa la sbyor ba phun sum tshogs pa
translated: Because one who has faith has the basis for applying oneself to the bodhisattva practice, one has faith in that Dharma as previously explained. But because one does not have perfect faith, one does not have perfect application to the bodhisattva practice.

original: ma yin pa'i phyir ni snga ma ltar rtogs pa'i mos pa mi thob par sbyar ro //
analyzed: ma yin pa'i phyir ni snga ma ltar rtogs pa'i mos pa mi thob par sbyar ro //
translated: Because one does not have perfect application, one does not attain the faith that comes from understanding, as previously explained.🔽These sūtras, etc.

original: mdo sde 'di dag ni zhes bya ba ni drang ba'i don gyi mdo brjod pa'i rnam pa zhes sngar smos pa nyid yin par sbyar ro //
analyzed: mdo sde 'di dag ni zhes bya ba ni drang ba'i don gyi mdo brjod pa'i rnam pa zhes sngar smos pa nyid yin par sbyar ro //
translated: , are the previously mentioned aspects of the statements of the interpretable meaning sūtras.

original: zab pa zhes bya ba ni ngo bo nyid kyis so //
analyzed: zab pa zhes bya ba ni ngo bo nyid kyis so //
translated: Profound means by nature.

original: zab par nang pa zhes bya ba ni rnal 'byor pas zab par rtogs shing blo la snang bar byar rung ba'o //
analyzed: zab par nang pa zhes bya ba ni rnal 'byor pas zab par rtogs shing blo la snang bar byar rung ba'o //
translated: Profoundly internal means that it is to be realized by the yogi, and is to be made manifest to the mind.

original: stong pa nyid dang ldan pa zhes bya ba ni chos bdag med pas rab tu phye ba'o //
analyzed: stong pa nyid dang ldan pa zhes bya ba ni chos bdag med pas rab tu phye ba'o //
translated: Endowed with emptiness means that it is distinguished by the selflessness of phenomena.

original: mthong bar dka' ba zhes bya ba ni mthong ba'i lam dang bar chad med pa'i lam ma skyes kyi bar du thabs gzhan gyis mi mthong ba'o //
analyzed: mthong bar dka' ba zhes bya ba ni mthong ba'i lam dang bar chad med pa'i lam ma skyes kyi bar du thabs gzhan gyis mi mthong ba'o //
translated: Difficult to see means that it is not seen by other means until the path of seeing and the uninterrupted path arise.

original: rtogs par dka' ba zhes bya ba ni bsgom pa'i lam dang rnam par grol ba'i lam ma skyes kyi bar du thabs gzhan gyis mi rtogs pa'o //
analyzed: rtogs par dka' ba zhes bya ba ni bsgom pa'i lam dang rnam par grol ba'i lam ma skyes kyi bar du thabs gzhan gyis mi rtogs pa'o //
translated: Difficult to realize means that it is not realized by other means until the path of meditation and the path of liberation arise.

original: brtag mi nus pa zhes bya ba ni tshad mas gzhal bar mi nus pa'o //
analyzed: brtag mi nus pa zhes bya ba ni tshad mas gzhal bar mi nus pa'o //
translated: Incapable of being examined means that it is not capable of being evaluated by a valid cognition.

original: rtog ge'i spyod yul ma yin pa zhes bya ba ni 'phags pa so so rang rig pa'i shes pa'i spyod yul yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rtog ge'i spyod yul ma yin pa zhes bya ba ni 'phags pa so so rang rig pa'i shes pa'i spyod yul yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Not the domain of sophistry means that it is the domain of the knowledge of the individual self-awareness of the āryas.

original: zhib mo zhes bya ba ni de kho na nyid kyi don la 'jug pa'i shes rab bo //
analyzed: zhib mo zhes bya ba ni de kho na nyid kyi don la 'jug pa'i shes rab bo //
translated: The term subtle refers to the wisdom that engages the meaning of reality.

original: brtags pa zhes bya ba ni tshar byung gi don la 'jug pa'i shes rab bo //
analyzed: brtags pa zhes bya ba ni tshar byung gi don la 'jug pa'i shes rab bo //
translated: The term thorough investigation refers to the wisdom that engages the meaning of the scriptures.

original: mkhas ba zhes bya ba ni sbyor ba las byung ba'i shes rab bo //
analyzed: mkhas ba zhes bya ba ni sbyor ba las byung ba'i shes rab bo //
translated: The term skill refers to the wisdom that arises from application.

original: mdzangs pa zhes bya ba ni lhan cig skyes pa'i shes rab bo //
analyzed: mdzangs pa zhes bya ba ni lhan cig skyes pa'i shes rab bo //
translated: The term cleverness refers to innate wisdom.

original: shes rab rnon po de bzhi dang ldan pa'i gang zag ni zhib mo brtags pa mkhas pa mdzangs pa zhes bya ste /
analyzed: shes rab rnon po de bzhi dang ldan pa'i gang zag ni zhib mo brtags pa mkhas pa mdzangs pa zhes bya ste /
translated: The person who possesses these four kinds of sharp wisdom is called subtle, thorough investigator, skilled, and clever.

original: gang zag de lta bus rig pa yin no zhes mos par byed do zhes bya bar sbyar te /
analyzed: gang zag de lta bus rig pa yin no zhes mos par byed do zhes bya bar sbyar te /
translated: One should connect this with the phrase has conviction in the knowledge of such a person.

original: de @125b dag gis ni sngar chos de la mos par byed cing zhes smos pa'i mtshan nyid gtso cher bstan par rig par bya'o //
analyzed: de @125b dag gis ni sngar chos de la mos par byed cing zhes smos pa'i mtshan nyid gtso cher bstan par rig par bya'o //
translated: One should understand that these terms primarily indicate the characteristics of the phrase previously generates conviction in that Dharma.

original: mdo sde de dag gis bstan pa dag la bdag mi shes so snyam nas 'dug ste zhes bya ba la sogs pas ni sngar rang gi lta ba mchog tu 'dzin par mi gnas pa zhes smos pa'i mtshan nyid gtso cher ston te /
analyzed: mdo sde de dag gis bstan pa dag la bdag mi shes so snyam nas 'dug ste zhes bya ba la sogs pas ni sngar rang gi lta ba mchog tu 'dzin par mi gnas pa zhes smos pa'i mtshan nyid gtso cher ston te /
translated: The passage beginning I do not understand the teachings of those sutras shows the principal characteristic of the former, i.e. the non-abiding in the extreme of attachment to one's own views.

original: de'i sgo nas kyang dad pas mos pa'i mtshan nyid ston par sbyar ro //
analyzed: de'i sgo nas kyang dad pas mos pa'i mtshan nyid ston par sbyar ro //
translated: The characteristic of faith-followers is also shown by this passage.

original: sangs rgyas kyi byang chub ces bya ba ni rtogs par thugs su chud pa'o //
analyzed: sangs rgyas kyi byang chub ces bya ba ni rtogs par thugs su chud pa'o //
translated: The term enlightenment of the Buddha refers to the realization of the Buddha.

original: chos rnams kyi chos nyid ces bya ba ni sgro btags pa med pa dang / skur pa med pa'i chos nyid do //
analyzed: chos rnams kyi chos nyid ces bya ba ni sgro btags pa med pa dang / skur pa med pa'i chos nyid do //
translated: The term reality of phenomena refers to the reality of phenomena that is free from exaggeration and deprecation.

original: mos pa sna tshogs kyis 'jug pa yin te zhes bya ba ni gdul ba rnams kyi mos pa ji lta ba bzhin du sgo sna tshogs nas ston pa'o //
analyzed: mos pa sna tshogs kyis 'jug pa yin te zhes bya ba ni gdul ba rnams kyi mos pa ji lta ba bzhin du sgo sna tshogs nas ston pa'o //
translated: It is entered by various kinds of faith, i.e. it is taught by various means in accordance with the faith of those to be trained.

original: de dag mdo sde de rnams goms par byas te yi ger bri bar yang byed ces bya ba la sogs pas ni sngar dang bya yang 'thob ste zhes smos pa'i mtshan nyid gtso cher ston te /
analyzed: de dag mdo sde de rnams goms par byas te yi ger bri bar yang byed ces bya ba la sogs pas ni sngar dang bya yang 'thob ste zhes smos pa'i mtshan nyid gtso cher ston te /
translated: By their cultivation of those sutras and by their writing of them, etc. indicates the characteristics of the previously mentioned they also attain.

original: sgo de nas kyang dad pas mos pa'i bye brag ston par sbyar ro //
analyzed: sgo de nas kyang dad pas mos pa'i bye brag ston par sbyar ro //
translated: From that point of view, the text also shows the varieties of faith and devotion.

original: bsgom pa'i rnam pas sbyor bar ni mi nus so zhes bya bas ni shes rab dang bral ba'i rgyu bstan te /
analyzed: bsgom pa'i rnam pas sbyor bar ni mi nus so zhes bya bas ni shes rab dang bral ba'i rgyu bstan te /
translated: They are unable to apply themselves by way of meditation indicates the cause of their lack of wisdom.

original: bsgom pa'i rnam pa la brten nas shes rab skye ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: bsgom pa'i rnam pa la brten nas shes rab skye ba'i phyir ro //
translated: Because wisdom arises in dependence on the aspects of meditation.

original: de dag gzhi des na zhes bya ba la sogs pas ni bsod nams dang ye shes dang de'i rgyu dang 'bras bu sngar bstan pa dag rim gyis 'phel ba'i sgo nas shes rab dang ldan par 'gyur ro zhes ston to //
analyzed: de dag gzhi des na zhes bya ba la sogs pas ni bsod nams dang ye shes dang de'i rgyu dang 'bras bu sngar bstan pa dag rim gyis 'phel ba'i sgo nas shes rab dang ldan par 'gyur ro zhes ston to //
translated: By on that basis and so on, the text shows that they will have wisdom by gradually increasing the merit and wisdom previously explained, as well as their causes and results.

original: gong du yang rgyud yongs su ma smin pa dag kyang yongs su smin par byed do zhes bya bas ni shes rab dang ldan par gyur pa'i gong du byang chub chen po yongs su rdzogs par 'gyur ba'i gzhi dang ldan par byed do zhes bya ba'i tha tshig
analyzed: gong du yang rgyud yongs su ma smin pa dag kyang yongs su smin par byed do zhes bya bas ni shes rab dang ldan par gyur pa'i gong du byang chub chen po yongs su rdzogs par 'gyur ba'i gzhi dang ldan par byed do zhes bya ba'i tha tshig
translated: Above, by saying “they ripen those whose mindstreams are not fully ripened,” it is implicitly saying that they cause those who have not fully ripened the basis for attaining great enlightenment to become endowed with wisdom.🔽This is the second extensive explanation of the different kinds of interest.

original: ste / de ni mos pa'i bye brag rgyas par bshad pa gnyis pa yin no /
analyzed: ste / de ni mos pa'i bye brag rgyas par bshad pa gnyis pa yin no /
translated: The third extensive explanation of the different kinds of interest🔽The third extensive explanation of the different kinds of interest is divided into three sections: the explanation of the words of the root stanza, the explanation of the different kinds of interest and the explanation of the different kinds of interest in detail.🔽The explanation of the words of the root stanza🔽The words of the root stanza are as follows:

original: rigs dang mos pa dang ldan pa'i zhes bya ba ni de bzhin gshegs pa'i theg pa mngon par rtogs pa'i rigs dang ldan la phun sum tshogs pa nyid ma yin pa dang / byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi mos pa'i khams dang ldan la brtas pa nyid ma yin pa ste /
analyzed: rigs dang mos pa dang ldan pa'i zhes bya ba ni de bzhin gshegs pa'i theg pa mngon par rtogs pa'i rigs dang ldan la phun sum tshogs pa nyid ma yin pa dang / byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi mos pa'i khams dang ldan la brtas pa nyid ma yin pa ste /

original: sngar gnyis pa'i skabs su ji skad bstan pa kho na bzhin du blta bar bya'o //
analyzed: sngar gnyis pa'i skabs su ji skad bstan pa kho na bzhin du blta bar bya'o //
translated: One should see it just as it was taught in the context of the second chapter.

original: shes rab chung ngu zhes bya bas snga ma las bye brag tu bstan pa yin te /
analyzed: shes rab chung ngu zhes bya bas snga ma las bye brag tu bstan pa yin te /
translated: The phrase of lesser wisdom indicates a distinction from the previous chapter.

original: de'i phyir ji ste sems can de dag las @126a * //
analyzed: de'i phyir ji ste sems can de dag las @126a * //
translated: Therefore, the text says, If those sentient beings...

original: sems can gang dag bsod nams dang ye shes kyi tshogs chen po'i bar du yang dag par 'grub pa ma yin yang zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs so //
analyzed: sems can gang dag bsod nams dang ye shes kyi tshogs chen po'i bar du yang dag par 'grub pa ma yin yang zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs so //
translated: The word even indicates that there are sentient beings who have not even accomplished the great accumulations of merit and wisdom.

original: bar du zhes bya ba'i sgra ni sngar gnyis pa'i skabs su dge ba'i rtsa ba bskyed pa dang / sgrib pa yongs su dag pa dang / rgyud yongs su smin pa dang / mos pa chen po ma yin pa zhes gsungs pa dag kyang 'dir bsdu ba'i tshig yin no //
analyzed: bar du zhes bya ba'i sgra ni sngar gnyis pa'i skabs su dge ba'i rtsa ba bskyed pa dang / sgrib pa yongs su dag pa dang / rgyud yongs su smin pa dang / mos pa chen po ma yin pa zhes gsungs pa dag kyang 'dir bsdu ba'i tshig yin no //
translated: The word even also includes those who have not previously generated the roots of virtue, purified the obstructions, ripened their continuums, or have not great devotion, as was taught in the context of the second chapter.

original: chen po zhes bya ba'i sgras dang po sems bskyed pa'i gong du /
analyzed: chen po zhes bya ba'i sgras dang po sems bskyed pa'i gong du /
translated: The word great indicates those who have generated the mind of enlightenment, but who are not yet at the stage of the first level.

original: byang chub sems dpa'i spyod pa la sbyor ba'i gnas skabs na bsod nams dang ye shes kyi tshogs dang / de'i rgyu dang 'bras bu shas kyis yod kyang yongs su ma yin par ni snga ma dang 'dra la /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa'i spyod pa la sbyor ba'i gnas skabs na bsod nams dang ye shes kyi tshogs dang / de'i rgyu dang 'bras bu shas kyis yod kyang yongs su ma yin par ni snga ma dang 'dra la /
translated: At the stage of application in the bodhisattva deeds, the accumulations of merit and direct intuition exist in part, as do their causes and fruits, but not in full measure, as before.

original: 'phral du mong rtul ba ma yin pa'i phyir ni shes rab chung ngu dang ldan pa zhes bya ste /
analyzed: 'phral du mong rtul ba ma yin pa'i phyir ni shes rab chung ngu dang ldan pa zhes bya ste /
translated: And because he is not immediately endowed with the universal vehicle, he is said to possess a small amount of understanding.

original: de'i phyir drang po dang drang po'i rang bzhin can ma yin la rtog pa dang sel nus shing zhes bya bas snga ma las bye brag tu bstan te /
analyzed: de'i phyir drang po dang drang po'i rang bzhin can ma yin la rtog pa dang sel nus shing zhes bya bas snga ma las bye brag tu bstan te /
translated: He is not straightforward and not of a straightforward nature, but is capable of understanding and rejecting, as stated previously.

original: des na shes rab chung ngu dang ldan pas re zhig chud za bar 'gyur bar ston to //
analyzed: des na shes rab chung ngu dang ldan pas re zhig chud za bar 'gyur bar ston to //
translated: Thus, because he possesses a small amount of understanding, he is said to be one who is lost for the time being.

original: gyur pa zhes bya ba'i sgra yang gzhi de gsum las byung ba'i mos pa'i bye brag ces bya bar sbyar ro //
analyzed: gyur pa zhes bya ba'i sgra yang gzhi de gsum las byung ba'i mos pa'i bye brag ces bya bar sbyar ro //
translated: The word “becomes” is to be connected with the phrase “a specific kind of devotion that arises from those three bases.”

original: mos pa'i bye brag ces bya ba'i sgra skabs 'dir ni chos la dad pas mos la /
analyzed: mos pa'i bye brag ces bya ba'i sgra skabs 'dir ni chos la dad pas mos la /
translated: In this context, the phrase “a specific kind of devotion” refers to devotion through faith in the Dharma.

original: don la sgra ji bzhin du mngon par zhen pa zhes bya ba'i don du gzung ste /
analyzed: don la sgra ji bzhin du mngon par zhen pa zhes bya ba'i don du gzung ste /
translated: The meaning of the phrase “conceives of the meaning according to the literal expression” should be understood as follows.

original: de'i phyir lta ba mchog tu 'dzin par gnas pa zhes bya ba gsungs te /
analyzed: de'i phyir lta ba mchog tu 'dzin par gnas pa zhes bya ba gsungs te /
translated: Therefore, it says, “abides in the view that holds as paramount.”

original: lta ba nyid dad pas mos pa dang / sgra ji bzhin du mngon par zhen pa'i rnam pa yin par sbyar ro //
analyzed: lta ba nyid dad pas mos pa dang / sgra ji bzhin du mngon par zhen pa'i rnam pa yin par sbyar ro //
translated: The view itself is the aspect of conviction and the literal expression is the aspect of conception.

original: de dag kyang gang zhe na /
analyzed: de dag kyang gang zhe na /
translated: What are they?🔽Having heard that teaching, they do not understand the profound discourses that I have explained with a specific intention in accordance with reality.

original: chos de thos nas nga'i dgongs te bshad pa zab mo yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin du rab tu mi shes te zhes bya bas ni rigs dang ldan pa las gyur pa'i mos pa'i bye brag bstan te /
analyzed: chos de thos nas nga'i dgongs te bshad pa zab mo yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin du rab tu mi shes te zhes bya bas ni rigs dang ldan pa las gyur pa'i mos pa'i bye brag bstan te /
translated: This passage teaches the difference in conviction that comes from having or not having the spiritual gene.

original: rigs dang ldan pas skal ba dang ldan pa'i gzhi yod pa'i phyir ni snga ma bzhin du chos de thos par 'gyur la /
analyzed: rigs dang ldan pas skal ba dang ldan pa'i gzhi yod pa'i phyir ni snga ma bzhin du chos de thos par 'gyur la /
translated: Because of having the spiritual gene, one has the basis for good fortune, and so, as before, one hears that teaching.

original: rigs phun sum tshogs pa ma yin pas skal pa dang ldan pa'i gzhi phun sum tshogs pa ma yin pa'i phyir ni snga ma bzhin du dgongs te bshad pa zab mo yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin du rab tu mi shes par sbyar ro //
analyzed: rigs phun sum tshogs pa ma yin pas skal pa dang ldan pa'i gzhi phun sum tshogs pa ma yin pa'i phyir ni snga ma bzhin du dgongs te bshad pa zab mo yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin du rab tu mi shes par sbyar ro //
translated: The phrase “they do not understand it correctly” should be connected with the phrase “they do not have a thorough knowledge of the bodhisattva conduct” in the same way that it was connected with the previous phrase.

original: chos de la mos kyang zhes bya ba ni mos pa ldan pa las gyur pa'i mos pa'i bye brag bstan te /
analyzed: chos de la mos kyang zhes bya ba ni mos pa ldan pa las gyur pa'i mos pa'i bye brag bstan te /
translated: The phrase “they have conviction in that teaching” indicates a specific type of conviction that is based upon having conviction.🔽The phrase “they do not have a thorough knowledge of the bodhisattva conduct” should be connected with the phrase “they do not have a thorough knowledge of the bodhisattva conduct” in the same way that it was connected with the previous phrase.

original: mos pa dang ldan pas byang chub sems dpa'i spyod pa la sbyor ba'i gzhi yod pa'i phyir ni snga ma bzhin du chos de la @126b mos par 'gyur la /
analyzed: mos pa dang ldan pas byang chub sems dpa'i spyod pa la sbyor ba'i gzhi yod pa'i phyir ni snga ma bzhin du chos de la @126b mos par 'gyur la /
translated: The phrase “they do not understand it correctly” should be connected with the phrase “they do not have a thorough knowledge of the bodhisattva conduct” in the same way that it was connected with the previous phrase.🔽The phrase “they have conviction in that teaching” indicates a specific type of conviction that is based upon having conviction.🔽The phrase “they do not have a thorough knowledge of the bodhisattva conduct” should be connected with the phrase “they do not have a thorough knowledge of the bodhisattva conduct” in the same way that it was connected with the previous phrase.

original: mos pa phun sum tshogs pa ma yin pas byang chub sems dpa'i spyod pa la sbyor ba'i gzhi phun sum tshogs pa ma yin pa'i phyir ni snga ma bzhin du rtogs bar mi 'gyur zhing /
analyzed: mos pa phun sum tshogs pa ma yin pas byang chub sems dpa'i spyod pa la sbyor ba'i gzhi phun sum tshogs pa ma yin pa'i phyir ni snga ma bzhin du rtogs bar mi 'gyur zhing /
translated: The phrase “they do not understand it correctly” should be connected with the phrase “they do not have a thorough knowledge of the bodhisattva conduct” in the same way that it was connected with the previous phrase.

original: chos de la dad pas mos pa'i bye brag thob par sbyar ro //
analyzed: chos de la dad pas mos pa'i bye brag thob par sbyar ro //
translated: The phrase “they have conviction in that teaching” indicates a specific type of conviction that is based upon having conviction.🔽The phrase “they do not have a thorough knowledge of the bodhisattva conduct” should be connected with the phrase “they do not have a thorough knowledge of the bodhisattva conduct” in the same way that it was connected with the previous phrase.🔽The phrase “they do not understand it correctly” should be

original: chos 'di dag thams cad kyi ngo bo nyid med pa kho na yin no zhes bya ba la sogs pas ni shes rab chung ngu las gyur pa'i mos pa'i bye brag bstan te /
analyzed: chos 'di dag thams cad kyi ngo bo nyid med pa kho na yin no zhes bya ba la sogs pas ni shes rab chung ngu las gyur pa'i mos pa'i bye brag bstan te /
translated: The statement “all these phenomena are only devoid of entityness” and so on teaches the specific types of interest that arise from lesser supreme knowledge.

original: shes rab chung ngu de ni bsod nams dang ye shes kyi tshogs dang de'i rgyu dang 'bras bu yang dag par 'grub pa'i rim gyis thob pa ni ma yin gyi /
analyzed: shes rab chung ngu de ni bsod nams dang ye shes kyi tshogs dang de'i rgyu dang 'bras bu yang dag par 'grub pa'i rim gyis thob pa ni ma yin gyi /
translated: Lesser supreme knowledge is not attained through the stages of correctly accomplishing the accumulations of merit and wisdom and their causes and results.🔽It is supreme knowledge that is not straightforward and is not of the nature of straightforwardness, and it is supreme knowledge that is merely capable of conceptualization and elimination.

original: drang po dang drang po'i rang bzhin can ma yin la rtog pa dang sel nus pa tsam gyis shes rab yin pas shes rab chung ngu de las gyur pa'i mos pa'i bye brag de yang don la sgra ji bzhin kho nar mngon par zhen pas byed pa'i mtshan
analyzed: drang po dang drang po'i rang bzhin can ma yin la rtog pa dang sel nus pa tsam gyis shes rab yin pas shes rab chung ngu de las gyur pa'i mos pa'i bye brag de yang don la sgra ji bzhin kho nar mngon par zhen pas byed pa'i mtshan
translated: The specific types of interest that arise from lesser supreme knowledge are also characterized by the fact that they are created by clinging to the meaning of the words exactly as they are.

original: nyid thams cad la skur pa 'debs par byed pa /
analyzed: nyid thams cad la skur pa 'debs par byed pa /
translated: They deprecate all the characteristics of conditioned phenomena.

original: shes rab dang dge ba'i chos rnams las ma thob pa'i mnyam pas yongs su mnyam par byed pa yin te /
analyzed: shes rab dang dge ba'i chos rnams las ma thob pa'i mnyam pas yongs su mnyam par byed pa yin te /
translated: They make everything equal through the equality of not attaining supreme knowledge and virtuous qualities.

original: sngar shes rab dang bral ba zhes bya ba ni shes rab yongs su ma smin pas chud za bar 'gyur ba yang med kyi /
analyzed: sngar shes rab dang bral ba zhes bya ba ni shes rab yongs su ma smin pas chud za bar 'gyur ba yang med kyi /
translated: Previously, it was said that “without wisdom” means that because wisdom is not fully ripened, it is not that it is wasted.

original: shes rab chung ngu 'di ni re zhig chud za bar 'gyur bar rig par bya'o //
analyzed: shes rab chung ngu 'di ni re zhig chud za bar 'gyur bar rig par bya'o //
translated: But this small wisdom should be understood as being wasted for a while.

original: de la chos 'di dag thams cad ni ngo bo nyid med pa kho na yin no //
analyzed: de la chos 'di dag thams cad ni ngo bo nyid med pa kho na yin no //
translated: In that regard, all these phenomena are indeed essenceless.🔽But they take the meaning of the Dharma literally, just as it is spoken.

original: chos kyi don la sgra ji bzhin kho nar mngon par zhen par byed de zhes bya bas ni chos thams cad ngo bo nyid med ces gsungs pa ni mtshan nyid thams cad ngo bo nyid med pa nyid kyis ngo bo nyid med pa ma yin gyi /
analyzed: chos kyi don la sgra ji bzhin kho nar mngon par zhen par byed de zhes bya bas ni chos thams cad ngo bo nyid med ces gsungs pa ni mtshan nyid thams cad ngo bo nyid med pa nyid kyis ngo bo nyid med pa ma yin gyi /
translated: This passage shows that the statement that all phenomena are essenceless is not because they are essenceless due to the essencelessness of all characteristics.

original: sngar drang ba'i don gyi mdo sde brjod pa'i rnam pas bstan pa lta bu yin na /
analyzed: sngar drang ba'i don gyi mdo sde brjod pa'i rnam pas bstan pa lta bu yin na /
translated: If it were, then it would be just like the teachings given by the former sutras of provisional meaning.

original: de ltar mi shes shing mtshan nyid thams cad ngo bo nyid med pa yin no zhes chos kyi don la sgra ji bzhin kho nar mngon par zhen par byed pa kho na'o //
analyzed: de ltar mi shes shing mtshan nyid thams cad ngo bo nyid med pa yin no zhes chos kyi don la sgra ji bzhin kho nar mngon par zhen par byed pa kho na'o //
translated: But they do not understand it that way. They take the meaning of the Dharma literally, just as it is spoken, when it says that all phenomena are essenceless.

original: chos 'di dag thams cad ni ma skyes pa kho na'o zhes bya ba la sogs pa chos kyi don la sgra ji bzhin kho nar mngon par zhen par byed pa ma yin no //
analyzed: chos 'di dag thams cad ni ma skyes pa kho na'o zhes bya ba la sogs pa chos kyi don la sgra ji bzhin kho nar mngon par zhen par byed pa ma yin no //
translated: One should not adhere to the meaning of the teachings in a literal way, saying, for example, that all these teachings are only unproduced.

original: chos thams cad la med par lta ba dang zhes bya ba ni mtshan nyid med pa'i chos dang / kun nas nyon mongs pa'i mtshan nyid kyi chos dang / rnam par byang ba'i mtshan nyid kyi chos thams cad mgo mnyam du med par blta bar bya'o //
analyzed: chos thams cad la med par lta ba dang zhes bya ba ni mtshan nyid med pa'i chos dang / kun nas nyon mongs pa'i mtshan nyid kyi chos dang / rnam par byang ba'i mtshan nyid kyi chos thams cad mgo mnyam du med par blta bar bya'o //
translated: The view of nonexistence with regard to all things means that one should view the characteristic of the nonexistence of all things, the characteristic of the affliction of all things, and the characteristic of the purification of all things as equivalent.

original: mtshan nyid med pa la lta ba zhes bya ba ni kun brtags pa'i mtshan nyid dang / gzhan gyi dbang gi mtshan nyid @127a * //
analyzed: mtshan nyid med pa la lta ba zhes bya ba ni kun brtags pa'i mtshan nyid dang / gzhan gyi dbang gi mtshan nyid @127a * //
translated: The view of the characteristic of nonexistence means that one should view the imagined characteristic, the other-dependent characteristic,

original: dang ; yongs su grub pa'i mtshan nyid thams cad mgo mnyam du med par blta ba'o //
analyzed: dang ; yongs su grub pa'i mtshan nyid thams cad mgo mnyam du med par blta ba'o //
translated: and the reality-realized characteristic as equivalent.

original: 'di ltar gzhan gyi dbang gi mtshan nyid dang yongs su grub pa'i mtshan nyid yod na ni kun brtags pa'i mtshan nyid kyang rab tu shes par 'gyur na zhes bya ba ni mtshan nyid de gnyis la ngo bo nyid dam bye brag tu ming dang brdar 'dogs pa🔽nyid kun brtags pa'i mtshan nyid yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: 'di ltar gzhan gyi dbang gi mtshan nyid dang yongs su grub pa'i mtshan nyid yod na ni kun brtags pa'i mtshan nyid kyang rab tu shes par 'gyur na zhes bya ba ni mtshan nyid de gnyis la ngo bo nyid dam bye brag tu ming dang brdar 'dogs pa nyid kun brtags pa'i mtshan nyid yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The imagination of what is unreal is the imagination of the entity or the particular as a name and symbol.🔽Therefore, they are said to be denigrators in regard to all three natures.

original: de lta bas na de dag ni mtshan nyid rnam pa gsum char la yang skur pa 'debs pa zhes bya'o zhes bya bas ni shes rab chung ngu las gyur pa'i mos pa'i bye brag nyid bstan pa yin no //
analyzed: de lta bas na de dag ni mtshan nyid rnam pa gsum char la yang skur pa 'debs pa zhes bya'o zhes bya bas ni shes rab chung ngu las gyur pa'i mos pa'i bye brag nyid bstan pa yin no //
translated: This shows the difference in the inclination that results from having little wisdom.

original: de dag ni nga'i chos la chos su 'du shes pa dang zhes bya ba ni sangs rgyas kyi bka' yin par 'dzin pa ste /
analyzed: de dag ni nga'i chos la chos su 'du shes pa dang zhes bya ba ni sangs rgyas kyi bka' yin par 'dzin pa ste /
translated: They have the idea that my Dharma is the Dharma.

original: des ni rigs dang ldan pa dang mos pa dang ldan pa las gyur pa'i mos pa'i bye brag nyid bstan pa yin no //
analyzed: des ni rigs dang ldan pa dang mos pa dang ldan pa las gyur pa'i mos pa'i bye brag nyid bstan pa yin no //
translated: This shows the difference in the inclination that results from belonging to the spiritual family and from having faith.

original: don ma yin pa la don du 'du shes pa yin te zhes bya ba ni chos kyi don la sgra ji bzhin kho nar zhes pa ste /
analyzed: don ma yin pa la don du 'du shes pa yin te zhes bya ba ni chos kyi don la sgra ji bzhin kho nar zhes pa ste /
translated: The meaning is not the meaning, but the perception of the meaning is the literal meaning of the Dharma.

original: des ni shes rab chung ngu las gyur pa'i mos pa'i bye brag mtshan nyid rnam pa gsum char la yang skur pa 'debs pa nyid bstan to //
analyzed: des ni shes rab chung ngu las gyur pa'i mos pa'i bye brag mtshan nyid rnam pa gsum char la yang skur pa 'debs pa nyid bstan to //
translated: This shows the specific faith that comes from lesser wisdom, which is the denial of all three characteristics.

original: de dag chos la mos pas dge ba'i chos rnams kyis 'phel mod kyi zhes bya bas ni rigs dang ldan pa dang mos pa dang ldan pa las gyur pa mos pa'i bye brag gi phan yon ston te /
analyzed: de dag chos la mos pas dge ba'i chos rnams kyis 'phel mod kyi zhes bya bas ni rigs dang ldan pa dang mos pa dang ldan pa las gyur pa mos pa'i bye brag gi phan yon ston te /
translated: Although they increase in virtuous qualities through faith in the Dharma, this shows the benefit of the specific faith that comes from having the lineage and having faith.

original: de dag de bzhin gshegs pa'i theg pa mngon par rtogs pa'i rigs yang dag par bsgrubs pa dang ldan zhing /
analyzed: de dag de bzhin gshegs pa'i theg pa mngon par rtogs pa'i rigs yang dag par bsgrubs pa dang ldan zhing /
translated: They have the lineage that is the realization of the vehicle of the Tathagata.

original: de'i gong du dang po byang chub tu sems bskyed pa'i gnas skabs na mos pa'i gnas brgyad po dag la mos shing sangs rgyas kyi chos rnams la thob par nus par yid ches pas rab tu phye ba'i mos pa'i khams dang ldan pas /
analyzed: de'i gong du dang po byang chub tu sems bskyed pa'i gnas skabs na mos pa'i gnas brgyad po dag la mos shing sangs rgyas kyi chos rnams la thob par nus par yid ches pas rab tu phye ba'i mos pa'i khams dang ldan pas /
translated: Prior to that, when one first generates the thought of enlightenment, one has the element of aspiration, which is distinguished by the aspiration for the eight abodes and by the confidence that one will be able to attain the qualities of the Buddha.

original: thar pa'i cha dang mthun pa'i dge ba'i rtsa ba bskyed zin pa'i phyir ring po mi thogs par nges par 'byed pa'i cha dang mthun pa'i dge ba'i rtsa ba skye zhing mthong ba'i lam dang bsgom pa'i lam dang / mthar thug pa'i 'bras bu yang rim gyis thob par 'gyur bas na /
analyzed: thar pa'i cha dang mthun pa'i dge ba'i rtsa ba bskyed zin pa'i phyir ring po mi thogs par nges par 'byed pa'i cha dang mthun pa'i dge ba'i rtsa ba skye zhing mthong ba'i lam dang bsgom pa'i lam dang / mthar thug pa'i 'bras bu yang rim gyis thob par 'gyur bas na /
translated: Since one has already generated the roots of virtue that are conducive to liberation, one will soon generate the roots of virtue that are conducive to penetration, and one will gradually attain the path of seeing, the path of cultivation, and the ultimate result.

original: de'i phyir dge ba'i chos rnams kyi 'phel ba zhes bya ste /
analyzed: de'i phyir dge ba'i chos rnams kyi 'phel ba zhes bya ste /
translated: Therefore, it is called the “increase of virtuous qualities.”

original: phan yon dpag tu med pa dang ldan par bstan pa yin no //
analyzed: phan yon dpag tu med pa dang ldan par bstan pa yin no //
translated: It is taught that it has immeasurable benefits.

original: 'on kyang don ma yin pa la mngon par zhen pas shes rab la yongs su nyams par 'gyur te zhes bya ba la sogs pas ni shes rab chung ngu @127b las gyur pa'i mos pa'i bye brag gi nyes dmigs ston te /
analyzed: 'on kyang don ma yin pa la mngon par zhen pas shes rab la yongs su nyams par 'gyur te zhes bya ba la sogs pas ni shes rab chung ngu @127b las gyur pa'i mos pa'i bye brag gi nyes dmigs ston te /
translated: This shows the faults of the specific types of interest that come from having little wisdom.

original: de dag shes rab chung ngu dang ldan pas don la sgra ji bzhin kho nar mngon par zhen cing mtshan nyid rnam pa gsum char la yang skur pa 'debs par byed pas /
analyzed: de dag shes rab chung ngu dang ldan pas don la sgra ji bzhin kho nar mngon par zhen cing mtshan nyid rnam pa gsum char la yang skur pa 'debs par byed pas /
translated: Since they have little wisdom, they adhere to the meaning just as the words are, and they deprecate all three natures.

original: re zhig nges par 'byed pa'i cha dang mthun pa'i dge ba'i rtsa ba dang mthong ba'i lam la sogs pas bsdus pa'i shes rab las ma thob pa'i nyams pas yongs su nyams par 'gyur ba'i nyes dmigs chen po dang ldan par ston to //
analyzed: re zhig nges par 'byed pa'i cha dang mthun pa'i dge ba'i rtsa ba dang mthong ba'i lam la sogs pas bsdus pa'i shes rab las ma thob pa'i nyams pas yongs su nyams par 'gyur ba'i nyes dmigs chen po dang ldan par ston to //
translated: This shows the great fault of their decline, since they have not obtained the wisdom that is included in the roots of virtue that are conducive to penetrative insight, the path of seeing and so on.

original: shes rab las yongs su nyams na dge ba'i chos shin tu rgya che ba dang / shin tu dpag tu med pa rnams las kyang yongs su nyams par 'gyur ro zhes bya ba ni de ltar shes rab de dag las ma thob pa'i nyams pas yongs su nyams na shes rab de dag gis bsdus pa'i dge ba'i chos shin tu rgya che ba dang
analyzed: shes rab las yongs su nyams na dge ba'i chos shin tu rgya che ba dang / shin tu dpag tu med pa rnams las kyang yongs su nyams par 'gyur ro zhes bya ba ni de ltar shes rab de dag las ma thob pa'i nyams pas yongs su nyams na shes rab de dag gis bsdus pa'i dge ba'i chos shin tu rgya che ba dang
translated: If one degenerates from wisdom, one degenerates from the extremely vast and extremely immeasurable virtuous qualities subsumed by wisdom.

original: shin tu dpag tu med pa rnams las kyang ma thob pa'i nyams pas yongs su nyams par 'gyur ba ste /
analyzed: shin tu dpag tu med pa rnams las kyang ma thob pa'i nyams pas yongs su nyams par 'gyur ba ste /
translated: This means that if one degenerates from the non-obtainment of those wisdoms, one also degenerates from the non-obtainment of the extremely vast and extremely immeasurable virtuous qualities subsumed by those wisdoms.

original: de tsam du 'gyur bar zad kyi kha na ma tho ba 'phel bar ni mi 'gyur ba'i don to //
analyzed: de tsam du 'gyur bar zad kyi kha na ma tho ba 'phel bar ni mi 'gyur ba'i don to //
translated: This is the extent of it, but it does not mean that one increases misdeeds.

original: de dag las gzhan dag gi chos la chos su dang / don ma yin pa la don du thos nas zhes bya ba'i smra ba po shes rab chung ngu de dag las nyan pa po las dang po pa gzhan dag gis thos nas so //
analyzed: de dag las gzhan dag gi chos la chos su dang / don ma yin pa la don du thos nas zhes bya ba'i smra ba po shes rab chung ngu de dag las nyan pa po las dang po pa gzhan dag gis thos nas so //
translated: Having heard from others who are beginners that those with little wisdom say that what is not Dharma is Dharma and what is not the meaning is the meaning, they hear it from those who speak in that way.

original: de la nyan pa po ni rnam pa gnyis te /
analyzed: de la nyan pa po ni rnam pa gnyis te /
translated: There are two types of listeners.

original: de dag gi lta ba la dga' bar byed pa dang / de dag gi lta ba la dga' bar mi byed pa'o //
analyzed: de dag gi lta ba la dga' bar byed pa dang / de dag gi lta ba la dga' bar mi byed pa'o //
translated: They delight in those views and they do not delight in those views.

original: lta ba la dga' bar byed pa dag ni smra ba po de dag nyid dang 'dra bar chos la mos pa'i dge ba'i chos rnams kyis kyang 'phel bar 'gyur //
analyzed: lta ba la dga' bar byed pa dag ni smra ba po de dag nyid dang 'dra bar chos la mos pa'i dge ba'i chos rnams kyis kyang 'phel bar 'gyur //
translated: Those who delight in those views increase in wholesome states of merit through their faith in the Dharma, just like those who expound those views.

original: don ma yin pa la mngon par zhen pas shes rab dang / dge ba'i chos rnams las yongs su nyams par 'gyur zhing kha na ma tho ba 'phel bar ni mi 'gyur te /
analyzed: don ma yin pa la mngon par zhen pas shes rab dang / dge ba'i chos rnams las yongs su nyams par 'gyur zhing kha na ma tho ba 'phel bar ni mi 'gyur te /
translated: But those who do not delight in those views do not increase in wholesome states of merit through their faith in the Dharma, just like those who expound those views.

original: de ni gang dag lta ba la dga' bar byed pa dag ni zhes bya ba la sogs pas bstan to //
analyzed: de ni gang dag lta ba la dga' bar byed pa dag ni zhes bya ba la sogs pas bstan to //
translated: This is what is shown by the passage beginning with “Those who delight in those views” and ending with “They do not increase in wholesome states of merit through their faith in the Dharma, just like those who expound those views.”

original: lta ba la dga' bar mi byed pa dag ni de dag gi lta ba la ma phyogs pa'i yon tan yod kyang /
analyzed: lta ba la dga' bar mi byed pa dag ni de dag gi lta ba la ma phyogs pa'i yon tan yod kyang /
translated: Those who do not delight in those views, even though they have the qualities of not being partial to those views,

original: chos la yang mi mos shing skur pa 'debs pa la sogs pa'i rim gyis dge ba'i chos rnams kyis 'phel bar lta ga la 'gyur gyi /
analyzed: chos la yang mi mos shing skur pa 'debs pa la sogs pa'i rim gyis dge ba'i chos rnams kyis 'phel bar lta ga la 'gyur gyi /
translated: how could they increase in wholesome states of merit through their faith in the Dharma?

original: shes rab dang dge ba'i chos rnams las ma thob pa'i nyams pas yongs su nyams par 'gyur ba'i steng du /
analyzed: shes rab dang dge ba'i chos rnams las ma thob pa'i nyams pas yongs su nyams par 'gyur ba'i steng du /
translated: They fall away from the attainment of wisdom and virtuous qualities, and on top of that

original: kha na ma tho ba chen po yang 'phel bar 'gyur te /
analyzed: kha na ma tho ba chen po yang 'phel bar 'gyur te /
translated: they increase their great misdeeds.

original: de ni gang dag lta ba la dga' @128a * //🔽bar mi byed pa de dag ni zhes bya ba la sogs pas bstan to //
analyzed: de ni gang dag lta ba la dga' @128a * // bar mi byed pa de dag ni zhes bya ba la sogs pas bstan to //
translated: Those who do not delight in views🔽are said to be the ones who delight in the Dharma.🔽Those who hear that all phenomena are essenceless

original: de dag la chos rnams kyi ngo bo nyid med pa nyid thos shing zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni smra ba po de dag la sgra ji bzhin du thos pa'o //
analyzed: de dag la chos rnams kyi ngo bo nyid med pa nyid thos shing zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni smra ba po de dag la sgra ji bzhin du thos pa'o //
translated: and so on refers to hearing the words of those teachers just as they are.

original: skrag cing zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni mtshan nyid rnam pa gsum char la skur pa 'debs pa'i lta ba la ma mos pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: skrag cing zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni mtshan nyid rnam pa gsum char la skur pa 'debs pa'i lta ba la ma mos pa'i phyir ro //
translated: They are frightened and so on refers to their lack of interest in the view that is the denial of all three natures.🔽How could those who deny the sūtras and so on

original: mdo sde dag la skur pa 'debs par byed ces bya ba la sogs pa ni smra ba po de dag gi lta ba la mos par lta ga la 'gyur gyi /
analyzed: mdo sde dag la skur pa 'debs par byed ces bya ba la sogs pa ni smra ba po de dag gi lta ba la mos par lta ga la 'gyur gyi /
translated: ever have interest in the views of those teachers?

original: de dag gang la mos pa'i chos de bzhin gshegs pas gsungs pa'i mdo sde de dang de dag la yang skur pa 'debs shing gtan spang ba la sogs par byed pa yin no //
analyzed: de dag gang la mos pa'i chos de bzhin gshegs pas gsungs pa'i mdo sde de dang de dag la yang skur pa 'debs shing gtan spang ba la sogs par byed pa yin no //
translated: They also deprecate and completely reject those sūtras taught by the Tathāgata that are consistent with the Dharma.

original: gzhi des na zhes bya ba ni de bzhin gshegs pas gsungs pa'i mdo sde de dag la skur pa btab pa la sogs pa'i gzhi des so //🔽phongs pa chen po thob par 'gyur zhing zhes bya ba ni dam pa'i chos kyis phongs par 'gyur ba'i sgrib pa chen po thob par 'gyur ba'am /
analyzed: gzhi des na zhes bya ba ni de bzhin gshegs pas gsungs pa'i mdo sde de dag la skur pa btab pa la sogs pa'i gzhi des so // phongs pa chen po thob par 'gyur zhing zhes bya ba ni dam pa'i chos kyis phongs par 'gyur ba'i sgrib pa chen po thob par 'gyur ba'am /
translated: “On that basis” means on the basis of deprecating and so on those sūtras taught by the Tathāgata.

original: yang na gzhi des 'bras bu sdug bsngal chen po thob par 'gyur ba'o //
analyzed: yang na gzhi des 'bras bu sdug bsngal chen po thob par 'gyur ba'o //
translated: “They will attain a great misfortune” means they will attain a great obscuration that is a misfortune of the true Dharma, or else they will attain a great suffering as a result of that.

original: las kyi sgrib pa chen pos kyang reg par 'gyur ro zhes bya ba ni dam pa'i chos kyis kyang phongs par 'gyur ba'i las kyi sgrib pa chen po'i 'bras bu sems can dmyal ba chen po gcig nas gcig tu brgyud pa 'phen pa dang ldan par 'gyur ro
analyzed: las kyi sgrib pa chen pos kyang reg par 'gyur ro zhes bya ba ni dam pa'i chos kyis kyang phongs par 'gyur ba'i las kyi sgrib pa chen po'i 'bras bu sems can dmyal ba chen po gcig nas gcig tu brgyud pa 'phen pa dang ldan par 'gyur ro
translated: And they will be touched by the great obscuration of karma means that they will have the result of the great obscuration of karma that is the loss of the true Dharma, which is the projection of one great hell after another.

original: zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: This is the meaning.

original: gzhi des kyang zhes bya ba ni nyan pa po rnam pa gnyis te /
analyzed: gzhi des kyang zhes bya ba ni nyan pa po rnam pa gnyis te /
translated: And by that basis means that there are two kinds of listeners.

original: de ltar rab tu nyams par byed pa'i gzhi des kyang ngo gang dag ces bya ba ni shes rab chung ngu las gyur pa'i mos pa'i bye brag dang ldan pa'i smra ba po dag go //
analyzed: de ltar rab tu nyams par byed pa'i gzhi des kyang ngo gang dag ces bya ba ni shes rab chung ngu las gyur pa'i mos pa'i bye brag dang ldan pa'i smra ba po dag go //
translated: And by that basis that causes such a great loss, those means those speakers who have the distinction of interest that comes from little wisdom.

original: de dag ni las kyi sgrib pa chen po dang ldan par nga smra'o zhes bya ba ni smra ba po de dag rang gi shes rab chung ngu las gyur pa'i mos pa'i bye brag gis ni shes rab dang / dge ba'i chos rnams las ma thob pa'i nyams pas yongs su nyams par 'gyur la kha na ma tho ba 'phel bar ni mi 'gyur mod kyi /
analyzed: de dag ni las kyi sgrib pa chen po dang ldan par nga smra'o zhes bya ba ni smra ba po de dag rang gi shes rab chung ngu las gyur pa'i mos pa'i bye brag gis ni shes rab dang / dge ba'i chos rnams las ma thob pa'i nyams pas yongs su nyams par 'gyur la kha na ma tho ba 'phel bar ni mi 'gyur mod kyi /
translated: Those who speak thus are impaired by the degeneration of not obtaining the wisdom and virtuous qualities that arise from their own small wisdom and interest.

original: nyan pa po rnam gnyis rab tu nyams par byas pa'i gzhi des kha na ma tho ba gzhan 'phel zhing re zhig chud za bar 'gyur ro zhes bya ba'i tha tshig ste /
analyzed: nyan pa po rnam gnyis rab tu nyams par byas pa'i gzhi des kha na ma tho ba gzhan 'phel zhing re zhig chud za bar 'gyur ro zhes bya ba'i tha tshig ste /
translated: However, the two kinds of listeners are impaired by the basis of that degeneration and other misdeeds increase and are wasted for a while.

original: de ni mos pa'i bye brag rgyas par bshad pa gsum pa yin no //
analyzed: de ni mos pa'i bye brag rgyas par bshad pa gsum pa yin no //
translated: This is the third extensive explanation of the types of interest.

original: de'i 'og tu mos pa'i bye brag rgyas par bshad pa bzhi pa'i tshig gi don la sogs pa bshad par bya ste /
analyzed: de'i 'og tu mos pa'i bye brag rgyas par bshad pa bzhi pa'i tshig gi don la sogs pa bshad par bya ste /
translated: Next, the meaning of the words and so on of the fourth extensive explanation of the types of interest should be explained.

original: thams cad dang bral zhing bkri ba @128b dgos pa zhes bya ba ni rigs yang dag par ma bsgrubs pa dang / mos pa med pa dang shes rab 'chal pa mkhas pa rnams kyis snying rje'i zhags pas gzung zhing bkri dgos pa ste /
analyzed: thams cad dang bral zhing bkri ba @128b dgos pa zhes bya ba ni rigs yang dag par ma bsgrubs pa dang / mos pa med pa dang shes rab 'chal pa mkhas pa rnams kyis snying rje'i zhags pas gzung zhing bkri dgos pa ste /
translated: Those who are devoid of all those and need to be led are those who have not properly accomplished the lineage, those who lack interest, and those with faulty wisdom. They are to be led by the hook of compassion of the wise.

original: de la don dam yang dag 'phags de la sems can gang dag dge ba'i rtsa ba ma bskyed sgrib pa yongs su ma dag rgyud yongs su ma smin zhes bya ba ni rigs yang dag par ma bsgrubs pa bstan to //
analyzed: de la don dam yang dag 'phags de la sems can gang dag dge ba'i rtsa ba ma bskyed sgrib pa yongs su ma dag rgyud yongs su ma smin zhes bya ba ni rigs yang dag par ma bsgrubs pa bstan to //
translated: Among them, those sentient beings who have not planted the roots of virtue, have not purified the obscurations, and have not fully ripened their continuums indicates those who have not properly accomplished the lineage.

original: mos pa mi mang zhes bya bas ni mos pa med pa bstan to //
analyzed: mos pa mi mang zhes bya bas ni mos pa med pa bstan to //
translated: Those who lack interest are indicated by those who have little interest.

original: bsod nams dang ye shes kyi tshogs yang dag par ma grub cing /
analyzed: bsod nams dang ye shes kyi tshogs yang dag par ma grub cing /
translated: Those who have not fully accomplished the accumulations of merit and wisdom

original: drang po dang drang po'i rang bzhin can ma yin la rtog pa dang sel mi nus shing zhes bya bas ni shes rab 'chal pa bstan to //
analyzed: drang po dang drang po'i rang bzhin can ma yin la rtog pa dang sel mi nus shing zhes bya bas ni shes rab 'chal pa bstan to //
translated: and those who are not straightforward and not of a straightforward nature, and are unable to contemplate and analyze indicate those with faulty wisdom.

original: gyur pa zhes bya ba yang thams cad dang bral zhing bkri dgos pa las byung ba'i mos pa'i bye brag ces bya bar sbyar ro //
analyzed: gyur pa zhes bya ba yang thams cad dang bral zhing bkri dgos pa las byung ba'i mos pa'i bye brag ces bya bar sbyar ro //
translated: The term change should be connected with a specific kind of devotion that arises from the necessity of being led away from all of those.

original: mos pa'i bye brag ces bya ba'i sgra skabs 'dir ni chos dang don la chos ma yin pa dang / don ma yin par 'du shes pa zhes bya ba'i don du gzung ngo //
analyzed: mos pa'i bye brag ces bya ba'i sgra skabs 'dir ni chos dang don la chos ma yin pa dang / don ma yin par 'du shes pa zhes bya ba'i don du gzung ngo //
translated: In this context, the term specific kind of devotion should be understood to mean the perception of the Dharma and its meaning as nondharma and nonsense.

original: de'i phyir rang gi lta ba mchog tu 'dzin par gnas pa zhes bya ba gsungs te /
analyzed: de'i phyir rang gi lta ba mchog tu 'dzin par gnas pa zhes bya ba gsungs te /
translated: Therefore, the root text states, they are abiding in the belief that their own view is supreme.

original: lta ba nyid 'du shes kyi rnam pa yin par sbyar ro //
analyzed: lta ba nyid 'du shes kyi rnam pa yin par sbyar ro //
translated: The term view should be connected with the term perception.

original: de dag kyang gang zhe na /🔽chos de thos na nga'i dgongs te bshad pa yang yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin du rab tu mi shes shing zhes bya bas ni rigs yang dag par ma bsgrubs pa las gyur pa'i mos pa'i bye brag bstan te rang bzhin gyis gnas pa'i rigs yod pas
analyzed: de dag kyang gang zhe na / chos de thos na nga'i dgongs te bshad pa yang yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin du rab tu mi shes shing zhes bya bas ni rigs yang dag par ma bsgrubs pa las gyur pa'i mos pa'i bye brag bstan te rang bzhin gyis gnas pa'i rigs yod pas
translated: What are those views?🔽The root text states, When they hear that Dharma, they do not understand my teachings that were given with a specific intention in a manner that is faithful to their meaning.🔽This passage teaches that a specific kind of devotion arises from the failure to establish a spiritual affinity.

original: ni chos de thos par 'gyur la /
analyzed: ni chos de thos par 'gyur la /
translated: The phrase When they hear that Dharma refers to the fact that they have an affinity that is naturally present.

original: yang dag par bsgrubs pa'i rigs med pas ni /
analyzed: yang dag par bsgrubs pa'i rigs med pas ni /
translated: Those who are not of the spiritual lineage of correct practice

original: dgongs te bshad pa yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin du rab tu mi shes par sbyar ro //
analyzed: dgongs te bshad pa yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin du rab tu mi shes par sbyar ro //
translated: do not understand the intentional statements correctly.🔽They do not have faith in that Dharma.

original: chos de la yang mos par yang mi 'gyur la zhes bya bas ni mos pa med pa las gyur pa'i mos pa'i bye brag bstan to //
analyzed: chos de la yang mos par yang mi 'gyur la zhes bya bas ni mos pa med pa las gyur pa'i mos pa'i bye brag bstan to //
translated: This shows the difference in faith that comes from not having faith.🔽They think that the Dharma is not Dharma, and they think that the meaning is not the meaning, etc.

original: de dag chos de la chos ma yin par 'du shes shing don la don ma yin par 'du shes la zhes bya ba la sogs pas ni shes rab 'chal pa las gyur pa'i mos pa'i bye brag bstan to //
analyzed: de dag chos de la chos ma yin par 'du shes shing don la don ma yin par 'du shes la zhes bya ba la sogs pas ni shes rab 'chal pa las gyur pa'i mos pa'i bye brag bstan to //
translated: This shows the difference in faith that comes from having bad discernment.🔽They will also teach it in the future.

original: slad kyang 'jud par byed de zhes bya ba ni don dang tshig la rang dga' dang 'dod phyogs la sogs pa byed cing dam pa'i chos ltar bcos pa ston par byed pa'o //
analyzed: slad kyang 'jud par byed de zhes bya ba ni don dang tshig la rang dga' dang 'dod phyogs la sogs pa byed cing dam pa'i chos ltar bcos pa ston par byed pa'o //
translated: This means that they will act as they please with regard to the meaning and the words, and they will teach a counterfeit holy Dharma.

original: de dag ni dang po nyid nas kyang las kyi sgrib pas bsgribs pa yin la zhes bya ba ni da ltar 'di lta bu'i gnas skabs su gyur pa'i rgyu sngon bsags pa gang yin pas so //
analyzed: de dag ni dang po nyid nas kyang las kyi sgrib pas bsgribs pa yin la zhes bya ba ni da ltar 'di lta bu'i gnas skabs su gyur pa'i rgyu sngon bsags pa gang yin pas so //
translated: This refers to the cause that was previously accumulated, which has resulted in their present condition.🔽The beginning of that obscuration of karma is difficult to determine.🔽The beginning of the obscuration of karma is difficult to determine.

translated: The beginning of that obscuration of karma is difficult to determine.🔽The beginning

original: sems can rnams kyi mos pa'i rim pa de lta bu dag kyang snang ngo zhes bya bas ni de yan chad du mos pa'i bye brag mdor bstan pa dang / rgyas par rnam pa bzhi bstan pa de dag gi mjug bsdu ba bstan to //
analyzed: sems can rnams kyi mos pa'i rim pa de lta bu dag kyang snang ngo zhes bya bas ni de yan chad du mos pa'i bye brag mdor bstan pa dang / rgyas par rnam pa bzhi bstan pa de dag gi mjug bsdu ba bstan to //
translated: “The various degrees of interest of sentient beings appear like that” indicates the summary of the above brief and extensive presentations of the four types of interest.

original: de ni mos pa'i bye brag rgyas par bshad pa bzhi pa'o ;
analyzed: de ni mos pa'i bye brag rgyas par bshad pa bzhi pa'o ;
translated: This is the fourth part: the detailed explanation of the types of interest.

original: de nas bcom ldan 'das kyis de'i tshe tshigs su bcad pa 'di dag bka' stsal to zhes bya ba la sogs pa tshigs su bcad pa lngas ni bcom ldan 'das kyis de yan chad du chos rnams kyi ngo bo nyid med pa'i mtshan nyid ji skad bstan pa
analyzed: de nas bcom ldan 'das kyis de'i tshe tshigs su bcad pa 'di dag bka' stsal to zhes bya ba la sogs pa tshigs su bcad pa lngas ni bcom ldan 'das kyis de yan chad du chos rnams kyi ngo bo nyid med pa'i mtshan nyid ji skad bstan pa
translated: The five verses beginning with “Then the Bhagavān spoke these verses” indicate the summary of the topics of the absence of nature of phenomena that the Bhagavān taught above.

original: de dag gi dngos po bsdu ba bstan te /
analyzed: de dag gi dngos po bsdu ba bstan te /
translated: It teaches the summary of their entities.

original: de la tshigs su bcad pa dang po dang gnyis pas ni don la log par rtogs pa rnam pa bzhis chud za bar 'gyur ba'i gnyen por ngo bo nyid med pa nyid kyi ldem por dgongs pa sngar bsdu ba'i dngos po bsdu ba bstan to //
analyzed: de la tshigs su bcad pa dang po dang gnyis pas ni don la log par rtogs pa rnam pa bzhis chud za bar 'gyur ba'i gnyen por ngo bo nyid med pa nyid kyi ldem por dgongs pa sngar bsdu ba'i dngos po bsdu ba bstan to //
translated: In the first and second verses, the author has explained the intended implication of realitylessness as the antidote to the four kinds of misunderstanding of the meaning of the scriptures, and has also explained the summary of the subject matter of the treatise.

original: tshigs su bcad pa gsum pas ni de la spyod pa'i gang zag gi bsgrub pa'i bye brag rgyas par bshad pa gsum sngar bstan pa'i dang po bstan pa'i gzhi dang ldan pa'i skabs su rnam par dag pa'i lam gcig dang / rnam par dag pa gcig dang /

translated: In the third verse, he has explained the three kinds of distinctions in the practice of the person who is engaged in that, and has also explained the summary of the subject matter of the treatise, which was presented in the first chapter, the chapter on the basis of the teaching, in the statements: “There is one path of purification, one purification of purification,
