analyzed: theg pa gcig pa dang / sems can gyi dbang po'i rim pa la rigs sna tshogs dag kyang med pa ni ma yin no zhes bshad pa'i dngos po bsdu ba bstan to //
translated: one vehicle, and there is not the absence of the variety of lineages of sentient beings.”

original: tshigs su bcad pa bzhi pa'i rtsa ba dang po gnyis kyis ni rigs kyi gzhi dang ldan pa'i skabs su gang zag nyan thos kyi rigs can zhi ba bgrod pa gcig pu pa zhes bshad pa de lta bu'i sems can mang po'i dngos po bsdu ba bstan to🔽// rtsa ba 'og ma gnyis kyis ni rkyen gyi gzhi dang ldan pa'i skabs su nyan thos byang chub tu yongs su 'gyur ba bshad pa la sogs pa bla na med pa'i byang chub tu lam sgrub pa de lta bu'i sems can shin tu dkon pa'i dngos po bsdu
analyzed: tshigs su bcad pa bzhi pa'i rtsa ba dang po gnyis kyis ni rigs kyi gzhi dang ldan pa'i skabs su gang zag nyan thos kyi rigs can zhi ba bgrod pa gcig pu pa zhes bshad pa de lta bu'i sems can mang po'i dngos po bsdu ba bstan to // rtsa ba 'og ma gnyis kyis ni rkyen gyi gzhi dang ldan pa'i skabs su nyan thos byang chub tu yongs su 'gyur ba bshad pa la sogs pa bla na med pa'i byang chub tu lam sgrub pa de lta bu'i sems can shin tu dkon pa'i dngos po bsdu
translated: The first two lines of the fourth verse show the collection of things that are the basis of the lineage, which is explained in the context of the person who has the sravaka lineage, the one who goes to peace in a single vehicle.

original: ba bstan to //
analyzed: ba bstan to //
translated: The two lower lines show the collection of things that are the basis of the condition, which is explained in the context of the person who has the bodhisattva lineage, the one who goes to peace in a single vehicle.

original: tshigs su bcad pa tha mas ni bcom ldan 'das kyis ngo bo nyid med pa nyid rnam pa gsum gdags @129b pa mdzad pa de la spyod pa'i gang zag gi bsgrub pa'i bye brag dang / mos pa'i bye brag tha dad du zin kyang sgo de nas zhugs te rnam par grol ba'i 'bras bu thob pa rnams kyi mya ngan las 'das pa'i dbyings la bye brag med pa dang /
analyzed: tshigs su bcad pa tha mas ni bcom ldan 'das kyis ngo bo nyid med pa nyid rnam pa gsum gdags @129b pa mdzad pa de la spyod pa'i gang zag gi bsgrub pa'i bye brag dang / mos pa'i bye brag tha dad du zin kyang sgo de nas zhugs te rnam par grol ba'i 'bras bu thob pa rnams kyi mya ngan las 'das pa'i dbyings la bye brag med pa dang /
translated: The last verse shows that although the persons who practice the three kinds of realitylessness have different kinds of proof and different kinds of belief, when they enter by that door and attain the fruit of liberation, there is no difference in their nirvana.

original: de'i tshe brgya cher bstan pa yin no //
analyzed: de'i tshe brgya cher bstan pa yin no //
translated: This is the teaching of the great exposition.

original: de'i 'og tu mos pa'i bye brag rgyas par bshad pa lnga pa'i tshig gi don la sogs pa bshad par bya ste /
analyzed: de'i 'og tu mos pa'i bye brag rgyas par bshad pa lnga pa'i tshig gi don la sogs pa bshad par bya ste /
translated: After that, the five verses of the extensive explanation of the differences of belief should be explained.

original: thams cad phun sum tshogs shing mgo glengs pas go ba zhes bya ba ni 'phags pa don dam yang dag 'phags nyid 'dir rigs dang / mos pa dang / shes rab thams cad phun sum tshogs shing mgo glengs pas go ba'i tshad mar byas pa yin te /
analyzed: thams cad phun sum tshogs shing mgo glengs pas go ba zhes bya ba ni 'phags pa don dam yang dag 'phags nyid 'dir rigs dang / mos pa dang / shes rab thams cad phun sum tshogs shing mgo glengs pas go ba'i tshad mar byas pa yin te /
translated: The phrase “all perfections and introductions are understood” means that the noble Paramārthasamudgata himself, having all perfections and introductions, is taken as the authority.

original: de dang 'dra bar byang chub sems dpa'i gnas pa mchog la yang dag par zhugs pa thams cad phun sum tshogs shing mgo glengs pas go ba gzhan dag kyang gzung bar bya'o //
analyzed: de dang 'dra bar byang chub sems dpa'i gnas pa mchog la yang dag par zhugs pa thams cad phun sum tshogs shing mgo glengs pas go ba gzhan dag kyang gzung bar bya'o //
translated: Likewise, one should understand that all the bodhisattvas who have entered the highest level are perfect and understand through being told the heading.

original: de'i phyir de bstan pa'i dbang du mdzad nas /
analyzed: de'i phyir de bstan pa'i dbang du mdzad nas /
translated: Therefore, in order to teach that,

original: de nas de'i tshe bcom ldan 'das la byang chub sems dpa' don dam yang dag 'phags kyis 'di skad ces gsol to zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs so //
analyzed: de nas de'i tshe bcom ldan 'das la byang chub sems dpa' don dam yang dag 'phags kyis 'di skad ces gsol to zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs so //
translated: then at that time the bodhisattva Paramārthasamudgata made a request to the Bhagavat, saying, and so on.

original: skabs 'dir 'phags pa don dam yang dag 'phags nyid tshad mar byas pa yin pas de'i rigs dang / mos pa dang shes rab phun sum tshogs pa ni yod par mngon par zhar la glengs par zad kyi dmigs kyis bstan pa med do //
analyzed: skabs 'dir 'phags pa don dam yang dag 'phags nyid tshad mar byas pa yin pas de'i rigs dang / mos pa dang shes rab phun sum tshogs pa ni yod par mngon par zhar la glengs par zad kyi dmigs kyis bstan pa med do //
translated: Here, since the noble Paramārthasamudgata himself is taken as an authority, his lineage and his perfect faith and wisdom are mentioned in passing, but they are not specifically taught.

original: de ji ltar mgo glengs pas go ba yin zhe na /
analyzed: de ji ltar mgo glengs pas go ba yin zhe na /
translated: How is it that they understand through being told the heading?

original: de'i phyir bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa'i don bdag gis 'di ltar 'tshal te zhes bya ba gsungs te /
analyzed: de'i phyir bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa'i don bdag gis 'di ltar 'tshal te zhes bya ba gsungs te /
translated: Therefore, I understand the meaning of what the Lord has said in this way.

original: bcom ldan 'das kyis chos rnams kyi ngo bo nyid med pa'i mtshan nyid skabs de yan chad du mgo glengs te bka' stsal pa'i rjes la /🔽'dir 'phags pa don dam yang dag 'phags nyid kyis de bzhin du go zhing rgya cher ston pa nyid mgo glengs pas go ba yin par sbyar ro //
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyis chos rnams kyi ngo bo nyid med pa'i mtshan nyid skabs de yan chad du mgo glengs te bka' stsal pa'i rjes la / 'dir 'phags pa don dam yang dag 'phags nyid kyis de bzhin du go zhing rgya cher ston pa nyid mgo glengs pas go ba yin par sbyar ro //
translated: The Lord has spoken up to this point in the chapter on the characteristic of the realitylessness of things,🔽and here the noble Sagaramati himself understands it in the same way and restates it extensively.🔽The word “thus” is to be supplied in the sense of “I understand it in the same way as he has restated it.”

original: gyur pa zhes bya ba yang de lta bur phun sum tshogs shing mgo glengs pas go ba las byung ba'i mos pa'i bye brag ces bya bar sbyar ro //
analyzed: gyur pa zhes bya ba yang de lta bur phun sum tshogs shing mgo glengs pas go ba las byung ba'i mos pa'i bye brag ces bya bar sbyar ro //
translated: “Having become” is to be supplied in the sense of “having arisen from the particular faith that comes from such perfect understanding.”

original: mos pa'i bye brag ces bya ba'i sgra skabs 'dir ni ngo bo nyid gsum ngo bo nyid kyis tha dad pa'i mthong ba'i rtogs pa bsgom pa'i rnam pa yongs su shes pa dang / de'i 'bras bu bya ba med pa nyid yin par sbyar ro //
analyzed: mos pa'i bye brag ces bya ba'i sgra skabs 'dir ni ngo bo nyid gsum ngo bo nyid kyis tha dad pa'i mthong ba'i rtogs pa bsgom pa'i rnam pa yongs su shes pa dang / de'i 'bras bu bya ba med pa nyid yin par sbyar ro //
translated: The term “specific aspiration” in this context refers to the understanding of the three realities as essentially different, and the understanding of the aspects of meditation on that realization, and the result of that, which is the absence of activity.

original: mos pa'i bye brag de dag kyang gang zhe na /🔽gzhung @130a * //
analyzed: mos pa'i bye brag de dag kyang gang zhe na / gzhung @130a * //
translated: What are those specific aspirations?

original: 'og ma rnams kyis ji skad ston pa dag yin par rig par bya'o //
analyzed: 'og ma rnams kyis ji skad ston pa dag yin par rig par bya'o //
translated: They should be understood as taught in the following passages.

original: de la rnam par rtog pa'i spyod yul kun brtags pa'i mtshan nyid kyi gnas 'du byed kyi mtshan ma la zhes bya ba ni tshig gi gzhi gcig tu bsdus te /
analyzed: de la rnam par rtog pa'i spyod yul kun brtags pa'i mtshan nyid kyi gnas 'du byed kyi mtshan ma la zhes bya ba ni tshig gi gzhi gcig tu bsdus te /
translated: The phrase “in the objective appearances of compositional activity, the imagined reality that is the domain of conceptual thought” is a single compound.

original: gzhan gyi dbang gi mtshan nyid la zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: gzhan gyi dbang gi mtshan nyid la zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: It means “in the reality of the other-dependent.”

original: de la rnam par rtog pa zhes bya ba ni yang dag pa ma yin pa kun rtog pa ste /
analyzed: de la rnam par rtog pa zhes bya ba ni yang dag pa ma yin pa kun rtog pa ste /
translated: “ Conceptual thought” here refers to the imagination of what is unreal,

original: khams gsum pa'i sems dang sems las byung ba thams cad do //
analyzed: khams gsum pa'i sems dang sems las byung ba thams cad do //
translated: which is all the minds and mental factors of the three realms.

original: de'i spyod yul zhes bya ba ni kun brtags pa'i mtshan nyid kyi gnas 'du byed kyi mtshan ma nyid yin no //
analyzed: de'i spyod yul zhes bya ba ni kun brtags pa'i mtshan nyid kyi gnas 'du byed kyi mtshan ma nyid yin no //
translated: The “domain” of that means the very mark of the formative forces, which is the basis of the imagined nature.

original: kun brtags pa'i mtshan nyid ces bya ba ni ji tsam du rjes su tha snyad gdags pa'i phyir ngo bo nyid dam bye brag tu ming dang brdar btags pa ste /
analyzed: kun brtags pa'i mtshan nyid ces bya ba ni ji tsam du rjes su tha snyad gdags pa'i phyir ngo bo nyid dam bye brag tu ming dang brdar btags pa ste /
translated: The “imagined nature” is the ascription of an essential nature or a particularity by means of a name or a conventional symbol to the extent that it is a conventional symbol.

original: de yang gnas med pa la gdags su mi rung bas de'i gnas kyang 'du byed kyi mtshan nyid yin no //
analyzed: de yang gnas med pa la gdags su mi rung bas de'i gnas kyang 'du byed kyi mtshan nyid yin no //
translated: Moreover, since it is not possible to ascribe anything to a non-existent basis, the basis of that is also the mark of the formative forces.

original: de ltar na rnam par rtog pa'i spyod yul yang 'du byed kyi mtshan nyid la kun brtags pa'i mtshan nyid kyi gnas kyang 'du byed kyi mtshan ma yin no //
analyzed: de ltar na rnam par rtog pa'i spyod yul yang 'du byed kyi mtshan nyid la kun brtags pa'i mtshan nyid kyi gnas kyang 'du byed kyi mtshan ma yin no //
translated: Thus, the domain of conceptual differentiation is also the mark of the formative forces.

original: 'du byed kyi mtshan ma zhes bya ba ni 'du byed kyi rnam pa ste /
analyzed: 'du byed kyi mtshan ma zhes bya ba ni 'du byed kyi rnam pa ste /
translated: The “mark of the formative forces” is the aspect of the formative forces.

original: rnam par rtog pa nyid 'du byed kyi rnam par snang ba la /
analyzed: rnam par rtog pa nyid 'du byed kyi rnam par snang ba la /
translated: The appearance of the conceptual differentiation itself as the formative forces is the mark of the formative forces.

original: rnam par rtog pa'i spyod yul kun brtags pa'i mtshan nyid kyi gnas 'du byed kyi mtshan ma zhes bya'i /
analyzed: rnam par rtog pa'i spyod yul kun brtags pa'i mtshan nyid kyi gnas 'du byed kyi mtshan ma zhes bya'i /
translated: The imagined identity is the objective referent of the conceptualization that is the imagined identity.

original: rnam par rtog pa las gzhan pa phyi rol na de'i spyod yul du gyur pa'i dngos po gzhan ni med do //
analyzed: rnam par rtog pa las gzhan pa phyi rol na de'i spyod yul du gyur pa'i dngos po gzhan ni med do //
translated: There is no other entity that is the objective referent of that conceptualization, apart from the conceptualization itself.🔽The dependent identity is the reality of that entity, which arises in dependence on other conditions.🔽The reality of that dependent identity is the perfected identity.🔽The perfected identity is the reality of that dependent identity.🔽The reality of that dependent identity is the perfected identity.

original: de nyid dngos po'i ngo bo nyid rkyen gzhan gyi dbang gis rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba gzhan gyi dbang gi mtshan nyid yin par rig par bya'o //🔽gzhan gyi dbang gi mtshan nyid de la gzugs kyi phung po zhes bya ba la sogs par ngo bo nyid kyi mtshan nyid dam /
analyzed: de nyid dngos po'i ngo bo nyid rkyen gzhan gyi dbang gis rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba gzhan gyi dbang gi mtshan nyid yin par rig par bya'o // gzhan gyi dbang gi mtshan nyid de la gzugs kyi phung po zhes bya ba la sogs par ngo bo nyid kyi mtshan nyid dam /

original: bye brag gi mtshan nyid du ming dang brdar rnam par gzhag pa gang lags pa de ni kun brtags pa'i mtshan nyid lags te zhes bya ba ni gzhan gyi dbang gi mtshan nyid de la ji tsam du rjes su tha snyad gdags pa'i phyir ngo bo nyid kyi
analyzed: bye brag gi mtshan nyid du ming dang brdar rnam par gzhag pa gang lags pa de ni kun brtags pa'i mtshan nyid lags te zhes bya ba ni gzhan gyi dbang gi mtshan nyid de la ji tsam du rjes su tha snyad gdags pa'i phyir ngo bo nyid kyi
translated: The reality of that dependent identity is the perfected identity.🔽The reality of that dependent identity

original: mtshan nyid du ming dang brdar btags ba dang / bye brag gi mtshan nyid du ming dang brdar btags pa gang yin pa de ni dngos po'i ngo bo nyid ma yin pa sgro btags pa yin pas kun brtags pa'i mtshan nyid yin par bstan to //🔽de la brten nas bcom ldan 'das chos rnams kyi mtshan nyid ngo bo nyid ma mchis pa nyid 'dogs par mdzad @130b lags so zhes bya ba ni kun brtags pa'i mtshan nyid de nyid mtshan nyid ngo bo nyid med pa nyid kyis ngo bo nyid med pa yin
analyzed: mtshan nyid du ming dang brdar btags ba dang / bye brag gi mtshan nyid du ming dang brdar btags pa gang yin pa de ni dngos po'i ngo bo nyid ma yin pa sgro btags pa yin pas kun brtags pa'i mtshan nyid yin par bstan to // de la brten nas bcom ldan 'das chos rnams kyi mtshan nyid ngo bo nyid ma mchis pa nyid 'dogs par mdzad @130b lags so zhes bya ba ni kun brtags pa'i mtshan nyid de nyid mtshan nyid ngo bo nyid med pa nyid kyis ngo bo nyid med pa yin
translated: The imaginary nature is taught to be the nature of the imagined, which is the superimposition of the nature of an entity that does not exist as an entity, namely, the designation by name and symbol of the universal characteristic and the designation by name and symbol of the particular characteristic.🔽The Bhagavat designates the naturelessness of all things as naturelessness due to the lack of an intrinsic identity.

original: pas gang dag gis de ltar kun brtags pa'i ngo bo nyid mtshan nyid ngo bo nyid med pa nyid kyis ngo bo nyid med par tha dad par mthong ba de dag la ni bcom ldan 'das mtshan nyid ngo bo nyid med pa nyid 'dogs par mi mdzad kyi
analyzed: pas gang dag gis de ltar kun brtags pa'i ngo bo nyid mtshan nyid ngo bo nyid med pa nyid kyis ngo bo nyid med par tha dad par mthong ba de dag la ni bcom ldan 'das mtshan nyid ngo bo nyid med pa nyid 'dogs par mi mdzad kyi
translated: The Bhagavat does not designate the naturelessness due to the lack of an intrinsic identity to those who perceive the imaginary nature, which is natureless due to the lack of an intrinsic identity, as a nature that is different from that.

original: / gang dag gis de ltar mi mthong ba de dag la kun brtags pa'i mtshan nyid de la brten nas /
analyzed: / gang dag gis de ltar mi mthong ba de dag la kun brtags pa'i mtshan nyid de la brten nas /
translated: Those who do not see in that way, for them, the imagined reality is imputed in dependence on the relative reality.

original: bcom ldan 'das chos rnams kyi mtshan nyid ngo bo nyid med pa nyid 'dogs par mdzad do zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das chos rnams kyi mtshan nyid ngo bo nyid med pa nyid 'dogs par mdzad do zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: The Bhagavat has said that the reality of phenomena is the realitylessness of the imagined.🔽The imagined reality, which is the object of conceptualization, the sign of compounded things, is the relative reality.

original: rnam par rtog pa'i spyod yul kun brtags pa'i mtshan nyid kyi gnas 'du byed kyi mtshan ma gang lags pa de ni gzhan gyi dbang gi mtshan nyid lags te zhes bya ba'i tha tshig gi don ni gang du bstan zin to /
analyzed: rnam par rtog pa'i spyod yul kun brtags pa'i mtshan nyid kyi gnas 'du byed kyi mtshan ma gang lags pa de ni gzhan gyi dbang gi mtshan nyid lags te zhes bya ba'i tha tshig gi don ni gang du bstan zin to /
translated: The meaning of the words has been explained above.

original: // / de la brten nas bcom ldan 'das chos rnams kyi skye ba ngo bo nyid ma mchis pa nyid dang / don dam pa ngo bo nyid ma mchis pa nyid de las gcig kyang 'dogs par mdzad lags so zhes bya ba yang gzhan gyi dbang gi mtshan nyid de nyid skye ba ngo bo nyid med pa nyid dang /
analyzed: // / de la brten nas bcom ldan 'das chos rnams kyi skye ba ngo bo nyid ma mchis pa nyid dang / don dam pa ngo bo nyid ma mchis pa nyid de las gcig kyang 'dogs par mdzad lags so zhes bya ba yang gzhan gyi dbang gi mtshan nyid de nyid skye ba ngo bo nyid med pa nyid dang /
translated: The Bhagavat has said that the reality of phenomena is the realitylessness of the imagined and the ultimate realitylessness.

original: don dam pa ngo bo nyid med pa nyid kyis ngo bo nyid med pa yin pas gang dag gis de ltar gzhan gyi dbang gi ngo bo nyid skye ba ngo bo nyid med pa nyid dang / don dam pa ngo bo nyid med pa nyid kyis ngo bo nyid med par tha dad par mthong ba de dag la ni bcom ldan 'das skye ba ngo bo nyid med pa nyid dang /
analyzed: don dam pa ngo bo nyid med pa nyid kyis ngo bo nyid med pa yin pas gang dag gis de ltar gzhan gyi dbang gi ngo bo nyid skye ba ngo bo nyid med pa nyid dang / don dam pa ngo bo nyid med pa nyid kyis ngo bo nyid med par tha dad par mthong ba de dag la ni bcom ldan 'das skye ba ngo bo nyid med pa nyid dang /
translated: Since the other-dependent nature is not essentially arisen, and the consummate nature is essentially devoid of the ultimate, they are essentially devoid of nature due to the essencelessness of the ultimate.🔽Therefore, the Bhagavān does not impute the essencelessness of production and the essencelessness of the ultimate to those who see the essencelessness of the other-dependent nature as essentially arisen and the essencelessness of the ultimate as essentially devoid of nature as being different.

original: don dam pa ngo bo nyid med pa nyid 'dogs par mi mdzad kyi gang dag gis de ltar ma mthong ba de dag la gzhan gyi dbang gi mtshan nyid de la brten nas bcom ldan 'das chos rnams kyi skye ba ngo bo nyid med pa nyid dang /
analyzed: don dam pa ngo bo nyid med pa nyid 'dogs par mi mdzad kyi gang dag gis de ltar ma mthong ba de dag la gzhan gyi dbang gi mtshan nyid de la brten nas bcom ldan 'das chos rnams kyi skye ba ngo bo nyid med pa nyid dang /
translated: However, the Bhagavān imputes the essencelessness of production and the essencelessness of the ultimate to those who do not see them in that way, based on the characteristic of the other-dependent nature.🔽This is the meaning.

original: don dam pa ngo bo nyid med pa nyid 'dogs par mdzad do zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //🔽don dam pa ngo bo nyid ma mchis pa nyid de las gcig kyang zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: don dam pa ngo bo nyid med pa nyid 'dogs par mdzad do zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //🔽don dam pa ngo bo nyid ma mchis pa nyid de las gcig kyang zhes bya ba ni /
translated: “The one that is the essencelessness of the ultimate” means

original: gzhan gyi mtshan nyid rnam par dag pa'i dmigs pa ma yin pa'i don dam pa'i ngo bo nyid med pa zhes sngar bstan pa de gzung bar bya'o //🔽rnam par rtog pa'i spyod yul kun brtags pa'i mtshan nyid kyi gnas 'du byed kyi mtshan ma de nyid kun brtags pa'i mtshan nyid der yongs su ma grub cing zhes bya ba ni gzhan gyi dbang gi mtshan nyid de nyid kun brtags pa'i mtshan nyid kyi ming dang
analyzed: gzhan gyi mtshan nyid rnam par dag pa'i dmigs pa ma yin pa'i don dam pa'i ngo bo nyid med pa zhes sngar bstan pa de gzung bar bya'o // rnam par rtog pa'i spyod yul kun brtags pa'i mtshan nyid kyi gnas 'du byed kyi mtshan ma de nyid kun brtags pa'i mtshan nyid der yongs su ma grub cing zhes bya ba ni gzhan gyi dbang gi mtshan nyid de nyid kun brtags pa'i mtshan nyid kyi ming dang
translated: The ultimate reality which is not the pure object of the other-dependent characteristic should be understood as the non-existence of the imagined reality, as previously explained.🔽That very representation of the formative forces, the basis of the imagined characteristic, which is the domain of conceptual differentiation, is not established as that imagined characteristic.

original: brdar sgro btags @131a * //🔽pa der yongs su ma grub pa'o //
analyzed: brdar sgro btags @131a * // pa der yongs su ma grub pa'o //
translated: The other-dependent characteristic is not established as that name and conventional expression which is verbally constructed as the imagined characteristic.

original: ngo bo nyid med de kho nas ngo bo nyid ma mchis pa nyid ces bya ba ni kun brtags pa'i ngo bo nyid de kho nas so //
analyzed: ngo bo nyid med de kho nas ngo bo nyid ma mchis pa nyid ces bya ba ni kun brtags pa'i ngo bo nyid de kho nas so //
translated: The non-existence of an essential nature in that very is the non-existence of an essential nature in the imagined.

original: chos bdag ma mchis pa de bzhin nyid ces bya ba ni de ltar kun brtags pa'i mtshan nyid der ma grub cing ngo bo nyid de kho nas ngo bo nyid med pa gzhan gyi dbang gi ngo bo nyid de'i de bzhin nyid de /
analyzed: chos bdag ma mchis pa de bzhin nyid ces bya ba ni de ltar kun brtags pa'i mtshan nyid der ma grub cing ngo bo nyid de kho nas ngo bo nyid med pa gzhan gyi dbang gi ngo bo nyid de'i de bzhin nyid de /
translated: The suchness of the relative reality, which is the absence of the self in phenomena, is the ultimate reality.

original: chos kyi dbyings rnam par dag pa'o //
analyzed: chos kyi dbyings rnam par dag pa'o //
translated: The suchness of the imagined reality, which is the absence of the self in phenomena, is the realm of the Dharma, which is pure.🔽What is the object of purification?

original: rnam par dag pa'i dmigs pa gang lags zhes bya ba la rnam par dag pa zhes bya ba ni /🔽gnas gyur pas rab tu phye ba yang dag pa'i shes pa 'jig rten las 'das pa yang dag pa'o //
analyzed: rnam par dag pa'i dmigs pa gang lags zhes bya ba la rnam par dag pa zhes bya ba ni / gnas gyur pas rab tu phye ba yang dag pa'i shes pa 'jig rten las 'das pa yang dag pa'o //
translated: The object of purification is the suchness of the absence of the self in phenomena, which has been previously explained.🔽The suchness of the relative reality, which is the absence of the self in phenomena, is the ultimate reality.🔽The suchness of the imagined reality, which is the absence of the self in phenomena, is the realm of the Dharma, which is pure.🔽What is the object of purification?🔽The object of purification is the suchness of the absence of the self in phenomena, which has been previously explained.🔽The suchness of the relative reality, which is the absence of the self in phenomena, is the ultimate reality.

original: de'i dmigs pa ni chos bdag med pa de bzhin nyid ces gong du bstan pa nyid yin no //
analyzed: de'i dmigs pa ni chos bdag med pa de bzhin nyid ces gong du bstan pa nyid yin no //
translated: The suchness of the imagined reality, which is the absence of the self in phenomena, is the realm of the Dharma, which is pure.

original: de ni yongs su grub pa'i mtshan nyid lags te zhes bya ba ni de ltar chos bdag med pas rab tu phye ba de bzhin nyid de dang / gnas gyur pas rab tu phye ba yang dag pa'i shes pa 'jig rten las 'das pa rnam par dag pa de ni de bzhin nyid yongs su grub pa dang /
analyzed: de ni yongs su grub pa'i mtshan nyid lags te zhes bya ba ni de ltar chos bdag med pas rab tu phye ba de bzhin nyid de dang / gnas gyur pas rab tu phye ba yang dag pa'i shes pa 'jig rten las 'das pa rnam par dag pa de ni de bzhin nyid yongs su grub pa dang /
translated: That is the characteristic of the consummate,🔽thusness that is distinguished by the selflessness of phenomena and also the authentic pristine consciousness that is distinguished by the transformation of the basis, the supramundane, pure pristine consciousness, is the consummate thusness and the consummate authentic pristine consciousness.

original: yang dag pa'i shes pa yongs su grub pa yin pas yongs su grub pa'i mtshan nyid ces bya ste /
analyzed: yang dag pa'i shes pa yongs su grub pa yin pas yongs su grub pa'i mtshan nyid ces bya ste /
translated: Therefore, it is called the characteristic of the consummate.

original: de yang yul dang yul can gyi dngos por gnyis su gnas pa ma yin gyi /
analyzed: de yang yul dang yul can gyi dngos por gnyis su gnas pa ma yin gyi /
translated: Moreover, it does not exist as a duality of the entity of object and subject.

original: yang dag pa'i shes pa'i ngo bo nyid de bzhin nyid yin pas 'phags pa so sor rig pa'i ngo bo nyid yin par blta bar bya'o //
analyzed: yang dag pa'i shes pa'i ngo bo nyid de bzhin nyid yin pas 'phags pa so sor rig pa'i ngo bo nyid yin par blta bar bya'o //
translated: Since the essence of authentic pristine consciousness is thusness, it should be viewed as the essence of the realization of the noble ones.

original: de la brten nas bcom ldan 'das chos rnams kyi don dam pa ngo bo nyid ma mchis pa de nyid de las gcig 'dogs par mdzad lags so zhes bya ba ni yongs su grub pa'i mtshan nyid de nyid don dam pa ngo bo nyid med pa nyid kyis
analyzed: de la brten nas bcom ldan 'das chos rnams kyi don dam pa ngo bo nyid ma mchis pa de nyid de las gcig 'dogs par mdzad lags so zhes bya ba ni yongs su grub pa'i mtshan nyid de nyid don dam pa ngo bo nyid med pa nyid kyis
translated: The Bhagavān designates the very ultimate reality of phenomena, which is the very naturelessness of all phenomena, as naturelessness.🔽 This is the characteristic of the consummate.

original: ngo bo nyid med pa yin pas gang dag gi sa de ltar yongs su grub pa'i ngo bo nyid don dam pa ngo bo nyid med pa nyid kyis ngo bo nyid med pa tha dad par mthong ba de dag la ni bcom ldan 'das don dam pa ngo
analyzed: ngo bo nyid med pa yin pas gang dag gi sa de ltar yongs su grub pa'i ngo bo nyid don dam pa ngo bo nyid med pa nyid kyis ngo bo nyid med pa tha dad par mthong ba de dag la ni bcom ldan 'das don dam pa ngo
translated: Since it is natureless by virtue of being the ultimate naturelessness, the Bhagavān does not designate the ultimate naturelessness as naturelessness for those who see the consummate nature as a different nature that is natureless by virtue of being the ultimate naturelessness.

original: bo nyid med pa nyid 'dogs par mi mdzad kyi gang dag gis de dag ma mthong ba de dag las yongs su grub pa'i mtshan nyid de la brten nas /
analyzed: bo nyid med pa nyid 'dogs par mi mdzad kyi gang dag gis de dag ma mthong ba de dag las yongs su grub pa'i mtshan nyid de la brten nas /
translated: But for those who do not see it in that way, the Bhagavān designates the ultimate naturelessness as naturelessness in dependence upon the consummate characteristic.

original: bcom ldan 'das chos rnams kyi don dam pa ngo bo nyid med pa nyid 'dogs par mdzad do zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das chos rnams kyi don dam pa ngo bo nyid med pa nyid 'dogs par mdzad do zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: This is what it means to say, The Bhagavān designates the ultimate naturelessness of phenomena as 'naturelessness.'

original: don dam pa ngo bo nyid mchis pa de nyid de las gcig ces bya bar ni yongs su grub pa'i mtshan nyid chos bdag med pas rab tu phye ba don dam pa ngo bo nyid @131b med pa nyid ces sngar bstan pa de gzung bar bya'o //
analyzed: don dam pa ngo bo nyid mchis pa de nyid de las gcig ces bya bar ni yongs su grub pa'i mtshan nyid chos bdag med pas rab tu phye ba don dam pa ngo bo nyid @131b med pa nyid ces sngar bstan pa de gzung bar bya'o //
translated: The ultimate reality that does exist by its intrinsic reality is to be understood as the ultimate reality that does not exist by its intrinsic reality, which was previously taught as the characteristic of the perfected, the ultimate reality that is distinguished by the selflessness of things.

original: 'phags pa don dam yang dag 'phags kyis bca' sga dang / ri mo bri ba'i gzhi dang / mar dang / nam mkha'i dpe bstan pa ni dngos po bstan pa tsam du zad kyi go rims de ltar nges pa kho nar dgongs pa ni ma yin pas /🔽'di bla ma'i gnas lta bu dag gis dpe rnam pa de bzhis mtshon pa'i don gyi sgo nas go rims kyi shugs sbyar ba ni dang po mar gyi dpes bstan la de'i 'og tu bca' sga'i dpes bstan /🔽de'i 'og tu ri mo bri ba'i gzhi'i dpes bstan /
analyzed: 'phags pa don dam yang dag 'phags kyis bca' sga dang / ri mo bri ba'i gzhi dang / mar dang / nam mkha'i dpe bstan pa ni dngos po bstan pa tsam du zad kyi go rims de ltar nges pa kho nar dgongs pa ni ma yin pas / 'di bla ma'i gnas lta bu dag gis dpe rnam pa de bzhis mtshon pa'i don gyi sgo nas go rims kyi shugs sbyar ba ni dang po mar gyi dpes bstan la de'i 'og tu bca' sga'i dpes bstan / de'i 'og tu ri mo bri ba'i gzhi'i dpes bstan /
translated: The noble Sāgaramati Sūtra teaches the example of the sky, the example of the canvas, the example of the butter lamp, and the example of the seed.🔽The example of the sky is taught first, then the example of the canvas, then the example of the butter lamp, and then the example of the seed.🔽The example of the sky is taught first, then the example of the canvas, then the example of the butter lamp, and then the example of the seed.

original: de'i 'og tu nam mkha'i dpes bstan to //
analyzed: de'i 'og tu nam mkha'i dpes bstan to //
translated: The example of the butter lamp is taught first, then the example of the canvas, then the example of the seed, and then the example of the sky.

original: go rims de ltar bkod ba'i dpe bzhi po dag gis ni tshul khrims dang / ting nge 'dzin gyi gtam dang / shes rab kyi gtam dang / kun rdzob kyi gtam dang / don dam pa'i gtam bstan te /
analyzed: go rims de ltar bkod ba'i dpe bzhi po dag gis ni tshul khrims dang / ting nge 'dzin gyi gtam dang / shes rab kyi gtam dang / kun rdzob kyi gtam dang / don dam pa'i gtam bstan te /
translated: The four examples arranged in this order teach the discourses on morality, meditative stabilization, wisdom, the conventional, and the ultimate.

original: go rims bzhin du sbyar bar shes par bya'o //
analyzed: go rims bzhin du sbyar bar shes par bya'o //
translated: They should be known as applied in order.

original: gtam de bzhi'i go rims ci'i phyir de ltar rnam par gnas par nges she na /
analyzed: gtam de bzhi'i go rims ci'i phyir de ltar rnam par gnas par nges she na /
translated: Why is the order of these four discourses definite?

original: dang por lhag pa'i tshul khrims la gnas na lhag pa'i sems skye bar 'gyur bas de'i phyir dang po tshul khrims dang ting nge 'dzin gyi gtam bstan to //
analyzed: dang por lhag pa'i tshul khrims la gnas na lhag pa'i sems skye bar 'gyur bas de'i phyir dang po tshul khrims dang ting nge 'dzin gyi gtam bstan to //
translated: First, if one abides in superior morality, superior thought will arise. Therefore, first the discourses on morality and meditative stabilization are taught.

original: de'i 'og tu lhag pa'i sems de la brten nas lhag pa'i shes rab skye bar 'gyur bas de'i 'og tu shes rab kyi gtam bstan to //
analyzed: de'i 'og tu lhag pa'i sems de la brten nas lhag pa'i shes rab skye bar 'gyur bas de'i 'og tu shes rab kyi gtam bstan to //
translated: After that, in dependence on that superior thought, superior wisdom will arise. Therefore, after that, the discourse on wisdom is taught.

original: de'i 'og tu lhag pa'i shes rab kyis shes par bya ba'i yul ni rnam pa gnyis te /
analyzed: de'i 'og tu lhag pa'i shes rab kyis shes par bya ba'i yul ni rnam pa gnyis te /
translated: After that, the object to be known by superior wisdom is twofold:

original: 'jig rten pa'i lam dang / 'jig rten las 'das pa'i lam ste /
analyzed: 'jig rten pa'i lam dang / 'jig rten las 'das pa'i lam ste /
translated: The mundane path and the supramundane path.

original: de la 'jig rten pa'i lam ni kun rdzob kyi bden pas bsdus pa yin pas de dang por rtogs par bya dgos pa'i phyir de'i 'og tu kun rdzob kyi gtam bstan to //
analyzed: de la 'jig rten pa'i lam ni kun rdzob kyi bden pas bsdus pa yin pas de dang por rtogs par bya dgos pa'i phyir de'i 'og tu kun rdzob kyi gtam bstan to //
translated: The mundane path is included in the conventional truth, so it must be realized first. Therefore, after that, the discourse on the conventional is taught.

original: 'jig rten las 'das ba'i lam ni don dam pa'i bden pas bsdus pa yin pas kun rdzob kyi bden pa rtogs pa'i 'og tu don dam pa'i bden pa rtogs par bya dgos pa'i phyir de'i 'og tu don dam pa'i gtam bstan to //
analyzed: 'jig rten las 'das ba'i lam ni don dam pa'i bden pas bsdus pa yin pas kun rdzob kyi bden pa rtogs pa'i 'og tu don dam pa'i bden pa rtogs par bya dgos pa'i phyir de'i 'og tu don dam pa'i gtam bstan to //
translated: The supramundane path is included in the ultimate truth, so after realizing the conventional truth, the ultimate truth must be realized. Therefore, after that, the discourse on the ultimate is taught.

original: gtam de bzhi'i 'brel pa ni dpe rnam pa bzhis mtshon ba'i don nyid la de bzhin du snang bas na de'i phyir /
analyzed: gtam de bzhi'i 'brel pa ni dpe rnam pa bzhis mtshon ba'i don nyid la de bzhin du snang bas na de'i phyir /
translated: The connection of those four discourses is as follows: Since the meaning illustrated by the four examples appears just as it is, therefore,

original: 'di lta ste dper bgyi na chab mar ni zhes bya ba la sogs pa'i dpes nges pa'i don bstan pa 'di yang drang ba'i don gyi mdo sde thams cad du brtsal na dga' ba dang mchog tu dga' ba chen por 'gyur lags so zhes bya ba'i bar gyi
analyzed: 'di lta ste dper bgyi na chab mar ni zhes bya ba la sogs pa'i dpes nges pa'i don bstan pa 'di yang drang ba'i don gyi mdo sde thams cad du brtsal na dga' ba dang mchog tu dga' ba chen por 'gyur lags so zhes bya ba'i bar gyi
translated: The section from For example, it is like this up to one should search for this definitive meaning in all the sūtras of provisional meaning

original: don bstan pas ni /🔽nges pa'i don bstan pa 'di drang ba'i don gyi mdo sde @132a * //
analyzed: don bstan pas ni / nges pa'i don bstan pa 'di drang ba'i don gyi mdo sde @132a * //
translated: teaches the meaning.

original: thams cad kyang sbyar na /🔽don la sgra ji bzhin du mngon par zhen par mi 'gyur zhing mthong ba'i lam gyis bsdus pa'i mngon par rtogs pa drug po dag mthong bas dad pa mngon par rtogs pa'i sgo nas tshul khrims mngon par rtogs pa'i dus na 'phags pa dgyes pa'i tshul khrims kyis
analyzed: thams cad kyang sbyar na / don la sgra ji bzhin du mngon par zhen par mi 'gyur zhing mthong ba'i lam gyis bsdus pa'i mngon par rtogs pa drug po dag mthong bas dad pa mngon par rtogs pa'i sgo nas tshul khrims mngon par rtogs pa'i dus na 'phags pa dgyes pa'i tshul khrims kyis
translated: By applying this teaching of the definitive meaning to all the sūtras of provisional meaning,🔽one will not adhere to the words literally.

original: rab tu phye ba'i lhag pa'i tshul khrims dang ldan par 'gyur ba ni dga' ba chen por 'gyur ba yin la /
analyzed: rab tu phye ba'i lhag pa'i tshul khrims dang ldan par 'gyur ba ni dga' ba chen por 'gyur ba yin la /
translated: When the six realizations subsumed by the path of seeing are realized through the realization of faith through seeing, at the time of the realization of ethics, one will possess the superior ethics that is distinguished by the ethics pleasing to the āryas.🔽This is the great joy.

original: lhag pa'i tshul khrims de la brten nas tshul khrims mngon par rtogs pa'i sgo nas bsam pa mngon par rtogs pa'i dus na /
analyzed: lhag pa'i tshul khrims de la brten nas tshul khrims mngon par rtogs pa'i sgo nas bsam pa mngon par rtogs pa'i dus na /
translated: Based on that superior morality, when one realizes the mind through realizing morality,🔽one comes to possess the superior mind that is distinguished by the great joy of the wisdom that arises from intention, which is irreproachable.

original: bsam pa las byung ba'i shes rab chen po'i dga' ba kha na ma tho ba med pas rab tu phye ba'i lhag pa'i sems dang ldan par 'gyur ba ni mchog tu dga' ba chen por 'gyur ba zhes bya ste /
analyzed: bsam pa las byung ba'i shes rab chen po'i dga' ba kha na ma tho ba med pas rab tu phye ba'i lhag pa'i sems dang ldan par 'gyur ba ni mchog tu dga' ba chen por 'gyur ba zhes bya ste /
translated: This is called “great joy.”

original: de'i phyir mar gyi dpes ni tshul khrims dang ting nge 'dzin gyi gtam bstan to //
analyzed: de'i phyir mar gyi dpes ni tshul khrims dang ting nge 'dzin gyi gtam bstan to //
translated: Therefore, the example of butter illustrates the teachings on morality and concentration.

original: de'i 'og tu 'di lta ste dper bgyi na bca' sga ni zhes bgyi ba la sogs pa'i dpes nges pa'i don bstan pa 'di yang drang ba'i don gyi mdo sde thams cad du brtsal bar bgyi ba lags so zhes bya ba'i bar gyi don bstan pas ni lhag
analyzed: de'i 'og tu 'di lta ste dper bgyi na bca' sga ni zhes bgyi ba la sogs pa'i dpes nges pa'i don bstan pa 'di yang drang ba'i don gyi mdo sde thams cad du brtsal bar bgyi ba lags so zhes bya ba'i bar gyi don bstan pas ni lhag
translated: After that, the example of the myrobalan fruit illustrates the teaching on the definitive meaning. This also should be sought in all the sutras of provisional meaning.

original: ba'i sems de la brten nas bsam pa mngon par rtogs pa'i sgo nas mngon par rtogs pa'i shes pa bden pa mthong bar rtogs pa'i dus na rnam bar ma bzhag pa'i bden pa la dmigs pa'i shes rab kyis rab tu phye ba'i lhag pa'i shes rab skye bar
analyzed: ba'i sems de la brten nas bsam pa mngon par rtogs pa'i sgo nas mngon par rtogs pa'i shes pa bden pa mthong bar rtogs pa'i dus na rnam bar ma bzhag pa'i bden pa la dmigs pa'i shes rab kyis rab tu phye ba'i lhag pa'i shes rab skye bar
translated: The wisdom that arises from the wisdom of the view of the truth of the realization of the realization of the mind that is based on that mind is the wisdom that is distinguished by the wisdom that observes the truth that is not established.

original: 'gyur ba ni drang ba'i don gyi mdo sde thams cad du brtsal bar bgyi ba zhes bya ste /
analyzed: 'gyur ba ni drang ba'i don gyi mdo sde thams cad du brtsal bar bgyi ba zhes bya ste /
translated: It is said that one should seek in all the sutras of provisional meaning.

original: de'i phyir bca' sga'i dpes ni shes rab kyi gtam bstan to //
analyzed: de'i phyir bca' sga'i dpes ni shes rab kyi gtam bstan to //
translated: Therefore, the teaching of the discourse on wisdom is taught by the example of the merchant.🔽After that, it is said, For example, the basis for drawing a picture, etc.,

original: de'i 'og tu 'di lta ste dper bgyi na ri mo bri ba'i gzhi ni zhes bya ba la sogs pa'i dpes /
analyzed: de'i 'og tu 'di lta ste dper bgyi na ri mo bri ba'i gzhi ni zhes bya ba la sogs pa'i dpes /
translated: by the example of the basis for drawing a picture, etc.,🔽 the teaching of the definitive meaning is also said to be of one taste with all the sutras of provisional meaning, and it makes those meanings of provisional meaning very clear.

original: nges pa'i don bstan pa 'di yang drang ba'i don gyi mdo sde thams cad la ro gcig pa dang dang ba'i don de dag shin tu gsal bar bgyid pa lags so zhes bya ba'i bar gyi don bstan pas ni lhag pa'i shes rab de la brten nas mngon
analyzed: nges pa'i don bstan pa 'di yang drang ba'i don gyi mdo sde thams cad la ro gcig pa dang dang ba'i don de dag shin tu gsal bar bgyid pa lags so zhes bya ba'i bar gyi don bstan pas ni lhag pa'i shes rab de la brten nas mngon
translated: The meaning of this is that based on that superior wisdom, the wisdom of the view of the truth of the realization of the realization of the mind that is based on that mind is the wisdom that arises from the wisdom of the view of the truth that is not established.

original: par rtogs pa'i shes pa mngon par rtogs pa'i sgo nas mngon par rtogs pa'i mtha' las byung ba'i shes pa la mngon pa mngon par rtogs ba'i dus na /
analyzed: par rtogs pa'i shes pa mngon par rtogs pa'i sgo nas mngon par rtogs pa'i mtha' las byung ba'i shes pa la mngon pa mngon par rtogs ba'i dus na /
translated: The knowledge that arises from the culmination of clear realization, through the door of the clear realization of the knowledge of the truth of suffering and so on, is the knowledge that arises from the culmination of clear realization.

original: rnam bar gzhag pa'i bden pa la dmigs pa'i shes rab kyis rab tu phye ba 'jig rten pa'i lam kun rdzob kyi bden pas bsdus pa thams cad rtogs par 'gyur ba ni drang ba'i don thams cad la ro gcig pa dang / de dag shin tu gsal @132b bar bgyid ba zhes bya ste /
analyzed: rnam bar gzhag pa'i bden pa la dmigs pa'i shes rab kyis rab tu phye ba 'jig rten pa'i lam kun rdzob kyi bden pas bsdus pa thams cad rtogs par 'gyur ba ni drang ba'i don thams cad la ro gcig pa dang / de dag shin tu gsal @132b bar bgyid ba zhes bya ste /
translated: At the time of clear realization, all mundane paths included in conventional truths, which are distinguished by the wisdom that focuses on the truths that are to be set forth, are realized. This is called “the single taste of all interpretable meanings” and “the complete clarity of those.”

original: de'i phyir ri mo bri ba'i dpe bzhis ni kun rdzob kyi gtam bstan to //
analyzed: de'i phyir ri mo bri ba'i dpe bzhis ni kun rdzob kyi gtam bstan to //
translated: Therefore, the four examples of painting illustrate the teachings of conventional truth.

original: de'i 'og tu 'di lta ste dper bgyi na nam mkha' ni zhes bya ba la sogs pa'i dpes nges pa'i don bstan pa 'di yang drang ba'i don gyi mdo sde thams cad la ro gcig pa dang nyan thos kyi theg pa dang rang sangs rgyas kyi theg pa
analyzed: de'i 'og tu 'di lta ste dper bgyi na nam mkha' ni zhes bya ba la sogs pa'i dpes nges pa'i don bstan pa 'di yang drang ba'i don gyi mdo sde thams cad la ro gcig pa dang nyan thos kyi theg pa dang rang sangs rgyas kyi theg pa
translated: After that, the example that begins “For example, space” illustrates the definitive meaning. This also is the single taste of all sūtras of interpretable meaning and the complete clarity of the Hearer Vehicle and the Solitary Realizer Vehicle

original: dang / theg pa chen por brtsal ba thams cad la sgrib pa mi 'gyur ba lags so zhes bya ba'i bar gyi don bstan pas ni lhag pa'i shes rab de nyid la brten nas mngon par rtogs pa'i mtha' las byung ba'i shes pa bden pa mngon par rtogs pa'i sgo
analyzed: dang / theg pa chen por brtsal ba thams cad la sgrib pa mi 'gyur ba lags so zhes bya ba'i bar gyi don bstan pas ni lhag pa'i shes rab de nyid la brten nas mngon par rtogs pa'i mtha' las byung ba'i shes pa bden pa mngon par rtogs pa'i sgo
translated: The meaning of the above passage is as follows.🔽🔽The passage from “The bodhisattvas’ wisdom is the wisdom of the buddhas” up to “all the obscurations of those who strive for the Great Vehicle will be removed” teaches the wisdom that arises from the end of the process of realization, the wisdom that directly realizes the truth, based on that very superior wisdom.🔽

original: nas mthar thug pa'i mngon par rtogs pa'i dus na zad pa dang / mi skye ba shes pas rab tu phye ba 'jig rten las 'das pa'i lam don dam pa'i bden pas bsdus pa thams cad rtogs par 'gyur ba ni drang ba'i don gyi mdo sde thams cad la ro gcig pa dang /
analyzed: nas mthar thug pa'i mngon par rtogs pa'i dus na zad pa dang / mi skye ba shes pas rab tu phye ba 'jig rten las 'das pa'i lam don dam pa'i bden pas bsdus pa thams cad rtogs par 'gyur ba ni drang ba'i don gyi mdo sde thams cad la ro gcig pa dang /
translated: The meaning of the above passage from “the wisdom of the noble ones” up to “all efforts in the Great Vehicle will not be obscured” teaches that based on that very superior wisdom, one will realize all the transcendent paths subsumed by ultimate truth, which are distinguished by the knowledge of elimination and nonarising at the time of ultimate realization, through the gateway of realizing the truth by means of the knowledge that arises from the end of realization.

original: brtsal ba thams cad la sgrib pa mi 'gyur ba zhes bya ste /
analyzed: brtsal ba thams cad la sgrib pa mi 'gyur ba zhes bya ste /
translated: This is called “the single taste of all sutras of provisional meaning” and “all efforts will not be obscured.”

original: de'i phyir nam mkha'i dpes ni don dam pa'i gtam bstan to //
analyzed: de'i phyir nam mkha'i dpes ni don dam pa'i gtam bstan to //
translated: Therefore, the example of space teaches the discourse on the ultimate.

original: de la nges pa'i don bstan pa 'di yang zhes bya ba ni bcom ldan 'das kyis chos thams cad ngo bo nyid med pa zhes gsungs pa yang mtshan nyid gsum la so sor nges pa bstan te /
analyzed: de la nges pa'i don bstan pa 'di yang zhes bya ba ni bcom ldan 'das kyis chos thams cad ngo bo nyid med pa zhes gsungs pa yang mtshan nyid gsum la so sor nges pa bstan te /
translated: The phrase this teaching of the definitive meaning refers to the fact that the Lord Buddha taught that all phenomena are devoid of essence, and that he taught this in terms of the three natures.

original: kun brtags pa'i mtshan nyid ngo bo nyid med pa nyid kyis ngo bo nyid med pa yin /
analyzed: kun brtags pa'i mtshan nyid ngo bo nyid med pa nyid kyis ngo bo nyid med pa yin /
translated: The imagined nature is devoid of essence by virtue of its lack of essence due to its characteristic.

original: gzhan kyi dbang gi mtshan nyid ni skye ba ngo bo nyid med pa dang / don dam pa ngo bo nyid med pa nyid kyis ngo bo nyid med pa yin /
analyzed: gzhan kyi dbang gi mtshan nyid ni skye ba ngo bo nyid med pa dang / don dam pa ngo bo nyid med pa nyid kyis ngo bo nyid med pa yin /
translated: The dependent nature is devoid of essence by virtue of its lack of essence due to origination and its lack of essence due to the ultimate.🔽The perfected nature is devoid of essence by virtue of its lack of essence due to the ultimate.

original: yongs su grub pa'i mtshan nyid ni don dam pa ngo bo nyid med pa nyid kyis ngo bo nyid med pa yin no zhes gsungs pa dang / chos thams cad ma skyes pa /
analyzed: yongs su grub pa'i mtshan nyid ni don dam pa ngo bo nyid med pa nyid kyis ngo bo nyid med pa yin no zhes gsungs pa dang / chos thams cad ma skyes pa /
translated: The Lord Buddha also taught that all phenomena are unarisen,

original: ma 'gags pa /
analyzed: ma 'gags pa /
translated: undisappeared,

original: gzod ma nas zhi ba /
analyzed: gzod ma nas zhi ba /
translated: primordially peaceful,🔽and naturally nirvanized.

original: rang bzhin gyis yongs su mya ngan las 'das pa zhes gsungs pa ni kun brtags pa'i mtshan nyid dang yongs su grub pa'i mtshan nyid yin par so sor nges pa bstan pa la bya'o //
analyzed: rang bzhin gyis yongs su mya ngan las 'das pa zhes gsungs pa ni kun brtags pa'i mtshan nyid dang yongs su grub pa'i mtshan nyid yin par so sor nges pa bstan pa la bya'o //
translated: The statement “they are essentially completely extinguished” should be understood as referring to the imaginary nature and the perfected nature, respectively.

original: drang ba'i don gyi mdo sde zhes bya ba ni de ltar so sor nges pa ma bstan par chos thams cad ngo bo nyid med par /
analyzed: drang ba'i don gyi mdo sde zhes bya ba ni de ltar so sor nges pa ma bstan par chos thams cad ngo bo nyid med par /
translated: A sūtra that is interpretable in meaning is one that does not teach such a definite discrimination, but rather teaches that all phenomena are natureless,

original: chos thams cad ma skyes pa /
analyzed: chos thams cad ma skyes pa /
translated: that all phenomena are unproduced,

original: ma 'gags pa /
analyzed: ma 'gags pa /
translated: that all phenomena are unceasing,

original: gzod ma nas zhi ba /
analyzed: gzod ma nas zhi ba /
translated: that all phenomena are primordially peaceful,

original: rang bzhin gyis yongs su mya ngan las 'das pa zhes gsungs pa ste /
analyzed: rang bzhin gyis yongs su mya ngan las 'das pa zhes gsungs pa ste /
translated: and that all phenomena are essentially completely extinguished.

original: de ni nges pa'i don ma yin pas drang zhing bshad dgos pa'i phyir drang ba'i don gyi mdo sde zhes bya'o //
analyzed: de ni nges pa'i don ma yin pas drang zhing bshad dgos pa'i phyir drang ba'i don gyi mdo sde zhes bya'o //
translated: Since this is not definitive, it must be interpreted and explained, and thus it is called a sūtra of interpretable meaning.

original: don dam yang dag 'phags de bzhin te gzhan du ma @133a * //
analyzed: don dam yang dag 'phags de bzhin te gzhan du ma @133a * //
translated: Paramārthasamudgata, it is just so.

original: yin gyi de ni de bzhin du zung shig ces bya bas ni bcom ldan 'das kyis 'phags pa don dam yang dag 'phags nyid thams cad phun sum tshogs shing mgo glengs bas go ba tshad mar 'dzin pa yin te /
analyzed: yin gyi de ni de bzhin du zung shig ces bya bas ni bcom ldan 'das kyis 'phags pa don dam yang dag 'phags nyid thams cad phun sum tshogs shing mgo glengs bas go ba tshad mar 'dzin pa yin te /
translated: The Bhagavan said, Yes, but you should hold it in that way, because the Bhagavan accepts the noble truth of ultimate reality as authoritative, since it is complete in all aspects and is understood by implication.

original: de ni mos pa'i bye brag rgyas par bshad pa lnga yin no //🔽mos pa'i bye brag rgyas par bshad pa'i tshig gi don la sogs pa bshad zin te /
analyzed: de ni mos pa'i bye brag rgyas par bshad pa lnga yin no // mos pa'i bye brag rgyas par bshad pa'i tshig gi don la sogs pa bshad zin te /
translated: These are the five extensive explanations of the different types of interest.

original: de la spyod pa'i gang zag gi tshig gi don la sogs pa bshad zin to /
analyzed: de la spyod pa'i gang zag gi tshig gi don la sogs pa bshad zin to /
translated: The meaning of the words of the extensive explanation of the different types of interest has been explained.

original: // / de'i 'og tu mdo sde'i che ba nyid bstan pa'i tshig gi don la sogs pa bshad par bya ste /
analyzed: // / de'i 'og tu mdo sde'i che ba nyid bstan pa'i tshig gi don la sogs pa bshad par bya ste /
translated: Now the meaning of the words of the greatness of the sutra will be explained.

original: de ni rnam pa bzhir rig par bya ste /
analyzed: de ni rnam pa bzhir rig par bya ste /
translated: It should be understood as having four aspects.

original: nges pa'i don gyi che ba nyid bstan pa dang / bsod nams skye ba'i che ba nyid bstan pa dang / nges pa'i tshig gi che ba nyid bstan pa dang / 'bras bu thob pa'i che ba nyid bstan pa'o //
analyzed: nges pa'i don gyi che ba nyid bstan pa dang / bsod nams skye ba'i che ba nyid bstan pa dang / nges pa'i tshig gi che ba nyid bstan pa dang / 'bras bu thob pa'i che ba nyid bstan pa'o //
translated: The greatness of the definitive meaning, the greatness of the arising of merit, the greatness of the etymology, and the greatness of attaining the result.

original: de la nges pa'i don gyi che ba nyid bstan pa ni /
analyzed: de la nges pa'i don gyi che ba nyid bstan pa ni /
translated: The greatness of the definitive meaning is taught.

original: de nas bcom ldan 'das la byang chub sems dpa' don dam yang dag 'phags kyis yang 'di skad ces gsol to zhes bya ba nas /
analyzed: de nas bcom ldan 'das la byang chub sems dpa' don dam yang dag 'phags kyis yang 'di skad ces gsol to zhes bya ba nas /
translated: Then the bodhisattva Paramārthasamudgata said to the Bhagavān:

original: rtsod pa'i gzhi'i gnas su gyur ba ma lags so zhes gsungs pa'i bar gyis bstan to //
analyzed: rtsod pa'i gzhi'i gnas su gyur ba ma lags so zhes gsungs pa'i bar gyis bstan to //
translated: ... it is not a basis for dispute.🔽The greatness of the increase of merit is taught.

original: bsod nams 'phel ba'i che ba nyid bstan pa ni bcom ldan 'das chos rnams kyi ngo bo nyid ma mchis pa nyid las brtsams zhes bya ba nas /
analyzed: bsod nams 'phel ba'i che ba nyid bstan pa ni bcom ldan 'das chos rnams kyi ngo bo nyid ma mchis pa nyid las brtsams zhes bya ba nas /
translated: Bhagavān, beginning with the lack of entityness of phenomena...

original: rgyu'i bar du yang mi 'gro'o zhes gsungs pa'i bar tha ma'i bar gyis bstan to //
analyzed: rgyu'i bar du yang mi 'gro'o zhes gsungs pa'i bar tha ma'i bar gyis bstan to //
translated: ... it does not go as far as a cause.

original: nges pa'i tshig gi che ba nyid bstan pa ni /
analyzed: nges pa'i tshig gi che ba nyid bstan pa ni /
translated: The greatness of the etymology is taught.

original: de skad ces bka' stsal pa dang / bcom ldan 'das la byang chub sems dpa' don dam yang dag 'phags kyis 'di skad ces gsol to zhes bya ba nas 'di don dam pa nges pa'i don bstan pa zhes bya bar zung shig ces bya ba'i bar gyis bstan to //
analyzed: de skad ces bka' stsal pa dang / bcom ldan 'das la byang chub sems dpa' don dam yang dag 'phags kyis 'di skad ces gsol to zhes bya ba nas 'di don dam pa nges pa'i don bstan pa zhes bya bar zung shig ces bya ba'i bar gyis bstan to //
translated: Having said that, the bodhisattva Paramārthasamudgata said to the Bhagavat, up to “you should hold this as the teaching of the ultimate definitive meaning.”

original: 'bras bu thob pa'i che ba nyid bstan pa ni /
analyzed: 'bras bu thob pa'i che ba nyid bstan pa ni /
translated: The greatness of attaining the result is taught.

original: don dam pa nges pa'i don 'di bstan pa 'di bshad pa ni zhes bya ba la sogs pa gzhung lhag ma thams cad kyis bstan to //
analyzed: don dam pa nges pa'i don 'di bstan pa 'di bshad pa ni zhes bya ba la sogs pa gzhung lhag ma thams cad kyis bstan to //
translated: The teaching of this ultimate definitive meaning, this explanation, and so on, is taught by all the remaining passages.

original: de la dang por nges pa'i don gyi che ba nyid bstan pa'i tshig gi don la sogs pa bshad par bya ste /
analyzed: de la dang por nges pa'i don gyi che ba nyid bstan pa'i tshig gi don la sogs pa bshad par bya ste /
translated: Therein, first, the greatness of the definitive meaning is taught. The meaning of the words and so on should be explained.

original: nges pa'i don gyi che ba nyid bstan pa zhes bya ba ni /🔽bcom ldan 'das kyis dang por nyan thos kyi theg pa la yang dag par zhugs pa rnams la /
analyzed: nges pa'i don gyi che ba nyid bstan pa zhes bya ba ni / bcom ldan 'das kyis dang por nyan thos kyi theg pa la yang dag par zhugs pa rnams la /
translated: The teaching of the greatness of the definitive meaning is as follows.

original: 'phags pa'i bden pa bzhi lan gsum du bzlas te /
analyzed: 'phags pa'i bden pa bzhi lan gsum du bzlas te /
translated: The Bhagavat first taught the four noble truths three times to those who had entered the vehicle of the hearers.

original: rnam pa bcu gnyis su chos kyi 'khor lo bskor ba dang / de'i @133b 'og tu theg pa chen po la yang dag par zhugs pa rnams la stong ba nyid mos pa'i rnam pas chos kyi 'khor lo gnyis pa bskor ba de gnyis ni bla na yod pa /🔽skabs yod pa /🔽drang ba'i don /
analyzed: rnam pa bcu gnyis su chos kyi 'khor lo bskor ba dang / de'i @133b 'og tu theg pa chen po la yang dag par zhugs pa rnams la stong ba nyid mos pa'i rnam pas chos kyi 'khor lo gnyis pa bskor ba de gnyis ni bla na yod pa / skabs yod pa / drang ba'i don /
translated: The first two wheels are respectively the provisional meaning and the definitive meaning.🔽The first wheel is the wheel of the provisional meaning because it is the basis for dispute.🔽The second wheel is the wheel of the definitive meaning because it is the basis for dispute.🔽The third wheel is the wheel of the definitive meaning because it is not the basis for dispute.

original: rtsod pa'i gzhi'i gnas su gyur pa yin gyi bcom ldan 'das kyis theg pa thams cad la yang dag par zhugs pa rnams la legs par rnam par phye ba dang ldan pa'i chos kyi 'khor lo gsum pa bskor ba 'di ni bla na med pa /🔽skabs med pa /🔽nges pa'i don /
analyzed: rtsod pa'i gzhi'i gnas su gyur pa yin gyi bcom ldan 'das kyis theg pa thams cad la yang dag par zhugs pa rnams la legs par rnam par phye ba dang ldan pa'i chos kyi 'khor lo gsum pa bskor ba 'di ni bla na med pa / skabs med pa / nges pa'i don /
translated: The first two wheels are respectively the wheel of the interpretable meaning and the wheel of the definitive meaning.🔽The first wheel is the wheel of the interpretable meaning because it is the basis for dispute.🔽The second wheel is the wheel of the definitive meaning because it is the basis for dispute.

original: rtsod ba'i gzhi'i gnas su gyur pa ma yin pas /
analyzed: rtsod ba'i gzhi'i gnas su gyur pa ma yin pas /
translated: The third wheel is the wheel of the definitive meaning because it is not the basis for dispute.

original: drang ba'i don gyi chos kyi 'khor lo bskor ba snga ma gnyis pas nges pa'i don gyi chos kyi 'khor lo bskor ba gsum pa ni ches khyad par du 'phags pa'i che ba nyid bstan pa gang yin pa'o //
analyzed: drang ba'i don gyi chos kyi 'khor lo bskor ba snga ma gnyis pas nges pa'i don gyi chos kyi 'khor lo bskor ba gsum pa ni ches khyad par du 'phags pa'i che ba nyid bstan pa gang yin pa'o //
translated: The third turning of the wheel of the Dharma, which teaches the ultimate truth, is far superior to the first two turnings of the wheel of the Dharma, which teach the provisional truth.

original: de'i phyir de bstan pa'i dbang du mdzad nas /
analyzed: de'i phyir de bstan pa'i dbang du mdzad nas /
translated: Therefore, with reference to the teaching of the third turning of the wheel of the Dharma,

original: bcom ldan 'das kyis dang po yul b'a r'a na s'i drang srong smra ba ri dags kyi nags su nyan thos kyi the ga la yang da gar zhugs pa rnams la zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs so //🔽de nas 'phags pa'i bden pa bzhi'i rnam pa bstan pas zhes bya ba ni bden pa bzhi lan gsum du bzlas te /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyis dang po yul b'a r'a na s'i drang srong smra ba ri dags kyi nags su nyan thos kyi the ga la yang da gar zhugs pa rnams la zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs so // de nas 'phags pa'i bden pa bzhi'i rnam pa bstan pas zhes bya ba ni bden pa bzhi lan gsum du bzlas te /
translated: the Bhagavat said, “In the Deer Park at Riṣivadana in the region of Vārāṇasī, I first set in motion the wheel of the Dharma for the hearers who had entered the vehicle.”

original: rnam pa bcu gnyis su chos kyi 'khor lo bskor ba gang yin pa'o //
analyzed: rnam pa bcu gnyis su chos kyi 'khor lo bskor ba gang yin pa'o //
translated: “Then, by teaching the aspects of the four noble truths” refers to the turning of the wheel of the Dharma in twelve aspects, which is the four noble truths repeated three times.

original: chos kyi 'khor lo ngo mtshar rmad du byung ba zhes bya ba ni bzlas pa dang po la mthong ba'i lam skye ba dang / bzlas pa gnyis pa la slob pa'i lam skye ba dang / bzlas pa gsum pa la mi slob pa'i lam skye bas 'jig rten thams cad dang mi mthun pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: chos kyi 'khor lo ngo mtshar rmad du byung ba zhes bya ba ni bzlas pa dang po la mthong ba'i lam skye ba dang / bzlas pa gnyis pa la slob pa'i lam skye ba dang / bzlas pa gsum pa la mi slob pa'i lam skye bas 'jig rten thams cad dang mi mthun pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The wheel of the Dharma, which is called “wonderful and marvelous,” is not in common with all worlds, because the path of insight arises in the first repetition, the path of cultivation arises in the second repetition, and the path of no training arises in the third repetition.

original: chos dang mthun par zhes bya ba ni mya ngan las 'das pa dang mthun par ro //
analyzed: chos dang mthun par zhes bya ba ni mya ngan las 'das pa dang mthun par ro //
translated: “In conformity with the Dharma” means in conformity with nirvāṇa.

original: bla na mchis pa ;
analyzed: bla na mchis pa ;
translated: It is surpassable,

original: skabs mchis pa /
analyzed: skabs mchis pa /
translated: it has a remainder,

original: drang ba'i don /
analyzed: drang ba'i don /
translated: it is interpretable in meaning,🔽and it is the basis of dispute.

original: rtsod pa'i gzhi'i gnas su gyur pa zhes bya ba ni rnam grangs de nges pa'i don ma yin pas da dung gzhan du drang ba yod pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: rtsod pa'i gzhi'i gnas su gyur pa zhes bya ba ni rnam grangs de nges pa'i don ma yin pas da dung gzhan du drang ba yod pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: Because it is not definitive in meaning, it still needs to be interpreted in another way.

original: stong pa nyid smos pa'i rnam bas zhes bya ba ni chos bdag med pa ston pa'o //
analyzed: stong pa nyid smos pa'i rnam bas zhes bya ba ni chos bdag med pa ston pa'o //
translated: “By means of the aspects of emptiness” means by means of the teaching of the selflessness of dharmas.

original: chos ngo mtshar rmad du byung ba zhes bya ba ni theg pa chen po'i tshul gyis mthong ba dang / slob pa dang mi slob pa'i lam skye bas 'jig rten thams cad dang mi mthun ba'i phyir ro //🔽chos kyi 'khor lo gnyis pa zhes bya ba ni nyan thos kyi theg pa la yang dag par zhugs pa rnams la chos kyi 'khor lo dang @134a * //
analyzed: chos ngo mtshar rmad du byung ba zhes bya ba ni theg pa chen po'i tshul gyis mthong ba dang / slob pa dang mi slob pa'i lam skye bas 'jig rten thams cad dang mi mthun ba'i phyir ro // chos kyi 'khor lo gnyis pa zhes bya ba ni nyan thos kyi theg pa la yang dag par zhugs pa rnams la chos kyi 'khor lo dang @134a * //
translated: The Dharma is called “wonderful and marvelous” because it is seen by means of the Mahayana, and because it is not in common with the whole world, since the paths of learning and no-learning are generated.

original: po bskor ba la ltos na gnyis pa ste /
analyzed: po bskor ba la ltos na gnyis pa ste /
translated: The second wheel of the Dharma is called “the second” in dependence on the first wheel of the Dharma, which was turned for those who had entered the Hearers’ Vehicle.

original: theg pa chen po drang ba'i don gyi mdo bshad pa thams cad spyir gzung ngo //
analyzed: theg pa chen po drang ba'i don gyi mdo bshad pa thams cad spyir gzung ngo //
translated: All the explanations of the interpretable meaning Sutras of the Mahayana are generally included in the second wheel of the Dharma.

original: theg pa chen po thams cad la yang dag par zhugs pa rnams la zhes bya ba ni nyan thos dang rang sangs rgyas dang byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi rnam par dag pa'i lam gcig pa dang / rnam par dag pa gcig pa dang / theg pa gcig tu bstan ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: theg pa chen po thams cad la yang dag par zhugs pa rnams la zhes bya ba ni nyan thos dang rang sangs rgyas dang byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi rnam par dag pa'i lam gcig pa dang / rnam par dag pa gcig pa dang / theg pa gcig tu bstan ba'i phyir ro //
translated: “For those who have entered all the Mahayana” means that the single pure path of the Hearers, Solitary Buddhas, and Bodhisattvas, the single purity, and the teaching of the single vehicle are for their sake.

original: legs par rnam par phye ba dang ldan pa zhes bya ba ni nges pa'i don bstan pa'o //
analyzed: legs par rnam par phye ba dang ldan pa zhes bya ba ni nges pa'i don bstan pa'o //
translated: Possessing a thorough differentiation is the teaching of the definitive meaning.

original: gcig tu ngo mtshar rmad du byung ba zhes bya ba ni theg pa thams cad kyi tshul gyis mthong ba dang / slob pa dang mi slob pa'i las skye bas 'jig rten thams cad dang mi mthun pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: gcig tu ngo mtshar rmad du byung ba zhes bya ba ni theg pa thams cad kyi tshul gyis mthong ba dang / slob pa dang mi slob pa'i las skye bas 'jig rten thams cad dang mi mthun pa'i phyir ro //
translated: It is unique and marvelous because it is not shared with any worldly beings, since it is seen by the way of all vehicles and is born from the activities of training and beyond training.

original: chos kyi 'khor lo gsum pa zhes bya ba ni theg pa chen po la yang dag par zhugs pa rnams la drang ba'i don gyi chos kyi 'khor lo gnyis pa bskor ba la ltos na gsum pa ste /
analyzed: chos kyi 'khor lo gsum pa zhes bya ba ni theg pa chen po la yang dag par zhugs pa rnams la drang ba'i don gyi chos kyi 'khor lo gnyis pa bskor ba la ltos na gsum pa ste /
translated: The third wheel of Dharma is the third in terms of the two wheels of Dharma of provisional meaning for those who have entered the Great Vehicle.

original: skabs 'dir don dam pa nges pa'i don dam pa bstan pa 'di nyid yin par sbyar ro //
analyzed: skabs 'dir don dam pa nges pa'i don dam pa bstan pa 'di nyid yin par sbyar ro //
translated: In this context, it is this very teaching of the ultimate definitive meaning that is applied as the third wheel of Dharma.

original: bla na ma mchis pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa'i tshig bzhi ni nges pa'i don yin pas de las gzhan du drang ba med ba'i phyir te /
analyzed: bla na ma mchis pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa'i tshig bzhi ni nges pa'i don yin pas de las gzhan du drang ba med ba'i phyir te /
translated: The four phrases beginning with unsurpassed are the definitive meaning, so there is nothing to be interpreted beyond that.

original: de ni nges pa'i don gyi che ba nyid bstan pa yin no //
analyzed: de ni nges pa'i don gyi che ba nyid bstan pa yin no //
translated: This is the teaching of the greatness of the definitive meaning.

original: de'i 'og tu bsod nams che ba'i 'phel ba nyid bstan pa'i tshig gi don la sogs pa bshad par bya ste /
analyzed: de'i 'og tu bsod nams che ba'i 'phel ba nyid bstan pa'i tshig gi don la sogs pa bshad par bya ste /
translated: Next, the meaning of the words of the teaching on the increase of merit will be explained.

original: bsod nams 'phel ba'i che ba nyid bstan pa zhes bya ba ni don dam pa nges pa'i don bstan pa 'di la chos spyod pa rnam pa bcu'i rim gyis sbyor bar byed pa ni sems can yongs su smin par byed pa dang / bsod nams rgya chen po bskyed pa'i lam dang /
analyzed: bsod nams 'phel ba'i che ba nyid bstan pa zhes bya ba ni don dam pa nges pa'i don bstan pa 'di la chos spyod pa rnam pa bcu'i rim gyis sbyor bar byed pa ni sems can yongs su smin par byed pa dang / bsod nams rgya chen po bskyed pa'i lam dang /
translated: The phrase the teaching on the greatness of the increase of merit refers to the path of engaging in this teaching on the ultimate definitive meaning through the stages of the ten Dharma activities, which is the path of ripening sentient beings and generating great merit.

original: sbyor ba'i lam dang ; sgrib pa rnam par dag pa'i lam yin pas /
analyzed: sbyor ba'i lam dang ; sgrib pa rnam par dag pa'i lam yin pas /
translated: It is the path of application and the path of purifying obscurations.

original: 'bras bu bla na med pa'i byang chub skyed par byed pa'i phyir dang / nges pa'i don bstan pa 'di la rigs kyi bu 'am /
analyzed: 'bras bu bla na med pa'i byang chub skyed par byed pa'i phyir dang / nges pa'i don bstan pa 'di la rigs kyi bu 'am /
translated: Because it generates the result of unsurpassed enlightenment, this teaching on the definitive meaning is the supreme Dharma activity for the sons of the Victorious Ones.

original: rigs kyi bu mo gang dag chos spyod pa rnam pa bcu'i rim gyis sbyor bar byed pa de dag la spyod pa re re'i sgo nas kyang bsod nams dpag tu med pa grangs med pa skye ba'i che ba nyid bstan pa gang yin pa'o //
analyzed: rigs kyi bu mo gang dag chos spyod pa rnam pa bcu'i rim gyis sbyor bar byed pa de dag la spyod pa re re'i sgo nas kyang bsod nams dpag tu med pa grangs med pa skye ba'i che ba nyid bstan pa gang yin pa'o //
translated: For those sons and daughters of good family who apply themselves by way of the ten Dharma activities, the greatness of the merit that arises from each activity is taught.

original: de'i phyir de bstan pa'i dbang du mdzad nas /
analyzed: de'i phyir de bstan pa'i dbang du mdzad nas /
translated: Therefore, in order to teach that,

original: bcom ldan 'das chos rnams kyi ngo bo nyid ma mchis pa nyid las brtsams zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs so //
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das chos rnams kyi ngo bo nyid ma mchis pa nyid las brtsams zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs so //
translated: the Bhagavān said, “Bhagavān, with regard to the lack of own-being of phenomena,” and so on.

original: thos nas zhes bya ba la sogs pas ni chos @134b spyod pa bcu po dag bstan te /
analyzed: thos nas zhes bya ba la sogs pas ni chos @134b spyod pa bcu po dag bstan te /
translated: “Having heard” and so on teaches the ten Dharma activities.

original: ci rigs par sbyar ro //
analyzed: ci rigs par sbyar ro //
translated: They should be applied as appropriate.

original: brgya'i char yang nye bar mi 'gro zhing /
analyzed: brgya'i char yang nye bar mi 'gro zhing /
translated: It does not approach even a hundredth part,

original: stong gi cha dang / 'bum gyi cha zhes bya ba ni 'jig rten na mang bar grags pa'i sgo nas mtshon pa yin no //
analyzed: stong gi cha dang / 'bum gyi cha zhes bya ba ni 'jig rten na mang bar grags pa'i sgo nas mtshon pa yin no //
translated: a thousandth part, a hundred thousandth part,” and so on are illustrations from what is well known in the world as being many.

original: grangs zhes bya ba ni mtshungs par rtsi ba nyid de /
analyzed: grangs zhes bya ba ni mtshungs par rtsi ba nyid de /
translated: “Number” is just a way of counting.

original: dper na ri bo gangs can dang cig shos 'bigs byed ces bya ba ni mtshungs par rtsi ba'i grangs su rigs kyi /
analyzed: dper na ri bo gangs can dang cig shos 'bigs byed ces bya ba ni mtshungs par rtsi ba'i grangs su rigs kyi /
translated: For example, it is appropriate to count the Himalayas and the Vindhyas as mountains,

original: ri bo gangs can dang yungs 'bru ni mtshungs par rtsi ba'i grangs su mi rigs par blta'o //
analyzed: ri bo gangs can dang yungs 'bru ni mtshungs par rtsi ba'i grangs su mi rigs par blta'o //
translated: but it is not appropriate to count the Himalayas and a mustard seed as mountains.

original: cha zhes bya ba ni yan lag ste /
analyzed: cha zhes bya ba ni yan lag ste /
translated: “ Part” means a member.

original: de yang rang bzhin 'dra ba yin te /
analyzed: de yang rang bzhin 'dra ba yin te /
translated: And that is similar in nature.

original: dper na rtse mo can rnams kyi rtse mo ni che ba yin gyi /
analyzed: dper na rtse mo can rnams kyi rtse mo ni che ba yin gyi /
translated: For example, the peak of those having peaks is great,

original: rtsva'i rtse mo ni de dag gi cha ma yin pa bzhin no //
analyzed: rtsva'i rtse mo ni de dag gi cha ma yin pa bzhin no //
translated: but the peak of grass is not a part of them.

original: bgrang ba zhes bya ba ni de yang mtshungs pa yin te /
analyzed: bgrang ba zhes bya ba ni de yang mtshungs pa yin te /
translated: “ Counting” is also similar.🔽For example, it is appropriate to count Meru and the Himalayas,

original: dper na ri rab dang gangs bzhes bgrang gi / ri rab dang yungs 'bru zhes ni mi bgrang ba bzhin no //
analyzed: dper na ri rab dang gangs bzhes bgrang gi / ri rab dang yungs 'bru zhes ni mi bgrang ba bzhin no //
translated: but it is not appropriate to count Meru and a mustard seed.

original: dpe zhes bya ba ni 'dra ba nyid de /
analyzed: dpe zhes bya ba ni 'dra ba nyid de /
translated: “ Example” means similarity.

original: dper na ba lang dang 'dra ba la ba lang zhes bya'i /
analyzed: dper na ba lang dang 'dra ba la ba lang zhes bya'i /
translated: For example, that which is similar to a cow is called a cow,

original: sbrang ma lam yin pa bzhin no //
analyzed: sbrang ma lam yin pa bzhin no //
translated: but not an ant.

original: rgyur yang zhes bya ba ni de'i rgyu'i dngos por yang mi bzod pa ste /
analyzed: rgyur yang zhes bya ba ni de'i rgyu'i dngos por yang mi bzod pa ste /
translated: “Also as a cause” means that it cannot even be the cause of that.

original: de ni bsod nams skye ba'i che ba nyid bstan pa yin no /
analyzed: de ni bsod nams skye ba'i che ba nyid bstan pa yin no /
translated: This teaches the greatness of the arising of merit.

original: de'i 'og tu nges pa'i tshig gi che ba nyid bstan pa'i tshig gi don la sogs pa bshad par bya ste /
analyzed: de'i 'og tu nges pa'i tshig gi che ba nyid bstan pa'i tshig gi don la sogs pa bshad par bya ste /
translated: After that, the greatness of the etymological definition is taught. The meaning of the words and so on should be explained.

original: nges pa'i tshig gi che ba nyid bstan pa zhes bya ba ni chos rnams kyi ngo bo nyid med pa'i mtshan nyid bstan pa'i le'u 'di'i ming don dam pa nges pa'i don bstan pa zhes nges pa'i tshig tu bstan pa gang yin pa'o //
analyzed: nges pa'i tshig gi che ba nyid bstan pa zhes bya ba ni chos rnams kyi ngo bo nyid med pa'i mtshan nyid bstan pa'i le'u 'di'i ming don dam pa nges pa'i don bstan pa zhes nges pa'i tshig tu bstan pa gang yin pa'o //
translated: The teaching of the greatness of the etymological definition is the name of this chapter that teaches the characteristic of the realitylessness of phenomena, which is taught as the etymological definition “teaching the ultimate definitive meaning.”

original: de'i phyir de bstan pa'i dbang du mdzad nas /
analyzed: de'i phyir de bstan pa'i dbang du mdzad nas /
translated: Therefore, with reference to the teaching of that,

original: bcom ldan 'das dgongs pa nges par 'grel ba'i chos kyi rnam grangs 'dir bstan pa 'di'i ming ci lags /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das dgongs pa nges par 'grel ba'i chos kyi rnam grangs 'dir bstan pa 'di'i ming ci lags /
translated: the Bhagavat was asked, “Bhagavat, what is the name of this Dharma discourse that teaches the definitive meaning?

original: 'di ji ltar gzung bar bgyi zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs so //
analyzed: 'di ji ltar gzung bar bgyi zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs so //
translated: How should it be remembered?” and so on.

original: dgongs pa nges par 'grel ba'i chos kyi rnam grangs 'dir zhes bya ba ni nges pa'i don bstan pa'i mdo sde 'di'i lus rnam par gzhag pa spyi la snyegs so //
analyzed: dgongs pa nges par 'grel ba'i chos kyi rnam grangs 'dir zhes bya ba ni nges pa'i don bstan pa'i mdo sde 'di'i lus rnam par gzhag pa spyi la snyegs so //
translated: In this Dharma discourse that definitely interprets the thought refers to the general presentation of the body of this sūtra that teaches the definitive meaning.

original: bstan pa 'di'i zhes bya ba ni chos rnams kyi ngo bo nyid med pa'i mtshan nyid bstan pa'i le'u 'di nyi tshe dang sbyar ro //🔽don dam pa nges pa'i don bstan pa zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: bstan pa 'di'i zhes bya ba ni chos rnams kyi ngo bo nyid med pa'i mtshan nyid bstan pa'i le'u 'di nyi tshe dang sbyar ro // don dam pa nges pa'i don bstan pa zhes bya ba la /
translated: This teaching refers to just this chapter that teaches the characteristic of the essencelessness of phenomena.🔽It is called the teaching of the ultimate definitive meaning.

original: don dam pa zhes bya ba ni dam pa'i don ces bya bar sbyar te /
analyzed: don dam pa zhes bya ba ni dam pa'i don ces bya bar sbyar te /
translated: Ultimate is connected to definitive meaning.

original: dam pa ni yang dag pa'i shes pa 'jig rten pa dang / 'jig rten las 'das pa'o //🔽don ni de'i yul kun nas nyon mongs pa'i mtshan nyid kyi chos dang / rnam par @135a * //
analyzed: dam pa ni yang dag pa'i shes pa 'jig rten pa dang / 'jig rten las 'das pa'o // don ni de'i yul kun nas nyon mongs pa'i mtshan nyid kyi chos dang / rnam par @135a * //
translated: The ultimate is correct knowledge that is mundane and supramundane.

original: byang ba'i mtshan nyid kyi chos so //
analyzed: byang ba'i mtshan nyid kyi chos so //
translated: Its object is phenomena that have the characteristic of the afflictive and phenomena that have the characteristic of purification.

original: 'di don dam pa nges pa'i don bstan pa zhes bya bar zung shig ces bya ba ni ming de ltar thung shig ces bya ba'i tha tshig ste /
analyzed: 'di don dam pa nges pa'i don bstan pa zhes bya bar zung shig ces bya ba ni ming de ltar thung shig ces bya ba'i tha tshig ste /
translated: This is called the teaching of the ultimate truth, and you should remember it by that name.

original: de ni nges pa'i tshig gi che ba nyid bstan pa yin no //
analyzed: de ni nges pa'i tshig gi che ba nyid bstan pa yin no //
translated: This is the explanation of the greatness of the etymological definition.

original: de'i 'og tu 'bras bu 'thob pa'i che ba nyid bstan pa zhes bya ba ni sangs rgyas dang byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyis sems can rnams la chos bstan pa'i 'bras bu'i phan yon rgya che ba rnam pa lnga bstan pa gang yin pa ste /
analyzed: de'i 'og tu 'bras bu 'thob pa'i che ba nyid bstan pa zhes bya ba ni sangs rgyas dang byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyis sems can rnams la chos bstan pa'i 'bras bu'i phan yon rgya che ba rnam pa lnga bstan pa gang yin pa ste /
translated: Then, the explanation of the greatness of attaining the result is as follows: The five great benefits of the result of the Buddhas and Bodhisattvas teaching the doctrine to sentient beings are shown.

original: lnga gang zhen de dag las sems can kha cig ni bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu sems bskyed par 'gyur ba dang / de dag las sems can kha cig ni dam pa'i chos bstan pa de nyid kyi tshe chos rnams la chos kyi mig rdul med cing dri ma dang bral ba bskyed par 'gyur ba dang /
analyzed: lnga gang zhen de dag las sems can kha cig ni bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu sems bskyed par 'gyur ba dang / de dag las sems can kha cig ni dam pa'i chos bstan pa de nyid kyi tshe chos rnams la chos kyi mig rdul med cing dri ma dang bral ba bskyed par 'gyur ba dang /
translated: What are the five? Some sentient beings generate the thought of unsurpassable perfect enlightenment from among them. Some sentient beings, at the very time of the teaching of the holy doctrine, generate the eye of doctrine with respect to doctrines, free from the dust, and uncontaminated.

original: de dag las sems can kha cig ni dam ba'i chos bstan pa'i mod la zag pa zad par 'gyur ba dang / de dag las sems can kha cig ni dam pa'i chos thos pa de nyid kyi mod la byang chub sems dpa'i bzod pa'i mchog thob par 'gyur ba dang /
analyzed: de dag las sems can kha cig ni dam ba'i chos bstan pa'i mod la zag pa zad par 'gyur ba dang / de dag las sems can kha cig ni dam pa'i chos thos pa de nyid kyi mod la byang chub sems dpa'i bzod pa'i mchog thob par 'gyur ba dang /
translated: Some sentient beings, as soon as they hear the excellent Dharma, will attain the supreme patience of the bodhisattva.

original: sangs rgyas dang byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi dam pa'i chos bstan pas lung 'bogs pa dang / kha thon byed pa dang / yang dag par sgrub pa gcig nas gcig tu brgyud pa'i tshul gyis dam pa'i chos kyi tshul yun ring du gnas par byed pa ste /
