analyzed: sangs rgyas dang byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi dam pa'i chos bstan pas lung 'bogs pa dang / kha thon byed pa dang / yang dag par sgrub pa gcig nas gcig tu brgyud pa'i tshul gyis dam pa'i chos kyi tshul yun ring du gnas par byed pa ste /
translated: The excellent Dharma taught by the buddhas and bodhisattvas, through the process of being passed down from one to another through recitation and correct practice, will remain for a long time.

original: bstan pa'i 'bras bu'i phan yon rgya che ba lnga po de dag bstan pa ni 'bras bu thob pa'i phan yon gyi che ba nyid bstan pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: bstan pa'i 'bras bu'i phan yon rgya che ba lnga po de dag bstan pa ni 'bras bu thob pa'i phan yon gyi che ba nyid bstan pa zhes bya'o //
translated: These five extensive benefits of the result of the teaching are called “the greatness of the benefit of attaining the result.”

original: de'i phyir de bstan pa'i dbang du mdzad nas /
analyzed: de'i phyir de bstan pa'i dbang du mdzad nas /
translated: Therefore, in order to teach that, it says:

original: don dam pa nges pa'i don bstan pa 'di bshad pa na srog chags drug 'bum ni bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu sems skyes so zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
analyzed: don dam pa nges pa'i don bstan pa 'di bshad pa na srog chags drug 'bum ni bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu sems skyes so zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
translated: When this teaching of the ultimate, the definitive meaning, was explained, the thought of unsurpassed, perfect, complete enlightenment arose in six hundred thousand living beings.

original: bstan pa'i 'bras bu'i phan yon rgya che ba lnga po de dag las dang po bzhi ni dkyus kyi tshig bzhi dang go rims bzhin du sbyar ro //
analyzed: bstan pa'i 'bras bu'i phan yon rgya che ba lnga po de dag las dang po bzhi ni dkyus kyi tshig bzhi dang go rims bzhin du sbyar ro //
translated: From among those five extensive benefits of the teaching, the first four are to be applied in order to the four lines of the root text.

original: lnga ba ni mdo sde thams cad kyi mjug nas bcom ldan 'das kyis de skad ces bka' stsal nas /🔽lha la sogs pa'i 'jig rten yi rang ste /
analyzed: lnga ba ni mdo sde thams cad kyi mjug nas bcom ldan 'das kyis de skad ces bka' stsal nas / lha la sogs pa'i 'jig rten yi rang ste /
translated: The fifth is to be applied to the end of all sutras, where it says, “The Bhagavan, having spoken these words,

original: mngon par dga'o zhes 'byung ba'i skabs dang sbyar te /
analyzed: mngon par dga'o zhes 'byung ba'i skabs dang sbyar te /
translated: the world, including the gods, rejoiced and greatly praised what the Bhagavan had said.”

original: skabs 'dir dmigs kyis ma smos kyang mjug nas 'byung ba nyid skabs 'dir sbyar bar bya'o //
analyzed: skabs 'dir dmigs kyis ma smos kyang mjug nas 'byung ba nyid skabs 'dir sbyar bar bya'o //
translated: Here, although it is not explicitly mentioned, what occurs at the end should be applied here.

original: de la rnam pa lnga po de dag gi rnam par gzhag pa ji lta bu zhe na /
analyzed: de la rnam pa lnga po de dag gi rnam par gzhag pa ji lta bu zhe na /
translated: What is the arrangement of those five?

original: de ni rnam pa gnyis te /
analyzed: de ni rnam pa gnyis te /
translated: There are two kinds.

original: gang @135b zag gi dbang du byas pa dang / chos kyi dbang du byas pa'o //
analyzed: gang @135b zag gi dbang du byas pa dang / chos kyi dbang du byas pa'o //
translated: It is from the point of view of the individual and from the point of view of the teaching.

original: de la gang zag gi dbang du byas pa yang rigs dang / bsam pa la sogs pa'i dbang gis rnam pa gnyis te /
analyzed: de la gang zag gi dbang du byas pa yang rigs dang / bsam pa la sogs pa'i dbang gis rnam pa gnyis te /
translated: From the point of view of the individual, it is twofold, from the point of view of lineage, attitude, etc.

original: nyan thos kyi theg pa'i gang zag dang / theg pa chen po pa'i gang zag go //
analyzed: nyan thos kyi theg pa'i gang zag dang / theg pa chen po pa'i gang zag go //
translated: There is the individual of the Disciple Vehicle and the individual of the Great Vehicle.

original: nyan thos kyi theg pa pa'i gang zag kyang rgyud kyi dbang gis rnam pa gnyis te /
analyzed: nyan thos kyi theg pa pa'i gang zag kyang rgyud kyi dbang gis rnam pa gnyis te /
translated: The individual of the Disciple Vehicle is twofold, from the point of view of the stream.

original: mthong ba'i lam skye ba dang / bsgom pa'i lam gyis mi slob pa'i sa man chad 'thob pa ste /
analyzed: mthong ba'i lam skye ba dang / bsgom pa'i lam gyis mi slob pa'i sa man chad 'thob pa ste /
translated: There is the one who obtains the path of insight and the one who obtains the stage of the disciple beyond training by the path of cultivation.

original: dkyus kyi tshig bar ma gnyis dang go rims bzhin no //
analyzed: dkyus kyi tshig bar ma gnyis dang go rims bzhin no //
translated: These correspond respectively to the two intermediate lines of the verse.

original: theg pa chen po pa'i gang zag kyang sems ma bskyed pa dang / bskyed pa'i dbang gis rnam pa gnyis te /
analyzed: theg pa chen po pa'i gang zag kyang sems ma bskyed pa dang / bskyed pa'i dbang gis rnam pa gnyis te /
translated: The individual of the Great Vehicle is twofold, from the point of view of the generation of the thought.

original: sems ma bskyed pa ni kun rdzob kyi sems dang / don dam pa'i sems ma bskyed pa skyed par byed de /
analyzed: sems ma bskyed pa ni kun rdzob kyi sems dang / don dam pa'i sems ma bskyed pa skyed par byed de /
translated: The one who has not generated the thought generates the conventional thought and the ultimate thought which have not been generated.

original: sems bskyed pa ni mi skye ba'i chos la bzod pa thob par 'gyur te /
analyzed: sems bskyed pa ni mi skye ba'i chos la bzod pa thob par 'gyur te /
translated: The generation of the Thought is the attainment of the acquiescence in the non-production of dharmas.

original: dkyus kyi tshig dang po dang / tha ma gnyis dang go rims bzhin du sbyar ro //
analyzed: dkyus kyi tshig dang po dang / tha ma gnyis dang go rims bzhin du sbyar ro //
translated: The first and last words of the verse are to be connected in order with the first and last words of the above passage.

original: chos kyi dbang du byas pa ni bde bar gshegs pa'i bstan pa yun ring du gnas pa ste /
analyzed: chos kyi dbang du byas pa ni bde bar gshegs pa'i bstan pa yun ring du gnas pa ste /
translated: The Dharma is the long-lasting of the Sugata's teaching.

original: tshig thams bstan to //
analyzed: tshig thams bstan to //
translated: The words are all explained.

original: de la bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu sems skyes so zhes bya ba ni kun rdzob kyi sems dang / don dam pa'i sems skyes pa ci rigs par sbyar ro //
analyzed: de la bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu sems skyes so zhes bya ba ni kun rdzob kyi sems dang / don dam pa'i sems skyes pa ci rigs par sbyar ro //
translated: The generation of the Thought of the unsurpassed, perfect enlightenment refers to the generation of the conventional and ultimate Thoughts, as appropriate.

original: chos rnams la chos kyi mig rdul med cing dri ma dang bral ba rnam par dag go zhes bya ba la chos rnams la zhes bya ba ni bden pa bzhi'i chos rnams la'o //
analyzed: chos rnams la chos kyi mig rdul med cing dri ma dang bral ba rnam par dag go zhes bya ba la chos rnams la zhes bya ba ni bden pa bzhi'i chos rnams la'o //
translated: The Dharma-eye with regard to dharmas became utterly pure, free from the dust and free from defilement means that the Dharma-eye with regard to the dharmas of the Four Noble Truths became utterly pure.

original: chos kyi mig ces bya ba ni mthong ba'i lam gyi shes pa'o //
analyzed: chos kyi mig ces bya ba ni mthong ba'i lam gyi shes pa'o //
translated: The Dharma-eye refers to the knowledge of the path of seeing.

original: rdul med cing zhes bya ba ni bar chad med pa'i lam gyi shes pa'o //
analyzed: rdul med cing zhes bya ba ni bar chad med pa'i lam gyi shes pa'o //
translated: Free from the dust refers to the knowledge of the path of no-more-learning.

original: dri ma dang bral ba rnams bya ba ni rnam par grol ba'i lam gyi shes pa'o //
analyzed: dri ma dang bral ba rnams bya ba ni rnam par grol ba'i lam gyi shes pa'o //
translated: The knowledge of the path of liberation is the knowledge of those who are free from defilements.

original: rnam par dag go zhes bya ba ni thob bo zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: rnam par dag go zhes bya ba ni thob bo zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: “They are purified” means “they are attained.”

original: len pa med par zag pa rnams las sems rnam par grol lo zhes bya ba la len pa med par zhes bya ba ni mi skye ba shes pa'o //
analyzed: len pa med par zag pa rnams las sems rnam par grol lo zhes bya ba la len pa med par zhes bya ba ni mi skye ba shes pa'o //
translated: “Their minds are liberated from the defilements without remainder” means that they attain the knowledge of non-arising.

original: zag pa rnams las sems rnam par grol lo zhes bya ba ni zad pa shes pa'o //
analyzed: zag pa rnams las sems rnam par grol lo zhes bya ba ni zad pa shes pa'o //
translated: “Their minds are liberated from the defilements” means that they attain the knowledge of destruction.

original: mi skye ba'i chos la bzod pa thob par 'gyur ro zhes bya ba ni sa brgyad pa thob bo zhes bya ba'i tha tshig ste /
analyzed: mi skye ba'i chos la bzod pa thob par 'gyur ro zhes bya ba ni sa brgyad pa thob bo zhes bya ba'i tha tshig ste /
translated: “They attain receptivity to the non-arising of dharmas” means that they attain the eighth stage.

original: de ni 'bras bu thob pa'i che ba nyid bstan pa yin no //
analyzed: de ni 'bras bu thob pa'i che ba nyid bstan pa yin no //
translated: This is the teaching on the greatness of attaining the result.

original: le'u bdun pa'i tshig gi don la sogs pa bshad zin to /
analyzed: le'u bdun pa'i tshig gi don la sogs pa bshad zin to /
translated: The explanation of the words and so on of the seventh chapter is complete.

original: // / de ltar chos rnams kyi ngo bo nyid med pa'i mtshan nyid kyis kun rdzob kyi bden pa'i mtshan nyid yongs su shes par bya ba @136a * //
analyzed: // / de ltar chos rnams kyi ngo bo nyid med pa'i mtshan nyid kyis kun rdzob kyi bden pa'i mtshan nyid yongs su shes par bya ba @136a * //
translated: Thus, by the characteristic of the realitylessness of dharmas, the characteristic of conventional truth should be understood.

original: bstan nas / da ni chos gdags pa rnam par gzhag pa las brtsams nas /
analyzed: bstan nas / da ni chos gdags pa rnam par gzhag pa las brtsams nas /
translated: Having taught that, now, beginning from the presentation of the designation of phenomena,

original: rnal 'byor gyis yongs su bsdus pa'i zhi gnas dang lhag mthong gi rab tu dbye bas kun rdzob kyi bden pa'i mtshan nyid yongs su shes par bya ba bstan pa'i tshig gi don la sogs pa bshad par bya ste /
analyzed: rnal 'byor gyis yongs su bsdus pa'i zhi gnas dang lhag mthong gi rab tu dbye bas kun rdzob kyi bden pa'i mtshan nyid yongs su shes par bya ba bstan pa'i tshig gi don la sogs pa bshad par bya ste /
translated: the explanation of the meaning of the words and so forth of the teaching on the knowledge of the characteristics of conventional truth by way of the divisions of śamatha and vipaśyanā that are included in yoga is to be explained.

original: de'i phyir de bstan pa'i dbang du mdzad nas /
analyzed: de'i phyir de bstan pa'i dbang du mdzad nas /
translated: Therefore, in order to teach that,

original: de nas bcom ldan 'das la byang chub sems dpa' byams pas zhu ba zhus pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa byams pa'i le'u brgyad pa 'di gsungs so //
analyzed: de nas bcom ldan 'das la byang chub sems dpa' byams pas zhu ba zhus pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa byams pa'i le'u brgyad pa 'di gsungs so //
translated: then the bodhisattva Maitreya asked the Bhagavān, and so forth. This chapter eight, the chapter of Maitreya, was spoken.

original: de la le'u brgyad pa 'di'i bsdus pa'i don ni mdor bsdu na chos gdags pa rnam par gzhag pa las brtsams nas /
analyzed: de la le'u brgyad pa 'di'i bsdus pa'i don ni mdor bsdu na chos gdags pa rnam par gzhag pa las brtsams nas /
translated: In that, the condensed meaning of this chapter eight, in brief, beginning from the presentation of the designation of phenomena,

original: rnal 'byor gyis yongs su bsdus pa'i zhi gnas dang lhag mthong gi lam gyi rab tu phye ba bstan pa yin no //
analyzed: rnal 'byor gyis yongs su bsdus pa'i zhi gnas dang lhag mthong gi lam gyi rab tu phye ba bstan pa yin no //
translated: the explanation of the divisions of the path of śamatha and vipaśyanā that are included in yoga is taught.

original: de yang rnam par dbye na rnam pa drug gis rnal 'byor gyi lam bstan te /
analyzed: de yang rnam par dbye na rnam pa drug gis rnal 'byor gyi lam bstan te /
translated: Moreover, it is taught by means of six aspects that distinguish the path of yoga.

original: yongs su shes pa dang / yongs su mi shes pa dang / ngo bo nyid dang / sbyor ba'i rgyu dang / 'thob pa dang ; 'thob pa'i thabs dang / chud mi za bar bya ba'i phyir gdags pa gtan la dbab pas de bstan to /
analyzed: yongs su shes pa dang / yongs su mi shes pa dang / ngo bo nyid dang / sbyor ba'i rgyu dang / 'thob pa dang ; 'thob pa'i thabs dang / chud mi za bar bya ba'i phyir gdags pa gtan la dbab pas de bstan to /
translated: It is taught by means of the ascertainment of designation for the sake of thorough understanding, thorough non-understanding, the nature, the cause of application, attainment, the means of attainment, and non-wastage.

original: de la yongs su shes pa dang / yongs su mi shes pa zhes bya ba ni le'u 'di bsdus pa'i don chos gdags pa rnam par gzhag pa las brtsams nas rnal 'byor gyis yongs su bsdus pa'i zhi gnas dang lhag mthong gi lam gyi dbye ba zhes bya bas lam gyi rgyu dang /
analyzed: de la yongs su shes pa dang / yongs su mi shes pa zhes bya ba ni le'u 'di bsdus pa'i don chos gdags pa rnam par gzhag pa las brtsams nas rnal 'byor gyis yongs su bsdus pa'i zhi gnas dang lhag mthong gi lam gyi dbye ba zhes bya bas lam gyi rgyu dang /
translated: Here, thorough understanding and thorough non-understanding refers to the division of the path of serenity and insight that are included in yoga, beginning with the presentation of the designation of phenomena, which is the summarized meaning of this chapter. The cause of the path refers to the cause of the path of serenity and insight.

original: ngo bo nyid dang rab tu dbye ba bstan pa'i lus thams cad dang spyir sbyar te /
analyzed: ngo bo nyid dang rab tu dbye ba bstan pa'i lus thams cad dang spyir sbyar te /
translated: The nature refers to the nature of the path of serenity and insight. The division refers to the division of the path of serenity and insight. The body refers to the body of the path of serenity and insight. In general refers to the general path of serenity and insight.

original: 'dir 'phags pa byams pas zhu ba rnam pa mang po zhus pa ni yongs su mi shes pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: 'dir 'phags pa byams pas zhu ba rnam pa mang po zhus pa ni yongs su mi shes pa zhes bya'o //
translated: Here, the many kinds of questions asked by the noble Maitreya are called thorough non-understanding.🔽The means of attainment refers to the means of attaining the path of serenity and insight. original: bcom ldan 'das kyis lan rnam pa mang po bka' stsal pa ni yongs su shes pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyis lan rnam pa mang po bka' stsal pa ni yongs su shes pa zhes bya'o //
translated: The Blessed One's many answers are called thorough knowledge.

original: de ni gzhung thams cad la yang spyir 'dra ba yin mod kyi skabs 'dir zhus pa dang lan btab pa lhag par mang ba dang / bcom ldan 'das ni bdag nyid kyis yongs su mkhyen nas yongs su mi shes pa gzhan dag la ston par mdzad do zhes ston pa'i che ba nyid bstan pa'i phyir dmigs kyis smos te /
analyzed: de ni gzhung thams cad la yang spyir 'dra ba yin mod kyi skabs 'dir zhus pa dang lan btab pa lhag par mang ba dang / bcom ldan 'das ni bdag nyid kyis yongs su mkhyen nas yongs su mi shes pa gzhan dag la ston par mdzad do zhes ston pa'i che ba nyid bstan pa'i phyir dmigs kyis smos te /
translated: Although this is generally similar in all the texts, in this context the questions and answers are especially numerous, and the Blessed One, having thoroughly understood himself, teaches others who do not thoroughly understand. This is taught to show the greatness of the teacher.

original: le'u 'di mgo mjug gi bar du zhus pa dang lan btab pa'i gzhung thams cad dang ci rigs par sbyar ro //
analyzed: le'u 'di mgo mjug gi bar du zhus pa dang lan btab pa'i gzhung thams cad dang ci rigs par sbyar ro //
translated: This chapter, from beginning to end, should be appropriately applied to all the texts of questions and answers.

original: ngo bo nyid ces bya ba ni rnal 'byor gyis yongs su bsdus pa'i zhi gnas dang lhag mthong gi lam zhes bya bas bstan te /
analyzed: ngo bo nyid ces bya ba ni rnal 'byor gyis yongs su bsdus pa'i zhi gnas dang lhag mthong gi lam zhes bya bas bstan te /
translated: Nature is taught by the phrase the path of shamatha and vipashyana that is fully included in yoga.

original: de la rnal 'byor ces bya ba'i sgra @136b ni sbyor ba zhes bya ba'i don te /
analyzed: de la rnal 'byor ces bya ba'i sgra @136b ni sbyor ba zhes bya ba'i don te /
translated: Here, the term yoga means application.

original: lhag pa'i tshul khrims so //
analyzed: lhag pa'i tshul khrims so //
translated: It is the superior morality.

original: zhi gnas dang lhag mthong gis zhes bya ba ni lhag pa'i sems dang lhag pa'i shes rab ste /
analyzed: zhi gnas dang lhag mthong gis zhes bya ba ni lhag pa'i sems dang lhag pa'i shes rab ste /
translated: Tranquility and insight refers to the higher faculty of mind and the higher faculty of wisdom.

original: lhag pa'i tshul khrims dang / lhag pa'i sems dang / lhag pa'i shes rab de la dngos dang / brgyud pa'i tshul du sbyor bar byed pas na lhag pa'i tshul khrims ni sbyor ba zhes bya ste /
analyzed: lhag pa'i tshul khrims dang / lhag pa'i sems dang / lhag pa'i shes rab de la dngos dang / brgyud pa'i tshul du sbyor bar byed pas na lhag pa'i tshul khrims ni sbyor ba zhes bya ste /
translated: The higher faculty of morality, the higher faculty of mind, and the higher faculty of wisdom are called the path of application because they are applied to the path of insight in the sense of being its proximate cause and in the sense of being its antecedent.

original: de ltar lhag pa'i tshul khrims kyi sbyor bas yongs su bsdus pa lhag pa'i sems dang / lhag pa'i shes rab ni rnal 'byor gyi lam gyi ngo bo nyid ces bya'o //🔽yang gcig tu na rnal 'byor ces bya ba'i sgra ni rigs pa la yang bya ste /
analyzed: de ltar lhag pa'i tshul khrims kyi sbyor bas yongs su bsdus pa lhag pa'i sems dang / lhag pa'i shes rab ni rnal 'byor gyi lam gyi ngo bo nyid ces bya'o // yang gcig tu na rnal 'byor ces bya ba'i sgra ni rigs pa la yang bya ste /
translated: Thus, the higher faculty of mind and the higher faculty of wisdom, which are included in the path of application by the higher faculty of morality, are called the essence of the path of application.

original: rigs pa bzhi'o //
analyzed: rigs pa bzhi'o //
translated: Moreover, the word yoga is also used in the sense of reason, and the four reasons are:

original: zhi gnas dang lhag mthong ni sbyor ba'i rgyu la sogs pa la ltos pas rigs pas yongs su bsdus pa yang yin la mi mthun pa'i phyogs spong ba dang / gnyen po bskyed pa dang 'bras bu 'thob par byed pas bya ba byed pa'i rigs pas yongs su bsdus pa yang yin /
analyzed: zhi gnas dang lhag mthong ni sbyor ba'i rgyu la sogs pa la ltos pas rigs pas yongs su bsdus pa yang yin la mi mthun pa'i phyogs spong ba dang / gnyen po bskyed pa dang 'bras bu 'thob par byed pas bya ba byed pa'i rigs pas yongs su bsdus pa yang yin /
translated: They are also included in the reasoning of performance of function, since they abandon the discordant classes, generate the antidotes and cause the attainment of the result.

original: rnal 'byor pa'i mngon sum la sogs pa'i mtshan ma dang mi 'gal bas 'thad pas bsgrubs pa'i rigs pas yongs su bsdus pa yang yin te /
analyzed: rnal 'byor pa'i mngon sum la sogs pa'i mtshan ma dang mi 'gal bas 'thad pas bsgrubs pa'i rigs pas yongs su bsdus pa yang yin te /
translated: They are also included in the reasoning of proof by tenable means, since they are not in contradiction with the signs of the yogi's direct perception and so forth.🔽They are also included in the reasoning of reality, since they are the reality of dependent origination.

original: rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba'i chos nyid yin pas chos nyid kyi rigs pas yongs su bsdus pa yang yin pas rigs pas yongs su bsdus pa'i zhi gnas dang lhag mthong ni rnal 'byor gyi lam gyi ngo bo nyid ces bya ste /
analyzed: rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba'i chos nyid yin pas chos nyid kyi rigs pas yongs su bsdus pa yang yin pas rigs pas yongs su bsdus pa'i zhi gnas dang lhag mthong ni rnal 'byor gyi lam gyi ngo bo nyid ces bya ste /
translated: Thus serenity and insight included in the reasonings are called the essence of the path of yoga.

original: de la tshig gi don spyir bsdu na /
analyzed: de la tshig gi don spyir bsdu na /
translated: The general meaning of the words is summarized as follows.

original: lhag pa'i tshul khrims dang rigs pa bzhis yongs su bsdus pa'i zhi gnas dang lhag mthong ni rnal 'byor gyi lam gyi ngo bo nyid yin te /
analyzed: lhag pa'i tshul khrims dang rigs pa bzhis yongs su bsdus pa'i zhi gnas dang lhag mthong ni rnal 'byor gyi lam gyi ngo bo nyid yin te /
translated: Calm abiding and insight subsumed by superior morality and the four rationales are the essence of the path of yoga.

original: 'di ltar lhag pa'i tshul khrims kyis ma bsdus pa'i zhi gnas dang lhag mthong ni nang gi rmugs pa dang / lta ba'i ngo bo nyid yin pas lam ma yin la /
analyzed: 'di ltar lhag pa'i tshul khrims kyis ma bsdus pa'i zhi gnas dang lhag mthong ni nang gi rmugs pa dang / lta ba'i ngo bo nyid yin pas lam ma yin la /
translated: Thus calm abiding and insight not subsumed by superior morality are not the path because they are the essence of internal lethargy and view.

original: rigs pas ma bsdus pa'i zhi gnas dang lhag mthong yang lam gol ba yin pas lam ma yin gyi /
analyzed: rigs pas ma bsdus pa'i zhi gnas dang lhag mthong yang lam gol ba yin pas lam ma yin gyi /
translated: Calm abiding and insight not subsumed by the rationales are not the path because they are deviant paths.

original: lhag pa'i tshul khrims dang rigs pa'i rnal 'byor gyis bsdus pa'i zhi gnas dang / lhag mthong ni spangs pa dang / ye shes phun sum tshogs pas rab tu phye ba'i 'bras bu bla na med pa thob pa'i lam yin pas na /
analyzed: lhag pa'i tshul khrims dang rigs pa'i rnal 'byor gyis bsdus pa'i zhi gnas dang / lhag mthong ni spangs pa dang / ye shes phun sum tshogs pas rab tu phye ba'i 'bras bu bla na med pa thob pa'i lam yin pas na /
translated: But calm abiding and insight subsumed by the yoga of superior morality and the rationales are the path because they are the path for attaining the unsurpassed result that is fully qualified abandonment and gnosis.

original: de'i phyir rnal 'byor gyis yongs su bsdus pa'i zhi gnas dang lhag mthong gi lam ni ngo bo nyid de /
analyzed: de'i phyir rnal 'byor gyis yongs su bsdus pa'i zhi gnas dang lhag mthong gi lam ni ngo bo nyid de /
translated: Therefore the path of calm abiding and insight subsumed by yoga is the essence of the path.

original: de yang le'u 'di las zhi gnas dang lhag mthong gi lam gyi ngo bo nyid bstan pa'i gzhung @137a * //
analyzed: de yang le'u 'di las zhi gnas dang lhag mthong gi lam gyi ngo bo nyid bstan pa'i gzhung @137a * //
translated: Moreover, this chapter is related to all the passages that teach the nature of the path of serenity and insight.

original: thams cad dang spyir sbyar ro //
analyzed: thams cad dang spyir sbyar ro //
translated: It is also related to the general subject matter of the entire treatise.

original: sbyor ba'i rgyu ni chos gdags pa rnam par gzhag pa las brtsams nas zhes bya bas bstan te /
analyzed: sbyor ba'i rgyu ni chos gdags pa rnam par gzhag pa las brtsams nas zhes bya bas bstan te /
translated: The cause of application is indicated by the passage beginning with “the establishment of the designation of the Dharma.”

original: de ni bcom ldan 'das byang chub sems dpa' ci la gnas ci la brten te zhes bya ba nas /🔽'di lta ste /
analyzed: de ni bcom ldan 'das byang chub sems dpa' ci la gnas ci la brten te zhes bya ba nas / 'di lta ste /
translated: This is taught in the passage beginning with “Blessed One, on what do the bodhisattvas base themselves and what do they rely on?”

original: dngos po'i mtha' dang dgos pa yongs su grub pa'o zhes gsungs pa'i bar gyis bstan to //
analyzed: dngos po'i mtha' dang dgos pa yongs su grub pa'o zhes gsungs pa'i bar gyis bstan to //
translated: and ending with “namely, the limit of reality and the accomplishment of the goal.”

original: 'thob pa dang 'thob pa'i thabs dang / chud mi za ba'i gdags pa gtan la dbab pa ni rab tu dbye ba zhes bya bas bstan te /
analyzed: 'thob pa dang 'thob pa'i thabs dang / chud mi za ba'i gdags pa gtan la dbab pa ni rab tu dbye ba zhes bya bas bstan te /
translated: The determination of the designation of attainment, the means of attainment, and non-wastage is indicated by the word “classification.”

original: de la 'thob pa ni bcom ldan 'das byang chub sems dpa'i zhi gnas dang lhag mthong gi dmigs pa'i dngos po bzhi po de dag la brten cing gnas nas zhes bya ba nas /
analyzed: de la 'thob pa ni bcom ldan 'das byang chub sems dpa'i zhi gnas dang lhag mthong gi dmigs pa'i dngos po bzhi po de dag la brten cing gnas nas zhes bya ba nas /
translated: Attainment is taught in the passage beginning with “Blessed One, the bodhisattvas base themselves and rely on those four things that are the objects of serenity and insight” and ending with “they attain the supreme attainment.”

original: de ltar na byang chub sems dpa' lhag mthong la mkhas pa yin no zhes gsungs pa'i bar gyis bstan to //
analyzed: de ltar na byang chub sems dpa' lhag mthong la mkhas pa yin no zhes gsungs pa'i bar gyis bstan to //
translated: Thus, a bodhisattva is skilled in vipaśyanā.

original: 'thob pa'i thabs ni bcom ldan 'das byang chub sems dpa' de sems la dmigs pa'i sems nang du yid la bgyid pa zhes bya ba nas /
analyzed: 'thob pa'i thabs ni bcom ldan 'das byang chub sems dpa' de sems la dmigs pa'i sems nang du yid la bgyid pa zhes bya ba nas /
translated: The method of attaining it is explained in the passage from “Blessed One, that bodhisattva who focuses on the mind and attends inwardly to the mind” up to

original: byams pa lhag mthong ni ma yin te /
analyzed: byams pa lhag mthong ni ma yin te /
translated: Maitreya, it is not vipaśyanā.

original: lhag mthong gi rjes su mthun pa'i mos pa dang mtshungs par ldan pa yin par brjod par bya'o zhes gsungs pa'i bar gyis brjod do //
analyzed: lhag mthong gi rjes su mthun pa'i mos pa dang mtshungs par ldan pa yin par brjod par bya'o zhes gsungs pa'i bar gyis brjod do //
translated: It should be said to be associated with the aspiration that is conducive to vipaśyanā.

original: chud mi za ba'i phyir gdags pa gtan la dbab pa ni /
analyzed: chud mi za ba'i phyir gdags pa gtan la dbab pa ni /
translated: The ascertainment of the designation for the purpose of non-wastage is

original: zhi gnas kyi lam dang / lhag mthong gi lam tha dad ces bgyi ba'am /
analyzed: zhi gnas kyi lam dang / lhag mthong gi lam tha dad ces bgyi ba'am /
translated: explained in the passage from “The path of śamatha and the path of vipaśyanā are said to be different” up to

original: tha dad pa ma lags zhes bgyi zhes bya ba la sogs pa le'u 'di nyid kyi gzhung lhag ma thams cad kyis bstan to //
analyzed: tha dad pa ma lags zhes bgyi zhes bya ba la sogs pa le'u 'di nyid kyi gzhung lhag ma thams cad kyis bstan to //
translated: “Are they not different?” and so on, which are explained by the remainder of the text of this chapter.

original: de la dang por sbyor ba'i rgyu'i tshig gi don la sogs pa bshad par bya ste /
analyzed: de la dang por sbyor ba'i rgyu'i tshig gi don la sogs pa bshad par bya ste /
translated: Here, first, the meaning of the words of the cause of application and so on should be explained.

original: sbyor ba'i rgyu zhes bya ba ni dang po so so'i skye bo'i gnas skabs na rnal 'byor pa las dang po pas rnal 'byor gyis yongs su bsdus pa'i zhi gnas dang lhag mthong gi lam gyi ngo bo nyid de la sbyor ba'i rgyu gang yin pa'o //
analyzed: sbyor ba'i rgyu zhes bya ba ni dang po so so'i skye bo'i gnas skabs na rnal 'byor pa las dang po pas rnal 'byor gyis yongs su bsdus pa'i zhi gnas dang lhag mthong gi lam gyi ngo bo nyid de la sbyor ba'i rgyu gang yin pa'o //
translated: The cause of preparation is that, in the beginning, in the state of ordinary beings, it is the cause of preparation for the essence of the path of serenity and insight that is included in yoga by a beginner yogi.

original: de yang rnam pa gsum ste /
analyzed: de yang rnam pa gsum ste /
translated: That is also threefold:

original: gnas kyi sbyor ba'i rgyu dang / rten gyi sbyor ba'i rgyu dang / dmigs pa'i sbyor ba'i rgyu bstan pa'o //
analyzed: gnas kyi sbyor ba'i rgyu dang / rten gyi sbyor ba'i rgyu dang / dmigs pa'i sbyor ba'i rgyu bstan pa'o //
translated: the cause of preparation of the basis, the cause of preparation of the support, and the cause of preparation of the object.

original: de la dang por gnas kyi sbyor ba'i rgyu dang / rten gyi sbyor ba'i rgyu bstan pa'i tshig gi don la sogs pa bshad par bya ste /
analyzed: de la dang por gnas kyi sbyor ba'i rgyu dang / rten gyi sbyor ba'i rgyu bstan pa'i tshig gi don la sogs pa bshad par bya ste /
translated: First, the meaning of the words of the teaching on the cause of preparation of the basis and the cause of preparation of the support should be explained.

original: de la mtshams sbyor ba ji lta bu zhe na /
analyzed: de la mtshams sbyor ba ji lta bu zhe na /
translated: What is the connection?

original: 'dir 'phags pas gzhan dag 'di snyam du rab 'byor gyis yongs su bsdus pa'i zhi gnas dang / lhag mthong gi lam gyi ngo bo nyid ni 'jig rten pa dang / 'jig rten las 'das @137b pa thams cad la yang yod de /
analyzed: 'dir 'phags pas gzhan dag 'di snyam du rab 'byor gyis yongs su bsdus pa'i zhi gnas dang / lhag mthong gi lam gyi ngo bo nyid ni 'jig rten pa dang / 'jig rten las 'das @137b pa thams cad la yang yod de /
translated: Here, the noble being Subhūti, in order to eliminate the doubts of those who think, “The essence of the path of śamatha and vipaśyanā that is subsumed by Subhūti exists for all mundane and transcendent states.

original: de la 'jig rten pa ni sa 'og ma'i rags pa nyid la gnas shing sa gong ma'i zhi ba nyid la gnas shing sbyor bar byed /
analyzed: de la 'jig rten pa ni sa 'og ma'i rags pa nyid la gnas shing sa gong ma'i zhi ba nyid la gnas shing sbyor bar byed /
translated: In that regard, the mundane path is the application of abiding in the coarseness of lower levels and abiding in the peacefulness of higher levels.

original: 'jig rten las 'das pa theg pa gnyis ni 'khor ba'i nyes dmigs la gnas shing mya ngan las 'das pa'i phan yon la brten te sbyor bar byed na /
analyzed: 'jig rten las 'das pa theg pa gnyis ni 'khor ba'i nyes dmigs la gnas shing mya ngan las 'das pa'i phan yon la brten te sbyor bar byed na /
translated: The transcendent path of the two vehicles is the application of abiding in the faults of samsara and relying on the benefits of nirvana.

original: 'jig rten las 'das pa'i theg pa chen po la rnal 'byor pa rnam pa ci la gnas shing ci la brten te rnal 'byor gyis yongs su bsdus pa'i zhi gnas dang lhag mthong gi lam gyi ngo bo nyid la sbyor bar byed snyam du sems pa rnams kyi
analyzed: 'jig rten las 'das pa'i theg pa chen po la rnal 'byor pa rnam pa ci la gnas shing ci la brten te rnal 'byor gyis yongs su bsdus pa'i zhi gnas dang lhag mthong gi lam gyi ngo bo nyid la sbyor bar byed snyam du sems pa rnams kyi
translated: In the transcendent Mahāyāna, what do yogins and yoginīs abide in and rely on to apply themselves to the essence of the path of śamatha and vipaśyanā that is subsumed by yoga?”🔽The reply to that is as follows.

original: bsam pa la brtags nas /
analyzed: bsam pa la brtags nas /
translated: Having examined the thought,

original: bcom ldan 'das byang chub sems dpa' ci la gnas ci la brten te /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das byang chub sems dpa' ci la gnas ci la brten te /
translated: the Lord, the Blessed One, was asked, “On what do bodhisattvas stand and rely in order to

original: theg pa chen po la zhi gnas dang lhag mthong sgom par bgyid lags zhes zhus par sbyar ro //
analyzed: theg pa chen po la zhi gnas dang lhag mthong sgom par bgyid lags zhes zhus par sbyar ro //
translated: cultivate serenity and insight in the Great Vehicle?”

original: de la ci la gnas zhes bya bas ni gnas kyi sbyor ba'i rgyu gang lags zhes zhus pa yin te /
analyzed: de la ci la gnas zhes bya bas ni gnas kyi sbyor ba'i rgyu gang lags zhes zhus pa yin te /
translated: There, “on what do they stand?” asks about the cause of application to the basis.

original: des ni thabs kyi rgyu bstan to /
analyzed: des ni thabs kyi rgyu bstan to /
translated: That shows the cause of the means.

original: ci la brten te zhes bya bas ni 'jig rten gyi sbyor ba'i rgyu gang lags zhes zhus pa yin te /
analyzed: ci la brten te zhes bya bas ni 'jig rten gyi sbyor ba'i rgyu gang lags zhes zhus pa yin te /
translated: “On what do they rely?” asks about the cause of mundane application.

original: des ni chud mi za ba'i rgyu ston to //
analyzed: des ni chud mi za ba'i rgyu ston to //
translated: That shows the cause of non-wastage.

original: theg pa chen po la zhes bya ba ni byang chub sems dpa'i lam 'bras bu dang bcas pa la zhes bya ba'i tha tshig ste /
analyzed: theg pa chen po la zhes bya ba ni byang chub sems dpa'i lam 'bras bu dang bcas pa la zhes bya ba'i tha tshig ste /
translated: “In the Great Vehicle” means in the bodhisattva path with its result.

original: des ni 'jig rten pa dang / theg pa gnyis las khyad par du 'phags pa'i lam ston to //
analyzed: des ni 'jig rten pa dang / theg pa gnyis las khyad par du 'phags pa'i lam ston to //
translated: That shows the path that is superior to the mundane and the two vehicles.

original: zhi gnas dang lhag mthong zhes bya ba ni lhag pa'i tshul khrims dang / rigs pa bzhis yongs su bsdus pa'i sems dang / lhag pa'i shes rab ces bya ba'i tha tshig ste /
analyzed: zhi gnas dang lhag mthong zhes bya ba ni lhag pa'i tshul khrims dang / rigs pa bzhis yongs su bsdus pa'i sems dang / lhag pa'i shes rab ces bya ba'i tha tshig ste /
translated: Tranquility and insight are synonymous with superior morality, superior thought, and superior wisdom, which are included in the four thorough investigations.

original: des ni rnal 'byor gyis yongs su bsdus pa'i zhi gnas dang / lhag mthong gi lam gyi ngo bo nyid ston to //
analyzed: des ni rnal 'byor gyis yongs su bsdus pa'i zhi gnas dang / lhag mthong gi lam gyi ngo bo nyid ston to //
translated: This shows the nature of the path of tranquility and insight, which is included in the yoga of meditative equipoise.

original: sgom par bgyid pa lags zhes bya ba ni lam kyi ngo bo nyid de la ji ltar sbyor bar bgyid ces zhus pa yin te /
analyzed: sgom par bgyid pa lags zhes bya ba ni lam kyi ngo bo nyid de la ji ltar sbyor bar bgyid ces zhus pa yin te /
translated: The phrase one practices means how does one apply oneself to the nature of the path?

original: des ni lam gyi ngo bo nyid la rnal 'byor du byed pa ston to //
analyzed: des ni lam gyi ngo bo nyid la rnal 'byor du byed pa ston to //
translated: This shows the yoga of the nature of the path.

original: de nas bcom ldan 'das kyis kyang de dag bstan pa'i dbang du mdzad nas /
analyzed: de nas bcom ldan 'das kyis kyang de dag bstan pa'i dbang du mdzad nas /
translated: Then, the Lord, in order to teach those topics, said,

original: byams pa chos gdags pa rnam par gzhag pa dang / bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu smon lam mi gtong ba la gnas shing brten nas so zhes bya ba gsungs te /
analyzed: byams pa chos gdags pa rnam par gzhag pa dang / bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu smon lam mi gtong ba la gnas shing brten nas so zhes bya ba gsungs te /
translated: Maitreya, it is based on and relies upon the establishment of the designation of phenomena and the aspiration for unsurpassed, complete enlightenment.

original: chos gdags pa rnam par gzhag pa la ni gnas /
analyzed: chos gdags pa rnam par gzhag pa la ni gnas /
translated: One relies on the foundation of the system of teaching the Dharma.

original: bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu smon lam mi gtong ba la ni brten te /🔽theg pa chen po la rnam 'byor gyis yongs @138a * //
analyzed: bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu smon lam mi gtong ba la ni brten te / theg pa chen po la rnam 'byor gyis yongs @138a * //
translated: One relies on not forsaking the aspiration for unsurpassed, perfect enlightenment.

original: su bsdus pa'i zhi gnas dang / lhag mthong gi lam gyi ngo bo nyid bsgom par bya'o zhes bya bar sbyar ro //
analyzed: su bsdus pa'i zhi gnas dang / lhag mthong gi lam gyi ngo bo nyid bsgom par bya'o zhes bya bar sbyar ro //
translated: One should cultivate the essence of the path of serenity and insight that is included in the practice of the Great Vehicle.

original: des ci bstan ce na /
analyzed: des ci bstan ce na /
translated: What does this passage teach?

original: chos gdags pa rnam par gzhag pa ni bshad pa'i chos kyi tshogs yin pa'i phyir de la gnas pa ni 'jig rten pa las 'das pa'i go 'phang thob pa'i sngon du 'gro ba yin pas /
analyzed: chos gdags pa rnam par gzhag pa ni bshad pa'i chos kyi tshogs yin pa'i phyir de la gnas pa ni 'jig rten pa las 'das pa'i go 'phang thob pa'i sngon du 'gro ba yin pas /
translated: The system of teaching the Dharma is the collection of teachings that are explained. Therefore, relying on it is the prerequisite for attaining the supramundane stage.

original: de ni 'jig rten pa'i gnas dang rten gyi sbyor ba'i rgyu las khyad par du 'phags pa'i gnas kyi sbyor ba'i rgyu yin la /
analyzed: de ni 'jig rten pa'i gnas dang rten gyi sbyor ba'i rgyu las khyad par du 'phags pa'i gnas kyi sbyor ba'i rgyu yin la /
translated: This is the cause of the practice of the foundation that is superior to the mundane cause of the practice of the foundation.

original: bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub ni rtogs pa'i chos kyi sku yin pa'i phyir /
analyzed: bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub ni rtogs pa'i chos kyi sku yin pa'i phyir /
translated: Unsurpassed, perfect enlightenment is the Dharma body of realization.

original: der smon lam mi gtong ba ni byang chub chen por 'dren par byed pa'i chos kyi sngon du 'gro ba yin pas de ni theg pa gnyis kyi gnas dang rten gyi sbyor ba'i rgyu las khyad par du 'phags pa'i rten gyi sbyor ba'i rgyu yin no zhes ston🔽to // de la chos gdags pa rnam par gzhag pa zhes bya ba ni lung las sangs rgyas dang byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi gdags pa rnam par gzhag pa ni rnam pa bzhi ste /
analyzed: der smon lam mi gtong ba ni byang chub chen por 'dren par byed pa'i chos kyi sngon du 'gro ba yin pas de ni theg pa gnyis kyi gnas dang rten gyi sbyor ba'i rgyu las khyad par du 'phags pa'i rten gyi sbyor ba'i rgyu yin no zhes ston to // de la chos gdags pa rnam par gzhag pa zhes bya ba ni lung las sangs rgyas dang byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi gdags pa rnam par gzhag pa ni rnam pa bzhi ste /
translated: Since not making prayers is a prerequisite for the Dharma that leads to great enlightenment, it is a cause of application to the support that is superior to the cause of application to the support and basis of the two vehicles.

original: chos gdags pa rnam par gzhag pa dang / bden pa gdags pa rnam par gzhag pa dang / rigs gdags pa rnam par gzhag pa dang / theg pa gdags pa rnam par gzhag pa ste /🔽de dag ni de bzhin gshegs pa'am /
analyzed: chos gdags pa rnam par gzhag pa dang / bden pa gdags pa rnam par gzhag pa dang / rigs gdags pa rnam par gzhag pa dang / theg pa gdags pa rnam par gzhag pa ste / de dag ni de bzhin gshegs pa'am /
translated: The presentation of the designation of phenomena is as follows: The presentation of the designation of phenomena, the presentation of the designation of the truths, the presentation of the designation of lineages and the presentation of the designation of vehicles.

original: byang chub sems dpa' kho na yang dag par 'dogs shing rnam par 'jog par mdzad kyi /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' kho na yang dag par 'dogs shing rnam par 'jog par mdzad kyi /
translated: These are correctly designated and presented by the Tathagata or by bodhisattvas alone.

original: lhar gyur pa'am /
analyzed: lhar gyur pa'am /
translated: They are not designated by gods or by those who are not aryas.

original: mir gyur pa'am /
analyzed: mir gyur pa'am /
translated: No one else can do this, not even a human being,

original: dge sbyong dang / bram zer gyur pa gzhan gang gis kyang mi nus /
analyzed: dge sbyong dang / bram zer gyur pa gzhan gang gis kyang mi nus /
translated: not even a śramaṇa or a brāhmaṇa.

original: de dag nyid las thob pa ni ma gtogs so zhes gsungs pa las chos gdags pa rnam par gzhag pa dang zhes bya ba dang sbyar te /
analyzed: de dag nyid las thob pa ni ma gtogs so zhes gsungs pa las chos gdags pa rnam par gzhag pa dang zhes bya ba dang sbyar te /
translated: This is connected with the statement, “The establishment of the designation of teachings.

original: mdo'i sde la sogs pa gsung rab tu gtogs pa yan lag bcu gnyis po go rims bzhin du sbyar ba dang / go rims bzhin du rnam par gzhag cing bsdeb pa gang yin pa de ni chos gdags pa rnam par gzhag pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: mdo'i sde la sogs pa gsung rab tu gtogs pa yan lag bcu gnyis po go rims bzhin du sbyar ba dang / go rims bzhin du rnam par gzhag cing bsdeb pa gang yin pa de ni chos gdags pa rnam par gzhag pa zhes bya'o //
translated: ” The establishment and arrangement of the twelve branches of the scriptures, such as the discourses, in their proper order is called “the establishment of the designation of teachings.”

original: de la gnas pa zhes bya ba ni de dag byang chub sems dpas legs par thos /
analyzed: de la gnas pa zhes bya ba ni de dag byang chub sems dpas legs par thos /
translated: “Abiding in them” means that the bodhisattva has heard them well,

original: legs par gzung /
analyzed: legs par gzung /
translated: has grasped them well,

original: kha thon byang bar byas /🔽yid kyis legs par brtags /
analyzed: kha thon byang bar byas / yid kyis legs par brtags /
translated: has mastered them through recitation,🔽has examined them well with his mind,

original: mthong bas shin tu rtogs par byas pa'o //
analyzed: mthong bas shin tu rtogs par byas pa'o //
translated: and has understood them well through insight.

original: de la gnas nas 'khor bar srid pa dang / longs spyod la sogs par yongs su mi bsngo zhing 'jig rten las 'das @138b pa'i lam la sbyor bar byed pas na /
analyzed: de la gnas nas 'khor bar srid pa dang / longs spyod la sogs par yongs su mi bsngo zhing 'jig rten las 'das @138b pa'i lam la sbyor bar byed pas na /
translated: Abiding in that, one does not dedicate to cyclic existence or to enjoyments, etc., but rather one applies oneself to the supramundane path.

original: de ni 'jig rten pa las khyad par du 'phags pa'i gnas kyi zhi gnas dang lhag mthong gi lam la sbyor ba'i rgyu bstan to //
analyzed: de ni 'jig rten pa las khyad par du 'phags pa'i gnas kyi zhi gnas dang lhag mthong gi lam la sbyor ba'i rgyu bstan to //
translated: Thus, it shows the cause of applying oneself to the path of serenity and insight that is superior to the mundane.

original: bla na med pa zhes bya ba ni bla na med pa drug ste /
analyzed: bla na med pa zhes bya ba ni bla na med pa drug ste /
translated: Unsurpassed means the six unsurpassed:

original: mthong ba bla na med pa dang / thos pa bla na med pa dang / rnyed pa bla na med pa dang / bslab pa bla na med pa dang / rim gro bla na med pa dang / rjes su dran pa bla na med pa'o //
analyzed: mthong ba bla na med pa dang / thos pa bla na med pa dang / rnyed pa bla na med pa dang / bslab pa bla na med pa dang / rim gro bla na med pa dang / rjes su dran pa bla na med pa'o //
translated: unsurpassed seeing, unsurpassed hearing, unsurpassed attainment, unsurpassed training, unsurpassed service, and unsurpassed recollection.

original: yang dag par rdzogs pa zhes bya ba ni chos thams cad kyi ngo bo nyid ma nor ba zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: yang dag par rdzogs pa zhes bya ba ni chos thams cad kyi ngo bo nyid ma nor ba zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: Perfect enlightenment means the non-erroneous nature of all phenomena.

original: byang chub ces bya ba ni rtogs pa'i don to /
analyzed: byang chub ces bya ba ni rtogs pa'i don to /
translated: Awakening means the meaning of realization.

original: der smon lam mi gtong ba zhes bya ba ni dang po bla na med pa'i byang chub tu sems bskyed pa'i mtshan nyid lnga po yang dag pa'i smon lam dang po ngo bo nyid dang / bdag gi byang chub dang / sems can gyi don bsgrubs pa'i rnam pa dang /
analyzed: der smon lam mi gtong ba zhes bya ba ni dang po bla na med pa'i byang chub tu sems bskyed pa'i mtshan nyid lnga po yang dag pa'i smon lam dang po ngo bo nyid dang / bdag gi byang chub dang / sems can gyi don bsgrubs pa'i rnam pa dang /
translated: The first of the five characteristics of generating the first generation of the unsurpassed bodhichitta is the nature of the perfect aspiration, which is called not to abandon aspiration.🔽The aspect is the accomplishment of one's enlightenment and the benefit of sentient beings.🔽The focal object is the unsurpassed enlightenment and all sentient beings.🔽The prerequisite is the collection of all roots of virtue that are conducive to enlightenment.

original: bla na med pa'i byang chub dang / sems can thams cad la dmigs pa'i dmigs pa dang / byang chub kyi phyogs dang mthun pa'i dge ba'i rtsa ba thams cad bsdus pa'i sngon du 'gro ba dang / sems can thams cad la brten pa'i lus dang ngag dang yid kyi nyes par spyod pa dang mi mthun pa'i yon tan dang /
analyzed: bla na med pa'i byang chub dang / sems can thams cad la dmigs pa'i dmigs pa dang / byang chub kyi phyogs dang mthun pa'i dge ba'i rtsa ba thams cad bsdus pa'i sngon du 'gro ba dang / sems can thams cad la brten pa'i lus dang ngag dang yid kyi nyes par spyod pa dang mi mthun pa'i yon tan dang /
translated: The qualities that are incompatible with physical, verbal, and mental misdeeds in relation to all sentient beings.

original: de las gzhan pa 'jig rten pa dang / 'jig rten las 'das pa'i don dag la yang dag pa'i smon pa'i dge ba de dag thams cad kyi nang na yang dag pa'i smon lam gyi mchog bla na med pas khyad par du 'phags pa dang ldan pa'i byang chub kyi sems rtag tu rgyun mi 'chad bar
analyzed: de las gzhan pa 'jig rten pa dang / 'jig rten las 'das pa'i don dag la yang dag pa'i smon pa'i dge ba de dag thams cad kyi nang na yang dag pa'i smon lam gyi mchog bla na med pas khyad par du 'phags pa dang ldan pa'i byang chub kyi sems rtag tu rgyun mi 'chad bar
translated: In addition to that, among all the virtues of correct aspiration for mundane and supramundane aims, the bodhisattva spirit is the highest, the unsurpassed, the most excellent correct aspiration.

original: bsam pa thag pa nas skyed par byed pa'o //
analyzed: bsam pa thag pa nas skyed par byed pa'o //
translated: He always generates it from the very depths of his heart.

original: de la brten nas so zhes bya ba ni de ltar bla na med pa'i byang chub kyi sems mi bskyed pa la nyan thos dang rang sangs rgyas kyi yid la byed pa'i go mi 'byed pa'i tshul gyis brten nas so //
analyzed: de la brten nas so zhes bya ba ni de ltar bla na med pa'i byang chub kyi sems mi bskyed pa la nyan thos dang rang sangs rgyas kyi yid la byed pa'i go mi 'byed pa'i tshul gyis brten nas so //
translated: In dependence on that, means in dependence on not opening the door to the attentions of the Disciples and Solitary Sages, which would prevent the generation of the unsurpassed spirit of enlightenment.

original: de la brten nas sems can gyi don yal bar mi 'dor zhing /
analyzed: de la brten nas sems can gyi don yal bar mi 'dor zhing /
translated: In dependence on that, he does not neglect the aims of sentient beings.

original: mya ngan las 'das pa la mngon du phyogs pa la sogs par yongs su mi bsngo zhing bla na med pa'i byang chub kyi lam la sbyor bar byed pas na /
analyzed: mya ngan las 'das pa la mngon du phyogs pa la sogs par yongs su mi bsngo zhing bla na med pa'i byang chub kyi lam la sbyor bar byed pas na /
translated: He does not dedicate them to the approach of nirvana, and so on, but rather to the unsurpassed enlightenment path.

original: de ni theg pa gnyis las khyad par du 'phags pa'i rten gyi zhi gnas dang / lhag mthong gi lam la sbyor ba'i rgyu yin te /
analyzed: de ni theg pa gnyis las khyad par du 'phags pa'i rten gyi zhi gnas dang / lhag mthong gi lam la sbyor ba'i rgyu yin te /
translated: It is the cause of application to the path of serenity and insight which is superior to the two vehicles.

original: des ni chud mi za ba'i rgyu bstan to /
analyzed: des ni chud mi za ba'i rgyu bstan to /
translated: Thus, it shows the cause of non-wastage.

original: de ltar na chos gdags pa rnam par gzhag pa la ni gnas /
analyzed: de ltar na chos gdags pa rnam par gzhag pa la ni gnas /
translated: Thus, one abides in the establishment of the designation of the Dharma.

original: bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu smon lam mi @139a * //
analyzed: bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu smon lam mi @139a * //
translated: One does not abandon the aspiration for supreme perfect enlightenment.

original: gtong ba ni rten te /
analyzed: gtong ba ni rten te /
translated: This is the basis.

original: theg pa chen po la zhi gnas dang / lhag mthong gi lam gyi ngo bo nyid bsgom par bya'o zhes bstan pa yin te /
analyzed: theg pa chen po la zhi gnas dang / lhag mthong gi lam gyi ngo bo nyid bsgom par bya'o zhes bstan pa yin te /
translated: One should cultivate the essence of the path of serenity and insight in the Great Vehicle.

original: de ni gnas kyi sbyor ba'i rgyu dang / rten gyi sbyor ba'i rgyu bstan pa yin no //
analyzed: de ni gnas kyi sbyor ba'i rgyu dang / rten gyi sbyor ba'i rgyu bstan pa yin no //
translated: Thus, it shows the cause of application to the basis and the cause of application to the object.

original: de'i 'og tu dmigs pas sbyor ba'i rgyu bstan pa'i tshig gi don la sogs pa bshad par bya ste /
analyzed: de'i 'og tu dmigs pas sbyor ba'i rgyu bstan pa'i tshig gi don la sogs pa bshad par bya ste /
translated: After that, the meaning of the words of the teaching on the cause of application to the object should be explained.

original: de la mtshams sbyor ba ji lta bu zhe na /
analyzed: de la mtshams sbyor ba ji lta bu zhe na /
translated: What is the connection here?

original: 'dir 'phags pa byams pas gzhan dag 'di snyam du /
analyzed: 'dir 'phags pa byams pas gzhan dag 'di snyam du /
translated: Here, the noble Maitreya thinks that others might think:

original: de ltar gnas dang rten gyi sbyor ba'i rgyu bstan pas rnal 'byor gyis yongs su bsdus pa'i zhi gnas dang / lhag mthong gi lam gyi ngo bo nyid la sbyor ba'i thabs dang chud mi za ba'i rgyu bstan du zin kyang de ni dmigs pa'i dngos po la brten te skye ba yin pas bde bar gshegs pas kyang mdo sde de dang de dag tu dmigs pa'i dngos po
analyzed: de ltar gnas dang rten gyi sbyor ba'i rgyu bstan pas rnal 'byor gyis yongs su bsdus pa'i zhi gnas dang / lhag mthong gi lam gyi ngo bo nyid la sbyor ba'i thabs dang chud mi za ba'i rgyu bstan du zin kyang de ni dmigs pa'i dngos po la brten te skye ba yin pas bde bar gshegs pas kyang mdo sde de dang de dag tu dmigs pa'i dngos po
translated: Thus, the causes of the application of the basis and support have been explained. Although the method of application to the essence of the path of śamatha and vipaśyanā that is included in yoga and the cause of not wasting it have been explained, since that arises in dependence on the thing that is the object of meditation, the Sugata also taught the thing that is the object of meditation in this and that sūtra.

original: rnam pa bzhi bka' stsal te /
analyzed: rnam pa bzhi bka' stsal te /
translated: Thus, since the causes of the application of the basis and support have been taught, although the method of application to the essence of the path of śamatha and vipaśyanā that are included in yoga and the cause of non-wastage have been taught, since that arises in dependence on the object of observation, the Sugata also taught the four types of objects of observation in this and that sūtra.

original: bzhi gang zhe na /
analyzed: bzhi gang zhe na /
translated: What are the four?

original: khyab pa'i dmigs pa dang / spyad pa'i rnam par sbyong ba'i dmigs pa dang / mkhas pa'i dmigs pa dang / nyon mongs pa rnam par sbyong ba'i dmigs pa'o //
analyzed: khyab pa'i dmigs pa dang / spyad pa'i rnam par sbyong ba'i dmigs pa dang / mkhas pa'i dmigs pa dang / nyon mongs pa rnam par sbyong ba'i dmigs pa'o //
translated: The pervasive object of observation, the object of observation for purifying behavior, the object of observation for expertise, and the object of observation for purifying afflictions.

original: de la khyab pa'i dmigs pa gang zhe na /
analyzed: de la khyab pa'i dmigs pa gang zhe na /
translated: What is the pervasive object of observation?

original: de yang rnam pa bzhi ste /
analyzed: de yang rnam pa bzhi ste /
translated: It is also of four types.

original: rnam par rtog pa dang bcas pa'i gzugs brnyan dang / rnam par mi rtog pa'i gzugs brnyan dang / dngos po'i mtha' dang / dgos pa yongs su grub pa'o //
analyzed: rnam par rtog pa dang bcas pa'i gzugs brnyan dang / rnam par mi rtog pa'i gzugs brnyan dang / dngos po'i mtha' dang / dgos pa yongs su grub pa'o //
translated: the reflected image with conceptualization, the reflected image without conceptualization, the limit of existence, and the accomplishment of the aim.

original: spyad pa rnam par sbyong ba'i dmigs pa gang zhe na /
analyzed: spyad pa rnam par sbyong ba'i dmigs pa gang zhe na /
translated: What is the object of the purification of the practice?

original: de ni rnam pa lnga ste /
analyzed: de ni rnam pa lnga ste /
translated: It is fivefold:

original: mi sdug pa dang / byams pa dang / rkyen 'di pa nyid kyi rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba dang / khams rab tu dbye ba dang / dbugs rngub pa dang / dbugs 'byung ba dran pa'o //
analyzed: mi sdug pa dang / byams pa dang / rkyen 'di pa nyid kyi rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba dang / khams rab tu dbye ba dang / dbugs rngub pa dang / dbugs 'byung ba dran pa'o //
translated: the unpleasant, loving kindness, the dependent origination of this very condition, the classification of the elements, and mindfulness of breathing.

original: mkhas pa'i dmigs pa gang zhe na /
analyzed: mkhas pa'i dmigs pa gang zhe na /
translated: What is the object of skill?

original: de yang rnam pa lnga ste ;
analyzed: de yang rnam pa lnga ste ;
translated: It is fivefold:

original: phung po la mkhas pa dang / khams la mkhas pa dang / skye mched la mkhas pa dang / rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba la mkhas pa dang / gnas dang gnas ma yin pa la mkhas pa'o //
analyzed: phung po la mkhas pa dang / khams la mkhas pa dang / skye mched la mkhas pa dang / rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba la mkhas pa dang / gnas dang gnas ma yin pa la mkhas pa'o //
translated: skill in the aggregates, skill in the elements, skill in the sense-fields, skill in the dependent origination, and skill in what is possible and impossible.

original: nyon mongs pa rnam par sbyong ba'i dmigs pa gang zhe na /
analyzed: nyon mongs pa rnam par sbyong ba'i dmigs pa gang zhe na /
translated: What is the object of the purification of the cankers?

original: de ni 'jig rten pa dang 'jig rten las 'das pa'i lam gyi bye brag gis rnam pa gnyis te /
analyzed: de ni 'jig rten pa dang 'jig rten las 'das pa'i lam gyi bye brag gis rnam pa gnyis te /
translated: It is twofold, due to the specific distinction of mundane and transcendent paths.

original: 'jig rten pa'i lam gyis nyon mongs pa rnam par sbyong ba'i dmigs pa yang rnam pa gnyis te /
analyzed: 'jig rten pa'i lam gyis nyon mongs pa rnam par sbyong ba'i dmigs pa yang rnam pa gnyis te /
translated: The object of observation for purifying afflictions by the mundane path is also twofold:

original: sa 'og ma rnams la rags par lta ba dang / sa gong ma rnams la zhi bar lta ba'o //
analyzed: sa 'og ma rnams la rags par lta ba dang / sa gong ma rnams la zhi bar lta ba'o //
translated: viewing lower levels as coarse and viewing higher levels as peaceful.

original: 'jig rten las 'das pa'i lam gyis nyon mongs pa rnam par @139b sbyong ba'i dmigs pa yang rnam pa gnyis te /
analyzed: 'jig rten las 'das pa'i lam gyis nyon mongs pa rnam par @139b sbyong ba'i dmigs pa yang rnam pa gnyis te /
translated: The object of observation for purifying afflictions by the transcendent path is also twofold:

original: rnam par bzhag pa'i bden pa la dmigs pa dang / rnam par ma bzhag pa'i bden pa la dmigs pa ste /
analyzed: rnam par bzhag pa'i bden pa la dmigs pa dang / rnam par ma bzhag pa'i bden pa la dmigs pa ste /
translated: the object of observation of the truth of the four truths that are posited and the object of observation of the truth of the four truths that are not posited.

original: de ltar dmigs pa rnam pa bzhi po de dag gang la dmigs te /
analyzed: de ltar dmigs pa rnam pa bzhi po de dag gang la dmigs te /
translated: Thus, what is the object of observation of those four types of objects of observation?

original: rnal 'byor gyis yongs su bsdus pa'i zhi gnas dang lhag mthong gi lam gyi ngo bo nyid de la sbyar bar bya zhing dmigs pa gang ni lam gang gi dmigs pa yin snyam du sems pa rnams kyi bsam pa la brtags nas /🔽mi pham pa nyid kyis khyab pa'i dmigs pa ni 'jig rten pa dang 'jig rten las 'das pa'i lam thams cad du 'gro zhing /
analyzed: rnal 'byor gyis yongs su bsdus pa'i zhi gnas dang lhag mthong gi lam gyi ngo bo nyid de la sbyar bar bya zhing dmigs pa gang ni lam gang gi dmigs pa yin snyam du sems pa rnams kyi bsam pa la brtags nas / mi pham pa nyid kyis khyab pa'i dmigs pa ni 'jig rten pa dang 'jig rten las 'das pa'i lam thams cad du 'gro zhing /
translated: The meaning of the phrase the object of observation of the path of the yoga of individual knowledge of the aspects is the entity of the path of serenity and insight that is included within the yoga of individual knowledge of the aspects.🔽 The phrase the object of observation of the path of the yoga of individual knowledge of the aspects is to be applied to the entity of the path of
