analyzed: dmigs pa de la brten te skyes pa'i zhi gnas dang lhag mthong ni mnyam par gzhag pa'i sa pa'i sems las byung ba'i ting nge 'dzin dang / shes rab kyi ngo bo nyid yin pa'i phyir gzugs brnyan gyi dmigs pa kun gzhi'i rnam par shes pa'i ngo bo nyid de ni zhi gnas dang lhag mthong de ni sems las byung ba'i ngo bo nyid de'i gnas kyi dngos po zhes bya ste /
translated: Therefore, that reflected image, which is the essence of the store consciousness, is the meditative object, and that serenity and insight, which are the essence of the mental factors, are the basis of the meditative object.

original: de'i phyir gzugs brnyan de ni dmigs pa dang gnas kyi dngos po zhes bya'o //
analyzed: de'i phyir gzugs brnyan de ni dmigs pa dang gnas kyi dngos po zhes bya'o //
translated: Therefore, that reflected image is called the meditative object and the basis of the meditative object.

original: de la ci'i phyir dngos po de'i ji snyed yod pa nyid dang / ji lta ba bzhin du yod pa nyid la mtha' zhes bya zhe na /
analyzed: de la ci'i phyir dngos po de'i ji snyed yod pa nyid dang / ji lta ba bzhin du yod pa nyid la mtha' zhes bya zhe na /
translated: Why is the existence of that entity in its entirety and as it really is called the limit?

original: de tsam gyis ni rnam grangs kyi mthar phyin pa dang / mtshan nyid kyi mthar phyin par gyur pa'i phyir te /
analyzed: de tsam gyis ni rnam grangs kyi mthar phyin pa dang / mtshan nyid kyi mthar phyin par gyur pa'i phyir te /
translated: Because one has reached the limit of enumeration and the limit of the characteristics by that alone.

original: de la ji snyed yod pa nyid ces bya ba ni rnam grangs te /
analyzed: de la ji snyed yod pa nyid ces bya ba ni rnam grangs te /
translated: The term “the existence of all things” is a synonym for the latter.

original: dper na phung po ni lnga kho nar zad de /
analyzed: dper na phung po ni lnga kho nar zad de /
translated: For example, the aggregates are only five in number,

original: de dag gis 'dus byas thams cad bsdus so //
analyzed: de dag gis 'dus byas thams cad bsdus so //
translated: and they include all conditioned things.

original: khams ni bco brgyad kho na'o //
analyzed: khams ni bco brgyad kho na'o //
translated: The elements are only eighteen in number,

original: skye mched ni bcu gnyis kho na ste /
analyzed: skye mched ni bcu gnyis kho na ste /
translated: and the sense bases are only twelve in number,

original: de dag gis ni 'dus byas dang 'dus ma byas kyi chos thams cad bsdus so //
analyzed: de dag gis ni 'dus byas dang 'dus ma byas kyi chos thams cad bsdus so //
translated: and they include all conditioned and unconditioned things.

original: 'phags pa'i bden pa ni bzhi kho na ste /
analyzed: 'phags pa'i bden pa ni bzhi kho na ste /
translated: The noble truths are only four in number,

original: de dag gis ni shes @146a * //
analyzed: de dag gis ni shes @146a * //
translated: and they include all things that should be known.

original: bya'i dngos po thams cad bsdus so zhes bya ba ni ji snyed yod pa nyid do //
analyzed: bya'i dngos po thams cad bsdus so zhes bya ba ni ji snyed yod pa nyid do //
translated: This is called “the existence of all things.”

original: ji lta ba bzhin du yod pa nyid ni mtshan nyid de /
analyzed: ji lta ba bzhin du yod pa nyid ni mtshan nyid de /
translated: The existence of things as they really are is their characteristics.

original: dper na ji snyed yod pa nyid kyi rnam pa de dag gis yang dag pa nyid dang / de bzhin nyid rigs pa bzhi dang ldan pa ni ji lta ba bzhin du yod pa nyid ces bya'o //
analyzed: dper na ji snyed yod pa nyid kyi rnam pa de dag gis yang dag pa nyid dang / de bzhin nyid rigs pa bzhi dang ldan pa ni ji lta ba bzhin du yod pa nyid ces bya'o //
translated: For example, the reality and suchness that are characterized by the aspects of the existence of all things and that are endowed with the four principles for examining the scriptures is called “the existence of things as they really are.”

original: de dang 'dra bar 'dir yang kun gzhi'i rnam par shes pa'i 'jug pa rnam par gzhag pa'i rnam grangs ji snyed pa thams cad ni ji snyed pa yod pa nyid do //
analyzed: de dang 'dra bar 'dir yang kun gzhi'i rnam par shes pa'i 'jug pa rnam par gzhag pa'i rnam grangs ji snyed pa thams cad ni ji snyed pa yod pa nyid do //
translated: In the same way, here, all the categories that are posited as the operations of the store consciousness are just the way things really are in their variety.

original: ldog pa rnam par gzhag pa'i mtshan nyid ci 'dra ba ni ji lta ba bzhin du yod pa nyid ces bya ste /
analyzed: ldog pa rnam par gzhag pa'i mtshan nyid ci 'dra ba ni ji lta ba bzhin du yod pa nyid ces bya ste /
translated: The definition of the way things really are in its aspect of exclusion is just the way things really are as it is.

original: de tsam gyis na dngos po de'i mthar phyin pa'i phyir ji snyed yod pa nyid dang / ji lta ba bzhin du yod pa nyid ni dngos po de'i mtha' zhes bya'o //
analyzed: de tsam gyis na dngos po de'i mthar phyin pa'i phyir ji snyed yod pa nyid dang / ji lta ba bzhin du yod pa nyid ni dngos po de'i mtha' zhes bya'o //
translated: Since that much is the limit of that entity, the way things really are in its aspect of variety and the way things really are as it is are called the limit of that entity.

original: de yang gang gi dus na dngos po de'i mthar gyur pa yin zhe na /
analyzed: de yang gang gi dus na dngos po de'i mthar gyur pa yin zhe na /
translated: And when does that entity become the limit?

original: gang gi tshe kun gzhi'i rnam par shes pa gnas gyur pa de'i tshe na dngos po de'i rnam grangs dang mtshan nyid kyi mthar gyur pa yin no //
analyzed: gang gi tshe kun gzhi'i rnam par shes pa gnas gyur pa de'i tshe na dngos po de'i rnam grangs dang mtshan nyid kyi mthar gyur pa yin no //
translated: When the store consciousness is transformed, then that entity becomes the limit of its categories and its characteristics.

original: de ltar na dmigs pa dang gnas kyi dngos po'i mtha' gnas gyur pa'i ngo bo nyid ni dngos po'i mtha' zhes bya ste /
analyzed: de ltar na dmigs pa dang gnas kyi dngos po'i mtha' gnas gyur pa'i ngo bo nyid ni dngos po'i mtha' zhes bya ste /
translated: Thus, the nature of the transformation of the extremes of objective supports and their bases is called the extreme of things.

original: de ni spangs pa phun sum tshogs pa yin no //
analyzed: de ni spangs pa phun sum tshogs pa yin no //
translated: That is the perfection of abandonment.

original: de yang gang gis rab tu phye ba yin zhe na /
analyzed: de yang gang gis rab tu phye ba yin zhe na /
translated: By what is it distinguished?

original: zhi gnas dang lhag mthong zung du 'brel pas rab tu phye ba yin te /
analyzed: zhi gnas dang lhag mthong zung du 'brel pas rab tu phye ba yin te /
translated: It is distinguished by the union of serenity and insight.

original: gang gi tshe zung du 'brel ba'i lam skyes pa de'i tshe na gnas gyur pa thob pa yin la /
analyzed: gang gi tshe zung du 'brel ba'i lam skyes pa de'i tshe na gnas gyur pa thob pa yin la /
translated: When the path of union arises, then the transformation is attained.🔽And since the suchness of the transformation is the objective support of the path of union, the attainment of the objective support of the transformation and the arising of the path of union occur at the same time.

original: gnas gyur pa'i de bzhin nyid de yang zung du 'brel ba'i lam gyi dmigs pa yin pas gnas gyur pa'i dmigs pa 'thob pa dang zung du 'brel pa'i lam skye ba ni 'byung ba'i dus kyang gcig ngo bo nyid dang gcig pas na zung du 'brel pas rab🔽tu phye ba zhes bya ste /
analyzed: gnas gyur pa'i de bzhin nyid de yang zung du 'brel ba'i lam gyi dmigs pa yin pas gnas gyur pa'i dmigs pa 'thob pa dang zung du 'brel pa'i lam skye ba ni 'byung ba'i dus kyang gcig ngo bo nyid dang gcig pas na zung du 'brel pas rab tu phye ba zhes bya ste /
translated: Since they are the same in nature, it is distinguished by union.

original: de ni dngos po'i mtha' yin no //
analyzed: de ni dngos po'i mtha' yin no //
translated: That is the extreme of things.

original: dgos pa yongs su grub pa zhes bya ba ni zung du 'brel pas rab tu phye ba sbyor ba mthar thug pa'i 'bras bu'i yid la byed pa yongs su grub pa yang dag pa'i shes pa'i ngo bo nyid yin pa ste /
analyzed: dgos pa yongs su grub pa zhes bya ba ni zung du 'brel pas rab tu phye ba sbyor ba mthar thug pa'i 'bras bu'i yid la byed pa yongs su grub pa yang dag pa'i shes pa'i ngo bo nyid yin pa ste /
translated: The so-called “accomplishment of the purpose” is the accomplishment of the mental attention of the fruit of the culmination of the union, which is the nature of correct knowing.

original: de la dgos pa zhes bya ba ni sbyor ba mthar thug pa'i 'bras bu'i yid la byed pa'o //
analyzed: de la dgos pa zhes bya ba ni sbyor ba mthar thug pa'i 'bras bu'i yid la byed pa'o //
translated: Therein, the so-called “purpose” is the mental attention of the fruit of the culmination of the union.

original: yongs su grub pa zhes bya ba ni de yongs su grub pa'i yang dag pa'i shes pa'i ngo bo nyid do //
analyzed: yongs su grub pa zhes bya ba ni de yongs su grub pa'i yang dag pa'i shes pa'i ngo bo nyid do //
translated: The so-called “accomplishment” is the nature of the correct knowing that is the accomplishment of that.

original: de la ci'i phyir sbyor ba'i mthar thug pa'i 'bras bu'i yid la byed pa la dgos pa zhes bya zhe na /
analyzed: de la ci'i phyir sbyor ba'i mthar thug pa'i 'bras bu'i yid la byed pa la dgos pa zhes bya zhe na /
translated: Therein, why is the mental attention of the fruit of the culmination of the union called “purpose”?

original: dgos pa zhes bya ba'i don ni 'bras bu dang bya ba yin la /
analyzed: dgos pa zhes bya ba'i don ni 'bras bu dang bya ba yin la /
translated: The meaning of the term “purpose” is “fruit” and “action.”

original: dgos pa mthar thug pa'i 'bras bu yang dngos gzhi thob pa'i 'bras @146b bu yin pas de nyid dgos pa yin pa'i phyir dang de'i yid la byed pa yang bya ba yin pas de yang dgos pa yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: dgos pa mthar thug pa'i 'bras bu yang dngos gzhi thob pa'i 'bras @146b bu yin pas de nyid dgos pa yin pa'i phyir dang de'i yid la byed pa yang bya ba yin pas de yang dgos pa yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The ultimate purpose is the result of obtaining the actual basis, and since that is the purpose, attention to that is also the purpose.

original: de la ci'i phyir de yongs su grub pa yang dag pa'i shes pa'i ngo bo nyid la yongs su grub pa zhes bya zhe na /🔽de yongs su grub pa zhes bya ba ni dngos gzhi thob pa rdo rje lta bu'i ting nge 'dzin gyis gnas ngan len phra mo snying po la yod pa lta bu ma lus par spangs te zad pa dang mi skye ba shes pa thob pa na sbyor ba
analyzed: de la ci'i phyir de yongs su grub pa yang dag pa'i shes pa'i ngo bo nyid la yongs su grub pa zhes bya zhe na / de yongs su grub pa zhes bya ba ni dngos gzhi thob pa rdo rje lta bu'i ting nge 'dzin gyis gnas ngan len phra mo snying po la yod pa lta bu ma lus par spangs te zad pa dang mi skye ba shes pa thob pa na sbyor ba
translated: Why is that perfect state called perfect?

original: mthar thug pa'i 'bras bu'i yid la byed pa de yongs su grub pa yin la /
analyzed: mthar thug pa'i 'bras bu'i yid la byed pa de yongs su grub pa yin la /
translated: The perfect state is the result of obtaining the actual basis, since vajra like concentration eliminates all negative tendencies, which are like a core, and when the knowledge of elimination and nonarising is obtained, the mental state of the ultimate result is perfected.

original: de nyid shes bya thams cad la chags pa med pa dang / thogs pa med pa'i shes pa dang / mthong ba 'jug pa 'jig rten las 'das pa'i yang dag pa'i shes pa'i ngo bo nyid yin pa'i phyir te /
analyzed: de nyid shes bya thams cad la chags pa med pa dang / thogs pa med pa'i shes pa dang / mthong ba 'jug pa 'jig rten las 'das pa'i yang dag pa'i shes pa'i ngo bo nyid yin pa'i phyir te /
translated: Because it is the nature of the unattached, unobstructed knowledge of all objects of knowledge and the supramundane correct knowledge that engages seeing.

original: de ltar na sbyor ba mthar thug pa'i 'bras bu'i yid la byed pa yongs su grub pa yang dag pa'i shes pa'i ngo bo nyid ni dgos pa yongs su grub pa zhes bya ste /
analyzed: de ltar na sbyor ba mthar thug pa'i 'bras bu'i yid la byed pa yongs su grub pa yang dag pa'i shes pa'i ngo bo nyid ni dgos pa yongs su grub pa zhes bya ste /
translated: Thus, the consummate mental attention of the result of the culmination of practice is the nature of correct knowledge, which is called the accomplishment of the purpose.

original: de ni ye shes phun sum tshogs pa yin no //
analyzed: de ni ye shes phun sum tshogs pa yin no //
translated: That is the perfection of wisdom.

original: de yang gang gis rab tu phye ba yin zhe na /
analyzed: de yang gang gis rab tu phye ba yin zhe na /
translated: By what is it distinguished?

original: zhi gnas dang lhag mthong zung du 'brel pas rab tu phye ba yin te /
analyzed: zhi gnas dang lhag mthong zung du 'brel pas rab tu phye ba yin te /
translated: It is distinguished by the union of serenity and insight.

original: gang gi tshe zung du 'brel pa'i lam skyes pa de'i tshe na yang dag pa'i shes pa thob pa yin la /
analyzed: gang gi tshe zung du 'brel pa'i lam skyes pa de'i tshe na yang dag pa'i shes pa thob pa yin la /
translated: When the path of union arises, correct knowledge is attained.

original: yang dag pa'i shes pa'i de bzhin nyid kyang zung du 'brel pa'i lam gyi dmigs pa yin pas yang dag pa'i shes pa'i dmigs pa 'thob pa dang zung du 'brel pa'i lam skye ba 'di 'byung ba'i dus kyang gcig ngo bo nyid kyang gcig pas na zung du
analyzed: yang dag pa'i shes pa'i de bzhin nyid kyang zung du 'brel pa'i lam gyi dmigs pa yin pas yang dag pa'i shes pa'i dmigs pa 'thob pa dang zung du 'brel pa'i lam skye ba 'di 'byung ba'i dus kyang gcig ngo bo nyid kyang gcig pas na zung du
translated: Thus, the attainment of the object of right knowledge and the arising of the path of union occur at the same time and have the same nature.

original: 'brel pas rab tu phye ba zhes bya ste /
analyzed: 'brel pas rab tu phye ba zhes bya ste /
translated: Therefore, it is called “the differentiation of union.”

original: de ni dgos pa yongs su grub pa yin no //
analyzed: de ni dgos pa yongs su grub pa yin no //
translated: This is the complete achievement of the purpose.

original: de ltar dmigs pa'i dngos po bzhi bstan pa de dag ni khyab pa'i dmigs pa zhes bya ste //
analyzed: de ltar dmigs pa'i dngos po bzhi bstan pa de dag ni khyab pa'i dmigs pa zhes bya ste //
translated: These four objects of meditation that have been presented are called “pervading objects.”

original: 'jig rten pa dang 'jig rten las 'das pa'i lam thams cad du 'gro zhing /
analyzed: 'jig rten pa dang 'jig rten las 'das pa'i lam thams cad du 'gro zhing /
translated: They pervade all mundane and supramundane paths.

original: spyad pa rnam par sbyong ba'i dmigs pa la sogs pa dmigs pa thams cad kyi rjes su song ba dang / 'das pa dang / ma 'ongs pa dang / da ltar byung ba'i yang dag par rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas thams cad kyi bshad pa yin pas na de'i phyir khab pa'i dmigs pa zhes bya'o //🔽yang de dag ni lhag mthong gi phyogs dang / zhi gnas kyi phyogs dang / dngos po thams cad dang ldan pa dang / yang dag pa'i dngos po dang ldan pa dang / rgyu dang 'bras bu'i dngos po dang ldan pa'i dmigs pa yin pas na de'i phyir yang khyab pa'i @147a * //
analyzed: spyad pa rnam par sbyong ba'i dmigs pa la sogs pa dmigs pa thams cad kyi rjes su song ba dang / 'das pa dang / ma 'ongs pa dang / da ltar byung ba'i yang dag par rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas thams cad kyi bshad pa yin pas na de'i phyir khab pa'i dmigs pa zhes bya'o // yang de dag ni lhag mthong gi phyogs dang / zhi gnas kyi phyogs dang / dngos po thams cad dang ldan pa dang / yang dag pa'i dngos po dang ldan pa dang / rgyu dang 'bras bu'i dngos po dang ldan pa'i dmigs pa yin pas na de'i phyir yang khyab pa'i @147a * //
translated: It is the object of the purification of the practice, and so on, and it is the object of all the objects of concentration. It is the explanation of all the perfect Buddhas of the past, future, and present. Therefore, it is called the universal object.

original: dmigs pa zhes bya ste /
analyzed: dmigs pa zhes bya ste /
translated: Moreover, it is the object of insight, the object of serenity, the object of all things, the object of real things, and the object of the relation of cause and effect. Therefore, it is called the universal object.

original: de la rnam par rtog pa dang bcas pa'i gzugs brnyan ni lhag mthong gi phyogs kyi dmigs pa yin no //
analyzed: de la rnam par rtog pa dang bcas pa'i gzugs brnyan ni lhag mthong gi phyogs kyi dmigs pa yin no //
translated: The object with conceptualization is the object of insight.

original: rnam par mi rtog pa'i gzugs brnyan ni zhi gnas kyi phyogs kyi dmigs pa yin no //
analyzed: rnam par mi rtog pa'i gzugs brnyan ni zhi gnas kyi phyogs kyi dmigs pa yin no //
translated: The reflection that is free from conceptual differentiation is the objective mental orientation of the side of meditative serenity.

original: dngos po'i mtha' ni ji snyed yod pa nyid dang / ji lta ba bzhin du yod pa nyid kyi dngos po thams cad dang ldan pa dang / yang dag pa'i dngos po dang ldan pa'i dmigs pa yin no //
analyzed: dngos po'i mtha' ni ji snyed yod pa nyid dang / ji lta ba bzhin du yod pa nyid kyi dngos po thams cad dang ldan pa dang / yang dag pa'i dngos po dang ldan pa'i dmigs pa yin no //
translated: The limit of existence is the objective mental orientation that is endowed with all things just as they are and just how many there are, and that is endowed with the true thing.

original: dgos pa yongs su grub pa ni yid la byed pa yongs su grub pa'i rgyus 'bras bu gnas ngan len spangs pa dang / gnas gyur pa dang / dngos gzhi thob pa dang / shes bya la shes pa dang / mthong ba 'jug pa nyid kyis rgyu dang 'bras bu'i dngos po dang ldan pa'i dmigs pa yin no //
analyzed: dgos pa yongs su grub pa ni yid la byed pa yongs su grub pa'i rgyus 'bras bu gnas ngan len spangs pa dang / gnas gyur pa dang / dngos gzhi thob pa dang / shes bya la shes pa dang / mthong ba 'jug pa nyid kyis rgyu dang 'bras bu'i dngos po dang ldan pa'i dmigs pa yin no //
translated: The accomplishment of the purpose is the objective mental orientation that is endowed with the nature of cause and effect, through the cause which is the accomplishment of mental attention, and through the effect which is the abandonment of the negative reflex actions, the conversion of the basis, the attainment of the basic revolution, the penetration of the knowledge and vision of the knowable.🔽This is the objective mental orientation of the bodhisattva who is engaged in the yoga of serenity and insight.

original: de ni gzhan dag de snyam du rnal 'byor gyis yongs su bsdus pa'i zhi gnas dang lhag mthong gi lam gyi ngo bo nyid de ni dmigs pa la brten te skye ba yin na /
analyzed: de ni gzhan dag de snyam du rnal 'byor gyis yongs su bsdus pa'i zhi gnas dang lhag mthong gi lam gyi ngo bo nyid de ni dmigs pa la brten te skye ba yin na /
translated: The objective mental orientation of the bodhisattva who is engaged in the yoga of serenity and insight is the essence of the path. It is born in dependence on the objective mental orientation.

original: dmigs pa bzhi po gang la brten te skye snyam pa la /
analyzed: dmigs pa bzhi po gang la brten te skye snyam pa la /
translated: One may think, On which of the four objects does it arise?

original: mi pham pa nyid kyis khyab pa'i dmigs pa de nyid mngon du bya bar mkhyen nas khyab pa'i dmigs pa bzhi bstan pa'i tshig gi don la sogs pa bshad pa yin no //
analyzed: mi pham pa nyid kyis khyab pa'i dmigs pa de nyid mngon du bya bar mkhyen nas khyab pa'i dmigs pa bzhi bstan pa'i tshig gi don la sogs pa bshad pa yin no //
translated: Ajita, having understood that very pervasion object should be manifested, explained the meaning of the words of the teaching of the four pervasion objects.

original: de'i 'og tu dmigs pa gang ni lam gang gi dmigs pa yin snyam pa la dmigs pa du dang gang zhig lam gang gi dmigs pa yin pa bstan pa'i phyir /
analyzed: de'i 'og tu dmigs pa gang ni lam gang gi dmigs pa yin snyam pa la dmigs pa du dang gang zhig lam gang gi dmigs pa yin pa bstan pa'i phyir /
translated: After that, one may think, Which object is the object of which path? In order to teach which objects are the objects of which paths,

original: bcom ldan 'das su zhig zhi gnas kyi dmigs pa lags zhes bya ba la sogs pa zhus so //
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das su zhig zhi gnas kyi dmigs pa lags zhes bya ba la sogs pa zhus so //
translated: he asked, Bhagavan, what is the object of calm abiding?

original: de la 'dir ci'i phyir zhi gnas dang por bstan ce na /
analyzed: de la 'dir ci'i phyir zhi gnas dang por bstan ce na /
translated: Here, one may ask, Why is calm abiding taught first?

original: mnyam par ma bzhag pa'i sa pa'i sems chu bzhin du g-yo ba de dang por mnyam par gzhag pa'i sa pa'i zhi gnas snod dang 'dra bas btsal dgos pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: mnyam par ma bzhag pa'i sa pa'i sems chu bzhin du g-yo ba de dang por mnyam par gzhag pa'i sa pa'i zhi gnas snod dang 'dra bas btsal dgos pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because that mind of the non-equipoised stage moves like water, and that calm abiding of the equipoised stage is like a vessel, it must be sought first.

original: 'o na khyab pa'i dmigs pa rnam pa bzhi las dang por rnam par rtog pa dang bcas pa'i gzugs brnyan bstan la /
analyzed: 'o na khyab pa'i dmigs pa rnam pa bzhi las dang por rnam par rtog pa dang bcas pa'i gzugs brnyan bstan la /
translated: Well then, from among the four types of objects of meditation for purifying behavior, you should teach the first, the image with analysis.🔽

original: de'i 'og tu rnam par mi rtog pa'i gzugs brnyan bstan pa dang ji ltar mi 'gal zhe na 'gal ba med de ;
analyzed: de'i 'og tu rnam par mi rtog pa'i gzugs brnyan bstan pa dang ji ltar mi 'gal zhe na 'gal ba med de ;
translated: Well then, how is it that the four types of objects to be abandoned are not contradictory to the first object of meditation being taught to be a conceptual image and the second being taught to be a nonconceptual image?

original: de ltar bstan pa ni dmigs pa thob pa dang / dmigs pa goms par byed pa'i dbang du mdzad pa yin gyi /
analyzed: de ltar bstan pa ni dmigs pa thob pa dang / dmigs pa goms par byed pa'i dbang du mdzad pa yin gyi /
translated: There is no contradiction because the teaching is from the perspective of those who have attained the object of meditation and those who are cultivating the object of meditation.

original: rnal 'byor pa las dang po pas dmigs pa yongs su tshol ba dang / dmigs pa thob pa dang / dmigs pa goms par byed pa dang / 'bras bu thob pa'i rigs ni dang po kho nar @147b rnal 'byor pa dmigs pa yongs su tshol ba'i tshe na mnyam par ma bzhag pa'i sems kyi dmigs pa gang yang rung ba mthong ba'am /
analyzed: rnal 'byor pa las dang po pas dmigs pa yongs su tshol ba dang / dmigs pa thob pa dang / dmigs pa goms par byed pa dang / 'bras bu thob pa'i rigs ni dang po kho nar @147b rnal 'byor pa dmigs pa yongs su tshol ba'i tshe na mnyam par ma bzhag pa'i sems kyi dmigs pa gang yang rung ba mthong ba'am /
translated: The type of yogi who is a beginner, who is seeking the object of meditation, who has attained the object of meditation, who is cultivating the object of meditation and who has attained the result, first sees any of the objects of meditation of the nonconcentrated mind.

original: thos pa'am / yongs su brtags pa gcig gzung ba'i dus na tshol ba dang / rnam par rtog pa dang bcas pa'i gzugs brnyan gyi dmigs pa yang mi thob /
analyzed: thos pa'am / yongs su brtags pa gcig gzung ba'i dus na tshol ba dang / rnam par rtog pa dang bcas pa'i gzugs brnyan gyi dmigs pa yang mi thob /
translated: When one is listening or reflecting, at the time of apprehending one thing, one does not obtain the object of a reflected image that is associated with searching and discursive thought.

original: lhag mthong gi lam yang mi skye'o //
analyzed: lhag mthong gi lam yang mi skye'o //
translated: The path of insight does not arise.

original: de'i 'og tu dam pa'i chos thos pa dang / gzung ba'am /
analyzed: de'i 'og tu dam pa'i chos thos pa dang / gzung ba'am /
translated: After that, one listens to the holy Dharma and apprehends it.

original: dge ba'i bshes gnyen gyi gdams ngag dang rjes su bsten pa la brten nas de nyid la mnyam par gzhag pa'i sa pa'i yid la byed pa mngon du byas te /
analyzed: dge ba'i bshes gnyen gyi gdams ngag dang rjes su bsten pa la brten nas de nyid la mnyam par gzhag pa'i sa pa'i yid la byed pa mngon du byas te /
translated: Or, one relies on the instructions and follow up teachings of a spiritual master. Then, one manifests the attention of the stage of meditative equipoise on that object.🔽In the time of the attention of aspiration, in order to make the aspect of that object appear to one’s mind, one must attend to aspiration with the mind of the stage of meditative equipoise.

original: de'i rnam pa rang gi blo la snang bar bya ba'i phyir mos pa yid la byed pa'i dus na ni dang por mnyam par gzhag pa'i sa pa'i sems kyis mos pa yid la bya dgos pas dmigs pa yongs su tshol ba de'i tshe na ni zhi gnas sngon🔽du 'gro ba yin no //
analyzed: de'i rnam pa rang gi blo la snang bar bya ba'i phyir mos pa yid la byed pa'i dus na ni dang por mnyam par gzhag pa'i sa pa'i sems kyis mos pa yid la bya dgos pas dmigs pa yongs su tshol ba de'i tshe na ni zhi gnas sngon🔽du 'gro ba yin no //
translated: When one searches for the object, then śamatha precedes.

original: de'i 'og tu de ltar mos pa'i yid la byed pa na mnyam par gzhag pa'i sa ba'i yid la byed pa de'i mthus shes bya'i dngos po da dang 'dra ba'i rnam pa rang gi blo la snang bar gyur pa'i dus na ni rnam par rtog pa dang bcas🔽pa'i gzugs brnyan gyi dmigs pa thob pa dang / sbyor ba'i lam gyi yid la byed pas rab tu phye ba'i lhag mthong gi lam skyes pa yin no //
analyzed: de'i 'og tu de ltar mos pa'i yid la byed pa na mnyam par gzhag pa'i sa ba'i yid la byed pa de'i mthus shes bya'i dngos po da dang 'dra ba'i rnam pa rang gi blo la snang bar gyur pa'i dus na ni rnam par rtog pa dang bcas pa'i gzugs brnyan gyi dmigs pa thob pa dang / sbyor ba'i lam gyi yid la byed pas rab tu phye ba'i lhag mthong gi lam skyes pa yin no //
translated: Then, when one attends to it with the mind of such belief, one obtains the object of a conceptual image through the power of that attention of the stage of meditative equipoise and when the entity of the object of knowledge appears to one's mind in the aspect of that image, one obtains the object of a conceptual image.🔽Then, when one generates insight on the path of preparation through the power of that attention, one generates the path of insight.

original: de'i 'og tu dmigs pa thob pa de nyid la zhi gnas kyi rnam pas rtse gcig tu mnyam par 'jog pa'i dus na ni rnam par mi rtog pa'i gzugs brnyan gyi dmigs pa goms par byed pa dang / yid la byed pa thob pa'i lam gyis rab tu phye ba mtshan ma'i g-yeng ba zhi ba'i zhi gnas kyi lam nang gi rtse gcig pa nyid skyes pa yin te /
analyzed: de'i 'og tu dmigs pa thob pa de nyid la zhi gnas kyi rnam pas rtse gcig tu mnyam par 'jog pa'i dus na ni rnam par mi rtog pa'i gzugs brnyan gyi dmigs pa goms par byed pa dang / yid la byed pa thob pa'i lam gyis rab tu phye ba mtshan ma'i g-yeng ba zhi ba'i zhi gnas kyi lam nang gi rtse gcig pa nyid skyes pa yin te /
translated: Then, when one one-pointedly and meditatively stabilizes that very attainment of the object through the aspect of serenity, one cultivates the object of a nonconceptual image and one generates the path of serenity that is the inner one-pointedness that pacifies the distraction of signs through the path of obtaining attention.

original: ji tsam du mtshan ma'i g-yeng ba zhi ba'i zhi gnas kyi lam nang gi sems rtse gcig pa nyid de yangs pa dang 'phel ba dang / rgyas par gyur pa de tsam du de'i mjug thogs su mthar thug pa'i lam gyi yid la byed pas rab tu phye ba gnas ngan len gyi zhi ba'i zhi gnas kyi lam dus dang sems shin tu sbyangs pa skye ba yang yangs pa dang /🔽'phel ba dang / rgyas par 'gyur la /🔽ji tsam du chos de gnyis yangs pa dang 'phel ba dang / rgyas par gyur pa de tsam du sbyor ba mthar thug pa'i lam gyi yid la byed pas rab tu phye ba'i lhag mthong sems kyi ngo bo nyid la gnyis med pa'i don rang rig pa'i ngo bo nyid rab tu dbye ba yang yangs pa dang /🔽'phel ba @148a * //
analyzed: ji tsam du mtshan ma'i g-yeng ba zhi ba'i zhi gnas kyi lam nang gi sems rtse gcig pa nyid de yangs pa dang 'phel ba dang / rgyas par gyur pa de tsam du de'i mjug thogs su mthar thug pa'i lam gyi yid la byed pas rab tu phye ba gnas ngan len gyi zhi ba'i zhi gnas kyi lam dus dang sems shin tu sbyangs pa skye ba yang yangs pa dang / 'phel ba dang / rgyas par 'gyur la / ji tsam du chos de gnyis yangs pa dang 'phel ba dang / rgyas par gyur pa de tsam du sbyor ba mthar thug pa'i lam gyi yid la byed pas rab tu phye ba'i lhag mthong sems kyi ngo bo nyid la gnyis med pa'i don rang rig pa'i ngo bo nyid rab tu dbye ba yang yangs pa dang / 'phel ba @148a * //
translated: To the extent that the path of mental one-pointedness of inner pacification of śamatha, which is the pacification of the distraction of signs, is vast, increased, and expanded, to that extent the path of pacification of the negative tendencies that is distinguished by the attention of the ultimate path and the arising of mental pliancy is vast, increased, and expanded.

original: dang rgyas par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: dang rgyas par 'gyur ro //
translated: To the extent that those two dharmas are vast, increased, and expanded, to that extent the vipaśyanā that is distinguished by the attention of the ultimate path of application and the differentiation of the essence of mind that is the nondual meaning of the essence of reflexive awareness is vast, increased, and expanded.

original: de ltar zhi gnas dang lhag mthong gi sems de gnyis yangs pa dang / 'phel ba dang / rgyas par gyur pa'i tshe na zung du 'brel par 'jug pa'i lam skye zhing dngos po'i mtha' dang dgos pa yongs su grub pa'i dmigs pa dus gcig tu thob par gyur te /
analyzed: de ltar zhi gnas dang lhag mthong gi sems de gnyis yangs pa dang / 'phel ba dang / rgyas par gyur pa'i tshe na zung du 'brel par 'jug pa'i lam skye zhing dngos po'i mtha' dang dgos pa yongs su grub pa'i dmigs pa dus gcig tu thob par gyur te /
translated: When those two minds of serenity and insight become vast, extensive, and expanded, then the path of their union arises, and one simultaneously attains the object of observation that is the culmination of things and the accomplishment of one’s purpose.

original: de thob pa'i tshe na yangs pa phun sum tshogs pas rab tu phye ba'i 'bras bu gnas gyur pa'i ngo bo nyid dang / ye shes phun sum tshogs pas rab tu phye ba'i 'bras bu yang dag pa'i shes pa'i ngo bo nyid gcig tu thob pa yin no //
analyzed: de thob pa'i tshe na yangs pa phun sum tshogs pas rab tu phye ba'i 'bras bu gnas gyur pa'i ngo bo nyid dang / ye shes phun sum tshogs pas rab tu phye ba'i 'bras bu yang dag pa'i shes pa'i ngo bo nyid gcig tu thob pa yin no //
translated: When one attains that, one attains the two fruits: the fruit that is the nature of the transformation of one’s being, which is distinguished by the perfection of vastness, and the fruit that is the nature of correct knowledge, which is distinguished by the perfection of pristine wisdom.

original: 'bras bu de gnyis thob pa ni rnam pa thams cad mngon par rdzogs par byang chub par sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das kyi go 'phang bla na med pa nyid thob pa yin te /
analyzed: 'bras bu de gnyis thob pa ni rnam pa thams cad mngon par rdzogs par byang chub par sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das kyi go 'phang bla na med pa nyid thob pa yin te /
translated: The attainment of those two fruits is the attainment of the unexcelled state of a Bhagavan Buddha, the complete and perfect enlightenment with respect to all aspects.

original: de'i dus na de bzhin gshegs pa nyid ces bya'o //
analyzed: de'i dus na de bzhin gshegs pa nyid ces bya'o //
translated: At that time, one is called a “Tathāgata.”

original: de ltar na rnal 'byor pa las dang po pa thog ma kho nar dmigs pa yongs su tshol ba'i dus na zhi gnas sngon du 'gro ba yin la /
analyzed: de ltar na rnal 'byor pa las dang po pa thog ma kho nar dmigs pa yongs su tshol ba'i dus na zhi gnas sngon du 'gro ba yin la /
translated: Thus, at the time of the beginner yogi's initial thorough search for the meditative object, serenity precedes.

original: dmigs pa thob pa'i dus na ni lhag mthong gi shas che ba yin /
analyzed: dmigs pa thob pa'i dus na ni lhag mthong gi shas che ba yin /
translated: At the time of attaining the meditative object, insight predominates.

original: dmigs pa goms par byed pa'i du sa na ni zhi gnas kyi shas che ba yin /
analyzed: dmigs pa goms par byed pa'i du sa na ni zhi gnas kyi shas che ba yin /
translated: At the time of cultivating the meditative object, serenity predominates.

original: 'bras bu thob pa'i dus na ni zung du 'brel pa'i lam gyi 'jug pa yin pas na de'i phyir 'dir dang por 'phags pa mi pham pa nyid kyis zhi gnas kyi lam gyi dmigs pa du dang gang lags zhes zhus par sbyar ro //
analyzed: 'bras bu thob pa'i dus na ni zung du 'brel pa'i lam gyi 'jug pa yin pas na de'i phyir 'dir dang por 'phags pa mi pham pa nyid kyis zhi gnas kyi lam gyi dmigs pa du dang gang lags zhes zhus par sbyar ro //
translated: At the time of attaining the result, the path of union is engaged. Therefore, here, first, the noble Ajita asks, How many meditative objects are there on the path of serenity?

original: gcig ste zhes bya bas ni du lags zhes zhus pa'i lan btab pa yin no //🔽'di lta ste /
analyzed: gcig ste zhes bya bas ni du lags zhes zhus pa'i lan btab pa yin no // 'di lta ste /
translated: The reply to the question, How many? is, One.

original: rnam par mi rtog pa'i gzugs brnyan no zhes bya bas ni gang lags zhes zhus pa'i lan btab pa yin te /
analyzed: rnam par mi rtog pa'i gzugs brnyan no zhes bya bas ni gang lags zhes zhus pa'i lan btab pa yin te /
translated: The reply to the question, What? is, It is the non-conceptual image.

original: de ni dmigs pa thob pa'i gong du dmigs pa goms par byed pa'i gnas skabs dang sbyar ro //
analyzed: de ni dmigs pa thob pa'i gong du dmigs pa goms par byed pa'i gnas skabs dang sbyar ro //
translated: This is related to the stage of cultivating the meditative object prior to attaining it.

original: de ci'i phyir zhi gnas kyi dmigs pa yin zhe na /
analyzed: de ci'i phyir zhi gnas kyi dmigs pa yin zhe na /
translated: Why is that the meditative object of serenity?

original: rnam par mi rtog pa zhes bya ba ni yid la byed pa thob pa'i lam gyis rab tu phye ba'i zhi gnas kyi rnam pa sems gnas pa dgus bsdus pa /
analyzed: rnam par mi rtog pa zhes bya ba ni yid la byed pa thob pa'i lam gyis rab tu phye ba'i zhi gnas kyi rnam pa sems gnas pa dgus bsdus pa /
translated: Non-discursive means that serenity is distinguished by the path of attaining mental attention, and is included in the nine mental states.

original: stobs drug dang ldan pa /
analyzed: stobs drug dang ldan pa /
translated: It is endowed with the six powers,

original: yid la byed pa bzhis 'jug pa yin la /
analyzed: yid la byed pa bzhis 'jug pa yin la /
translated: and is engaged in by means of the four mental attentions.

original: gzugs brnyan zhes bya ba ni rnam par mi rtog pa'i zhi gnas kyi rnam pa des rab tu phye ba shes bya'i dngos po dang cha mthun pa'i sems kyi gzugs brnyan rang rig pa yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: gzugs brnyan zhes bya ba ni rnam par mi rtog pa'i zhi gnas kyi rnam pa des rab tu phye ba shes bya'i dngos po dang cha mthun pa'i sems kyi gzugs brnyan rang rig pa yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The image means that the image of the mind is similar to the thing that is known, and is distinguished by that aspect of serenity which is non-discursive.

original: du zhig lhag mthong gi dmigs pa lags zhes bya bas kyang du dang gang lags zhes par sbyar ro //
analyzed: du zhig lhag mthong gi dmigs pa lags zhes bya bas kyang du dang gang lags zhes par sbyar ro //
translated: How many are the meditative objects of insight?

original: gcig kho na ste zhes bya bas ni du lags zhes @148b zhus pa'i lan btab pa yin no //
analyzed: gcig kho na ste zhes bya bas ni du lags zhes @148b zhus pa'i lan btab pa yin no //
translated: One alone is the meditative object of both.

original: rnam par rtog pa dang bcas pa'i gzugs brnyan no zhes bya bas ni gang lags zhes zhus pa'i lan btab pa yin te /
analyzed: rnam par rtog pa dang bcas pa'i gzugs brnyan no zhes bya bas ni gang lags zhes zhus pa'i lan btab pa yin te /
translated: The phrase “conceptual image” responds to the question, “What is it?”

original: de ni dmigs pa yongs su btsal ba'i gong du dmigs pa thob pa'i gnas skabs dang sbyar ro //
analyzed: de ni dmigs pa yongs su btsal ba'i gong du dmigs pa thob pa'i gnas skabs dang sbyar ro //
translated: This is the context for the attainment of the object of meditation that was mentioned earlier in the discussion of the thorough search for the object of meditation.

original: de ci'i phyir lhag mthong gi dmigs pa yin zhe na /
analyzed: de ci'i phyir lhag mthong gi dmigs pa yin zhe na /
translated: Why is this the object of insight?

original: rnam par rtog pa dang bcas pa'i zhes bya ba ni sbyor ba'i lam gyi yid la byed pas rab tu phye ba'i lhag mthong gi rnam pa shes rab kyi spyod pa bzhis bsdus pa sgo gsum dang ldan pa /
analyzed: rnam par rtog pa dang bcas pa'i zhes bya ba ni sbyor ba'i lam gyi yid la byed pas rab tu phye ba'i lhag mthong gi rnam pa shes rab kyi spyod pa bzhis bsdus pa sgo gsum dang ldan pa /
translated: The phrase “conceptual image” refers to the mental image of an object of meditation that is the domain of the discernment of the aspects of insight that is distinguished by the attention of the path of preparation. It is included in the four types of activities of wisdom. It is endowed with the three doors to deliverance.

original: gzhi rab tu dbye ba rnam pa drug la dmigs pa yin la /
analyzed: gzhi rab tu dbye ba rnam pa drug la dmigs pa yin la /
translated: It is the object of the six kinds of thorough discernment of the basis.

original: gzugs brnyan zhes bya ba ni rnam par rtog pa dang bcas pa'i lhag mthong gi rnam pa des rab tu phye ba shes bya'i dngos po dang cha mthun pa sems kyi gzugs brnyan rang rig pa yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: gzugs brnyan zhes bya ba ni rnam par rtog pa dang bcas pa'i lhag mthong gi rnam pa des rab tu phye ba shes bya'i dngos po dang cha mthun pa sems kyi gzugs brnyan rang rig pa yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: It is called an “image” because it is a mental image of an object of knowledge that is similar to the object. It is a self-cognizing image.

original: du zhig de gnyis ka'i dmigs pa lags zhes bya bas kyang du dang gang lags zhes zhus bar sbyar te /
analyzed: du zhig de gnyis ka'i dmigs pa lags zhes bya bas kyang du dang gang lags zhes zhus bar sbyar te /
translated: How many are the objects of both?

original: de gnyis ka'i zhes bya ba ni zung du 'brel pa 'jug pa'i lam gyi zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: de gnyis ka'i zhes bya ba ni zung du 'brel pa 'jug pa'i lam gyi zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: The phrase both of them means the path of unification.

original: gnyis te zhes bya bas ni du lags zhes zhus pa'i lan btab pa yin no //
analyzed: gnyis te zhes bya bas ni du lags zhes zhus pa'i lan btab pa yin no //
translated: The word two answers the question, How many?

original: 'di lta ste /
analyzed: 'di lta ste /
translated: The phrase they are as follows answers the question, What are they?

original: dngos po'i mtha' dang dgongs pa yongs su grub pa'o zhes bya bas ni gang lags zhes zhus ba'i lan btab pa yin te /
analyzed: dngos po'i mtha' dang dgongs pa yongs su grub pa'o zhes bya bas ni gang lags zhes zhus ba'i lan btab pa yin te /
translated: The phrase the limit of existence and the perfect realization of the will to be fully enlightened answers the question, What is it?

original: de ni dmigs pa goms par byas pa'i gong du sbyor ba mthar thug pa'i 'bras bu thob pa'i gnas skabs dang sbyar ro //
analyzed: de ni dmigs pa goms par byas pa'i gong du sbyor ba mthar thug pa'i 'bras bu thob pa'i gnas skabs dang sbyar ro //
translated: This is applied to the situation of attaining the result of the culmination of practice, which is subsequent to the practice of the object.

original: de gnyis ci'i phyir zung du 'brel pa'i lam gyi dmigs pa yin zhe na /
analyzed: de gnyis ci'i phyir zung du 'brel pa'i lam gyi dmigs pa yin zhe na /
translated: Why are those two the objects of the path of unification?

original: zung du 'brel pa'i lam gyi zhi gnas kyi rnam pa ni yongs su 'dris pa'i stobs dang / rtsol ba med par 'jug pa'i yid la byed pas ting nge 'dzin du byed pa kho na yin la /
analyzed: zung du 'brel pa'i lam gyi zhi gnas kyi rnam pa ni yongs su 'dris pa'i stobs dang / rtsol ba med par 'jug pa'i yid la byed pas ting nge 'dzin du byed pa kho na yin la /
translated: The aspect of serenity on the path of unification is the power of complete familiarity and it is only concentration with the mental attention that engages effortlessly.

original: lhag mthong gi rnam pa ni yongs su dpyod pa'i rnam pas bsdus pa yongs su btsal ba la so sor rtog pa'i rjes su zhugs pa'i sgo dang ldan pa rtogs pa'i gzhi rab tu dbye ba la dmigs pa yin te /
analyzed: lhag mthong gi rnam pa ni yongs su dpyod pa'i rnam pas bsdus pa yongs su btsal ba la so sor rtog pa'i rjes su zhugs pa'i sgo dang ldan pa rtogs pa'i gzhi rab tu dbye ba la dmigs pa yin te /
translated: The aspect of insight is the basis of realization that possesses the door of engagement that is the discernment of thorough investigation and it focuses on the differentiation of the basis of realization.

original: de gnyis mnyam par zung du 'brel pas 'jug pa'i lam de gang gi tshe skyes pa de'i tshe na dngos po'i mtha' dang dgos pa yongs su grub pa'i dmigs pa 'thob pa yin la /
analyzed: de gnyis mnyam par zung du 'brel pas 'jug pa'i lam de gang gi tshe skyes pa de'i tshe na dngos po'i mtha' dang dgos pa yongs su grub pa'i dmigs pa 'thob pa yin la /
translated: When the path of engagement that is the union of serenity and insight in equal measure arises, one obtains the focal object that is the limit of entities and the accomplishment of one's purpose.

original: zung du 'brel pa'i lam de yang dmigs pa de gnyis la dmigs pa yin pas dmigs pa de nyid 'thob pa dang / zung du 'brel pa'i lam skye ba ni 'byung ba'i dus kyang gcig / ngo bo nyid kyang gcig pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: zung du 'brel pa'i lam de yang dmigs pa de gnyis la dmigs pa yin pas dmigs pa de nyid 'thob pa dang / zung du 'brel pa'i lam skye ba ni 'byung ba'i dus kyang gcig / ngo bo nyid kyang gcig pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Since that path of unification has those two objects as its object, it obtains that object, and the time of arising of the path of unification and the time of obtaining it are the same, because they have the same nature.

original: de ni dmigs pas sbyor ba'i rgyu bstan pa yin @149a * //
analyzed: de ni dmigs pas sbyor ba'i rgyu bstan pa yin @149a * //
translated: That is the explanation of the cause of preparation through its object.

original: te ; sbyor ba'i rgyu'i tshig gi don la sogs pa bshad zin to /
analyzed: te ; sbyor ba'i rgyu'i tshig gi don la sogs pa bshad zin to /
translated: The meaning of the words of the cause of preparation and so on have been explained.

original: // / de'i 'og tu 'thob pa'i tshig gi don la sogs pa bshad par bya ste /
analyzed: // / de'i 'og tu 'thob pa'i tshig gi don la sogs pa bshad par bya ste /
translated: After that, the meaning of the words of obtainment and so on should be explained.

original: 'thob pa zhes bya ba ni de ltar sbyor ba'i rgyu rnam pa gsum la brten te /
analyzed: 'thob pa zhes bya ba ni de ltar sbyor ba'i rgyu rnam pa gsum la brten te /
translated: Obtainment is as follows: In dependence on the three causes of preparation,

original: rnal 'byor gyis yongs su bsdus pa'i zhi gnas dang lhag mthong gi lam gyi ngo bo nyid la sbyor bar byed pa ni sbyor ba mthar thug pa'i lam gyi yid la byed pas rab tu phye ba'i zhi gnas dang lhag mthong gi lam gyi ngo bo nyid la
analyzed: rnal 'byor gyis yongs su bsdus pa'i zhi gnas dang lhag mthong gi lam gyi ngo bo nyid la sbyor bar byed pa ni sbyor ba mthar thug pa'i lam gyi yid la byed pas rab tu phye ba'i zhi gnas dang lhag mthong gi lam gyi ngo bo nyid la
translated: one applies oneself to the essence of the path of serenity and insight that are included in yoga.

original: sbyor bar byed pa na sbyor ba mthar thug pa'i lam gyi yid la byed pas rab tu phye ba'i zhi gnas dang lhag mthong thob pa gang yin pa'o //
analyzed: sbyor bar byed pa na sbyor ba mthar thug pa'i lam gyi yid la byed pas rab tu phye ba'i zhi gnas dang lhag mthong thob pa gang yin pa'o //
translated: When one is engaged in the preparatory path, one obtains serenity and insight that are distinguished by the attention of the path of completion of preparation.

original: de la mtshams sbyar ba ji lta bu zhe na /
analyzed: de la mtshams sbyar ba ji lta bu zhe na /
translated: What is the connection?

original: 'dir 'phags pa byams pas gzhan dag 'di snyam du de ltar rnal 'byor pas sbyor ba'i rgyu de lta bu la brten te /
analyzed: 'dir 'phags pa byams pas gzhan dag 'di snyam du de ltar rnal 'byor pas sbyor ba'i rgyu de lta bu la brten te /
translated: Here, the noble Maitreya says that others think, “In that way, the yogi relies on such causes of preparation.

original: rnal 'byor gyis yongs su bsdus pa'i zhi gnas dang lhag mthong gi lam gyi ngo bo nyid la sbyor bar byed pa ni sbyor ba mthar thug pa'i lam gyi yid la byed pas rab tu phye ba'i zhi gnas ni ji ltar yongs su btsal bar bya /
analyzed: rnal 'byor gyis yongs su bsdus pa'i zhi gnas dang lhag mthong gi lam gyi ngo bo nyid la sbyor bar byed pa ni sbyor ba mthar thug pa'i lam gyi yid la byed pas rab tu phye ba'i zhi gnas ni ji ltar yongs su btsal bar bya /
translated: How does the yogi who is engaged in the essence of the path of serenity and insight that are included in yoga distinguish serenity and insight that are distinguished by the attention of the path of completion of preparation?

original: lhag mthong la ni ji ltar mkhas par bya snyam du sems pa rnams kyi bsam pa la brtags nas sbyor ba mthar thug pa'i lam gyi yid la byed pas rab tu phye ba'i zhi gnas yongs su btsal ba dang / lhag mthong la mkhas pa bstan pa'i dbang du mdzad nas /
analyzed: lhag mthong la ni ji ltar mkhas par bya snyam du sems pa rnams kyi bsam pa la brtags nas sbyor ba mthar thug pa'i lam gyi yid la byed pas rab tu phye ba'i zhi gnas yongs su btsal ba dang / lhag mthong la mkhas pa bstan pa'i dbang du mdzad nas /
translated: Having examined their thoughts, the search for serenity distinguished by mental attention on the path of final training and skill in insight are taught in terms of the request:

original: bcom ldan 'das byang chub sems dpa'i zhi gnas dang lhag mthong gi dmigs pa'i dngos po de dag brten cing /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das byang chub sems dpa'i zhi gnas dang lhag mthong gi dmigs pa'i dngos po de dag brten cing /
translated: Blessed One, having relied on those things that are the objects of observation of a bodhisattva's serenity and insight,

original: gnas nas ji ltar zhi gnas yongs su tshol bar bgyid pa dang / lhag mthong la mkhas pa lags zhes bya bar zhus bar sbyar ro //
analyzed: gnas nas ji ltar zhi gnas yongs su tshol bar bgyid pa dang / lhag mthong la mkhas pa lags zhes bya bar zhus bar sbyar ro //
translated: how does one search for serenity and how does one become skilled in insight?

original: de la ji ltar zhi gnas yongs su tshol bar bgyid ces bya ba ni sbyor ba'i rgyu yongs su tshol ba ma yin gyi /
analyzed: de la ji ltar zhi gnas yongs su tshol bar bgyid ces bya ba ni sbyor ba'i rgyu yongs su tshol ba ma yin gyi /
translated: Here, how does one search for serenity? is not a search for the cause of training,

original: sbyor ba mthar thug pa'i lam gyi yid la byed pas rab tu phye ba'i zhi gnas yongs su tshol ba ste /
analyzed: sbyor ba mthar thug pa'i lam gyi yid la byed pas rab tu phye ba'i zhi gnas yongs su tshol ba ste /
translated: but a search for serenity distinguished by mental attention on the path of final training.

original: ji tsam gyis na de thob pa lags zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: ji tsam gyis na de thob pa lags zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: The meaning is: by what means does one attain it?

original: 'di ltar lhag mthong la mkhas pa lags zhes bya ba yang sbyor ba'i lam gyi rab tu phye ba la mkhas pa ma yin gyi sbyor ba mthar thug pa'i lam gyi yid la byed pas rab tu phye ba'i lhag mthong la mkhas pa ste /
analyzed: 'di ltar lhag mthong la mkhas pa lags zhes bya ba yang sbyor ba'i lam gyi rab tu phye ba la mkhas pa ma yin gyi sbyor ba mthar thug pa'i lam gyi yid la byed pas rab tu phye ba'i lhag mthong la mkhas pa ste /
translated: Also, the statement “one is skilled in insight” does not refer to skill in the analysis of the path of preparation, but to skill in insight that is analyzed by the attention of the path of conclusion of preparation.

original: ji tsam gyis na de thob pa lags zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //🔽de nas bcom ldan 'das kyis kyang zhi gnas ni mtshan ma dang gnas ngan len gyi g-yeng ba'i ngo bo nyid dang rab tu phye bas @149b sems kyi gdung ba yongs su zhi ba'i ngo bo nyid yin pa'i phyir byang chub sems dpas yongs su btsal bar bya
analyzed: ji tsam gyis na de thob pa lags zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go // de nas bcom ldan 'das kyis kyang zhi gnas ni mtshan ma dang gnas ngan len gyi g-yeng ba'i ngo bo nyid dang rab tu phye bas @149b sems kyi gdung ba yongs su zhi ba'i ngo bo nyid yin pa'i phyir byang chub sems dpas yongs su btsal bar bya
translated: The meaning is: by what means does one attain it?

original: ba yin la /
analyzed: ba yin la /
translated: Then the Bhagavān said, “Bodhisattvas should seek śamatha because it is the nature of the mind that completely pacifies mental distress, since it is the nature of distraction that is characterized by signs and the taking up of negative tendencies.

original: lhag mthong ni sems kyi ngo bo nyid la gnyis med pa'i don rang rig pa'i ngo bo nyid rab tu dbye bas chos rab tu rnam par 'byed pa'i ngo bo nyid yin pa'i phyir byang chub sems dpa' de la mkhas par bya ba bstan pa'i dbang du mdzad
analyzed: lhag mthong ni sems kyi ngo bo nyid la gnyis med pa'i don rang rig pa'i ngo bo nyid rab tu dbye bas chos rab tu rnam par 'byed pa'i ngo bo nyid yin pa'i phyir byang chub sems dpa' de la mkhas par bya ba bstan pa'i dbang du mdzad
translated: Since insight is the very essence of the mind, the very essence of self-awareness of the meaning of non-duality, and the very essence of the thorough differentiation of phenomena, the bodhisattva is skilled in that.

original: nas / byams pa ngas zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
analyzed: nas / byams pa ngas zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
translated: With regard to that, Maitreya, I have taught the three trainings, and so on.

original: 'dir bcom ldan 'das kyi sbyor ba'i rgyu rnam pa gsum las gnas kyi sbyor ba'i rgyu ni dang por sbyor ba'i thabs kyi rgyu yin pas gtso cher bstan te /
analyzed: 'dir bcom ldan 'das kyi sbyor ba'i rgyu rnam pa gsum las gnas kyi sbyor ba'i rgyu ni dang por sbyor ba'i thabs kyi rgyu yin pas gtso cher bstan te /
translated: Here, from among the three causal trainings of the Bhagavat, the causal training in the basis is the principal one because it is the cause of the method of training.

original: rten gyi sbyor ba'i rgyu dang / dmigs pas sbyor ba'i rgyu yang sngar bstan pa bzhin du sbyar bar bya'o //
analyzed: rten gyi sbyor ba'i rgyu dang / dmigs pas sbyor ba'i rgyu yang sngar bstan pa bzhin du sbyar bar bya'o //
translated: The causal training in the support and the causal training in the object should be applied as they were previously explained.

original: de la chos gdags pa rnam par gzhag pa zhes bya ba ni mdor bstan pa yin te /
analyzed: de la chos gdags pa rnam par gzhag pa zhes bya ba ni mdor bstan pa yin te /
translated: With regard to that, the statement “I have taught the presentation of the designation of phenomena” is the brief presentation.

original: dper na bden pa gdags pa rnam par gzhag pa dang / rigs pa gdags pa rnam par gzhag pa dang / theg pa gdags pa rnam par gzhag pa dang zhes mdor bstan pa dang 'dra'o //
analyzed: dper na bden pa gdags pa rnam par gzhag pa dang / rigs pa gdags pa rnam par gzhag pa dang / theg pa gdags pa rnam par gzhag pa dang zhes mdor bstan pa dang 'dra'o //
translated: For example, it is like the brief indication: “The establishment of the designation of truth, the establishment of the designation of reasoning, the establishment of the designation of vehicle.”

original: 'di lta ste zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni rgyas par bshad pa yin te /
analyzed: 'di lta ste zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni rgyas par bshad pa yin te /
translated: “For example” and so on is the extensive explanation.

original: dper na bden pa gdags pa rnam par gzhag pa ni bden pa gcig nas bcu'i bar ro //
analyzed: dper na bden pa gdags pa rnam par gzhag pa ni bden pa gcig nas bcu'i bar ro //
translated: For example, the establishment of the designation of truth is from one truth up to ten truths.

original: rigs pa gdags pa rnam par gzhag pa ni rigs pa bzhi'o //
analyzed: rigs pa gdags pa rnam par gzhag pa ni rigs pa bzhi'o //
translated: The establishment of the designation of reasoning is the four reasonings.

original: theg pa gdags pa rnam par gzhag pa ni theg pa gsum mo zhes rgyas par bshad pa dang 'dra'o //
analyzed: theg pa gdags pa rnam par gzhag pa ni theg pa gsum mo zhes rgyas par bshad pa dang 'dra'o //
translated: The establishment of the designation of vehicle is the three vehicles.

original: de la mdo'i sde zhes bya ba ni bcom ldan 'das kyis de dang de dag tu gdul ba de dang de dag dang / gdul ba'i spyod pa rnams las brtsams te phung po dang ldan pa'i gtam dang / skye mched dang ldan pa dang / rten cing 'brel bar 'byung ba dang ldan pa dang /
analyzed: de la mdo'i sde zhes bya ba ni bcom ldan 'das kyis de dang de dag tu gdul ba de dang de dag dang / gdul ba'i spyod pa rnams las brtsams te phung po dang ldan pa'i gtam dang / skye mched dang ldan pa dang / rten cing 'brel bar 'byung ba dang ldan pa dang /
translated: The sutra collection is the Bhagavan's discourses that begin with the various disciples and their conduct and then discuss the aggregates, the sense bases, dependent origination,

original: zas dang ldan pa dang / khams dang ldan pa dang / nyan thos dang / rang sangs rgyas dang / de bzhin gshegs pa dang ldan pa dang / dran pa nye bar gzhag pa dang / yang dag pa'i spong ba dang / rdzu 'phrul gyi rkang pa dang /
analyzed: zas dang ldan pa dang / khams dang ldan pa dang / nyan thos dang / rang sangs rgyas dang / de bzhin gshegs pa dang ldan pa dang / dran pa nye bar gzhag pa dang / yang dag pa'i spong ba dang / rdzu 'phrul gyi rkang pa dang /
translated: the sustenances, the elements, the sravakas, pratyekabuddhas, tathagatas, the foundations of mindfulness, the correct exertions, the bases of supernatural power,

original: dbang po dang / stobs dang / byang chub kyi yan lag dang / lam gyi yan lag dang ldan pa dang ; mi sdug pa dang / dbugs rngub pa dang / dbugs 'byung ba dang / bslab pa dang / shes nas dad pa dang ldan pa'i gtam gsungs pa gang yin pa dag yang dag par sdud bar byed pa rnams kyis yongs su bzung nas bstan pa yun ring du gnas par bya ba'i don du 'di lta ste /🔽don dge ba @150a * //
analyzed: dbang po dang / stobs dang / byang chub kyi yan lag dang / lam gyi yan lag dang ldan pa dang ; mi sdug pa dang / dbugs rngub pa dang / dbugs 'byung ba dang / bslab pa dang / shes nas dad pa dang ldan pa'i gtam gsungs pa gang yin pa dag yang dag par sdud bar byed pa rnams kyis yongs su bzung nas bstan pa yun ring du gnas par bya ba'i don du 'di lta ste / don dge ba @150a * //
translated: It is the discourses that are endowed with the aggregates of the factors of awakening, the aggregates of the path, the faculties, the powers, the limbs of awakening, and the limbs of the path, and that are endowed with the teachings on foulness, inhalation and exhalation, the trainings, and faith born of insight.🔽The teachings that are well-composed by those who have taken them up and are intent on ensuring that the teachings remain for a long time are those that are virtuous in meaning,

original: dang ; don dang ldan pa tshangs par spyod pa dang ldan pa de dang de dag bstan par bya ba'i phyir ming gi tshogs dang / tshig gi tshogs dang / yi ge'i tshogs mthun pa dag gis ci rigs par rim gyis bkod cing rim gyis sbyar ba gang yin pa'o //
analyzed: dang ; don dang ldan pa tshangs par spyod pa dang ldan pa de dang de dag bstan par bya ba'i phyir ming gi tshogs dang / tshig gi tshogs dang / yi ge'i tshogs mthun pa dag gis ci rigs par rim gyis bkod cing rim gyis sbyar ba gang yin pa'o //
translated: meaningful, and endowed with pure conduct. They are composed and arranged in sequence by means of suitable collections of names, collections of phrases, and collections of syllables.

original: dbyangs kyis bsnyad pa'i sde zhes bya ba ni gang gis tha ma'i mjug tu tshigs su bcad pa mngon par brjod pa dang / drang ba'i don gyi mdo sde gang yin pa'o //
analyzed: dbyangs kyis bsnyad pa'i sde zhes bya ba ni gang gis tha ma'i mjug tu tshigs su bcad pa mngon par brjod pa dang / drang ba'i don gyi mdo sde gang yin pa'o //
translated: The “songs” are those that end with verses, and are of interpretable meaning.

original: lung du bstan pa'i sde zhes bya ba ni gang las nyan thos shi 'phos ba dang 'dus byas pa dang / skye ba lung ston pa dang nges pa'i don gyi mdo sde gang yin pa'o //
analyzed: lung du bstan pa'i sde zhes bya ba ni gang las nyan thos shi 'phos ba dang 'dus byas pa dang / skye ba lung ston pa dang nges pa'i don gyi mdo sde gang yin pa'o //
translated: The “metaphors” are those that teach the transmigration and rebirth of disciples, and are of definitive meaning.

original: tshigs su bcad pa'i sde zhes bya ba ni rgyas par bshad pa ma yin pa ste /
analyzed: tshigs su bcad pa'i sde zhes bya ba ni rgyas par bshad pa ma yin pa ste /
translated: The “discourses” are those that are not extensive.

original: 'di ltar rtsa ba gnyis pa'am /
analyzed: 'di ltar rtsa ba gnyis pa'am /
translated: They may be in two-line verses,

original: rtsa ba gsum pa'am /
analyzed: rtsa ba gsum pa'am /
translated: three-line verses,

original: rtsa ba bzhi pa'am /🔽rtsa ba lnga pa'am /
analyzed: rtsa ba bzhi pa'am / rtsa ba lnga pa'am /
translated: four-line verses,🔽five-line verses,

original: rtsa ba drug par bsdebs bshad pa gang yin pa'o //
analyzed: rtsa ba drug par bsdebs bshad pa gang yin pa'o //
translated: or six-line verses.

original: ched du brjod pa'i sde zhes bya ba ni gang zag gi ming dang rigs yongs su ma brjod ma bstan par phyis dam pa'i chos yun ring du gnas par bya ba dang / bstan pa yun ring du gnas par bya ba'i phyir bshad pa gang yin pa'o //
analyzed: ched du brjod pa'i sde zhes bya ba ni gang zag gi ming dang rigs yongs su ma brjod ma bstan par phyis dam pa'i chos yun ring du gnas par bya ba dang / bstan pa yun ring du gnas par bya ba'i phyir bshad pa gang yin pa'o //
translated: The category of statements of exalted thought is that which is explained later without mentioning or teaching the name and type of person, in order to make the holy Dharma last long and to make the teaching last long.

original: gleng gzhi'i sde zhes bya ba ni gang zag gi ming dang rigs brjod cing bstan te bshad pa dang / cung zad 'dul ba dang ldan pa'i byung ba dang bcas /
analyzed: gleng gzhi'i sde zhes bya ba ni gang zag gi ming dang rigs brjod cing bstan te bshad pa dang / cung zad 'dul ba dang ldan pa'i byung ba dang bcas /
translated: The category of sources is that which is explained by mentioning and teaching the name and type of person, and which is accompanied by the occurrence of a little Vinaya.

original: gleng gzhi dang bcas so sor thar pa'i mdo sde gang yin pa'o //
analyzed: gleng gzhi dang bcas so sor thar pa'i mdo sde gang yin pa'o //
translated: It is the Sūtra Collection of the Prātimokṣa that has sources.

original: rtogs pa brjod pa'i sde zhes bya ba ni dpe dang bcas par bstan pa ste /
analyzed: rtogs pa brjod pa'i sde zhes bya ba ni dpe dang bcas par bstan pa ste /
translated: The category of stories is that which is taught with examples.

original: dpe des don gyi ngo bo nyid de rnam par gsal bar 'gyur ba gang yin pa'o //
analyzed: dpe des don gyi ngo bo nyid de rnam par gsal bar 'gyur ba gang yin pa'o //
translated: It is that which clarifies the nature of the meaning by means of that example.

original: de lta bu byung ba'i sde zhes bya ba ni cung zad sngon gyi sbyor ba dang ldan pa gang yin pa'o //
analyzed: de lta bu byung ba'i sde zhes bya ba ni cung zad sngon gyi sbyor ba dang ldan pa gang yin pa'o //
translated: The category of former events is that which is accompanied by a little previous application.

original: skyes pa rabs kyi sde zhes bya ba ni 'das pa'i dus la brten te /
analyzed: skyes pa rabs kyi sde zhes bya ba ni 'das pa'i dus la brten te /
translated: The Jataka collection is that which, based on the past,

original: bcom ldan 'das kyis 'chi 'pho dang skye ba de dang de dag tu byang chub sems dpa'i spyod pa dang dka' ba spyad pa bstan pa gang yin pa'o //
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyis 'chi 'pho dang skye ba de dang de dag tu byang chub sems dpa'i spyod pa dang dka' ba spyad pa bstan pa gang yin pa'o //
translated: teaches the deeds of the Bodhisattva and the practice of austerities in such and such rebirths and deaths.

original: shin tu rgyas pa'i sde zhes bya ba ni gang las bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub dang / stobs bcu dang ; sgrib pa med pa'i ye shes yang dag par bsgrubs pa'i phyir byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi lam bstan pa gang yin pa'o //
analyzed: shin tu rgyas pa'i sde zhes bya ba ni gang las bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub dang / stobs bcu dang ; sgrib pa med pa'i ye shes yang dag par bsgrubs pa'i phyir byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi lam bstan pa gang yin pa'o //
translated: The Vaipulya collection is that which teaches the path of the Bodhisattvas in order to accomplish the ten powers and unobstructed knowledge of a perfect Buddha.

original: rmad du byung ba'i chos kyi sde zhes bya ba ni gang las sangs rgyas rnams dang / sangs rgyas kyi nyan thos dge slong rnams dang / dge slong ma rnams dang / dge tshul @150b rnams dang / dge tshul ma rnams dang / dge bsnyen rnams dang /
analyzed: rmad du byung ba'i chos kyi sde zhes bya ba ni gang las sangs rgyas rnams dang / sangs rgyas kyi nyan thos dge slong rnams dang / dge slong ma rnams dang / dge tshul @150b rnams dang / dge tshul ma rnams dang / dge bsnyen rnams dang /
translated: The Adbhutadharma collection is that which teaches the extraordinary qualities of the Buddhas, the disciples of the Buddhas, the bhiksus, the bhiksunis, the upasakas, the upasikas, and the Solitary Buddhas.

original: dge bsnyen ma rnams kyi thun mong dang / thun mong ma yin pa dang / de las gzhan pa khyad par 'phags pa'i yon tan khyad par can ngo mtshar rmad du byung bar grags pa dag bstan pa gang yin pa'o //
analyzed: dge bsnyen ma rnams kyi thun mong dang / thun mong ma yin pa dang / de las gzhan pa khyad par 'phags pa'i yon tan khyad par can ngo mtshar rmad du byung bar grags pa dag bstan pa gang yin pa'o //
translated: It is the teaching of the qualities of the upasikas, common and uncommon, and of the extraordinary qualities that are superior to those.

original: gtan la phab par bstan pa'i sde zhes bya ba ni mdo sde 'dren mar byed cing /
analyzed: gtan la phab par bstan pa'i sde zhes bya ba ni mdo sde 'dren mar byed cing /
translated: The Abhidharma is the teaching of the established doctrine.

original: mdo sde rnam par 'chad par byed pa ma lta bu'i chos mngon pa thams cad do //
analyzed: mdo sde rnam par 'chad par byed pa ma lta bu'i chos mngon pa thams cad do //
translated: It is the Abhidharma that is not like a mother, that does not give birth to the Sutras, but only explains them.

original: gsung rab tu gtogs pa yan lag bcu gnyis po de dag la mdo sde yang yod /
analyzed: gsung rab tu gtogs pa yan lag bcu gnyis po de dag la mdo sde yang yod /
translated: In these twelve members of the scriptures, there is Sutra,

original: 'dul ba yang yod /
analyzed: 'dul ba yang yod /
translated: there is Vinaya,

original: chos mngon pa yang yod /
analyzed: chos mngon pa yang yod /
translated: and there is Abhidharma.

original: de la re zhig mdo'i sde dang / dbyangs kyis bsnyad pa'i sde dang / lung du bstan pa'i sde dang / tshigs su bcad pa'i sde dang / ched du brjod pa'i sde gang yin pa de ni nyan thos kyi mdo sde'i sde snod do //
analyzed: de la re zhig mdo'i sde dang / dbyangs kyis bsnyad pa'i sde dang / lung du bstan pa'i sde dang / tshigs su bcad pa'i sde dang / ched du brjod pa'i sde gang yin pa de ni nyan thos kyi mdo sde'i sde snod do //
translated: The Sutra, the Geva, the Vyakarana, the Gatha, and the Udana are the Sutra-pitaka of the Sravakas.

original: shin tu rgyas pa'i sde dang / rmad du byung ba'i chos kyi sde gang yin pa de ni byang chub sems dpa'i mdo sde'i sde snod do //
analyzed: shin tu rgyas pa'i sde dang / rmad du byung ba'i chos kyi sde gang yin pa de ni byang chub sems dpa'i mdo sde'i sde snod do //
translated: The Vaipulya and the Adbhutadharma are the Sutra Pitaka of the Bodhisattvas.

original: gleng gzhi'i sde dang / de lta bu byung ba'i sde dang skyes pa rabs kyi sde gang yin pa de ni gnyis ka'i 'dul ba'i sde snod do //
analyzed: gleng gzhi'i sde dang / de lta bu byung ba'i sde dang skyes pa rabs kyi sde gang yin pa de ni gnyis ka'i 'dul ba'i sde snod do //
translated: The Nidana, the Itivrttaka, and the Jataka are the Vinaya Pitaka of both.

original: gtan la dbab bar bstan pa'i sde gang yin pa de ni gnyis ka'i chos mngon pa'i sde snod do //
analyzed: gtan la dbab bar bstan pa'i sde gang yin pa de ni gnyis ka'i chos mngon pa'i sde snod do //
translated: The Upadeśa is the Abhidharma Pitaka of both.

original: skabs kha cig nas ni gleng gzhi'i sde dang / gtan la dbab bar bstan pa'i sde ma gtogs pa gzhan bcu ni gnyi ga'i mdo sde'i sde snod do //
analyzed: skabs kha cig nas ni gleng gzhi'i sde dang / gtan la dbab bar bstan pa'i sde ma gtogs pa gzhan bcu ni gnyi ga'i mdo sde'i sde snod do //
translated: In some places, it is said that the ten categories, with the exception of the Nidana and the Upadeśa, are the Sutra Pitaka of both.

original: gleng gzhi'i sde ni gnyi ga'i 'dul ba'i sde snod do //
analyzed: gleng gzhi'i sde ni gnyi ga'i 'dul ba'i sde snod do //
translated: The Nidana is the Vinaya Pitaka of both.

original: gtan la dbab bar bstan pa'i sde ni gnyi ga'i chos mngon pa'i sde snod do zhes kyang bshad do //
analyzed: gtan la dbab bar bstan pa'i sde ni gnyi ga'i chos mngon pa'i sde snod do zhes kyang bshad do //
translated: The Upadeśa is the Abhidharma Pitaka of both.

original: gang dag byang chub sems dpa' rnams la bshad pa de dag ces bya bas ni theg pa gnyis las khyad par du 'phags pa byang chub sems dpa'i sde snod kyis bsdus pa'i chos gdags pa rnam par gzhag pa yin par bstan to //
analyzed: gang dag byang chub sems dpa' rnams la bshad pa de dag ces bya bas ni theg pa gnyis las khyad par du 'phags pa byang chub sems dpa'i sde snod kyis bsdus pa'i chos gdags pa rnam par gzhag pa yin par bstan to //
translated: Those who explain to the bodhisattvas indicates the presentation of the designation of phenomena included in the bodhisattva canon, which is superior to the two vehicles.

original: de ltar chos gdags pa rnam par gzhag pa mdor bstan pa dang / rgyas par bshad pa bstan nas /
analyzed: de ltar chos gdags pa rnam par gzhag pa mdor bstan pa dang / rgyas par bshad pa bstan nas /
translated: Having thus presented the brief and extensive explanations of the presentation of the designation of phenomena,

original: da ni de la ji ltar gnas bas gnas pa'i rgyu bstan pa'i tshig gi don la sogs pa bshad par bya ste /
analyzed: da ni de la ji ltar gnas bas gnas pa'i rgyu bstan pa'i tshig gi don la sogs pa bshad par bya ste /
translated: now, in order to explain the meaning of the words of the teaching on the cause of abiding in that way, and so on,

original: de la gnas pa ni thos pa dang bsam pa'i shes rab kyi stobs bskyed pas lung gi chos de dag la gnas pa ste /
analyzed: de la gnas pa ni thos pa dang bsam pa'i shes rab kyi stobs bskyed pas lung gi chos de dag la gnas pa ste /
translated: abiding there means abiding in those scriptural dharmas through the power of the wisdom of hearing and contemplation.

original: de'i phyir byang chub sems dpas zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs so //🔽de la legs par thos zhes bya ba ni tshig dang don phyin ci ma @151a * //
analyzed: de'i phyir byang chub sems dpas zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs so // de la legs par thos zhes bya ba ni tshig dang don phyin ci ma @151a * //
translated: Therefore, it is said that the bodhisattva...

original: log par thos pa'o //
analyzed: log par thos pa'o //
translated: There, hearing well means hearing the words and meanings without error.

original: legs par gzung zhes bya ba ni thos pa de nyid mi brjed par gzung ba'o //
analyzed: legs par gzung zhes bya ba ni thos pa de nyid mi brjed par gzung ba'o //
translated: The phrase they are well held means that they are held without being forgotten.

original: kha thon byang bar byas zhes bya ba ni gzung ba de dag rnam par bshad pa dang / kha thon du goms par byas pa ste /
analyzed: kha thon byang bar byas zhes bya ba ni gzung ba de dag rnam par bshad pa dang / kha thon du goms par byas pa ste /
translated: The phrase they are well mastered means that they are well explained and well practiced.

original: de dag gis thos pa'i shes rab kyi stobs bskyed pas lung gi chos de dag la gnas pa bstan to //
analyzed: de dag gis thos pa'i shes rab kyi stobs bskyed pas lung gi chos de dag la gnas pa bstan to //
translated: These two lines indicate that the bodhisattva who is established in the Dharma of the scriptures generates the power of wisdom that comes from listening.

original: yid kyis legs par brtags zhes bya ba ni kha thon byang bar byas pa de dag rigs pas yid kyi mngon sum du byas pa'o //
analyzed: yid kyis legs par brtags zhes bya ba ni kha thon byang bar byas pa de dag rigs pas yid kyi mngon sum du byas pa'o //
translated: The phrase they are well investigated with the mind means that they are made evident to the mind through reasoning.

original: mthong bas shin tu rtogs par byas nas zhes bya ba ni yid kyi mngon sum du byas pa de dag gi nges pa'i don dang / drang pa'i don gang yin par rigs pas bskyed pa'i blos legs par rtogs par byas pa ste /
analyzed: mthong bas shin tu rtogs par byas nas zhes bya ba ni yid kyi mngon sum du byas pa de dag gi nges pa'i don dang / drang pa'i don gang yin par rigs pas bskyed pa'i blos legs par rtogs par byas pa ste /
translated: The phrase they are well realized through insight means that the bodhisattva generates the power of wisdom that comes from contemplation by means of the mind that has been developed through reasoning and that he or she realizes well the definitive and provisional meanings of those that have been made evident to the mind.

original: de dag gis ni bsam pa'i shes rab kyi stobs bskyed pas lung gi chos de dag la gnas pa bstan to //
analyzed: de dag gis ni bsam pa'i shes rab kyi stobs bskyed pas lung gi chos de dag la gnas pa bstan to //
translated: These two lines indicate that the bodhisattva who is established in the Dharma of the scriptures generates the power of wisdom that comes from contemplation.

original: de ltar sbyor ba'i rgyu bstan pa de ni 'jig rten pa las khyad par du 'phags pa'i thabs kyi rgyu yin pas 'dir gtso cher smos par zad kyi byang chub sems dpa' zhi gnas yongs su tshol ba dang / lhag mthong la mkhas par 'dod pas ting nge 'dzin gyi tshogs bsrung zhing bsags ba gzhan dag la yang nges par sbyar bar bya dgos te /
analyzed: de ltar sbyor ba'i rgyu bstan pa de ni 'jig rten pa las khyad par du 'phags pa'i thabs kyi rgyu yin pas 'dir gtso cher smos par zad kyi byang chub sems dpa' zhi gnas yongs su tshol ba dang / lhag mthong la mkhas par 'dod pas ting nge 'dzin gyi tshogs bsrung zhing bsags ba gzhan dag la yang nges par sbyar bar bya dgos te /
translated: However, the bodhisattva who seeks serenity and who wishes to be skilled in insight must definitely apply himself to the other accumulations and protection of the requisites of samadhi.

original: de la ting nge 'dzin gyi tshogs bsrung zhing bsags pa gang zhe na /
analyzed: de la ting nge 'dzin gyi tshogs bsrung zhing bsags pa gang zhe na /
translated: What are the requisites of samadhi and their protection?

original: de ni rnam pa bcu gsum ste /
analyzed: de ni rnam pa bcu gsum ste /
translated: They are thirteen:

original: bdag gi 'byor pa dang ; gzhan gyi 'byor pa dang / dge ba'i chos la 'dun pa dang / tshul khrims kyi sdom pa dang / dbang po sdom pa dang / zas kyi tshod rig pa nyid dang / nam gyi cha stod dang cha smad la mi nyal bar sbyor ba'i rjes su brtson pa nyid dang /
analyzed: bdag gi 'byor pa dang ; gzhan gyi 'byor pa dang / dge ba'i chos la 'dun pa dang / tshul khrims kyi sdom pa dang / dbang po sdom pa dang / zas kyi tshod rig pa nyid dang / nam gyi cha stod dang cha smad la mi nyal bar sbyor ba'i rjes su brtson pa nyid dang /
translated: one's own requisites, the requisites of others, aspiration for virtue, the vow of moral discipline, the restraint of the senses, moderation in eating, striving in the first and last parts of the night, not being devoted to conversation, not being devoted to sleep, not being devoted to postures, not being devoted to society, being devoted to solitude, and being devoted to the practice of yoga.

original: shes bzhin du spyod pa nyid dang / dge ba'i bshes gnyen dang / dam pa'i chos nyan cing sems pa dang / bar chad med pa dang / gtong ba spel ba dang / dge sbyong gi rgyan dang ldan pa'o //
analyzed: shes bzhin du spyod pa nyid dang / dge ba'i bshes gnyen dang / dam pa'i chos nyan cing sems pa dang / bar chad med pa dang / gtong ba spel ba dang / dge sbyong gi rgyan dang ldan pa'o //
translated: 1. the practice of vigilance, 2. the spiritual teacher, 3. listening to the holy Dharma and reflecting on it, 4. the absence of obstacles, 5. the increase of giving, and 6. the possession of the ornament of the religious wanderer.

original: de dag ni 'jig rten pa dang / 'jig rten las 'das pa'i lam gang yang rung bas 'dod chags dang bral par gyur pa'i ting nge 'dzin gyi tshogs rgya cher bstan pa yin te /
analyzed: de dag ni 'jig rten pa dang / 'jig rten las 'das pa'i lam gang yang rung bas 'dod chags dang bral par gyur pa'i ting nge 'dzin gyi tshogs rgya cher bstan pa yin te /
translated: These are the extensive explanations of the collections of concentration for one who has become free from attachment by means of any of the mundane or supramundane paths.🔽Having abandoned the factors that contribute to debility, one relies on the factors that contribute to penetrability.

original: de dag gis nyams par gyur pa'i cha dang mthun pa'i chos rnams yongs su spangs shing khyad par du gyur pa ni cha dang mthun pa'i chos rnams la so sor brten pas de'i 'og tu rab tu dben pa dang / sems rtse gcig pa nyid la nges par sbyor ba'i rim gyis /
analyzed: de dag gis nyams par gyur pa'i cha dang mthun pa'i chos rnams yongs su spangs shing khyad par du gyur pa ni cha dang mthun pa'i chos rnams la so sor brten pas de'i 'og tu rab tu dben pa dang / sems rtse gcig pa nyid la nges par sbyor ba'i rim gyis /
translated: Then, in order, one is definitely joined to isolation and one-pointedness of mind.

original: zhi gnas dang lhag mthong gi dmigs pa yongs su tshol ba @151b bstan par bya ste /
analyzed: zhi gnas dang lhag mthong gi dmigs pa yongs su tshol ba @151b bstan par bya ste /
translated: The search for the object of meditation of serenity and insight should be explained.

original: 'dir dang por sbyor ba'i lam gyis yid la byed pas rab tu phye ba'i zhi gnas sngon du 'gro bar sbyar ro //
analyzed: 'dir dang por sbyor ba'i lam gyis yid la byed pas rab tu phye ba'i zhi gnas sngon du 'gro bar sbyar ro //
translated: Here, the path of application is distinguished by mental attention, and is applied in the preliminary stage of serenity.

original: de la rab tu dben pa la sbyor ba bstan pa'i dbang du mdzad nas de gcig pu dben bar 'dug ste zhes bya ba gsungs so //
analyzed: de la rab tu dben pa la sbyor ba bstan pa'i dbang du mdzad nas de gcig pu dben bar 'dug ste zhes bya ba gsungs so //
translated: With reference to the teaching of application in solitude, he said, “He dwells alone in solitude. ”

original: de zhes bya ba ni byang chub sems dpa'o //
analyzed: de zhes bya ba ni byang chub sems dpa'o //
translated: “He” refers to the bodhisattva.

original: gcig bu zhes bya ba ni lus dben pa'o //
analyzed: gcig bu zhes bya ba ni lus dben pa'o //
translated: “Alone” refers to physical solitude.

original: dben pa zhes bya ba ni sems dben par ro //
analyzed: dben pa zhes bya ba ni sems dben par ro //
translated: “In solitude” refers to mental solitude.

original: 'dug ste zhes bya ba ni rab tu dben pa la nges par sbyor ba'o //
analyzed: 'dug ste zhes bya ba ni rab tu dben pa la nges par sbyor ba'o //
translated: “Dwells” refers to the definite application in solitude.

original: de la rab tu dben pa gang zhe na /
analyzed: de la rab tu dben pa gang zhe na /
translated: What is solitude?

original: de ni rnam pa gsum ste /
analyzed: de ni rnam pa gsum ste /
translated: It is threefold:

original: gnas phun sum tshogs pa dang / spyod lam phun sum tshogs pa dang / dpen pa phun sum tshogs pa'o //
analyzed: gnas phun sum tshogs pa dang / spyod lam phun sum tshogs pa dang / dpen pa phun sum tshogs pa'o //
translated: solitude of place, solitude of conduct, and solitude of detachment.

original: de la gnas phun sum tshogs pa zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: de la gnas phun sum tshogs pa zhes bya ba la /
translated: With regard to the statement about the excellence of place,

original: gnas ni rnam pa gsum ste /
analyzed: gnas ni rnam pa gsum ste /
translated: place is threefold:

original: dgon pa dang / shing drung dang / khyim gyis stongs pa'o //
analyzed: dgon pa dang / shing drung dang / khyim gyis stongs pa'o //
translated: in the forest, at the foot of a tree, or in an empty building.

original: de la dgon pa zhes bya ba ni gnas mal bla gab med pa dang / dur khrod dang / bas mtha'o //
analyzed: de la dgon pa zhes bya ba ni gnas mal bla gab med pa dang / dur khrod dang / bas mtha'o //
translated: The forest is a place without a roof, a charnel ground, or a wilderness.

original: shing drung zhes bya ba ni nags 'dab po //
analyzed: shing drung zhes bya ba ni nags 'dab po //
translated: The foot of a tree is a grove.

original: khyim gyis stongs pa zhes bya ba ni gang na khyim gyi gnas bya ba med pa ste /
analyzed: khyim gyis stongs pa zhes bya ba ni gang na khyim gyi gnas bya ba med pa ste /
translated: The vacant place is where there is no human habitation.

original: ri khrod dang / ri phug dang / rtsva gseb bo //
analyzed: ri khrod dang / ri phug dang / rtsva gseb bo //
translated: The mountain is a mountain cave, a thicket, or a forest.

original: phun sum tshogs pa rnam pa lnga ste /🔽dang po kho nar gnas dbyibs su shis pa blta na sdug pa /
