analyzed: phun sum tshogs pa rnam pa lnga ste / dang po kho nar gnas dbyibs su shis pa blta na sdug pa /
translated: There are five kinds of perfection:🔽First, the place should be pleasant, beautiful, and attractive.

original: mdzes pa / kun dga'i ra ba dang ldan pa /
analyzed: mdzes pa / kun dga'i ra ba dang ldan pa /
translated: It should have a garden,

original: nags tshal dang ldan pa /
analyzed: nags tshal dang ldan pa /
translated: a forest,

original: rdzing bu dang ldan pa /
analyzed: rdzing bu dang ldan pa /
translated: and a pond.

original: gtsang ba / nyams dga' ba /
analyzed: gtsang ba / nyams dga' ba /
translated: It should be clean, delightful,

original: shang shing med pa /
analyzed: shang shing med pa /
translated: and free of thorns.

original: sdong dum dang tsher ma'i gzhi ma yin pa /
analyzed: sdong dum dang tsher ma'i gzhi ma yin pa /
translated: It should not be a place of stumps or thorns,🔽or of many stones, pebbles, and gravel.

original: rdo ba dang / gseg ma gyo dum mi mang ba gang des mthong na spong ba la brtson ba la gnas par bya ba'i phyir sems mngon par dang bar gyur cing /
analyzed: rdo ba dang / gseg ma gyo dum mi mang ba gang des mthong na spong ba la brtson ba la gnas par bya ba'i phyir sems mngon par dang bar gyur cing /
translated: When one sees it, one's mind should be filled with joy, for the purpose of abiding in the practice of renunciation.

original: sems rangs pa dang / rab tu dga' bas spong ba la rab tu rtogs par byed pa gang yin pa de ni gnas phun sum tshogs pa dang po yin no //🔽gzhan yang nyin mo mi sdug pa nyung la /
analyzed: sems rangs pa dang / rab tu dga' bas spong ba la rab tu rtogs par byed pa gang yin pa de ni gnas phun sum tshogs pa dang po yin no // gzhan yang nyin mo mi sdug pa nyung la /
translated: The first excellent basis is the joy and delight of the bodhisattva who is fully engaged in the practice of abandoning.

original: mtshan mo sgra chung zhing klag cor nyung ba dang / sha sbrang dang / sbrang bu mchu rings dang / rlung dang / nyi ma dang / sdig sbrul gyi reg pa nyung ba gang yin pa de ni gnas phun sum tshogs pa gnyis pa yin no //🔽gzhan yang seng ge dang / stag dang gung dang / chom rkun dang / pha rol gyi dmag tshogs dang / mi dang mi ma yin pa'i 'jigs pa dang / 'jigs su rung ba med pa yid brtan cing bag tsha ba med pa bde ba la reg par gnas par 'gyur ba gang yin pa de ni gnas phun sum tshogs pa @152a * //
analyzed: mtshan mo sgra chung zhing klag cor nyung ba dang / sha sbrang dang / sbrang bu mchu rings dang / rlung dang / nyi ma dang / sdig sbrul gyi reg pa nyung ba gang yin pa de ni gnas phun sum tshogs pa gnyis pa yin no // gzhan yang seng ge dang / stag dang gung dang / chom rkun dang / pha rol gyi dmag tshogs dang / mi dang mi ma yin pa'i 'jigs pa dang / 'jigs su rung ba med pa yid brtan cing bag tsha ba med pa bde ba la reg par gnas par 'gyur ba gang yin pa de ni gnas phun sum tshogs pa @152a * //
translated: The second excellent basis is the bodhisattva’s practice of abandoning in a place that is not crowded during the day and that is quiet at night, with few sounds, few mosquitoes, few flies, few snakes, and few strong winds, and where there are few sun and wind.

original: gsum pa yin no //
analyzed: gsum pa yin no //
translated: The third excellent basis is the bodhisattva’s practice of abandoning in a place that is free of fear, such as the fear of lions, tigers, panthers, robbers, enemies, humans, and non-humans, and where one can live happily, confidently, and without fear.

original: gzhan yang gong du chos gos la sogs pa 'tsho ba'i yo byad rkyen du 'bab pa gang dag yin pa de dag tshegs chung ngus 'grub cing /
analyzed: gzhan yang gong du chos gos la sogs pa 'tsho ba'i yo byad rkyen du 'bab pa gang dag yin pa de dag tshegs chung ngus 'grub cing /
translated: Furthermore, the requisites for your livelihood, such as your Dharma robes, are easily obtained.🔽

original: bsod snyoms la sogs pas lus ngal ba med par 'tsho bar 'gyur ba gang yin pa de ni gnas phun sum tshogs pa bzhi pa yin no //
analyzed: bsod snyoms la sogs pas lus ngal ba med par 'tsho bar 'gyur ba gang yin pa de ni gnas phun sum tshogs pa bzhi pa yin no //
translated: Furthermore, the fourth excellent basis is that the conditions for the requisites of life, such as Dharma robes, are easily obtained and one can live without physical hardship through alms and so forth.

original: gzhan yang gang du dge ba'i bshes gnyen gyis yongs su zin par 'gyur zhing /
analyzed: gzhan yang gang du dge ba'i bshes gnyen gyis yongs su zin par 'gyur zhing /
translated: Furthermore, one should live in a place where one is cared for by a spiritual friend,

original: gang dag de la ma phye ba'i gnas rnams 'byed par byed cing /
analyzed: gang dag de la ma phye ba'i gnas rnams 'byed par byed cing /
translated: where one can open up the topics that have not been opened up,

original: phye ba rnams kyang bsal bar byed pa dang / shes pa dang mthong ba rnam par dag par bya ba'i phyir zab mo'i 'don dang / tshig shes rab kyis so sor brtags nas legs par rab tu ston par byed pa dang / de lta bu'i tshangs pa mtshungs par spyod pa mkhas ba dag gnas pa gang yin pa de ni gnas phun sum tshogs pa lnga pa yin te /
analyzed: phye ba rnams kyang bsal bar byed pa dang / shes pa dang mthong ba rnam par dag par bya ba'i phyir zab mo'i 'don dang / tshig shes rab kyis so sor brtags nas legs par rab tu ston par byed pa dang / de lta bu'i tshangs pa mtshungs par spyod pa mkhas ba dag gnas pa gang yin pa de ni gnas phun sum tshogs pa lnga pa yin te /
translated: The fifth perfectness is the perfect place.

original: de dag gcig tu bsdus pa ni gnas phun sum tshogs pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: de dag gcig tu bsdus pa ni gnas phun sum tshogs pa zhes bya'o //
translated: All of these are included in the perfect place.

original: de la spyod lam phun sum tshogs pa gang zhe na /
analyzed: de la spyod lam phun sum tshogs pa gang zhe na /
translated: What is the perfect conduct?

original: gnas phun sum tshogs pa de nyid du nyin mo 'chag pa dang / 'dug pa dag gis 'da' bar byed cing /
analyzed: gnas phun sum tshogs pa de nyid du nyin mo 'chag pa dang / 'dug pa dag gis 'da' bar byed cing /
translated: In that perfect place, he spends the day walking, sitting, and so forth.

original: mtshan mo'i thun dang po la yang de bzhin byed pa dang / thun bar ma la glo g-yas pa phab ste /
analyzed: mtshan mo'i thun dang po la yang de bzhin byed pa dang / thun bar ma la glo g-yas pa phab ste /
translated: In the first part of the night, he does the same. In the middle part of the night, he lies down on his right side,

original: rkang pa rkang pa'i steng du bzhag nas snang ba'i 'du shes dang / dran pa dang shes bzhin dang ldan pa kho na'i 'du shes yid la byed bzhin du thum phras kyis nyal bar byed pa dang / thun tha ma la myur ba myur ba kho nar langs te 'chag pa dang 'dug pa dag gis 'da' bar byed pa dang /
analyzed: rkang pa rkang pa'i steng du bzhag nas snang ba'i 'du shes dang / dran pa dang shes bzhin dang ldan pa kho na'i 'du shes yid la byed bzhin du thum phras kyis nyal bar byed pa dang / thun tha ma la myur ba myur ba kho nar langs te 'chag pa dang 'dug pa dag gis 'da' bar byed pa dang /
translated: In the last period of the night, he gets up quickly and spends the time walking and sitting.

original: 'chag pa na yang 'chags dkyus ring zhing ha cang yang mi che bar byas pa'i sa phyogs su 'jig rten dang mi 'gal zhing 'dul ba dang mi 'gal bar 'gro ba dang ldog pa dang ldan pa'i lus kyi las kyis ci ran par 'chag pa dang 'dug pa
analyzed: 'chag pa na yang 'chags dkyus ring zhing ha cang yang mi che bar byas pa'i sa phyogs su 'jig rten dang mi 'gal zhing 'dul ba dang mi 'gal bar 'gro ba dang ldog pa dang ldan pa'i lus kyi las kyis ci ran par 'chag pa dang 'dug pa
translated: When he walks, he walks on a path that is neither too far nor too near, that is safe from danger, and that is not frequented by ordinary people. He walks and turns back with a physical action that is appropriate and in accord with worldly norms and the monastic code.

original: na yang sangs rgyas kyis gnang ba'i khri 'am khri'u 'am /
analyzed: na yang sangs rgyas kyis gnang ba'i khri 'am khri'u 'am /
translated: When he sits, he sits on a seat approved by the Buddha, such as a wooden bench, a wooden box,

original: rtsva bting ba'i steng du skyil mo krung bcas te lus drang por bsrang nas dran pa phyogs par gzhag ste 'dug pa'o //
analyzed: rtsva bting ba'i steng du skyil mo krung bcas te lus drang por bsrang nas dran pa phyogs par gzhag ste 'dug pa'o //
translated: a grass mat, or a woolen mat. He sits with his legs crossed, his body erect, and his mindfulness directed to the present.

original: de la ci'i phyir skyil mo krung bca' zhe na /
analyzed: de la ci'i phyir skyil mo krung bca' zhe na /
translated: Why does he sit cross-legged?

original: rgyu rnam pa lnga'i phyir te /
analyzed: rgyu rnam pa lnga'i phyir te /
translated: For five reasons:

original: spyod lam des lus legs par bsgrims nas shin tu sbyangs pa skye ba dang spyod lam des 'dug pas yun ring du 'da' bar byed cing lus ngal bar mi 'gyur ba dang / spyod lam de gzhan du mu stegs can la sogs pa dang thun mong ma yin pa dang /
analyzed: spyod lam des lus legs par bsgrims nas shin tu sbyangs pa skye ba dang spyod lam des 'dug pas yun ring du 'da' bar byed cing lus ngal bar mi 'gyur ba dang / spyod lam de gzhan du mu stegs can la sogs pa dang thun mong ma yin pa dang /
translated: because in that posture the body is well-controlled and pliancy arises; because in that posture one can remain seated for a long time without tiring; because that posture is not common to the tirthikas;

original: spyod lam des 'dug pa gzhan dag gis @152b mthong na shin tu dang ba skye ba dang / spyod lam de sangs rgyas dang sangs rgyas kyi nyan thos rnams kyis rjes su gnang ba yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: spyod lam des 'dug pa gzhan dag gis @152b mthong na shin tu dang ba skye ba dang / spyod lam de sangs rgyas dang sangs rgyas kyi nyan thos rnams kyis rjes su gnang ba yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because when others see one seated in that posture, they feel great faith; and because that posture is approved by the Buddhas and disciples.

original: de la lus drang por bsrang ba gang zhe na /
analyzed: de la lus drang por bsrang ba gang zhe na /
translated: What is it to be straight in body?

original: lus la bag yangs su drang por gzhag pa dang / sems la g-yo dang tshul 'chos pa med bar drang por gzhag pa'o //
analyzed: lus la bag yangs su drang por gzhag pa dang / sems la g-yo dang tshul 'chos pa med bar drang por gzhag pa'o //
translated: It is to be straight in body and mind without pretense or deceit.

original: de la lus bag yangs su drang por gzhag pas ni nang gi rmugs pa dang gnyid kyi sems yang dag par blangs te mi gnas la sems la g-yo dang tshul 'chos pa med par drang por gzhag pas ni phyi rol du rnam par g-yeng ba dang rgod pa'i
analyzed: de la lus bag yangs su drang por gzhag pas ni nang gi rmugs pa dang gnyid kyi sems yang dag par blangs te mi gnas la sems la g-yo dang tshul 'chos pa med par drang por gzhag pas ni phyi rol du rnam par g-yeng ba dang rgod pa'i
translated: By placing the body in a relaxed posture, one does not maintain a state of mind that is sluggish or sleepy. By placing the mind in a relaxed posture that is free of deceit and hypocrisy, one does not maintain a state of mind that is distracted outwardly or agitated.

original: sems yang dag par blangs te mi gnas so //
analyzed: sems yang dag par blangs te mi gnas so //
translated: By placing the mind in a posture that is free of deceit and hypocrisy, one does not maintain a state of mind that is distracted outwardly or agitated.

original: dran pa phyogs par gzhag ste zhes bya ba ni dran pa'i phyir phyogs pa dang / mngon du phyogs par gzhag pa ste /
analyzed: dran pa phyogs par gzhag ste zhes bya ba ni dran pa'i phyir phyogs pa dang / mngon du phyogs par gzhag pa ste /
translated: Placing the mind in a posture that is directed by mindfulness means that it is placed in a posture that is directed toward and faces in the direction of mindfulness.

original: tshul bzhin yid la byed pa dang ldan pa'i dran pa ni nag po'i phyogs thams cad las phyir phyogs pa yin pa dang / ting nge 'dzin gyi mtshan ma la dmigs pa'i dran pa ni mnyam par gzhag pa'i sa pa'i dmigs pa thams cad la mngon du phyogs pa yin pas de ltar dran pa'i phyir phyogs pa dang /
analyzed: tshul bzhin yid la byed pa dang ldan pa'i dran pa ni nag po'i phyogs thams cad las phyir phyogs pa yin pa dang / ting nge 'dzin gyi mtshan ma la dmigs pa'i dran pa ni mnyam par gzhag pa'i sa pa'i dmigs pa thams cad la mngon du phyogs pa yin pas de ltar dran pa'i phyir phyogs pa dang /
translated: The mindfulness that is accompanied by proper attention turns away from everything that is a negative quality, and the mindfulness that is focused on the signs of one-pointed concentration faces in the direction of and is directed toward all the objects that are related to the stage of meditative absorption.

original: mngon du phyogs par gzhag pa ni dran pa phyogs par gzhag pa zhes bya ste /
analyzed: mngon du phyogs par gzhag pa ni dran pa phyogs par gzhag pa zhes bya ste /
translated: The placing of mindfulness is called the placing of mindfulness in front.

original: de ni spyod lam phun sum tshogs pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: de ni spyod lam phun sum tshogs pa zhes bya'o //
translated: This is called the perfection of deportment.

original: de la dben pa phun sum tshogs pa gang zhe na rnam pa gnyis te /
analyzed: de la dben pa phun sum tshogs pa gang zhe na rnam pa gnyis te /
translated: What is perfection of solitude? It is twofold:

original: lus dben pa dang / sems dben pa'o //
analyzed: lus dben pa dang / sems dben pa'o //
translated: solitude of body and solitude of mind.

original: de la lus dben pa ni khyim na gnas pa dang rab tu byung ba rnams dang gnyis lhan cig mi gnas pa'o //🔽sems dben pa ni nyon mongs pa can dang / lung du ma bstan pa'i yid la byed pa spangs te mnyam par gzhag pa'i sa pa'i 'am /
analyzed: de la lus dben pa ni khyim na gnas pa dang rab tu byung ba rnams dang gnyis lhan cig mi gnas pa'o // sems dben pa ni nyon mongs pa can dang / lung du ma bstan pa'i yid la byed pa spangs te mnyam par gzhag pa'i sa pa'i 'am /
translated: The solitude of body is the avoidance of the two, namely, the lay people who live in a house and those who have gone forth into the homeless state.

original: ting nge 'dzin gyi tshogs kyi sbyor ba las byung ba'i yid la byed pa dge ba don dang ldan pa sgom par byed pa ste /
analyzed: ting nge 'dzin gyi tshogs kyi sbyor ba las byung ba'i yid la byed pa dge ba don dang ldan pa sgom par byed pa ste /
translated: The solitude of mind is the avoidance of defiled and morally indeterminate thoughts and the cultivation of wholesome thoughts associated with the stage of meditative concentration or with the preparations for the meditative absorptions and formless meditative attainments.

original: de ni rab tu dben pa la nges par sbyor ba zhes bya'o //
analyzed: de ni rab tu dben pa la nges par sbyor ba zhes bya'o //
translated: This is called the application to solitude.

original: de'i 'og tu sems rtse gcig pa nyid la nges par sbyor ba bstan pa'i dbang du mdzad nas /
analyzed: de'i 'og tu sems rtse gcig pa nyid la nges par sbyor ba bstan pa'i dbang du mdzad nas /
translated: After that, with reference to the teaching of the one-pointedness of mind, he said:

original: nang du yang dag bzhag nas zhes bya ba gsungs so //
analyzed: nang du yang dag bzhag nas zhes bya ba gsungs so //
translated: He says, “having settled into inner proper attention.”

original: de la nang du yang dag 'jog ces bya ba ni ting nge 'dzin zhes kyang bya /
analyzed: de la nang du yang dag 'jog ces bya ba ni ting nge 'dzin zhes kyang bya /
translated: Therein, “inner proper attention” is also called “meditative concentration.”

original: dge ba'i sems rtse gcig pa zhes kyang bya ste /
analyzed: dge ba'i sems rtse gcig pa zhes kyang bya ste /
translated: It is also called “one-pointed virtuous mind.”

original: de yang dang yang du rjes su dran pa dang cha mthun ba la dmigs pa dang / rgyun dang ldan pa dang / kha na ma tho ba med pa dang ldan pa dang / dga' ba dang ldan pa'i sems kyi rgyun gang yin pa'o //🔽de la yang dang yang du rjes su dran pa'i sems kyi @153a * //
analyzed: de yang dang yang du rjes su dran pa dang cha mthun ba la dmigs pa dang / rgyun dang ldan pa dang / kha na ma tho ba med pa dang ldan pa dang / dga' ba dang ldan pa'i sems kyi rgyun gang yin pa'o // de la yang dang yang du rjes su dran pa'i sems kyi @153a * //
translated: It is the continuity of mind that is associated with repeated recollection, that takes as its object what is similar, that is continuous, that is associated with the absence of misdeeds, and that is associated with joy.🔽Therein, the “continuity of mind that is associated with repeated recollection” is the continuity of mind that is associated with the repeated recollection of the Dharma, such as the scriptures, that one has heard and retained, and that is associated with the instructions and teachings that one has received from one’s spiritual teacher.

original: rgyun zhes bya ba ni mdo'i sde la sogs pa chos gang dag nyan cing gzung ba dang / bla ma la gdams ngag dang rjes su bstan pa thob pa gang yin pa de'i dbang du byas nas mnyam par gzhag pa'i sa pa'i mtshan ma mngon du byas te /
analyzed: rgyun zhes bya ba ni mdo'i sde la sogs pa chos gang dag nyan cing gzung ba dang / bla ma la gdams ngag dang rjes su bstan pa thob pa gang yin pa de'i dbang du byas nas mnyam par gzhag pa'i sa pa'i mtshan ma mngon du byas te /
translated: Having brought to mind the signs of the stage of meditative equipoise, one should then direct one’s mind to the object that is the object of one’s attention.

original: dmigs pa de la rgyun dang ldan pa'i dran pas rjes su 'jug par byed cing nye bar gtod par byed pa'o //
analyzed: dmigs pa de la rgyun dang ldan pa'i dran pas rjes su 'jug par byed cing nye bar gtod par byed pa'o //
translated: He engages in and directs his attention to that object with mindfulness that is continuous and closely placed.

original: cha mthun pa la dmigs pa'i sems kyi rgyun zhes bya ba ni mnyam par gzhag pa'i sa pa'i dmigs pa rnam pa du ma rnam pa mang po sna tshogs gang dag yin pa de dag ni shes bya'i dngos po dang cha mthun ba sems kyi gzugs brnyan rang🔽rig pa yin pas shes bya'i dngos po dang cha mthun pa zhes bya ste /
analyzed: cha mthun pa la dmigs pa'i sems kyi rgyun zhes bya ba ni mnyam par gzhag pa'i sa pa'i dmigs pa rnam pa du ma rnam pa mang po sna tshogs gang dag yin pa de dag ni shes bya'i dngos po dang cha mthun ba sems kyi gzugs brnyan rang rig pa yin pas shes bya'i dngos po dang cha mthun pa zhes bya ste /
translated: The continuity of mind that has a similar aspect is the many and various objects of the stage of meditative concentration. They are similar to the entity that is the object of knowledge.🔽They are the mental images of that entity.

original: cha mthun pa'i dmigs pa de la mnyam par gzhag pa'i sa pa'i sems kyis dmigs par byed pa'o //
analyzed: cha mthun pa'i dmigs pa de la mnyam par gzhag pa'i sa pa'i sems kyis dmigs par byed pa'o //
translated: The mind of the stage of meditative concentration takes them as its object.

original: rgyun dang ldan pa'i sems kyi rgyun zhes bya ba ni dmigs pa de la dran pa rnam par g-yeng ba med pa dang / rab tu chad pa med pa dang / rgyun chags pa dang / rtag tu gus par 'jug pa gang yin pa'o //
analyzed: rgyun dang ldan pa'i sems kyi rgyun zhes bya ba ni dmigs pa de la dran pa rnam par g-yeng ba med pa dang / rab tu chad pa med pa dang / rgyun chags pa dang / rtag tu gus par 'jug pa gang yin pa'o //
translated: The continuity of mind that is continuous is the mindfulness that engages in that object without distraction, without interruption, and with a continuous flow.

original: kha na ma tho ba med pa dang ldan pa'i sems kyi rgyun zhes bya ba ni dmigs pa de nyid la nyon mongs pa med cing bde ba la reg bar gnas pa'i dran pas lam du zhugs ba gang yin pa'o //
analyzed: kha na ma tho ba med pa dang ldan pa'i sems kyi rgyun zhes bya ba ni dmigs pa de nyid la nyon mongs pa med cing bde ba la reg bar gnas pa'i dran pas lam du zhugs ba gang yin pa'o //
translated: The “stream of mind endowed with the absence of remorse” is the entry into the path by means of mindfulness that is free from the afflictions and that abides in the experience of bliss with regard to that very meditative object.

original: dga' ba dang ldan pa'i sems kyi rgyun zhes bya ba ni dmigs pa de nyid la mngon par dga' zhing bde ba la reg par gnas pa'i dran pas lam du zhugs pa gang yin pa'o //
analyzed: dga' ba dang ldan pa'i sems kyi rgyun zhes bya ba ni dmigs pa de nyid la mngon par dga' zhing bde ba la reg par gnas pa'i dran pas lam du zhugs pa gang yin pa'o //
translated: The “stream of mind endowed with joy” is the entry into the path by means of mindfulness that is filled with delight and that abides in the experience of bliss with regard to that very meditative object.

original: sems rtse gcig pa nyid de la yang zhi gnas kyi phyogs kyang yod /
analyzed: sems rtse gcig pa nyid de la yang zhi gnas kyi phyogs kyang yod /
translated: One-pointedness of mind also has a side that is serenity

original: lhag mthong gi phyogs kyang yod de /
analyzed: lhag mthong gi phyogs kyang yod de /
translated: and a side that is insight.

original: de la sems gnas pa dgu gang yin pa de ni zhi gnas kyi phyogs so //
analyzed: de la sems gnas pa dgu gang yin pa de ni zhi gnas kyi phyogs so //
translated: Among those, the nine states of mind are the side that is serenity.

original: shes rab kyi spyod pa bzhi gang yin pa de ni lhag mthong gi phyogs te /
analyzed: shes rab kyi spyod pa bzhi gang yin pa de ni lhag mthong gi phyogs te /
translated: The four kinds of activity of wisdom are the side that is insight.

original: de ni sems rtse gcig pa nyid la nges par sbyor ba zhes bya'o //
analyzed: de ni sems rtse gcig pa nyid la nges par sbyor ba zhes bya'o //
translated: This is called “the application to one-pointedness of mind.”

original: de tsam gyis na rnal 'byor pa las dang po pas dmigs pa yongs su btsal pa yin te /
analyzed: de tsam gyis na rnal 'byor pa las dang po pas dmigs pa yongs su btsal pa yin te /
translated: At that point, the beginner yogi has thoroughly investigated the object of meditation.🔽Thus, having engaged in the causes of meditative concentration and the prerequisites of meditative concentration, the beginner yogi should first cultivate meditative serenity by way of the steps for engaging the mind in order to achieve the mental states of withdrawal and one-pointedness.

original: de ltar sbyor ba'i rgyu dang ting nge 'dzin gyi tshogs la gnas nas rab tu dben pa dang / sems rtse gcig pa nyid la nges par sbyar ba'i rim gyis sbyor ba'i lam gyi zhi gnas sngon du btang ste dmigs pa yongs su btsal nas da ni rnam par rtog pa dang bcas pa'i gzugs brnyan gyi dmigs pa thob pa dang /🔽sbyor ba'i lam gyi yid la byed pas rab tu bye ba'i lhag mthong gi lam skye ba bstan pa'i dbang du mdzad nas /
analyzed: de ltar sbyor ba'i rgyu dang ting nge 'dzin gyi tshogs la gnas nas rab tu dben pa dang / sems rtse gcig pa nyid la nges par sbyar ba'i rim gyis sbyor ba'i lam gyi zhi gnas sngon du btang ste dmigs pa yongs su btsal nas da ni rnam par rtog pa dang bcas pa'i gzugs brnyan gyi dmigs pa thob pa dang / sbyor ba'i lam gyi yid la byed pas rab tu bye ba'i lhag mthong gi lam skye ba bstan pa'i dbang du mdzad nas /
translated: Having thoroughly investigated the object of meditation, the beginner yogi now achieves the object of meditation that is a conceptual representation.

original: ji ltar @153b legs par bsams pa'i chos de dag nyid yid la byed cing zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
analyzed: ji ltar @153b legs par bsams pa'i chos de dag nyid yid la byed cing zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
translated: To present the path of insight that is achieved by the mental contemplation of thorough examination on the path of preparation, the text says, “He attends to just those phenomena that he has properly contemplated.”

original: ji ltar legs par bsams pa'i chos de dag nyid ces bya ba ni sngar chos gdags pa rnam par gzhag pa gang dag legs par thos /🔽legs par gzung /🔽kha thon byang bar byas /
analyzed: ji ltar legs par bsams pa'i chos de dag nyid ces bya ba ni sngar chos gdags pa rnam par gzhag pa gang dag legs par thos / legs par gzung / kha thon byang bar byas /
translated: The phrase “those very phenomena that were well contemplated” refers to the phenomena that were well heard, well grasped, and well recited in the past.🔽

original: yid kyis legs par brtags mthong bas shin tu rtogs par byas pa'i chos de dag nyid do //
analyzed: yid kyis legs par brtags mthong bas shin tu rtogs par byas pa'i chos de dag nyid do //
translated: Those very phenomena that were well contemplated are those phenomena that were well heard, well grasped, well mastered verbally, well investigated by the mind and well realized by seeing.

original: yid la byed cing zhes bya ba ni sngar shes bya'i dngos po'i mtshan ma bzung ste /
analyzed: yid la byed cing zhes bya ba ni sngar shes bya'i dngos po'i mtshan ma bzung ste /
translated: Mental attention means that, having previously apprehended the sign of an object of knowledge,

original: ji ltar legs par bzung ba'i chos de dag nyid la brten nas mnyam bar gzhag pa'i sa pa'i mos pa yid la byas pa'i mthus rnam par rtog pa dang bcas pa'i gzugs brnyan gyi dmigs pa thob pa la sbyor ba'i lam gyi yid la byed pas rab tu
analyzed: ji ltar legs par bzung ba'i chos de dag nyid la brten nas mnyam bar gzhag pa'i sa pa'i mos pa yid la byas pa'i mthus rnam par rtog pa dang bcas pa'i gzugs brnyan gyi dmigs pa thob pa la sbyor ba'i lam gyi yid la byed pas rab tu
translated: one is applied to the attainment of the object of meditation that possesses conception through the power of mental attention that is the interest of the level of meditative equipoise in dependence on those very phenomena that were well grasped.🔽Mental attention of the path of preparation is the mental attention of the path of preparation.

original: phye ba'i lhag mthong gi phyogs kyi yid la byed ba bzhi po bsgrims te 'jug pa'i yid la byed pa dang / skabs su 'chad cing 'jug pa'i yid la byed pa dang / skabs su 'chad pa med par 'jug pa'i yid la byed pa dang /
analyzed: phye ba'i lhag mthong gi phyogs kyi yid la byed ba bzhi po bsgrims te 'jug pa'i yid la byed pa dang / skabs su 'chad cing 'jug pa'i yid la byed pa dang / skabs su 'chad pa med par 'jug pa'i yid la byed pa dang /
translated: The four mental orientations that are the remaining categories of discerning wisdom are the mental orientation of tight focus, the mental orientation of intermittent focus, the mental orientation of uninterrupted focus and the mental orientation of spontaneous focus.🔽🔽

original: rtsol ba med par 'jug pa'i yid la byed pa dag gis ci rigs par yid la byed pa'o //
analyzed: rtsol ba med par 'jug pa'i yid la byed pa dag gis ci rigs par yid la byed pa'o //
translated: The four mental orientations of the side of insight that is differentiated are: mental orientation that is concentrated engagement, mental orientation that is intermittent engagement, mental orientation that is non-intermittent engagement, and mental orientation that is effortless engagement.🔽One should attend to them as appropriate.

original: de tsam gyis na rnal 'byor pa rnam par rtog pa dang bcas pa'i gzugs brnyan gyi dmigs pa thob pa dang / sbyor ba'i lam gyi yid la byed pas rab tu phye ba'i lhag mthong gyi lam skyes pa yin te /
analyzed: de tsam gyis na rnal 'byor pa rnam par rtog pa dang bcas pa'i gzugs brnyan gyi dmigs pa thob pa dang / sbyor ba'i lam gyi yid la byed pas rab tu phye ba'i lhag mthong gyi lam skyes pa yin te /
translated: At that point, the yogi/nī has attained the object of observation that is the conceptual image, and the path of insight that is differentiated by the mental orientation of the path of preparation has arisen.

original: de'i dus na ni rnam par rtog pa dang bcas pa'i gzugs brnyan la dmigs pa yin no //
analyzed: de'i dus na ni rnam par rtog pa dang bcas pa'i gzugs brnyan la dmigs pa yin no //
translated: At that time, one is observing the conceptual image.

original: de'i 'og tu dmigs pa 'thob pa de nyid la zhi gnas kyi rnam pas sems rtse gcig tu mnyam par 'jog pa'i dus na rnam par mi rtog pa'i gzugs brnyan gyi dmigs pa 'thob pa dang yid la byed pa thob pa'i lam gyi rab tu phye ba mtshan
analyzed: de'i 'og tu dmigs pa 'thob pa de nyid la zhi gnas kyi rnam pas sems rtse gcig tu mnyam par 'jog pa'i dus na rnam par mi rtog pa'i gzugs brnyan gyi dmigs pa 'thob pa dang yid la byed pa thob pa'i lam gyi rab tu phye ba mtshan
translated: After that, when one-pointedly equipoises the mind with the aspect of śamatha on the object of meditation that was attained, at that time one attains the object of meditation that is a nonconceptual image and the path of attention is distinguished.

original: ma'i g-yeng bzhi ba'i zhi gnas kyi lam skye ba bstan pa'i dbang du mdzad nas /
analyzed: ma'i g-yeng bzhi ba'i zhi gnas kyi lam skye ba bstan pa'i dbang du mdzad nas /
translated: In terms of the arising of the path of śamatha that is free of the four types of distraction, it is said:

original: sems gang gis yid la byed pa'i sems de nang du rgyun chags su yid la byed pas yid la byed do zhes bya ba gsungs te /
analyzed: sems gang gis yid la byed pa'i sems de nang du rgyun chags su yid la byed pas yid la byed do zhes bya ba gsungs te /
translated: “The mind that attends to that object of meditation attends to it by continuously keeping the mind inwardly focused.”

original: sems gang gis yid la byed pa'i sems de zhes bya ba ni sngar sbyor ba'i lam gyi yid la byed pas rab tu phye ba'i lhag mthong gi rnam pa'i sems gang gis rnam par rtog pa bcas pa'i gzugs brnyan gyi dmigs pa thob pa la lhag mthong gi
analyzed: sems gang gis yid la byed pa'i sems de zhes bya ba ni sngar sbyor ba'i lam gyi yid la byed pas rab tu phye ba'i lhag mthong gi rnam pa'i sems gang gis rnam par rtog pa bcas pa'i gzugs brnyan gyi dmigs pa thob pa la lhag mthong gi
translated: The mind that attends to that object of meditation refers to the mind that is distinguished by the attention of the path of preparation. The mind that has the aspect of vipaśyanā attains the object of meditation that is a conceptual image.

original: phyogs kyi yid la byed pa bzhis ci rigs bar yid la byed pa'i sems de nyid do //
analyzed: phyogs kyi yid la byed pa bzhis ci rigs bar yid la byed pa'i sems de nyid do //
translated: The mind that attends to those is the mind that attends to the object of meditation through the four kinds of attention.

original: nang du rgyun chags su yid la byed pas yid la byed do zhes bya ba la nang du zhes bya ba ni @154a * //
analyzed: nang du rgyun chags su yid la byed pas yid la byed do zhes bya ba la nang du zhes bya ba ni @154a * //
translated: It is the mind that attends to the object of meditation through continuous attention to the object.

original: zhi gnas kyi rnam pas sems rtse gcig tu mnyam par 'jog pa ste /🔽de yang lhag mthong gi rnam pas sems de dang des mos pa yid la byas pa las byung ba rnam par rtog pa dang bcas pa'i gzugs brnyan blo la snang ba de gnyis /
analyzed: zhi gnas kyi rnam pas sems rtse gcig tu mnyam par 'jog pa ste / de yang lhag mthong gi rnam pas sems de dang des mos pa yid la byas pa las byung ba rnam par rtog pa dang bcas pa'i gzugs brnyan blo la snang ba de gnyis /
translated: Continuous attention means to focus the mind one pointedly in meditative equipoise through the aspect of serenity.🔽Moreover, through the aspect of insight, the mind that attends to the object of meditation through the aspect of interest is a conceptual image that appears to the mind.🔽Those two are the object of meditation for the path of preparation.

original: sbyor ba'i lam gyi gnas skabs des na gzung ba dang 'dzin pa'i rnam pa lta bur gnyis su snang ba de la gnyis su med par sems kyi ngo bo nyid du de kho na nyid yid la byed pas gzugs brnyan gyi dmigs pa ma btang ba'i sems de
analyzed: sbyor ba'i lam gyi gnas skabs des na gzung ba dang 'dzin pa'i rnam pa lta bur gnyis su snang ba de la gnyis su med par sems kyi ngo bo nyid du de kho na nyid yid la byed pas gzugs brnyan gyi dmigs pa ma btang ba'i sems de
translated: Therefore, the mind that attends to the object of meditation through the aspect of interest is a conceptual image that appears to the mind.

original: nyid la zhi gnas kyi rnam pas rang rig pa'i tshul du mnyam par 'jog go zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: nyid la zhi gnas kyi rnam pas rang rig pa'i tshul du mnyam par 'jog go zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: It is said that one rests in equipoise in the mode of self-awareness through the aspect of śamatha.

original: rgyun chags so zhes bya ba ni zhi gnas de nyid la skabs su 'chad pa med par 'jug pa'i yid la byed pas rgyud gcig tu byed pa'i don to //
analyzed: rgyun chags so zhes bya ba ni zhi gnas de nyid la skabs su 'chad pa med par 'jug pa'i yid la byed pas rgyud gcig tu byed pa'i don to //
translated: Continuous means that one engages in that śamatha without interruption. The meaning is that one makes the mind a single continuum through attention.

original: de yang rnal 'byor pa dbang po rnon po sems las su rung ba'i shas che ba dag ni dang po zhi gnas kyi sems rtse gcig pa de nyid la brten nas brtson 'grus kyi stobs dang / skabs su 'chad pa med par 'jug pa'i yid la byed pas rgyud gcig tu byed pa'i dbang gis yongs su 'dris pa'i stobs dang /
analyzed: de yang rnal 'byor pa dbang po rnon po sems las su rung ba'i shas che ba dag ni dang po zhi gnas kyi sems rtse gcig pa de nyid la brten nas brtson 'grus kyi stobs dang / skabs su 'chad pa med par 'jug pa'i yid la byed pas rgyud gcig tu byed pa'i dbang gis yongs su 'dris pa'i stobs dang /
translated: Moreover, yogins and yoginīs who have sharp faculties and a predominance of mental flexibility first rely on the one-pointed mind of śamatha. Then, through the power of effort, the power of thorough acquaintance, and the power of spontaneity, they make the mind a single continuum through attention that engages without interruption.🔽They make the mind a single continuum through attention that engages without interruption.

original: lhun gyis grub par 'jug pa'i yid la byed pa 'thob cing thal byung ting nge 'dzin du byed pas rgyun chags su yid la byed do //
analyzed: lhun gyis grub par 'jug pa'i yid la byed pa 'thob cing thal byung ting nge 'dzin du byed pas rgyun chags su yid la byed do //
translated: They make the mind a single continuum through attention that engages without interruption.

original: rnal 'byor pa dbang po rtul po sems las su rung ba'i shas mi che ba dag ni dang po zhi gnas kyi sems rtse gcig pa de la brten nas sems gnas pa dgu dang / stobs drug dang yid la byed pa bzhi sngar bstan pa'i rim pa kho na bzhin du rgyun chags su yid la byed cing tha mar ting nge 'dzin du byed de /
analyzed: rnal 'byor pa dbang po rtul po sems las su rung ba'i shas mi che ba dag ni dang po zhi gnas kyi sems rtse gcig pa de la brten nas sems gnas pa dgu dang / stobs drug dang yid la byed pa bzhi sngar bstan pa'i rim pa kho na bzhin du rgyun chags su yid la byed cing tha mar ting nge 'dzin du byed de /
translated: Yogins and yoginis of duller faculties, who do not have a great deal of mental flexibility, rely on the one-pointed mind of serenity that they have attained and, in accordance with the stages presented above, continuously keep in mind the nine mental states, the six powers and the four types of attention.

original: de ni yid la byed pa thob pa'i lam gyis rab tu phye ba mtshan ma'i g-yeng ba zhi ba'i zhi gnas kyi lam nang gi sems rtse gcig pa nyid kyi ngo bo nyid dang rab tu dbye ba yin no //
analyzed: de ni yid la byed pa thob pa'i lam gyis rab tu phye ba mtshan ma'i g-yeng ba zhi ba'i zhi gnas kyi lam nang gi sems rtse gcig pa nyid kyi ngo bo nyid dang rab tu dbye ba yin no //
translated: This is the path of serenity that pacifies the distraction of signs and is the essence and classification of the inner one-pointed mind of the path of achieving mental attention.

original: de tsam gyis na rnal 'byor pa rnam par mi rtog pa'i gzugs brnyan gyi dmigs pa 'thob pa dang / yid la byed pa thob pa'i lam gyis rab tu phye ba'i zhi gnas kyi lam skyes pa yin te /
analyzed: de tsam gyis na rnal 'byor pa rnam par mi rtog pa'i gzugs brnyan gyi dmigs pa 'thob pa dang / yid la byed pa thob pa'i lam gyis rab tu phye ba'i zhi gnas kyi lam skyes pa yin te /
translated: By that alone, yogins and yoginis attain the object of observation of the nonconceptual image and the path of serenity that is classified as the path of achieving mental attention.

original: de'i dus na ni rnam par mi rtog pa'i gzugs brnyan la dmigs pa yin no //🔽de'i 'og tu de ltar yid la byed pa thob pa'i lam gyis rab tu phye ba mtshan ma'i g-yeng ba zhi ba'i zhi gnas kyi lam nang gi sems rtse gcig pa nyid de yangs pa dang / 'phel ba dang / rgyas par gyur pa de'i mjug thogs su @154b sbyor ba mthar thug pa'i lam gyi yid la byed pas rab tu phye ba gnas ngan len gyi g-yeng ba zhi ba'i zhi gnas kyi lam lus dang sems shin tu sbyangs ba'i ngo bo nyid rab tu dbye ba bstan
analyzed: de'i dus na ni rnam par mi rtog pa'i gzugs brnyan la dmigs pa yin no // de'i 'og tu de ltar yid la byed pa thob pa'i lam gyis rab tu phye ba mtshan ma'i g-yeng ba zhi ba'i zhi gnas kyi lam nang gi sems rtse gcig pa nyid de yangs pa dang / 'phel ba dang / rgyas par gyur pa de'i mjug thogs su @154b sbyor ba mthar thug pa'i lam gyi yid la byed pas rab tu phye ba gnas ngan len gyi g-yeng ba zhi ba'i zhi gnas kyi lam lus dang sems shin tu sbyangs ba'i ngo bo nyid rab tu dbye ba bstan
translated: At that time, one focuses on the nonconceptual image.

original: pa'i dbang du mdzad nas de ltar zhugs shing de la lan mang du gnas pa de la lus shin tu sbyangs pa dang / sems shin tu sbyangs pa 'byung ba gang yin la de ni zhi gnas zhes bya ste zhes bya ba gsungs te /

original: de ltar zhugs shing zhes bya ba ni yid la byed pa thob pa'i lam gyis rab tu phye ba mtshan ma'i g-yeng ba zhi ba'i zhi gnas kyi lam nang gi sems rtse gcig pa nyid du zhugs pa'o //
analyzed: de ltar zhugs shing zhes bya ba ni yid la byed pa thob pa'i lam gyis rab tu phye ba mtshan ma'i g-yeng ba zhi ba'i zhi gnas kyi lam nang gi sems rtse gcig pa nyid du zhugs pa'o //
translated: Thus he enters and abides in the path of serenity, which is the inner one-pointedness of mind, and which is the path of the attainment of attention, the pacification of the distraction of signs.

original: de la lan mang du gnas pa zhes bya ba ni mtshan ma'i g-yeng ba zhi gnas kyi lam nang gi sems rtse gcig pa nyid de yangs pa dang 'phel ba dang / rgyas par gyur pa zhes bya ba'i tha tshig ste /
analyzed: de la lan mang du gnas pa zhes bya ba ni mtshan ma'i g-yeng ba zhi gnas kyi lam nang gi sems rtse gcig pa nyid de yangs pa dang 'phel ba dang / rgyas par gyur pa zhes bya ba'i tha tshig ste /
translated: He abides in it frequently means that he abides in the inner one-pointedness of mind, the path of serenity, the pacification of the distraction of signs, which is extensive, increased, and expanded.

original: de yang sems gnas pa dgu dang / stobs drug dang / yid la byed pa bzhi po dag kun tu bsten cing goms par byas lan mang du byas pa'i rgyus tha mar yongs su 'dris pa'i stobs dang / lhun gyis grub pa'i 'jug pa'i yid la byed pa thob cing ting nge 'dzin du byed nus pa'i dus dang sbyar ro //
analyzed: de yang sems gnas pa dgu dang / stobs drug dang / yid la byed pa bzhi po dag kun tu bsten cing goms par byas lan mang du byas pa'i rgyus tha mar yongs su 'dris pa'i stobs dang / lhun gyis grub pa'i 'jug pa'i yid la byed pa thob cing ting nge 'dzin du byed nus pa'i dus dang sbyar ro //
translated: Moreover, this is the time when he is able to enter into concentration, having attained the power of thorough familiarity and spontaneous entry, through the cause of the complete reliance, practice, and frequent performance of the nine mental states, the six powers, and the four attentions.

original: de la lus shin tu sbyangs pa dang / sems shin tu sbyangs pa 'byung ba zhes bya ba ni sbyor ba mthar thug pa'i lam gyi yid la byed pas rab tu phye ba gnas ngan len gyi g-yeng ba zhi ba'i zhi gnas kyi lam gyi ngo bo nyid yin te /
analyzed: de la lus shin tu sbyangs pa dang / sems shin tu sbyangs pa 'byung ba zhes bya ba ni sbyor ba mthar thug pa'i lam gyi yid la byed pas rab tu phye ba gnas ngan len gyi g-yeng ba zhi ba'i zhi gnas kyi lam gyi ngo bo nyid yin te /
translated: The arising of physical pliancy and mental pliancy is distinguished by attention on the ultimate path of preparation and is the essence of the path of serenity that pacifies the distraction of physical dysfunction.

original: de la lus shin tu sbyangs pa zhes bya ba ni lus dben pa las skyes pa lus kyi gnas ngan len gyi gnyen po lus zo mdog bde ba'o //
analyzed: de la lus shin tu sbyangs pa zhes bya ba ni lus dben pa las skyes pa lus kyi gnas ngan len gyi gnyen po lus zo mdog bde ba'o //
translated: Physical pliancy is physical pliancy that arises from physical isolation, the antidote to physical dysfunction and it is a physical well-being.

original: sems shin tu sbyangs pa zhes bya ba ni sems dben pa las skyes pa /
analyzed: sems shin tu sbyangs pa zhes bya ba ni sems dben pa las skyes pa /
translated: Mental pliancy is mental pliancy that arises from mental isolation,

original: sems kyi gnas ngan len gyi gnyen po sems las su rung ba'o ;
analyzed: sems kyi gnas ngan len gyi gnyen po sems las su rung ba'o ;
translated: the antidote to mental dysfunction and it is mental flexibility.

original: / yang gnyen po chos yid la byed pa'i rnam pa thos pas bsgom pas spang bar bya ba'i nyon mongs pa bsrabs pa'i phyir lus shin tu sbyangs pa yin la mthong bas spang bar bya ba'i nyon mongs pa bsrabs pa'i phyir sems shin tu sbyangs pa yin te
analyzed: / yang gnyen po chos yid la byed pa'i rnam pa thos pas bsgom pas spang bar bya ba'i nyon mongs pa bsrabs pa'i phyir lus shin tu sbyangs pa yin la mthong bas spang bar bya ba'i nyon mongs pa bsrabs pa'i phyir sems shin tu sbyangs pa yin te
translated: Furthermore, the aspect of attention to the counteragent is physical pliancy, because it diminishes the afflictions that are to be abandoned by cultivation. It is mental pliancy, because it diminishes the afflictions that are to be abandoned by the path of insight.

original: / lus ngal ba med pa'i phyir dang / sems yongs su gdung ba med pa'i phyir lus dang sems shin tu sbyangs pa zhes kyang bya'o //
analyzed: / lus ngal ba med pa'i phyir dang / sems yongs su gdung ba med pa'i phyir lus dang sems shin tu sbyangs pa zhes kyang bya'o //
translated: It is also called physical and mental pliancy, because it is free from physical and mental fatigue.🔽That is called serenity.

original: de ni zhi gnas zhes bya ste zhes bya ba ni mtshan ma'i g-yeng ba zhi ba'i zhi gnas kyi lam gyi yid la byed pas rab tu phye ba'i lhag mthong rnam par rtog pa dang bcas pa'i gzugs brnyan la dmigs pa'i gnas skabs na @155a * //
analyzed: de ni zhi gnas zhes bya ste zhes bya ba ni mtshan ma'i g-yeng ba zhi ba'i zhi gnas kyi lam gyi yid la byed pas rab tu phye ba'i lhag mthong rnam par rtog pa dang bcas pa'i gzugs brnyan la dmigs pa'i gnas skabs na @155a * //
translated: The path of insight is distinguished by attention to serenity, which is the pacification of distraction by signs.

original: ji tsam du goms pa dang / yongs su dag pa'i stobs kyi dbang byas te /
analyzed: ji tsam du goms pa dang / yongs su dag pa'i stobs kyi dbang byas te /
translated: To the extent that one is habituated to and purifies the path of insight, one attains the path of cultivation.

original: yangs pa dang 'phel ba dang / rgyas par gyur pa de tsam du yid la byed pa thob pa'i lam gyis rab tu phye ba mtshan ma'i g-yeng ba zhi ba'i zhi gnas kyi lam nang gi sems rtse gcig pa nyid kyang yangs pa dang / 'phel ba dang rgyas par gyur la /🔽ji tsam du nang gi sems rtse gcig pa nyid de yangs pa dang / 'phel ba dang / rgyas par gyur pa de tsam du de'i mjug thogs su sbyor ba mthar thug pa'i lam gyi yid la byed pas rab tu phye ba gnas ngan len gyi g-yeng ba zhi ba'i zhi gnas kyi lam lus dang sems shin tu sbyangs pa skye ba yang yangs pa dang
analyzed: yangs pa dang 'phel ba dang / rgyas par gyur pa de tsam du yid la byed pa thob pa'i lam gyis rab tu phye ba mtshan ma'i g-yeng ba zhi ba'i zhi gnas kyi lam nang gi sems rtse gcig pa nyid kyang yangs pa dang / 'phel ba dang rgyas par gyur la / ji tsam du nang gi sems rtse gcig pa nyid de yangs pa dang / 'phel ba dang / rgyas par gyur pa de tsam du de'i mjug thogs su sbyor ba mthar thug pa'i lam gyi yid la byed pas rab tu phye ba gnas ngan len gyi g-yeng ba zhi ba'i zhi gnas kyi lam lus dang sems shin tu sbyangs pa skye ba yang yangs pa dang
translated: To the extent that the path of attention that is attained by the path of meditative serenity, which is the pacification of the distraction of signs, becomes vast, extensive, and greatly developed, to that extent the path of meditative serenity, which is the pacification of the distraction of negative reflex actions, becomes vast, extensive, and greatly developed.

original: / 'phel ba dang / rgyas par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: / 'phel ba dang / rgyas par 'gyur ro //
translated: To the extent that the attention that is attained by the path of final training, which is the pacification of the distraction of negative reflex actions, becomes vast, extensive, and greatly developed, to that extent physical and mental pliancy, which are the path of meditative serenity, become vast, extensive, and greatly developed.

original: ji tsam du lus dang sems shin tu sbyangs pa de yangs pa dang / 'phel ba dang / rgyas par gyur pa de tsam du nang gi sems rtse gcig pa de skabs 'dir yang yangs pa dang / 'phel ba dang / rgyas par 'gyur te /
analyzed: ji tsam du lus dang sems shin tu sbyangs pa de yangs pa dang / 'phel ba dang / rgyas par gyur pa de tsam du nang gi sems rtse gcig pa de skabs 'dir yang yangs pa dang / 'phel ba dang / rgyas par 'gyur te /
translated: To the extent that physical and mental pliancy increase, expand, and flourish, to that extent the internal mental one-pointedness in this context increases, expands, and flourishes.

original: de ltar na chos gnyis po nang gi sems rtse gcig pa nyid dang / lus dang sems shin tu sbyangs pa de gnyis ni gcig la gcig brten pa dang / gcig la gcig rag las pa yin par rig par bya'o //
analyzed: de ltar na chos gnyis po nang gi sems rtse gcig pa nyid dang / lus dang sems shin tu sbyangs pa de gnyis ni gcig la gcig brten pa dang / gcig la gcig rag las pa yin par rig par bya'o //
translated: Thus, these two phenomena—internal mental one-pointedness and physical and mental pliancy—should be understood as mutually dependent and mutually supportive.

original: de ltar na byang chub sems dpa' zhi gnas yongs su tshol bar byed pa yin no zhes bya ba ni mjug bsdu ba'i tshig yin te /
analyzed: de ltar na byang chub sems dpa' zhi gnas yongs su tshol bar byed pa yin no zhes bya ba ni mjug bsdu ba'i tshig yin te /
translated: Thus, bodhisattvas seek mental stability. This is a concluding statement.

original: de ltar na zhes bya ba'i sgras ni byang chub sems dpa' chos yid la byed pa kho nas zhi gnas yongs su tshol bar byed pa yin gyi gzhan gyis ni ma yin no zhes nges par 'byed do //
analyzed: de ltar na zhes bya ba'i sgras ni byang chub sems dpa' chos yid la byed pa kho nas zhi gnas yongs su tshol bar byed pa yin gyi gzhan gyis ni ma yin no zhes nges par 'byed do //
translated: The word “thus” indicates that bodhisattvas seek mental stability by means of attention to the teachings alone, not by any other means.

original: zhi gnas zhes bya ba'i tshig gi don ni mtshan ma'i g-yeng ba dang / gnas ngan len gyi g-yeng ba zhi ba'i gnas te /
analyzed: zhi gnas zhes bya ba'i tshig gi don ni mtshan ma'i g-yeng ba dang / gnas ngan len gyi g-yeng ba zhi ba'i gnas te /
translated: The meaning of the term “calming” is a state of calm in which the distraction of signs and the distraction of bad tendencies are calmed.

original: sems rtse gcig pa nyid ces bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: sems rtse gcig pa nyid ces bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: It is a synonym for “one-pointedness of mind.”

original: yongs su tshol ba zhes bya ba ni sbyor ba'i rgyu yongs su tshol ba'i ma yin gyi sbyor ba mthar thug pa'i lam gyi yid la byed pas rab tu phye ba yongs su tshol ba ste /
analyzed: yongs su tshol ba zhes bya ba ni sbyor ba'i rgyu yongs su tshol ba'i ma yin gyi sbyor ba mthar thug pa'i lam gyi yid la byed pas rab tu phye ba yongs su tshol ba ste /
translated: “ Investigation” is not the investigation of the cause of application, but the investigation of the path of the culmination of application, which is distinguished by mental attention.

original: de tsam gyis na zhi gnas thob pa yin no zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: de tsam gyis na zhi gnas thob pa yin no zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: The meaning is that one attains calming to that extent.

original: de ltar zhi gnas yongs su tshol ba bstan nas /
analyzed: de ltar zhi gnas yongs su tshol ba bstan nas /
translated: Having thus taught the investigation of calming,

original: da ni byang chub sems dpa' ji ltar lhag mthong la mkhas pa bstan pa'i dbang du mdzad nas /
analyzed: da ni byang chub sems dpa' ji ltar lhag mthong la mkhas pa bstan pa'i dbang du mdzad nas /
translated: now, in order to demonstrate the skill of the bodhisattva in discerning,

original: de lus shin tu sbyangs pa dang / sems shin tu sbyangs pa de thob nas zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
analyzed: de lus shin tu sbyangs pa dang / sems shin tu sbyangs pa de thob nas zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
translated: he says, “Having attained that physical and mental tranquility,” and so on.

original: de zhes bya ba ni byang chub sems dpa'o //
analyzed: de zhes bya ba ni byang chub sems dpa'o //
translated: “ That” refers to the bodhisattva.

original: lus shin tu sbyangs pa dang / sems @155b shin tu sbyangs pa de thob nas zhes bya ba ni sbyor ba mthar thug pa'i lam gyi yid la byed pas rab tu phye ba'i zhi gnas kyi lam thob nas zhes bya bar sbyar ro //
analyzed: lus shin tu sbyangs pa dang / sems @155b shin tu sbyangs pa de thob nas zhes bya ba ni sbyor ba mthar thug pa'i lam gyi yid la byed pas rab tu phye ba'i zhi gnas kyi lam thob nas zhes bya bar sbyar ro //
translated: Having attained physical and mental pliancy, means having attained the path of serenity distinguished by the attention of the path of completion of the preparatory stage.

original: de nyid la gnas te zhes bya ba ni sbyor ba mthar thug pa'i lam gyi yid la byed pas rab tu phye ba'i zhi gnas kyi lam de nyid la gnas te /
analyzed: de nyid la gnas te zhes bya ba ni sbyor ba mthar thug pa'i lam gyi yid la byed pas rab tu phye ba'i zhi gnas kyi lam de nyid la gnas te /
translated: Dwelling in that means dwelling in the path of serenity distinguished by the attention of the path of completion of the preparatory stage.

original: sbyor ba mthar thug pa'i lam gyi yid la byed pas rab tu phye ba'i lhag mthong gi lam la mkhas par bya'o zhes bstan to //
analyzed: sbyor ba mthar thug pa'i lam gyi yid la byed pas rab tu phye ba'i lhag mthong gi lam la mkhas par bya'o zhes bstan to //
translated: One should become skilled in the path of insight distinguished by the attention of the path of completion of the preparatory stage.

original: de yang mnyam par gzhag pa'i sa pa'i sems la gnas pa'i dus na zhi gnas dang lhag mthong gnas skabs tha dad pa ma yin te /
analyzed: de yang mnyam par gzhag pa'i sa pa'i sems la gnas pa'i dus na zhi gnas dang lhag mthong gnas skabs tha dad pa ma yin te /
translated: Moreover, when one dwells in the mind of the stage of meditative equipoise, serenity and insight are not in different situations.

original: rtag tu 'brel mar byung ba yin mod kyi zung du 'brel pa'i lam ma thob kyi bar du shas che chung gi dbang du mdzad pa dang / mnyam par gzhag pa las yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin du rab tu shes pa yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin du rab tu mthong bar gyur pa'i rim pa bstan par bya ba dang /
analyzed: rtag tu 'brel mar byung ba yin mod kyi zung du 'brel pa'i lam ma thob kyi bar du shas che chung gi dbang du mdzad pa dang / mnyam par gzhag pa las yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin du rab tu shes pa yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin du rab tu mthong bar gyur pa'i rim pa bstan par bya ba dang /
translated: The order in which one correctly knows and sees reality is taught.

original: zhi gnas kyi sems de nyid la lhag mthong gi bya ba ji lta bu yin pa bstan pa'i phyir /
analyzed: zhi gnas kyi sems de nyid la lhag mthong gi bya ba ji lta bu yin pa bstan pa'i phyir /
translated: In order to teach the function of insight in that very state of śamatha,

original: 'dir zhi gnas de nyid la gnas te zhes bya ba smos so //
analyzed: 'dir zhi gnas de nyid la gnas te zhes bya ba smos so //
translated: it says, “while remaining in that very śamatha.”

original: sems kyi rnam pa spangs nas zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: sems kyi rnam pa spangs nas zhes bya ba la /
translated: “Having abandoned mental activity” means

original: sems kyi rnam pa zhes bya ba ni sbyor ba mthar thug pa'i lam gyi yid la byed pas rab tu phye ba'i zhi gnas kyi lam de'i dmigs pa rnam par mi rtog pa'i gzugs brnyan blo la dmigs pa'i rnam par snang ba'o //
analyzed: sems kyi rnam pa zhes bya ba ni sbyor ba mthar thug pa'i lam gyi yid la byed pas rab tu phye ba'i zhi gnas kyi lam de'i dmigs pa rnam par mi rtog pa'i gzugs brnyan blo la dmigs pa'i rnam par snang ba'o //
translated: that the mental activity of the path of the culmination of practice distinguishes the object of observation of that path of śamatha, the nonconceptual image, which appears to the mind.

original: de spangs pa ni rnam pa de la sbyor ba mthar thug pa'i lam gyi yid la byed pas rab tu phye ba'i lhag mthong gis brtags pa'i ngo bo nyid du mngon par zhen pa med par gzhan gyi dbang gi ngo bo nyid yin par sems tsam du de
analyzed: de spangs pa ni rnam pa de la sbyor ba mthar thug pa'i lam gyi yid la byed pas rab tu phye ba'i lhag mthong gis brtags pa'i ngo bo nyid du mngon par zhen pa med par gzhan gyi dbang gi ngo bo nyid yin par sems tsam du de
translated: The actual state of mind that is the path of no further learning is the actual state of mind that is the path of special seeing.

original: kho na nyid yid la byed pas yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin du rab tu shes yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin du rab tu mthong ba'i dus na sems kyi rnam pa spangs pa zhes bya'o //🔽'o na rtogs pa'i gnas skabs na yongs su grub pa'i ngo bo nyid kyi chos rnams med ba yin la /
analyzed: kho na nyid yid la byed pas yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin du rab tu shes yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin du rab tu mthong ba'i dus na sems kyi rnam pa spangs pa zhes bya'o // 'o na rtogs pa'i gnas skabs na yongs su grub pa'i ngo bo nyid kyi chos rnams med ba yin la /
translated: The actual state of mind that is the path of seeing is the actual state of mind that is the path of cultivation.🔽The actual state of mind that is the path of no further learning is the actual state of mind that is the path of no obstacles.🔽The actual state of mind that is the path of seeing is the actual state of mind that is the path of liberation.🔽The actual state of mind that is the path of no further learning is the actual state of mind that is the path of special seeing.

original: de rab tu rnam par 'byed par byed pa'i lhag mthong gi sems ni shes rab kyi spyod pa bzhi dang sgo gsum dang gzhi rab tu dbye ba rnam pa drug la dmigs pa'i rnam pa dang bcas pa yin na /
analyzed: de rab tu rnam par 'byed par byed pa'i lhag mthong gi sems ni shes rab kyi spyod pa bzhi dang sgo gsum dang gzhi rab tu dbye ba rnam pa drug la dmigs pa'i rnam pa dang bcas pa yin na /
translated: The actual state of mind that is the path of seeing is the actual state of mind that is the path of cultivation.🔽The actual state of mind that is the path of no further learning is the actual state of mind that is the path of no obstacles.

original: ji ltar rnam pa med pa'i chos rnams rnam pa dang bcas pa'i sems dang gcig tu byas te /
analyzed: ji ltar rnam pa med pa'i chos rnams rnam pa dang bcas pa'i sems dang gcig tu byas te /
translated: How can a formless dharma be made one with a mind that has a form?

original: so sor brtags pa dang / mos par byar rung zhe na /🔽dmigs par bya ba'i sems dang / dmigs par byed pa'i @156a * //
analyzed: so sor brtags pa dang / mos par byar rung zhe na / dmigs par bya ba'i sems dang / dmigs par byed pa'i @156a * //
translated: How can it be analyzed and believed?

original: sems kyi rnam pa gnyis yod pa ma yin te /
analyzed: sems kyi rnam pa gnyis yod pa ma yin te /
translated: There is no distinction between the mind that is the object of observation and the mind that observes.

original: sems kyi ngo bo nyid la sems kyi ngo bo nyid kyis rang rig pa'i tshul du dmigs pa yin pas yul dang yul can lta bur mi 'gyur te /
analyzed: sems kyi ngo bo nyid la sems kyi ngo bo nyid kyis rang rig pa'i tshul du dmigs pa yin pas yul dang yul can lta bur mi 'gyur te /
translated: The mind is observed by the mind itself in the manner of reflexive awareness. Therefore, it is not like an object and an object possessor.

original: de ni 'phags pa so so rang rig pa'i shes pa 'jig rten las 'das pa rnam par mi rtog pa'i ngo bo nyid yin par bzhed do zhes ston to //🔽ji ltar bsams pa'i chos de dag nyid ces bya ba ni sngar chos gdags par rnam par gzhag pa gang dag legs par thos /🔽legs par gzung /🔽kha thon byang bar byas /
analyzed: de ni 'phags pa so so rang rig pa'i shes pa 'jig rten las 'das pa rnam par mi rtog pa'i ngo bo nyid yin par bzhed do zhes ston to // ji ltar bsams pa'i chos de dag nyid ces bya ba ni sngar chos gdags par rnam par gzhag pa gang dag legs par thos / legs par gzung / kha thon byang bar byas /
translated: This is the noble reflexive awareness that is a supramundane nonconceptual wisdom.

original: yid kyis legs par brtags /
analyzed: yid kyis legs par brtags /
translated: Those very dharmas that were contemplated are the dharmas that were previously well heard, well grasped, well expressed, well contemplated by the mind, and well meditated on by the wisdom of individual knowledge.

original: mthong bas shin tu rtogs par byas pa'i chos de dag nyid de /
analyzed: mthong bas shin tu rtogs par byas pa'i chos de dag nyid de /
translated: Those phenomena are fully understood through seeing.

original: de yang dang po dmigs pa yongs su tshol ba'i dus na shes bya'i dngos po mtshan ma bzung ste /
analyzed: de yang dang po dmigs pa yongs su tshol ba'i dus na shes bya'i dngos po mtshan ma bzung ste /
translated: Moreover, when one first seeks the object of meditation, one apprehends the characteristics of the entity that is to be known.🔽Then, on the basis of those phenomena, one attains a conceptual image of the object of meditation through the force of keeping interest in mind.

original: chos de dag la brten nas mos pa yid la byas pa'i mthus rnam par rtog pa dang bcas pa'i gzugs kyi dmigs pa thob pa de nyid la zhi gnas kyi rnam pas rtse gcig tu mnyam par gzhag pa'i dus na rnam par mi rtog pa'i gzugs brnyan gyi
analyzed: chos de dag la brten nas mos pa yid la byas pa'i mthus rnam par rtog pa dang bcas pa'i gzugs kyi dmigs pa thob pa de nyid la zhi gnas kyi rnam pas rtse gcig tu mnyam par gzhag pa'i dus na rnam par mi rtog pa'i gzugs brnyan gyi
translated: When one subsequently stabilizes one's mind one-pointedly on that image through the process of sustained calm, one attains a nonconceptual image of the object of meditation.

original: dmigs pa thob pa de nyid la ji ltar bsams pa'i chos de dag nyid ces bya'i /
analyzed: dmigs pa thob pa de nyid la ji ltar bsams pa'i chos de dag nyid ces bya'i /
translated: This is what is meant by one's fully understanding those phenomena that one has contemplated.

original: dang po dmigs pa yongs su tshol ba'i dus na ji ltar bsams pa'i chos de dag nyid ni ma yin no //
analyzed: dang po dmigs pa yongs su tshol ba'i dus na ji ltar bsams pa'i chos de dag nyid ni ma yin no //
translated: It is not the case that one fully understands those phenomena that one has contemplated when one first seeks the object of meditation.

original: nang du zhes bya ba ni rnam par mi rtog pa'i gzugs brnyan gyi dmigs pa de nyid sems las phyi rol du ma gyur par nang du sems kyi ngo bo nyid du so sor rtog par byed /
analyzed: nang du zhes bya ba ni rnam par mi rtog pa'i gzugs brnyan gyi dmigs pa de nyid sems las phyi rol du ma gyur par nang du sems kyi ngo bo nyid du so sor rtog par byed /
translated: Internally means that one should discern that very object of the image of non-conceptuality as internal, not external to the mind, as the nature of the mind itself.

original: mos par byed ces bya bar sbyar ro //
analyzed: mos par byed ces bya bar sbyar ro //
translated: One should be convinced is to be supplied.🔽Therefore, it is said:

original: de'i phyir ting nge 'dzin gyi spyod yul gzugs brnyan du zhes bya ba gsungs te /
analyzed: de'i phyir ting nge 'dzin gyi spyod yul gzugs brnyan du zhes bya ba gsungs te /
translated: The image of the domain of samadhi.

original: ting nge 'dzin gyi zhes bya ba ni mnyam par bzhag pa'i sems rtse gcig pa nyid do ;
analyzed: ting nge 'dzin gyi zhes bya ba ni mnyam par bzhag pa'i sems rtse gcig pa nyid do ;
translated: Samadhi means the one-pointed mind of equipoise.

original: / spyod yul du gzugs brnyan du zhes bya ba ni sems de'i rang rig pa'i spyod yul sems kyi ngo bo nyid kyi gzugs brnyan du zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: / spyod yul du gzugs brnyan du zhes bya ba ni sems de'i rang rig pa'i spyod yul sems kyi ngo bo nyid kyi gzugs brnyan du zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: The image of the domain means that the domain of that mind is the image of the nature of the mind itself.

original: so sor rtog par byed ces bya ba ni rab tu rnam par 'byed par byed pa'o //
analyzed: so sor rtog par byed ces bya ba ni rab tu rnam par 'byed par byed pa'o //
translated: One should discern means one should thoroughly differentiate.

original: mos par byed do zhes bya ba ni mos pa yid la byed pa ma yin gyi nges par 'byed do zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: mos par byed do zhes bya ba ni mos pa yid la byed pa ma yin gyi nges par 'byed do zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: One should be convinced means one should ascertain, not just be convinced.

original: 'o na ting nge 'dzin dang shes rab ni sa mang po pa yin pa'i phyir rtag tu sems dang 'jug pa yin na /
analyzed: 'o na ting nge 'dzin dang shes rab ni sa mang po pa yin pa'i phyir rtag tu sems dang 'jug pa yin na /
translated: But if concentration and wisdom are universal mental factors, they always occur with the mind and mental factors.

original: sems kyi rnam pa med na de gnyis kyang med par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: sems kyi rnam pa med na de gnyis kyang med par 'gyur ro //
translated: If there are no mental factors, then they do not exist.

original: de gnyis med na zhi gnas ni ting nge 'dzin la lhag mthong ni shes rab yin pas zhi gnas dang lhag mthong yang med par @156b 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de gnyis med na zhi gnas ni ting nge 'dzin la lhag mthong ni shes rab yin pas zhi gnas dang lhag mthong yang med par @156b 'gyur ro //
translated: If they do not exist, then concentration is not meditative serenity and wisdom is not insight, so meditative serenity and insight do not exist.

original: de gnyis med na ji ltar chos de dag ting nge 'dzin gyi spyod yul gzugs brnyan du so sor brtag cing mos par byar rung zhe na /
analyzed: de gnyis med na ji ltar chos de dag ting nge 'dzin gyi spyod yul gzugs brnyan du so sor brtag cing mos par byar rung zhe na /
translated: If they do not exist, how can one investigate and believe that those phenomena are the objects of concentration in the form of representations?

original: sems gang yin pa dang ting nge 'dzin gang yin pa dang / shes rab gang yin pa dang / chos de dag gang dag yin pa de dag thams cad ni rtogs pa'i gnas skabs na sems las phyi rol du sbyor pa ma yin pa'i phyir sems bzhin du ngo bo nyid med pa dag yin no //
analyzed: sems gang yin pa dang ting nge 'dzin gang yin pa dang / shes rab gang yin pa dang / chos de dag gang dag yin pa de dag thams cad ni rtogs pa'i gnas skabs na sems las phyi rol du sbyor pa ma yin pa'i phyir sems bzhin du ngo bo nyid med pa dag yin no //
translated: All of those phenomena—whatever the mind, whatever concentration, whatever wisdom, and whatever those phenomena are—are like the mind, for they are not external to the mind in the state of realization and therefore are essenceless.

original: sems kyi ngo bo nyid med pa nyid ni sems kyi ngo bo nyid sems med pa nyid yin te /
analyzed: sems kyi ngo bo nyid med pa nyid ni sems kyi ngo bo nyid sems med pa nyid yin te /
translated: The absence of an intrinsic reality of mind is the absence of mind as an intrinsic reality of mind.

original: de skad du shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin ba las kyang sems ni sems med pa yin te /
analyzed: de skad du shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin ba las kyang sems ni sems med pa yin te /
translated: Thus, the Perfection of Wisdom says, “Mind is not mind,

original: sems kyi rang bzhin ni 'od gsal ba nyid yin no zhes gsungs so //
analyzed: sems kyi rang bzhin ni 'od gsal ba nyid yin no zhes gsungs so //
translated: because the nature of mind is clear light.”

original: de'i phyir sems kyi rnam pa spangs nas ji ltar bsams pa'i chos de dag nyid nang du ting nge 'dzin gyi spyod yul gzugs brnyan du so sor rtog par byed mos par byed do zhes gsungs te /
analyzed: de'i phyir sems kyi rnam pa spangs nas ji ltar bsams pa'i chos de dag nyid nang du ting nge 'dzin gyi spyod yul gzugs brnyan du so sor rtog par byed mos par byed do zhes gsungs te /
translated: Therefore, having abandoned the aspects of mind, one should imagine and visualize those very phenomena that one has contemplated as the reflection that is the object of concentration.

original: de ni sbyor ba mthar thug pa'i lam gyi yid la byed pas rab tu lhag mthong sems kyi ngo bo nyid la gnyis med pa'i don rang rig pa'i ngo bo nyid bstan pa yin no //
analyzed: de ni sbyor ba mthar thug pa'i lam gyi yid la byed pas rab tu lhag mthong sems kyi ngo bo nyid la gnyis med pa'i don rang rig pa'i ngo bo nyid bstan pa yin no //
translated: This is the teaching on the intrinsic awareness of the non-duality of the intrinsic reality of mind, which is the insight of the mental attention of the path of culmination of application.

original: de'i 'og tu shes rab kyi spyod pa bzhi dang sgo gsum dang / gzhi rab tu dbye ba rnam pa drug la dmigs pas de nyid kyi rab tu dbye ba bstan pa'i dbang du mdzad nas /
analyzed: de'i 'og tu shes rab kyi spyod pa bzhi dang sgo gsum dang / gzhi rab tu dbye ba rnam pa drug la dmigs pas de nyid kyi rab tu dbye ba bstan pa'i dbang du mdzad nas /
translated: With regard to the teaching of the discrimination of that,

original: de ltar zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs so //
analyzed: de ltar zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs so //
translated: he says, “Thus, etc.”

original: ting nge 'dzin gyi spyod yul gzugs brnyan de dag la zhes bya ba ni sems las phyi rol du ma gyur pa'i chos sems kyi ngo bo nyid de dag la'o //
analyzed: ting nge 'dzin gyi spyod yul gzugs brnyan de dag la zhes bya ba ni sems las phyi rol du ma gyur pa'i chos sems kyi ngo bo nyid de dag la'o //
translated: “Those images which are the domain of samadhi” are those phenomena which are not external to the mind, but are of the nature of the mind.

original: shes bya'i don de zhes bya ba ni gnyis med pa'i don de'o //🔽rnam par 'byed ba dang / rab tu rnam par 'byed ba dang / yongs su rtog pa dang ; yongs su dpyod pa zhes bya ba ni shes rab kyi dpyod pa bzhi zhes kyang bya /
analyzed: shes bya'i don de zhes bya ba ni gnyis med pa'i don de'o // rnam par 'byed ba dang / rab tu rnam par 'byed ba dang / yongs su rtog pa dang ; yongs su dpyod pa zhes bya ba ni shes rab kyi dpyod pa bzhi zhes kyang bya /
translated: “That object of knowledge” is that object of non-duality.🔽“Discrimination, thorough discrimination, thorough examination, and thorough analysis” are the four investigations of wisdom,

original: lhag mthong rnam pa bzhi zhes kyang bya ste /
analyzed: lhag mthong rnam pa bzhi zhes kyang bya ste /
translated: and are also called the four kinds of insight.

original: skabs 'dir ni sbyor ba mthar thug pa'i lam gyi yid la byed pas rab tu phye ba'i lhag mthong sems kyi ngo bo nyid la gnyis med pa'i don rang rig pa'i rnam pa yin par sbyar ro //
analyzed: skabs 'dir ni sbyor ba mthar thug pa'i lam gyi yid la byed pas rab tu phye ba'i lhag mthong sems kyi ngo bo nyid la gnyis med pa'i don rang rig pa'i rnam pa yin par sbyar ro //
translated: In this context, insight is distinguished by the attention of the path of culmination. It is the aspect of reflexive awareness of the meaning of non-duality in the nature of mind.

original: 'di bzhi'i tshig gi don ni sngar rnam par rtog pa dang bcas pa'i gzugs brnyan gyi dmigs pa bstan pa'i skabs su bshad pa bzhin du rig par bya'o //
analyzed: 'di bzhi'i tshig gi don ni sngar rnam par rtog pa dang bcas pa'i gzugs brnyan gyi dmigs pa bstan pa'i skabs su bshad pa bzhin du rig par bya'o //
translated: The meaning of these four terms should be understood as explained above in the context of the object of meditation with concepts.

original: bzod pa dang / 'dod pa dang / bye brag 'byed pa zhes bya ba gsum gyis ni lhag mthong gi sgo gsum bstan te /
analyzed: bzod pa dang / 'dod pa dang / bye brag 'byed pa zhes bya ba gsum gyis ni lhag mthong gi sgo gsum bstan te /
translated: The three terms “acceptance,” “desire,” and “analysis” indicate the three doors of insight.

original: sgo gsum gang zhe na /
analyzed: sgo gsum gang zhe na /
translated: What are the three doors?

original: mtshan ma tsam gyis rjes su @157a * //
analyzed: mtshan ma tsam gyis rjes su @157a * //
translated: They are: the door of engagement through mere signs,

original: zhugs pa dang / yongs su btsal ba'i rjes su zhugs pa dang / yongs su btsal ba la so sor rtog pa'i rjes su zhugs pa'o //
analyzed: zhugs pa dang / yongs su btsal ba'i rjes su zhugs pa dang / yongs su btsal ba la so sor rtog pa'i rjes su zhugs pa'o //
translated: the door of engagement through thorough investigation, and the door of engagement through thorough analysis of thorough investigation.

original: de la mtshan ma tsam gyis rjes su zhugs pa zhes bya ba ni gang gi tshe dam pa'i chos thos pa dang / bzung ba dang / dge ba'i bshes gnyen gyi gdams ngag dang rjes su bstan pa la mnyam par gzhag pa'i sa pa'i yid la byed cing sems par mi byed /
analyzed: de la mtshan ma tsam gyis rjes su zhugs pa zhes bya ba ni gang gi tshe dam pa'i chos thos pa dang / bzung ba dang / dge ba'i bshes gnyen gyi gdams ngag dang rjes su bstan pa la mnyam par gzhag pa'i sa pa'i yid la byed cing sems par mi byed /
translated: The phrase engaged through mere representations refers to the time when one does not reflect,🔽contemplate,🔽ponder,

original: rtog par mi byed /🔽'jal bar mi byed /🔽nye bar rtog par mi byed pa yin la /
analyzed: rtog par mi byed / 'jal bar mi byed / nye bar rtog par mi byed pa yin la /
translated: or investigate the instructions and teachings of a spiritual master while one is in a state of meditative equipoise on the sacred Dharma that one has heard and retained.

original: bzod pa zhes bya ba yang sems kyi ngo bo nyid la gnyis med pa'i don de mnyam par gzhag pa'i sa pa'i yid la byed pas yid la byed par bzod pa yin pas na /
analyzed: bzod pa zhes bya ba yang sems kyi ngo bo nyid la gnyis med pa'i don de mnyam par gzhag pa'i sa pa'i yid la byed pas yid la byed par bzod pa yin pas na /
translated: The phrase acceptance refers to the acceptance of mental attention to the meaning of nonduality that is the nature of mind while one is in a state of meditative equipoise.

original: bzod pa zhes bya ba'i tshig gis ni mtshan ma tsam gyis rjes su zhugs pa'i sgo bstan te /
analyzed: bzod pa zhes bya ba'i tshig gis ni mtshan ma tsam gyis rjes su zhugs pa'i sgo bstan te /
translated: The word acceptance indicates the door of entry that is engagement through mere representations.

original: skabs 'dir ni thams cad kyang sbyor ba mthar thug pa'i lam gyi yid la byed pas rab tu phye ba'i lhag mthong gi sgo yin par sbyar ro //
analyzed: skabs 'dir ni thams cad kyang sbyor ba mthar thug pa'i lam gyi yid la byed pas rab tu phye ba'i lhag mthong gi sgo yin par sbyar ro //
translated: However, in the present context, all of these are to be applied to the door of insight that is distinguished by the mental attention of the path of the culmination of the union.

original: yongs su btsal ba'i rjes su zhugs pa zhes bya ba ni gang gi tshe dam pa'i chos thos pa dang / gzung ba'am dge ba'i bshes gnyen gyi gdams ngag dang rjes su bstan pa de la mnyam par gzhag pa'i sa pa'i yid la byed pas yid la byed cing sems par byed /
analyzed: yongs su btsal ba'i rjes su zhugs pa zhes bya ba ni gang gi tshe dam pa'i chos thos pa dang / gzung ba'am dge ba'i bshes gnyen gyi gdams ngag dang rjes su bstan pa de la mnyam par gzhag pa'i sa pa'i yid la byed pas yid la byed cing sems par byed /
translated: “Engaging in thorough investigation” means that when one hears the sacred Dharma, holds it, or receives the instructions and follow up teachings of a spiritual master, one uses the attention of the stage of meditative concentration to pay attention to it, to reflect on it,

original: rtog par byed /🔽'jal bar byed /
analyzed: rtog par byed / 'jal bar byed /
translated: to understand it,🔽to evaluate it,

original: nye bar rtog par byed pa yin la /
analyzed: nye bar rtog par byed pa yin la /
translated: and to fully comprehend it.

original: 'dod pa zhes bya ba yang sems kyi ngo bo nyid la gnyis med pa'i don te /
analyzed: 'dod pa zhes bya ba yang sems kyi ngo bo nyid la gnyis med pa'i don te /
translated: “Desire” means the nondual state of the nature of mind.

original: mnyam par gzhag pa'i sa pa'i yid la byed pas yid la byed cing sems par byed /🔽rtog par byed /
analyzed: mnyam par gzhag pa'i sa pa'i yid la byed pas yid la byed cing sems par byed / rtog par byed /
translated: “Desire” means that one uses the attention of the stage of meditative concentration to pay attention to it, to reflect on it,🔽to understand it,

original: 'jal bar byed /
analyzed: 'jal bar byed /
translated: to evaluate it,🔽and to fully comprehend it.

original: nye bar rtog par byed 'dod pa yin pas na 'dod pa zhes bya ba'i tshig gis ni yongs su btsal ba'i rjes su zhugs pa'i sgo ston to /
analyzed: nye bar rtog par byed 'dod pa yin pas na 'dod pa zhes bya ba'i tshig gis ni yongs su btsal ba'i rjes su zhugs pa'i sgo ston to /
translated: The word “desire” indicates the door of engaging in thorough investigation.

original: yongs su btsal ba la so sor rtog pa'i rjes su zhugs pa zhes bya ba ni gang gi tshe bsams shing brtags la gzhal zhing nye bar brtags nas ji ltar rnam par gzhag pa de bzhin du so sor rtog par byed pa yin la bye brag 'byed pa
analyzed: yongs su btsal ba la so sor rtog pa'i rjes su zhugs pa zhes bya ba ni gang gi tshe bsams shing brtags la gzhal zhing nye bar brtags nas ji ltar rnam par gzhag pa de bzhin du so sor rtog par byed pa yin la bye brag 'byed pa
translated: Thorough investigation is called “engaged in thorough investigation” because when one investigates, analyzes, judges, and examines, one thoroughly investigates just as it is posited.

original: zhes bya ba yang sems kyi ngo bo nyid la gnyis med pa'i don de mnyam par gzhag pa'i sa pa'i yid la byed pas bsams shing brtags la gzhal zhing nye bar brtags nas ji ltar rnam par gzhag pa de bzhin du so sor rtog cing bye brag 'byed
analyzed: zhes bya ba yang sems kyi ngo bo nyid la gnyis med pa'i don de mnyam par gzhag pa'i sa pa'i yid la byed pas bsams shing brtags la gzhal zhing nye bar brtags nas ji ltar rnam par gzhag pa de bzhin du so sor rtog cing bye brag 'byed
translated: And “differentiating” means that through mental attention on the level of meditative equipoise, one investigates, analyzes, judges, and examines the meaning of nonduality in the nature of mind and thoroughly investigates and differentiates just as it is posited.

original: pa yin pas na bye brag 'byed pa zhes bya ba'i tshig gis ni yongs su btsal ba la so sor rtog pa'i rjes su zhugs pa'i sgo bstan to //
analyzed: pa yin pas na bye brag 'byed pa zhes bya ba'i tshig gis ni yongs su btsal ba la so sor rtog pa'i rjes su zhugs pa'i sgo bstan to //
translated: Therefore the term “differentiating” indicates the door of thorough investigation.

original: lta ba dang rtog pa zhes bya bas ni gzhi rab tu dbye ba drug la @157b dmigs pa bstan te /
analyzed: lta ba dang rtog pa zhes bya bas ni gzhi rab tu dbye ba drug la @157b dmigs pa bstan te /
translated: “View and conception” indicates the observation of the six bases of differentiation.

original: gzhi rab tu dbye ba drug gang zhe na /
analyzed: gzhi rab tu dbye ba drug gang zhe na /
translated: What is the sixfold basis?

original: don dang / dngos po dang / mtshan nyid dang / phyogs dang / dus dang / rigs pa yongs su tshol bar byed cing yongs su btsal nas kyang de dag la so sor rtog par byed pa ste /
analyzed: don dang / dngos po dang / mtshan nyid dang / phyogs dang / dus dang / rigs pa yongs su tshol bar byed cing yongs su btsal nas kyang de dag la so sor rtog par byed pa ste /
translated: It is the investigation and discernment of meaning, substance, characteristic, category, time, and reason.

original: de dag gi tshig gi don yang sngar bstan pa bzhin no //
analyzed: de dag gi tshig gi don yang sngar bstan pa bzhin no //
translated: The meaning of these terms has been explained above.

original: lta ba zhes bya ba ni yongs su tshol bar byed pa yin la /🔽rtog pa zhes bya ba ni yongs su btsal nas de dag la so sor rtog pa yin pas na lta ba dang rtog pa zhes bya ba'i tshig gnyis kyis ni gzhi rab tu dbye ba drug po re re la yang yongs su tshol bar byed cing /
analyzed: lta ba zhes bya ba ni yongs su tshol bar byed pa yin la / rtog pa zhes bya ba ni yongs su btsal nas de dag la so sor rtog pa yin pas na lta ba dang rtog pa zhes bya ba'i tshig gnyis kyis ni gzhi rab tu dbye ba drug po re re la yang yongs su tshol bar byed cing /
translated: “View” means investigation.🔽“Reflection” means discernment after investigation. Thus, the two terms “view” and “reflection” indicate the six kinds of bases, each of which is investigated and discerned in order.

original: yongs su btsal nas so sor rtog par byed pa'i rim gyis gzhi rab tu dbye ba drug la dmigs pa bstan to //
analyzed: yongs su btsal nas so sor rtog par byed pa'i rim gyis gzhi rab tu dbye ba drug la dmigs pa bstan to //
translated: Thus, the two terms “view” and “reflection” indicate the six kinds of bases, each of which is investigated and discerned in order.

original: de ni lhag mthong zhes bya ba ste lhag mthong zhes bya ba ni sbyor ba mthar thug pa'i lam gyis yid la byed pas rab tu phye ba'i lhag mthong gi sems kyi ngo bo nyid la gnyis su med pa'i don rang rig pa'i rnam pas so sor rtog
analyzed: de ni lhag mthong zhes bya ba ste lhag mthong zhes bya ba ni sbyor ba mthar thug pa'i lam gyis yid la byed pas rab tu phye ba'i lhag mthong gi sems kyi ngo bo nyid la gnyis su med pa'i don rang rig pa'i rnam pas so sor rtog
translated: That is called insight. Insight is the essence of mind that is distinguished by the mental contemplation of the final path of preparation.
