analyzed: byed pa po mi rigs pa'i phyir bya ba dang las kyang mi rigs pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because of nonexistence, there is no agent and no object of action, because there is no agent and no object of action.🔽Because of nonexistence, there is no agent and no object of action, because there is no agent and no object of action.

original: 'o na sems kyi ngo bo nyid gcig tu de ji ltar gzung ba dang 'dzin pa'i rnam par snang bar 'gyur zhe na /
analyzed: 'o na sems kyi ngo bo nyid gcig tu de ji ltar gzung ba dang 'dzin pa'i rnam par snang bar 'gyur zhe na /
translated: Well then, if the nature of mind is one, how can it appear in the aspect of the apprehended and apprehender?

original: 'on kyang de skyes pa'i sems gang yin pa de de ltar snang ngo zhes bya ba gsungs te /
analyzed: 'on kyang de skyes pa'i sems gang yin pa de de ltar snang ngo zhes bya ba gsungs te /
translated: Nevertheless, it is said that “the mind that arises appears in that way.”

original: thog ma med pa'i dus nas kun brtags pa'i ngo bo nyid la mngon par zhen pa'i bag chags kyis yongs su bsgos pa'i kun gzhi'i rnam par shes pa nyid de ltar snang ngo zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: thog ma med pa'i dus nas kun brtags pa'i ngo bo nyid la mngon par zhen pa'i bag chags kyis yongs su bsgos pa'i kun gzhi'i rnam par shes pa nyid de ltar snang ngo zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: The meaning is that the mind of the ground of all, which is completely imbued with the habitual tendencies of the conception of the imagined nature that has existed since beginningless time, appears in that way.

original: de la chos gang yang chos gang la yang rtog par mi byed ces bya ba ni yongs su grub pa'i sems yongs su dag pa bstan la /
analyzed: de la chos gang yang chos gang la yang rtog par mi byed ces bya ba ni yongs su grub pa'i sems yongs su dag pa bstan la /
translated: The line “no phenomenon is conceived in any phenomenon” teaches the completely pure mind of the consummate nature.

original: de ltar skyes pa'i sems gang yin pa de de ltar snang ngo zhes bya bas ni gzhan gyi dbang gis sems 'khrul par bstan to //
analyzed: de ltar skyes pa'i sems gang yin pa de de ltar snang ngo zhes bya bas ni gzhan gyi dbang gis sems 'khrul par bstan to //
translated: The line “the mind that arises appears in that way” teaches the deluded mind of the dependent nature.

original: byams pa 'di lta ste dper na zhes bya ba la sogs pas ni tha dad pa ma yin pa'i don de nyid gsal bar bya ba'i phyir dpe ston te /
analyzed: byams pa 'di lta ste dper na zhes bya ba la sogs pas ni tha dad pa ma yin pa'i don de nyid gsal bar bya ba'i phyir dpe ston te /
translated: The passage beginning “Maitreya, it is thus,” and so on, presents an analogy in order to clarify the meaning of nondifference.

original: dper na me long gi dkyil 'khor la gzugs brnyan gzhan 'byung ba med par gzugs nyid gzugs brnyan lta bur snang ba ni gzugs brnyan mthong ngo snyam du sems pa dang 'dra bar sems nyid gzugs brnyan lta bur snang bar zad kyi /
analyzed: dper na me long gi dkyil 'khor la gzugs brnyan gzhan 'byung ba med par gzugs nyid gzugs brnyan lta bur snang ba ni gzugs brnyan mthong ngo snyam du sems pa dang 'dra bar sems nyid gzugs brnyan lta bur snang bar zad kyi /
translated: For example, when a reflection appears in a round mirror, the form itself appears as a reflection without another form arising. It is like the appearance of a reflection, where one thinks, “I see a reflection.”

original: sems las gzhan pa'i gzugs brnyan med do zhes bya bar ston to //
analyzed: sems las gzhan pa'i gzugs brnyan med do zhes bya bar ston to //
translated: The mind itself appears as a reflection, but there is no reflection other than the mind.

original: 'di la smra ba po dag me long gi dkyil 'khor dang gzugs la brten nas gzugs brnyan gzhan zhig 'byung bas brten te byung ba gang yin pa de dag thams cad ni yod pa yin na dpe 'di ji ltar rung bar 'gyur zhes zer ba dag kyang yod
analyzed: 'di la smra ba po dag me long gi dkyil 'khor dang gzugs la brten nas gzugs brnyan gzhan zhig 'byung bas brten te byung ba gang yin pa de dag thams cad ni yod pa yin na dpe 'di ji ltar rung bar 'gyur zhes zer ba dag kyang yod
translated: Some say that since a reflection arises in dependence on a mirror and a form, whatever arises in dependence exists. They ask, “How can this be a suitable example?”

original: de / de dag la 'di skad ces gzugs dang gzugs brnyan gyi rnam pa'i rnam par shes pa las gzhan pa'i don byed pas rdzas gzhan ni med do //
analyzed: de / de dag la 'di skad ces gzugs dang gzugs brnyan gyi rnam pa'i rnam par shes pa las gzhan pa'i don byed pas rdzas gzhan ni med do //
translated: To them he says: “There is no other substance that performs a function apart from the consciousness that has the aspect of form and the reflection of form.

original: ji ltar don med ce na /
analyzed: ji ltar don med ce na /
translated: How is there no object?

original: don med kyang rnam par @163b shes pa skye ba snang ba'i phyir te /
analyzed: don med kyang rnam par @163b shes pa skye ba snang ba'i phyir te /
translated: Even though there is no object, consciousness arises in the appearance of that object.

original: 'di ltar 'das pa dang ma 'ongs pa dang rmi lam la sogs pa la don med par yang de'i rnam pa'i rnam par shes pa skye ba snang ba lta bu'o //
analyzed: 'di ltar 'das pa dang ma 'ongs pa dang rmi lam la sogs pa la don med par yang de'i rnam pa'i rnam par shes pa skye ba snang ba lta bu'o //
translated: Thus, even though there is no object, the arising of consciousness in the aspect of that object is seen in the case of the past, the future, dreams, and so on.

original: yang gcig tu na don mtshungs pa la mos pa'i dbang gis rnam par rig pa tha dad pa dmigs pas kyang sems nyid gzugs brnyan du snang bar rigs te nges pa yin te /
analyzed: yang gcig tu na don mtshungs pa la mos pa'i dbang gis rnam par rig pa tha dad pa dmigs pas kyang sems nyid gzugs brnyan du snang bar rigs te nges pa yin te /
translated: Moreover, it is reasonable to say that mind itself appears as a reflection because of the observation of different representations through the power of interest in the same object.

original: dper na chu klung gi dngos po gcig la dud 'gro rnams kyis ni gnas kyi rnam par mthong /
analyzed: dper na chu klung gi dngos po gcig la dud 'gro rnams kyis ni gnas kyi rnam par mthong /
translated: For example, with regard to a single thing, such as a body of water, animals see it as a place to live,

original: yi dags rnams kyis ni rnag gi rnam par mthong /
analyzed: yi dags rnams kyis ni rnag gi rnam par mthong /
translated: hungry ghosts see it as pus and blood,🔽and humans see it as something to use for drinking and bathing.

original: mi rnams kyis ni chu'i rnam pa lta bur mthong ba dang / lha rnams kyis ni sa gzhi bee d'urya'i rang bzhin du mthong ba lta bu'o zhes brjod pas bya'o //
analyzed: mi rnams kyis ni chu'i rnam pa lta bur mthong ba dang / lha rnams kyis ni sa gzhi bee d'urya'i rang bzhin du mthong ba lta bu'o zhes brjod pas bya'o //
translated: It is like the way that humans see water, while the gods see the ground as the nature of beryl.

original: de ltar mnyam par gzhag pa'i sa pa'i ting nge 'dzin gyi spyod yul gzugs brnyan de 'ba' zhig sems dang tha dad pa ma yin par zad dam /
analyzed: de ltar mnyam par gzhag pa'i sa pa'i ting nge 'dzin gyi spyod yul gzugs brnyan de 'ba' zhig sems dang tha dad pa ma yin par zad dam /
translated: Is the reflection that is the object of meditation of the level of meditative equipoise only not different from the mind?

original: 'on te mnyam par ma bzhag pa'i sa pa'i sems can rnams kyi spyod yul gzugs la sogs par snang ba de yang sems dang tha dad pa ma yin snyam pa dag gi phyir /
analyzed: 'on te mnyam par ma bzhag pa'i sa pa'i sems can rnams kyi spyod yul gzugs la sogs par snang ba de yang sems dang tha dad pa ma yin snyam pa dag gi phyir /
translated: Or is the appearance of form and so on that is the object of sentient beings on the level of non-equipoise also not different from the mind?

original: bcom ldan 'das sems can rnams kyi zhes bya ba la sogs pa zhus te /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das sems can rnams kyi zhes bya ba la sogs pa zhus te /
translated: In order to think about this, it says, “Bhagavān, are the appearances of form and so on of sentient beings…” and so forth.

original: gzugs la sogs par snang ba zhes bya ba ni sngon po la sogs pa'i rdzas so //
analyzed: gzugs la sogs par snang ba zhes bya ba ni sngon po la sogs pa'i rdzas so //
translated: “The appearances of form and so on” are the substances of blue and so forth.

original: sems kyi gzugs brnyan zhes bya ba ni sems la snang bar gyur pa'o //
analyzed: sems kyi gzugs brnyan zhes bya ba ni sems la snang bar gyur pa'o //
translated: “The reflections of the mind” are what appear to the mind.

original: rang bzhin du gnas zhes bya ba ni mnyam par gzhag pa'i sa pa rnams kyi spyod yul tha mal par gnas pa'o //
analyzed: rang bzhin du gnas zhes bya ba ni mnyam par gzhag pa'i sa pa rnams kyi spyod yul tha mal par gnas pa'o //
translated: “Abiding in its own nature” means that the objects of those who are in equipoise are abiding in the ordinary state.

original: byams pa tha dad pa ma yin zhes bya ste zhes bya ba ni bstan pa'o //
analyzed: byams pa tha dad pa ma yin zhes bya ste zhes bya ba ni bstan pa'o //
translated: “Loving-kindness is not different” is the teaching.

original: byis pa phyin ci log gi blo can rnams ni zhes bya ba la sogs pa bshad pa ste /
analyzed: byis pa phyin ci log gi blo can rnams ni zhes bya ba la sogs pa bshad pa ste /
translated: “The childish, whose minds are distorted” and so on is the explanation.

original: des na ci'i phyir sems las tha dad pa lta bur snang snyam pa la /
analyzed: des na ci'i phyir sems las tha dad pa lta bur snang snyam pa la /
translated: Therefore, why do they appear as if they are different from the mind?

original: byis pa de kho na nyid ma mthong ba lta ba rab rib kyis nyams par byas pa rnams ni phyi rol gyi don med bzhin du yod par mthong ba yin no zhes bstan to //
analyzed: byis pa de kho na nyid ma mthong ba lta ba rab rib kyis nyams par byas pa rnams ni phyi rol gyi don med bzhin du yod par mthong ba yin no zhes bstan to //
translated: It is taught that the childish, whose vision of reality is obscured by the cataracts of wrong views, see external objects as existing, even though they do not exist.

original: de ltar rnam par mi rtog pa'i shes pas nyogs pa dang / rab tu phye ba'i zhi gnas dang lhag mthong gi lam gyi ngo bo nyid de las rab tu nyams par mi 'gyur zhing chud mi za bar bya ba'i phyir bstan pa dang bshad pas rnam par mi rtog pa gdags pa gtan la dbab pa bstan pa ni rnam
analyzed: de ltar rnam par mi rtog pa'i shes pas nyogs pa dang / rab tu phye ba'i zhi gnas dang lhag mthong gi lam gyi ngo bo nyid de las rab tu nyams par mi 'gyur zhing chud mi za bar bya ba'i phyir bstan pa dang bshad pas rnam par mi rtog pa gdags pa gtan la dbab pa bstan pa ni rnam
translated: Thus, in order to prevent the degeneration of the path of serenity and insight, which is the essence of the unmediated cognition and the unmediated cognition itself, and in order to prevent its destruction, the teaching of the determination of the designation of the unmediated cognition is taught and explained.

original: par mi rtog pa'i shes pa rtogs pa chud mi za bar bya ba'i phyir gdags pa gtan la dbab pa yin no //🔽de'i 'og tu rgyu mtshan gsum bsgom pa'i dus mi shes pa rnam par gzhig cing chud mi za bar bya ba'i phyir gdags pa gtan la dbab pa'i tshig @164a * //
analyzed: par mi rtog pa'i shes pa rtogs pa chud mi za bar bya ba'i phyir gdags pa gtan la dbab pa yin no // de'i 'og tu rgyu mtshan gsum bsgom pa'i dus mi shes pa rnam par gzhig cing chud mi za bar bya ba'i phyir gdags pa gtan la dbab pa'i tshig @164a * //
translated: The determination of the designation is taught in order to prevent the destruction of the realization of the unmediated cognition.

original: gi don la sogs pa bshad par bya ste /
analyzed: gi don la sogs pa bshad par bya ste /
translated: After that, in order to destroy the ignorance of the time of cultivation of the three reasons and to prevent its destruction, the meaning of the words of the determination of the designation should be explained.

original: rgyu mtshan gsum bsgom pa'i dus mi shes pa zhes bya ba ni lhag mthong gi rgyu mtshan dang / zhi gnas kyi rgyu mtshan dang / btang snyoms kyi rgyu mtshan bsgom pa'i dus mi shes pa'o //🔽rnam par gzhig cing chud mi za bar bya ba'i phyir gdags pa gtan la dbab pa zhes bya ba ni mi shes pa de rnam par gzhig cing rgyu mtshan gsum bsgom pa'i dus shes pas rab tu phye ba'i zhi gnas dang lhag mthong gi lam gyi ngo bo
analyzed: rgyu mtshan gsum bsgom pa'i dus mi shes pa zhes bya ba ni lhag mthong gi rgyu mtshan dang / zhi gnas kyi rgyu mtshan dang / btang snyoms kyi rgyu mtshan bsgom pa'i dus mi shes pa'o // rnam par gzhig cing chud mi za bar bya ba'i phyir gdags pa gtan la dbab pa zhes bya ba ni mi shes pa de rnam par gzhig cing rgyu mtshan gsum bsgom pa'i dus shes pas rab tu phye ba'i zhi gnas dang lhag mthong gi lam gyi ngo bo
translated: Not knowing the time for cultivating the three reasons is not knowing the time for cultivating the reason for insight, the reason for serenity, and the reason for equanimity.🔽Ascertainment of the teaching is taught in order to destroy that ignorance and to prevent its loss. It is the essence of the path of serenity and insight, which is distinguished by knowing the time for cultivating the three reasons.

original: nyid de la rab tu nyams par mi 'gyur zhing chud mi za bar bya ba'i phyir bstan pa dang bshad pas rgyu mtshan gsum bsgom pa'i dus shes pa gdags pa gtan la dbab pa'o ;
analyzed: nyid de la rab tu nyams par mi 'gyur zhing chud mi za bar bya ba'i phyir bstan pa dang bshad pas rgyu mtshan gsum bsgom pa'i dus shes pa gdags pa gtan la dbab pa'o ;
translated: It is the ascertainment of the teaching, which is taught and explained in order to prevent the loss and destruction of that path of serenity and insight.

original: / de la mtshams sbyar ba ji lta bu zhe na /
analyzed: / de la mtshams sbyar ba ji lta bu zhe na /
translated: What is the connection?

original: 'dir 'phags pa byams pas gzhan dag 'di snyam du rnal 'byor yongs su bsdus pa'i zhi gnas dang lhag mthong gi ngo bo nyid la 'di la sbyor ba ni mi mthun pa'i phyogs spong ba dang / gnyen po 'phel ba'i dus shes par bya dgos na /
analyzed: 'dir 'phags pa byams pas gzhan dag 'di snyam du rnal 'byor yongs su bsdus pa'i zhi gnas dang lhag mthong gi ngo bo nyid la 'di la sbyor ba ni mi mthun pa'i phyogs spong ba dang / gnyen po 'phel ba'i dus shes par bya dgos na /
translated: Here, the noble Maitreya, considering the thoughts of others who think, “In the essence of serenity and insight that comprise yoga in general, one must know the time for abandoning the opposing side and for increasing the antidote.

original: de la lhag mthong gi rgyu mtshan bsgom pa'i ngas ni gang /🔽zhi gnas kyi rgyu mtshan bsgom pa'i dus ni gang /
analyzed: de la lhag mthong gi rgyu mtshan bsgom pa'i ngas ni gang / zhi gnas kyi rgyu mtshan bsgom pa'i dus ni gang /
translated: What is the time for cultivating the signs of insight?🔽What is the time for cultivating the signs of serenity?

original: btang snyoms kyi rgyu mtshan bsgom pa'i dus ni gang snyam du sems pa rnams kyi bsam pa la brtags nas /
analyzed: btang snyoms kyi rgyu mtshan bsgom pa'i dus ni gang snyam du sems pa rnams kyi bsam pa la brtags nas /
translated: What is the time for cultivating the signs of equanimity?”

original: bcom ldan 'das byang chub sems dpa' zhes bya ba la sogs pa zhu ba rnam pa drug zhus par sbyar ro //
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das byang chub sems dpa' zhes bya ba la sogs pa zhu ba rnam pa drug zhus par sbyar ro //
translated: asked the Blessed One six questions beginning with “Blessed One, what is called a bodhisattva.”

original: ji tsam gyis na gcig tu lhag mthong bsgom pa lags zhes bya bas ni lhag mthong gi rgyu mtshan bsgom pa'i dus gang lags zhes zhus pa yin no //
analyzed: ji tsam gyis na gcig tu lhag mthong bsgom pa lags zhes bya bas ni lhag mthong gi rgyu mtshan bsgom pa'i dus gang lags zhes zhus pa yin no //
translated: “To what extent is one cultivating insight exclusively?” asks about the time for cultivating the signs of insight.

original: gang gi tshe rgyun chags su yid la byed pas sems kyi mtshan nyid yid la byed pa'o zhes bya bas ni bstan pas lhag mthong gi rgyu mtshan bsgom pa'i dus mi shes pa rnam par gzhig cing chud mi za bar bya ba'i phyir gdags pa gtan la dbab🔽pa bstan te /
analyzed: gang gi tshe rgyun chags su yid la byed pas sems kyi mtshan nyid yid la byed pa'o zhes bya bas ni bstan pas lhag mthong gi rgyu mtshan bsgom pa'i dus mi shes pa rnam par gzhig cing chud mi za bar bya ba'i phyir gdags pa gtan la dbab pa bstan te /
translated: When it is said that attention to the characteristics of mind is attention to the mind through continuous attention, this teaches that in order to eliminate ignorance about the time of cultivating the signs of insight and to prevent its degeneration, one should determine the presentation of designation.

original: de la rgyun chags su yid la byed pas zhes bya bas ni lhag mthong bstan te /
analyzed: de la rgyun chags su yid la byed pas zhes bya bas ni lhag mthong bstan te /
translated: Attention to the characteristics of mind is attention to the mind through continuous attention teaches insight.

original: sbyor ba mthar thug pa'i lam gyi yid la byed pa'i gnas skabs kyi lhag mthong sems kyi ngo bo nyid la gnyis med pa'i don rang rig pa'i ngo bo nyid dang / shes rab kyi spyod pa bzhi dang / sgo gsum dang gzhi rab tu dbye ba rnam pa drug la dmigs pa'i sems kyi ngo bo nyid la gnyis med pa'i don de rgyun chags su yid la byed pa ni lhag mthong gi lam gyi ngo bo nyid yin par bstan to //🔽sems kyi mtshan nyid ces bya ba ni lhag mthong gi rgyu mtshan ni rnam pa gnyis te @164b dmigs pa'i rgyu mtshan dang / gzhi'i rgyu mtshan no //
analyzed: sbyor ba mthar thug pa'i lam gyi yid la byed pa'i gnas skabs kyi lhag mthong sems kyi ngo bo nyid la gnyis med pa'i don rang rig pa'i ngo bo nyid dang / shes rab kyi spyod pa bzhi dang / sgo gsum dang gzhi rab tu dbye ba rnam pa drug la dmigs pa'i sems kyi ngo bo nyid la gnyis med pa'i don de rgyun chags su yid la byed pa ni lhag mthong gi lam gyi ngo bo nyid yin par bstan to // sems kyi mtshan nyid ces bya ba ni lhag mthong gi rgyu mtshan ni rnam pa gnyis te @164b dmigs pa'i rgyu mtshan dang / gzhi'i rgyu mtshan no //
translated: The essence of insight on the path of culmination is the uninterrupted attention to the meaning of nonduality in the nature of mind, which is the essence of reflexive awareness, and the attention to the meaning of nonduality in the nature of mind that is the four kinds of wisdom activity and the three doors and the six kinds of thorough analysis of the basis.🔽The characteristics of mind are taught to be the two kinds of objects of meditation for insight: the object of meditation for the cause of insight and the object of meditation for the basis of insight.

original: de la dmigs pa'i rgyu mtshan ni lhag mthong yid la byed pa thob pa'i rgyu mtshan te /
analyzed: de la dmigs pa'i rgyu mtshan ni lhag mthong yid la byed pa thob pa'i rgyu mtshan te /
translated: The object of meditation for the cause of insight is the cause of attaining attention to insight.

original: lhag mthong gi dmigs pa ting nge 'dzin gyi spyod yul rnam par rtog pa dang bcas pa'i gzugs brnyan gang yin pa'o //
analyzed: lhag mthong gi dmigs pa ting nge 'dzin gyi spyod yul rnam par rtog pa dang bcas pa'i gzugs brnyan gang yin pa'o //
translated: The object of insight is the object of concentration that is an image associated with discursive thought.

original: gzhi'i rgyu mtshan ni lhag mthong gi lam yongs su dag pa'i rgyu ste /
analyzed: gzhi'i rgyu mtshan ni lhag mthong gi lam yongs su dag pa'i rgyu ste /
translated: The causal sign of the basis is the cause of the purification of the path of insight.

original: lhag mthong gi sems yongs su bsgoms nas de'i 'og tu lhag mthong gi lam yongs su dag par bya ba'i phyir zhi gnas kyi sems kyi mtshan ma nyid la sbyor ba gang yin pa ste /
analyzed: lhag mthong gi sems yongs su bsgoms nas de'i 'og tu lhag mthong gi lam yongs su dag par bya ba'i phyir zhi gnas kyi sems kyi mtshan ma nyid la sbyor ba gang yin pa ste /
translated: After one has cultivated the mind of insight, in order to purify the path of insight, one applies oneself to the sign of the mind of serenity.

original: skabs 'dir ni dmigs pa'i rgyu mtshan nyid gzung bar bya'o //
analyzed: skabs 'dir ni dmigs pa'i rgyu mtshan nyid gzung bar bya'o //
translated: In this context, however, one should understand the causal sign of the object.

original: yid la byed pa'o zhes bya ba ni lhag mthong gi rgyu mtshan sgom pa'i dus bstan te /🔽zhi gnas kyi sems yongs su bsgoms pa'i dus sam /
analyzed: yid la byed pa'o zhes bya ba ni lhag mthong gi rgyu mtshan sgom pa'i dus bstan te / zhi gnas kyi sems yongs su bsgoms pa'i dus sam /
translated: The phrase “mental attention” indicates the time of cultivation of the causal sign of insight.🔽It is the time for cultivating insight when one has cultivated the mind of serenity,

original: ma bsgoms pa'i dang po'i dus su ni lhag mthong sgom pa'i dus yin te /
analyzed: ma bsgoms pa'i dang po'i dus su ni lhag mthong sgom pa'i dus yin te /
translated: or when one has not cultivated it, at the beginning.

original: dus der lhag mthong gi rgyu mtshan de lhag mthong gi phyogs yid la byed pa bzhi po sngar bstan pa dag gis yid la byas na bying ba la sogs pa mi mthun pa'i phyogs spong zhing shes bya'i dngos po yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin du rab
analyzed: dus der lhag mthong gi rgyu mtshan de lhag mthong gi phyogs yid la byed pa bzhi po sngar bstan pa dag gis yid la byas na bying ba la sogs pa mi mthun pa'i phyogs spong zhing shes bya'i dngos po yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin du rab
translated: At that time, if one attends to the reasons for insight with the four attentions that are the side of insight, as previously explained, one abandons the unfavorable side of dullness, etc., and the remedy increases, such as the correct knowledge of things to be known just as they are.

original: tu shes pa la sogs pa gnyen po 'phel bar 'gyur ro zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: tu shes pa la sogs pa gnyen po 'phel bar 'gyur ro zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: This is the meaning.

original: ji tsam gyis na gcig tu zhi gnas bsgom pa lags zhes bya bas ni zhi gnas kyi rgyu bsgom pa'i dus mtshan gang lags zhus pa yin no //🔽gang gi tshe rgyun chags su yid la byed pas bar chad med pa'i sems yid la byed pa'o zhes bya bas ni bstan pas zhi gnas kyi rgyu mtshan bsgom pa'i dus mi shes pa rnam par gzhig cing chud mi za bar bya ba'i phyir gdags pa gtan la
analyzed: ji tsam gyis na gcig tu zhi gnas bsgom pa lags zhes bya bas ni zhi gnas kyi rgyu bsgom pa'i dus mtshan gang lags zhus pa yin no // gang gi tshe rgyun chags su yid la byed pas bar chad med pa'i sems yid la byed pa'o zhes bya bas ni bstan pas zhi gnas kyi rgyu mtshan bsgom pa'i dus mi shes pa rnam par gzhig cing chud mi za bar bya ba'i phyir gdags pa gtan la
translated: By at what point is it the cultivation of calm abiding exclusively? he asks about the time of the cultivation of the cause of calm abiding.

original: dbab pa bstan te /
analyzed: dbab pa bstan te /
translated: By when one attends to the mind uninterruptedly with continuous attention, he explains that the time of cultivation of the reason for calm abiding is the time of cultivation of the cause of calm abiding. In order to eliminate the ignorance of that and to prevent its loss, he teaches the presentation of the ascertainment of the teaching.

original: de la rgyun chags su yid la byed pas zhes bya bas ni zhi gnas bstan te /
analyzed: de la rgyun chags su yid la byed pas zhes bya bas ni zhi gnas bstan te /
translated: The phrase by means of continuous attention indicates serenity.

original: sbyor ba mthar thug pa'i lam gyi yid la byed pa'i zhi gnas mtshan ma dang gnas ngan len gyi g-yeng ba zhi ba'i ngo bo nyid dang sems gnas pa dgu dang stobs drug dang yid la byed pa bzhi'i rab tu dbye ba dang bcas pas sems rtse gcig
analyzed: sbyor ba mthar thug pa'i lam gyi yid la byed pa'i zhi gnas mtshan ma dang gnas ngan len gyi g-yeng ba zhi ba'i ngo bo nyid dang sems gnas pa dgu dang stobs drug dang yid la byed pa bzhi'i rab tu dbye ba dang bcas pas sems rtse gcig
translated: The essence of serenity is one-pointed attention that is attained by means of the path of meditative preparation, and is characterized by the pacification of the distractions of signs and the physicalļas of afflicted states. It is also characterized by the nine states of mind that are attained in meditative equipoise, the six powers, and the four types of attention.

original: tu rgyun chags su yid la byed pa ni zhi gnas kyi lam gyi ngo bo nyid yin par bstan to //
analyzed: tu rgyun chags su yid la byed pa ni zhi gnas kyi lam gyi ngo bo nyid yin par bstan to //
translated: The phrase by means of continuous attention indicates the essence of the path of serenity.

original: bar chad med pa'i sems zhes bya bas ni zhi gnas kyi rgyu mtshan bstan te /
analyzed: bar chad med pa'i sems zhes bya bas ni zhi gnas kyi rgyu mtshan bstan te /
translated: The phrase by means of an uninterrupted mind indicates the sign of serenity.

original: rgyu mtshan ni rnam pa gnyis te /
analyzed: rgyu mtshan ni rnam pa gnyis te /
translated: There are two kinds of signs:

original: dmigs pa'i rgyu mtshan dang / zhi ba'i rgyu mtshan no //
analyzed: dmigs pa'i rgyu mtshan dang / zhi ba'i rgyu mtshan no //
translated: the sign of the object of meditation and the sign of serenity.

original: de la dmigs pa'i rgyu mtshan ni zhi gnas kyi yid la byed pa thob pa'i rgyu ste /🔽zhi @165a * //
analyzed: de la dmigs pa'i rgyu mtshan ni zhi gnas kyi yid la byed pa thob pa'i rgyu ste /🔽zhi @165a * //
translated: The sign of the object of meditation is the cause for attaining attention directed to serenity.

original: gnas kyi dmigs pa'i ting nge 'dzin gyi spyod yul rnam par mi rtog pa'i gzugs brnyan gang yin pa'o //
analyzed: gnas kyi dmigs pa'i ting nge 'dzin gyi spyod yul rnam par mi rtog pa'i gzugs brnyan gang yin pa'o //
translated: It is the non-conceptual reflection that is the domain of meditative concentration on the object of meditation.

original: gzhi'i gzugs brnyan ni zhi gnas kyi lam yongs su dag pa'i rgyu ste /
analyzed: gzhi'i gzugs brnyan ni zhi gnas kyi lam yongs su dag pa'i rgyu ste /
translated: The reflection of the basis is the cause of the purification of the path of serenity.

original: zhi gnas kyi sems yongs su bsgoms nas de'i 'og tu zhi gnas kyi lam yongs su dag par bya ba'i phyir lhag mthong gi sems kyi mtshan nyid la sbyor ba gang yin pa ste /
analyzed: zhi gnas kyi sems yongs su bsgoms nas de'i 'og tu zhi gnas kyi lam yongs su dag par bya ba'i phyir lhag mthong gi sems kyi mtshan nyid la sbyor ba gang yin pa ste /
translated: After fully cultivating the mind of serenity, in order to purify the path of serenity, one applies oneself to the characteristics of the mind of insight.

original: skabs 'dir ni dmigs pa'i rgyu mtshan nyid gzung bar bya'o //
analyzed: skabs 'dir ni dmigs pa'i rgyu mtshan nyid gzung bar bya'o //
translated: In this context, however, one should grasp the object of meditation as the causal sign.

original: yid la byed pa'o zhes bya ba ni zhi gnas kyi rgyu mtshan bsgom pa'i dus bstan te /
analyzed: yid la byed pa'o zhes bya ba ni zhi gnas kyi rgyu mtshan bsgom pa'i dus bstan te /
translated: Mental attention is taught as the time of cultivation of the causal sign of serenity.

original: sems rgod par gyur pa'i dus sam rgod du dogs pa'i dus su ni zhi gnas bsgom pa'i dus yin te /
analyzed: sems rgod par gyur pa'i dus sam rgod du dogs pa'i dus su ni zhi gnas bsgom pa'i dus yin te /
translated: When the mind is agitated or when one fears that it will become agitated, that is the time to cultivate serenity.

original: dus de zhi gnas kyi rgyu mtshan de zhi gnas kyi phyogs kyi yid la byed pa bzhi po sngar bstan pa dag gis yid la byas na rgod pa la sogs pa mi mthun pa'i phyogs spong zhing nang gi sems rtse gcig pa nyid dang / lus dang sems shin tu sbyangs pa la sogs pa gnyen po 'phel bar 'gyur ro zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: dus de zhi gnas kyi rgyu mtshan de zhi gnas kyi phyogs kyi yid la byed pa bzhi po sngar bstan pa dag gis yid la byas na rgod pa la sogs pa mi mthun pa'i phyogs spong zhing nang gi sems rtse gcig pa nyid dang / lus dang sems shin tu sbyangs pa la sogs pa gnyen po 'phel bar 'gyur ro zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: At that time, if one attends to the reason for calm abiding, and to the four mental orientations that are on the side of calm abiding, as previously explained, then one abandons the discordances such as excitation, and the antidotes such as internal mental one-pointedness and physical and mental pliancy increase. This is the meaning.

original: ji tsam gyis na zhi gnas dang lhag mthong gnyis 'dres par gyur te mnyam par zung du 'jug pa lags zhes bya bas ni btang snyoms kyi rgyu mtshan bsgom pa'i dus gang lags zhes pa yin no //
analyzed: ji tsam gyis na zhi gnas dang lhag mthong gnyis 'dres par gyur te mnyam par zung du 'jug pa lags zhes bya bas ni btang snyoms kyi rgyu mtshan bsgom pa'i dus gang lags zhes pa yin no //
translated: By how much does calm abiding and insight mix, and become evenly unified? This is the time for cultivating the reason for equanimity.

original: gang gi tshe sems rtse gcig pa nyid yid la byed pa'o zhes bya bas ni bstan pas btang snyoms gyi rgyu mtshan bsgom pa'i dus mi shes pa rnam par gzhig cing chud mi za bar bya ba'i phyir gdags pa gtan la dbab pa ste /

original: dmigs pa de la rgyun chags du brtsal mi dgos par sems rtse gcig pa nyid lhun gyis grub pa ni btang snyoms kyi lam gyi ngo bo nyid yin par bstan to //
analyzed: dmigs pa de la rgyun chags du brtsal mi dgos par sems rtse gcig pa nyid lhun gyis grub pa ni btang snyoms kyi lam gyi ngo bo nyid yin par bstan to //
translated: The spontaneous, effortless one-pointedness of mind that is not dependent on repeated effort on that object is taught to be the essence of the path of equanimity.

original: rgyu mtshan ni rnam pa gnyis te /
analyzed: rgyu mtshan ni rnam pa gnyis te /
translated: There are two reasons:

original: dmigs pa'i rgyu mtshan dang / gzhi'i rgyu mtshan no //
analyzed: dmigs pa'i rgyu mtshan dang / gzhi'i rgyu mtshan no //
translated: the objective reason and the fundamental reason.

original: de la @165b dmigs pa'i rgyu mtshan ni btang snyoms kyi yid la byed pa thob pa'i rgyu ste /
analyzed: de la @165b dmigs pa'i rgyu mtshan ni btang snyoms kyi yid la byed pa thob pa'i rgyu ste /
translated: The objective reason is the cause for attaining the mental attention of equanimity,

original: dngos po'i mtha' dang / dgos pa yongs su grub pa'i dmigs pa gang yin pa'o //
analyzed: dngos po'i mtha' dang / dgos pa yongs su grub pa'i dmigs pa gang yin pa'o //
translated: which is the object of the limit of existence and the object of the accomplishment of the purpose.

original: gzhi'i rgyu mtshan ni btang snyoms kyi lam yongs su dag pa'i rgyu ste /
analyzed: gzhi'i rgyu mtshan ni btang snyoms kyi lam yongs su dag pa'i rgyu ste /
translated: The fundamental reason is the cause for purifying the path of equanimity,

original: btang snyoms kyi sems de nyid ches shin tu gong nas gong du yongs su dag par bya ba'i phyir dmigs pa de nyid la ren par spyod cing /
analyzed: btang snyoms kyi sems de nyid ches shin tu gong nas gong du yongs su dag par bya ba'i phyir dmigs pa de nyid la ren par spyod cing /
translated: which is the practice of that very object of equanimity in order to make the mind of equanimity increasingly pure.

original: brtson 'grus ha cang lhag par brtson par mi byed pa gang yin pa ste /
analyzed: brtson 'grus ha cang lhag par brtson par mi byed pa gang yin pa ste /
translated: It is not engaging in excessive effort.

original: skabs 'dir ni dmigs pa'i rgyu mtshan nyid gzung bar bya'o //
analyzed: skabs 'dir ni dmigs pa'i rgyu mtshan nyid gzung bar bya'o //
translated: In this context, the objective mental image itself is to be taken as the objective mental image.

original: yid la byed pa'o zhes bya bas ni btang snyoms kyi rgyu mtshan bsgom pa'i dus bstan te /
analyzed: yid la byed pa'o zhes bya bas ni btang snyoms kyi rgyu mtshan bsgom pa'i dus bstan te /
translated: The phrase “mental attention” indicates the time for cultivating the objective mental image of equanimity.

original: zhi gnas dang lhag mthong gi phyogs la sems bying ba dang rgod pa med pa'i dus su ni btang snyoms kyi rgyu mtshan bsgom pa'i dus yin te /
analyzed: zhi gnas dang lhag mthong gi phyogs la sems bying ba dang rgod pa med pa'i dus su ni btang snyoms kyi rgyu mtshan bsgom pa'i dus yin te /
translated: When the mind is neither depressed nor excited with regard to the factors that contribute to tranquility and insight, that is the time for cultivating the objective mental image of equanimity.

original: dus der btang snyoms kyi rgyu mtshan de lhun gyis grub par yid la byed pas yid la byas na sems zhum pa dang rgod pa la sogs pa mi mthun pa'i phyogs thag ring du spong zhing dngos po'i mtha' dang ; dgos pa yongs su grub pas rab tu phye ba spangs pa phun sum tshogs pa dang /
analyzed: dus der btang snyoms kyi rgyu mtshan de lhun gyis grub par yid la byed pas yid la byas na sems zhum pa dang rgod pa la sogs pa mi mthun pa'i phyogs thag ring du spong zhing dngos po'i mtha' dang ; dgos pa yongs su grub pas rab tu phye ba spangs pa phun sum tshogs pa dang /
translated: At that time, by means of mental attention that is spontaneous, one cultivates the objective mental image of equanimity. This mental attention eliminates the resistances, such as mental depression and excitement, and it is distinguished by the perfection of abandonment and the perfection of direct intuition, which are respectively characterized by the culmination of the process of elimination and the culmination of the process of realization.

original: ye shes phun sum tshogs pa'i 'bras bu thob par 'gyur ro zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: ye shes phun sum tshogs pa'i 'bras bu thob par 'gyur ro zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: This is the meaning of the statement: “one attains the result that is the perfection of abandonment and the perfection of direct intuition.”

original: bcom ldan 'das sems kyi mtshan ma gang lags zhes bya bas ni sngar lhag mthong gi dmigs pa'i rgyu mtshan bstan pa de'i bshad pa zhus pa yin no //
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das sems kyi mtshan ma gang lags zhes bya bas ni sngar lhag mthong gi dmigs pa'i rgyu mtshan bstan pa de'i bshad pa zhus pa yin no //
translated: The Blessed One, what are the signs of mind? By this, he asks for an explanation of the previously taught sign of the object of insight.

original: byams pa lhag mthong gi dmigs pa ting nge 'dzin gyi spyod yul rnam par rtog pa dang bcas pa'i gzugs brnyan gang yin pa'i zhes bya bas ni bshad pas /
analyzed: byams pa lhag mthong gi dmigs pa ting nge 'dzin gyi spyod yul rnam par rtog pa dang bcas pa'i gzugs brnyan gang yin pa'i zhes bya bas ni bshad pas /
translated: Maitreya, the sign of insight is any conceptual image that is the object of concentration.  By this, he explains.

original: lhag mthong gi rgyu mtshan bsgom pa'i dus mi shes pa rnam par gzhig cing chud mi za bar bya ba'i phyir gdags pa gtan la dbab pa bstan te /
analyzed: lhag mthong gi rgyu mtshan bsgom pa'i dus mi shes pa rnam par gzhig cing chud mi za bar bya ba'i phyir gdags pa gtan la dbab pa bstan te /
translated: In order to eliminate the ignorance of the time for cultivating the sign of insight and to prevent waste, he teaches the ascertainment of designation.

original: sems kyi mtshan ma zhes bya ba ni sems kyi rnam pa ste /
analyzed: sems kyi mtshan ma zhes bya ba ni sems kyi rnam pa ste /
translated: The term sign of mind refers to the aspect of mind.

original: rnam par rtog pa dang bcas pa'i gzugs brnyan yin par bstan to //
analyzed: rnam par rtog pa dang bcas pa'i gzugs brnyan yin par bstan to //
translated: It is taught to be a conceptual image.

original: bar chad ma mchis pa'i sems gang lags zhes bya bas ni sngar zhi gnas kyi dmigs pa'i rgyu mtshan bstan pa de'i bshad pa zhus pa yin no //
analyzed: bar chad ma mchis pa'i sems gang lags zhes bya bas ni sngar zhi gnas kyi dmigs pa'i rgyu mtshan bstan pa de'i bshad pa zhus pa yin no //
translated: What is the uninterrupted mind? By this, he asks for an explanation of the previously taught sign of the object of serenity.

original: byams pa zhi gnas kyi dmigs pa gzugs brnyan la dmigs pa'i sems gang yin pa'o zhes bya bas ni bshad pas zhi gnas kyi rgyu mtshan bsgom pa'i dus mi shes pa rnam par bshig cing chud mi za bar bya ba'i phyir gdags pa gtan la dbab pa bstan
analyzed: byams pa zhi gnas kyi dmigs pa gzugs brnyan la dmigs pa'i sems gang yin pa'o zhes bya bas ni bshad pas zhi gnas kyi rgyu mtshan bsgom pa'i dus mi shes pa rnam par bshig cing chud mi za bar bya ba'i phyir gdags pa gtan la dbab pa bstan
translated: The statement Maitreya, it is the mind that observes the image, the object of observation of calm abiding is a teaching of the ascertainment of designations in order to destroy the ignorance of those who do not know the time for cultivating the signs of calm abiding and to prevent their wasting their lives.🔽The statement it is the uninterrupted mind is a teaching of the ascertainment of designations in order to destroy the ignorance of those who do not know the time for cultivating insight and to prevent their wasting their lives.🔽The statement it is the uninterrupted mind is a teaching of the ascertainment of designations in order to destroy the ignorance of those who do not know the time for cultivating insight and to prevent their wasting their lives.

original: de rtogs nas kyang de bzhin du yid la byed pa gang yin pa'o zhes bya bas ni bshad pas btang snyoms kyi rgyu mtshan bsgom pa'i dus mi shes pa rnam par gzhig cing chud mi za bar bya ba'i phyir gdags pa gtan la dbab pa bstan te /
analyzed: de rtogs nas kyang de bzhin du yid la byed pa gang yin pa'o zhes bya bas ni bshad pas btang snyoms kyi rgyu mtshan bsgom pa'i dus mi shes pa rnam par gzhig cing chud mi za bar bya ba'i phyir gdags pa gtan la dbab pa bstan te /
translated: By this, the treatise is taught in order to eliminate the ignorance of the time for cultivating the three reasons and to prevent their loss.

original: sems rtse gcig pa nyid ces bya bas dmigs pa gcig tu gyur pa ste /🔽gzugs brnyan rnam pa gnyis kyi dmigs pa las yang dag par 'das nas /
analyzed: sems rtse gcig pa nyid ces bya bas dmigs pa gcig tu gyur pa ste / gzugs brnyan rnam pa gnyis kyi dmigs pa las yang dag par 'das nas /
translated: One-pointedness of mind means the mind becomes one-pointed.

original: dngos po'i mtha' dang dgos pa yongs su grub pa'i dmigs pa gcig la zung du 'brel pa'i sems so //
analyzed: dngos po'i mtha' dang dgos pa yongs su grub pa'i dmigs pa gcig la zung du 'brel pa'i sems so //
translated: Having transcended the two types of object of observation, the object of observation of the limit of entities and the object of observation of the accomplishment of purpose are combined into one.

original: de ltar rgyu mtshan gsum bsgom pa'i dus mi shes pa de rnam par bshig cing rgyu mtshan gsum bsgom pa'i dus shes pas rab tu phye ba'i zhi gnas dang lhag mthong gi lam gyi ngo bo nyid de las rab tu nyams par mi 'gyur zhing chud mi za
analyzed: de ltar rgyu mtshan gsum bsgom pa'i dus mi shes pa de rnam par bshig cing rgyu mtshan gsum bsgom pa'i dus shes pas rab tu phye ba'i zhi gnas dang lhag mthong gi lam gyi ngo bo nyid de las rab tu nyams par mi 'gyur zhing chud mi za
translated: Thus, having eliminated the ignorance of the time for cultivating the three reasons, by knowing the time for cultivating the three reasons, one does not fall away from the essence of the path of śamatha and vipaśyanā that is distinguished by that and does not waste it.

original: bar bya ba'i phyir bstan pa dang bshad pas rgyu mtshan gsum bsgom pa'i dus shes pa gdags pa gtan la dbab pa bstan pa ni rgyu mtshan gsum bsgom pa'i dus mi shes pa rnam par gzhig cing chud mi za bar bya ba'i phyir gdags pa gtan la dbab🔽pa yin no //
analyzed: bar bya ba'i phyir bstan pa dang bshad pas rgyu mtshan gsum bsgom pa'i dus shes pa gdags pa gtan la dbab pa bstan pa ni rgyu mtshan gsum bsgom pa'i dus mi shes pa rnam par gzhig cing chud mi za bar bya ba'i phyir gdags pa gtan la dbab pa yin no //
translated: The presentation of the ascertainment of designation is taught in order to destroy the ignorance of the time of meditating on the three reasons and to prevent their loss.

original: de'i 'og tu cung zad tsam gyis chog par 'dzin pa rnam par gzhig cing chud mi za bar bya ba'i phyir gdags pa gtan la dbab pa'i tshig gi don la sogs pa bshad par bya ste /
analyzed: de'i 'og tu cung zad tsam gyis chog par 'dzin pa rnam par gzhig cing chud mi za bar bya ba'i phyir gdags pa gtan la dbab pa'i tshig gi don la sogs pa bshad par bya ste /
translated: After that, in order to destroy the grasping of mere slight satisfaction and to prevent its loss, the meaning of the words of the ascertainment of designation and so on should be explained.

original: cung zad tsam gyis chog par 'dzin pa zhes bya ba ni zhi gnas dang lhag mthong gi lam gyi ngo bo nyid ni gzhi tha dad pa las byung ba dang / rnam pa tha dad pa dang / gnas skabs tha dad pa du ma yod pas rnal 'byor pas de dag thams cad yongs su shes par bya zhing kun chub par bya dgos pa yin na /
analyzed: cung zad tsam gyis chog par 'dzin pa zhes bya ba ni zhi gnas dang lhag mthong gi lam gyi ngo bo nyid ni gzhi tha dad pa las byung ba dang / rnam pa tha dad pa dang / gnas skabs tha dad pa du ma yod pas rnal 'byor pas de dag thams cad yongs su shes par bya zhing kun chub par bya dgos pa yin na /
translated: The phrase to be satisfied with a little means that the essence of the path of serenity and insight is made up of many different bases, aspects, and states. Therefore, the practitioner must understand and master all of them.

original: de dag la 'ga' tsam zhig yongs su shes par byas shing kun chub bar byas pas chog par 'dzin pa ni cung zad tsam gyis chog par 'dzin pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: de dag la 'ga' tsam zhig yongs su shes par byas shing kun chub bar byas pas chog par 'dzin pa ni cung zad tsam gyis chog par 'dzin pa zhes bya'o //
translated: To be satisfied with understanding and mastering only a few of them is called to be satisfied with a little.

original: rnam par gzhig cing chud mi za bar bya ba'i phyir gdags pa gtan la dbab pa zhes bya ba ni cung zad tsam gyis chog par 'dzin pa de rnam par @166b gzhig cing /
analyzed: rnam par gzhig cing chud mi za bar bya ba'i phyir gdags pa gtan la dbab pa zhes bya ba ni cung zad tsam gyis chog par 'dzin pa de rnam par @166b gzhig cing /
translated: The phrase to establish a presentation in order to destroy and not to waste means that, in order to destroy the satisfaction with a little, one must understand the presentation of the path of serenity and insight.

original: cung zad tsam gyis chog par mi 'dzin pas rab tu phye ba'i zhi gnas dang lhag mthong gi lam ngo bo nyid de las rab tu nyams par mi 'gyur zhing chud mi za bar bya ba'i phyir bstan pa dang bshad pas cung zad tsam gyis chog par mi
analyzed: cung zad tsam gyis chog par mi 'dzin pas rab tu phye ba'i zhi gnas dang lhag mthong gi lam ngo bo nyid de las rab tu nyams par mi 'gyur zhing chud mi za bar bya ba'i phyir bstan pa dang bshad pas cung zad tsam gyis chog par mi
translated: It is taught and explained in order to prevent the loss of that path.

original: 'dzin par gdags pa gtan la dbab pa'o //
analyzed: 'dzin par gdags pa gtan la dbab pa'o //
translated: The designation of the path is the determination of the path.

original: de la mtshams sbyar ba ji lta bu zhe na /
analyzed: de la mtshams sbyar ba ji lta bu zhe na /
translated: What is the connection here?🔽Here, the noble Maitreya, having considered the thoughts of others who think:

original: 'dir 'phags pa byams pas gzhan dag 'di snyam du rnal 'byor gyis yongs su bsdus pa'i zhi gnas dang lhag mthong gi lam gyi ngo bo nyid de gzhi gang las byung ba rnam pa du yod gnas skabs gang dag na yod snyam du sems pa rnams kyi bsam🔽pa la brtags nas /
analyzed: 'dir 'phags pa byams pas gzhan dag 'di snyam du rnal 'byor gyis yongs su bsdus pa'i zhi gnas dang lhag mthong gi lam gyi ngo bo nyid de gzhi gang las byung ba rnam pa du yod gnas skabs gang dag na yod snyam du sems pa rnams kyi bsam pa la brtags nas /
translated: “What is the nature of the path of serenity and insight which is included in yoga? What is its basis? How many kinds are there? In what states does it occur?”

original: bcom ldan 'das lhag mthong la rnam pa du mchis zhes bya ba la sogs pa zhub rnam pa gnyis zhus par sbyar ro //
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das lhag mthong la rnam pa du mchis zhes bya ba la sogs pa zhub rnam pa gnyis zhus par sbyar ro //
translated: asked the Lord two questions, beginning with “How many kinds of insight are there?”

original: byams pa rnam pa gsum ste zhes bya ba la sogs pas ni bstan pas lhag mthong cung zad tsam gyis chog par 'dzin pa rnam par gzhig cing chud mi za bar bya ba'i phyir gdags pa gtan la dbab pa bstan to //🔽mtshan ma las byung ba dang / yongs su tshol ba las byung ba dang / so sor rtog pa las byung ba'o zhes bya ba ni lhag mthong gi lam gyi sgo gsum po mtshan ma tsam gyi rjes su zhugs pa dang / yongs su btsal ba'i rjes su zhugs pa dang /
analyzed: byams pa rnam pa gsum ste zhes bya ba la sogs pas ni bstan pas lhag mthong cung zad tsam gyis chog par 'dzin pa rnam par gzhig cing chud mi za bar bya ba'i phyir gdags pa gtan la dbab pa bstan to // mtshan ma las byung ba dang / yongs su tshol ba las byung ba dang / so sor rtog pa las byung ba'o zhes bya ba ni lhag mthong gi lam gyi sgo gsum po mtshan ma tsam gyi rjes su zhugs pa dang / yongs su btsal ba'i rjes su zhugs pa dang /
translated: The three kinds of loving kindness, etc. are taught in order to eliminate the grasping at the sufficiency of a mere slight insight through the teaching.🔽The three kinds of insight are: that which arises from signs, that which arises from thorough searching, and that which arises from discernment.

original: yongs su btsal ba la so sor rtog pa'i rjes su zhugs pa zhes ji skad bstan pa dang go rims bzhin du sbyar ro //
analyzed: yongs su btsal ba la so sor rtog pa'i rjes su zhugs pa zhes ji skad bstan pa dang go rims bzhin du sbyar ro //
translated: These should be connected in the same order as they are taught, with the three doors of insight being the path: that which engages in mere signs, that which engages in thorough searching, and that which engages in discernment of thorough searching.

original: de yang thos pa las byung ba dang / bsams pa las byung ba dang / bsgoms pa las byung ba yin no //
analyzed: de yang thos pa las byung ba dang / bsams pa las byung ba dang / bsgoms pa las byung ba yin no //
translated: Moreover, it arises from hearing, reflection, and meditation.

original: yang dmigs pa rnam par dag pas rab tu phye ba dang / lam rnam par dag pas rab tu phye ba dang / dri ma med pas rnam par dag pa dang / rang bzhin rnam par dag pas rab tu phye ba yang yin te /
analyzed: yang dmigs pa rnam par dag pas rab tu phye ba dang / lam rnam par dag pas rab tu phye ba dang / dri ma med pas rnam par dag pa dang / rang bzhin rnam par dag pas rab tu phye ba yang yin te /
translated: Moreover, it is distinguished by the purity of its object, by the purity of its path, by the purity of its stainlessness, and by the purity of its intrinsic nature.

original: de la dmigs pa rnam par dag pa zhes bya ba ni rtog pa dang bcas dpyod pa dang bcas pa'i ting nge 'dzin gyi spyod yul dam pa'i chos thos pa dang / gzung ba 'am /
analyzed: de la dmigs pa rnam par dag pa zhes bya ba ni rtog pa dang bcas dpyod pa dang bcas pa'i ting nge 'dzin gyi spyod yul dam pa'i chos thos pa dang / gzung ba 'am /
translated: The purity of its object is the object of the meditative concentration that is accompanied by both discursive thought and discrimination, and it is the holy Dharma that is heard and retained.

original: dge ba'i bshes gnyen gyi gdams ngag dang rjes su bstan pa la mnyam par gzhag pa'i sa pa yid la byed pa dmigs pa'o //
analyzed: dge ba'i bshes gnyen gyi gdams ngag dang rjes su bstan pa la mnyam par gzhag pa'i sa pa yid la byed pa dmigs pa'o //
translated: Or else, it is the object of the mental attention that is on the stage of meditative equipoise, which is the instruction and teaching of a spiritual friend.

original: lam rnam par dag pa zhes bya ba ni de nyid la dmigs pa rnam par dag pas dmigs par byed cing /🔽bsams pa las byung ba'i shes rab kyis sems par byed /🔽rtog par byed /🔽'jal bar byed /
analyzed: lam rnam par dag pa zhes bya ba ni de nyid la dmigs pa rnam par dag pas dmigs par byed cing / bsams pa las byung ba'i shes rab kyis sems par byed / rtog par byed / 'jal bar byed /
translated: The purity of its path is the path that is purified by the purity of its object.

original: nye bar rtog par byed pa'i lam mo //
analyzed: nye bar rtog par byed pa'i lam mo //
translated: It is the path that is the reflection, the thought, the investigation, the evaluation, and the thorough investigation of that very object by the wisdom that arises from reflection.

original: dri ma med pa rnam par dag pa zhes bya ba ni de nyid la @167a * //🔽lam rnam par dag pas bsams shing brtags la gzhal zhing /
analyzed: dri ma med pa rnam par dag pa zhes bya ba ni de nyid la @167a * // lam rnam par dag pas bsams shing brtags la gzhal zhing /
translated: The expression “purified and immaculate” refers to the same object.🔽It is the wisdom that arises from meditation, which is to say, it is the wisdom that is born of reflection and investigation, and that is born of meditation.

original: nye bar brtags nas bsgoms pa las byung ba'i shes rab kyis ji ltar rnam par gzhag pa de bzhin du so sor rtog par byed pa na /
analyzed: nye bar brtags nas bsgoms pa las byung ba'i shes rab kyis ji ltar rnam par gzhag pa de bzhin du so sor rtog par byed pa na /
translated: When one examines and investigates that object with the wisdom that arises from meditation, and when one then realizes that object in accordance with the way it has been established,

original: nyon mongs pa'i sgrib pa rnam par dag pas sems rnam par grol ba'o //
analyzed: nyon mongs pa'i sgrib pa rnam par dag pas sems rnam par grol ba'o //
translated: one’s mind is liberated through the purification of the obscurations of the mental afflictions.

original: rang bzhin rnam par dag pa zhes bya ba ni de nyid kyi tshe shes bya'i sgrib pa rnam par dag pas shes rab rnam par grol ba'o //
analyzed: rang bzhin rnam par dag pa zhes bya ba ni de nyid kyi tshe shes bya'i sgrib pa rnam par dag pas shes rab rnam par grol ba'o //
translated: The expression “purified by nature” refers to the same object. At that time, one’s wisdom is liberated through the purification of the obscurations to that which needs to be known.

original: yang ltos pa'i rigs pa dang / bya ba byed pa'i rigs pa'i mtshan ma las byung ba dang / 'thad pas bsgrubs pa'i rigs pas yongs su tshol ba las byung ba dang / chos nyid kyi rigs pas so sor rtog pa las byung ba yin no //
analyzed: yang ltos pa'i rigs pa dang / bya ba byed pa'i rigs pa'i mtshan ma las byung ba dang / 'thad pas bsgrubs pa'i rigs pas yongs su tshol ba las byung ba dang / chos nyid kyi rigs pas so sor rtog pa las byung ba yin no //
translated: Moreover, the wisdom that arises from seeking is born from the signs of the reasoning of dependence and the reasoning of efficacy, and the wisdom that arises from thorough investigation is born from the reasoning of proof.

original: mtshan ma las byung ba gang zhe na zhes bya ba la sogs pas ni bshad pas lhag mthong cung zad tsam gyis chog par 'dzin pa'i rnam pa gzhig cing chud mi za bar bya ba'i phyir gdags pa gtan la dbab pa bstan to /
analyzed: mtshan ma las byung ba gang zhe na zhes bya ba la sogs pas ni bshad pas lhag mthong cung zad tsam gyis chog par 'dzin pa'i rnam pa gzhig cing chud mi za bar bya ba'i phyir gdags pa gtan la dbab pa bstan to /
translated: The passage beginning What is that derived from signs? teaches the ascertainment of the designation in order to destroy the aspect that is satisfied with just a little insight and to prevent its being wasted.

original: // / ting nge 'dzin gyi spyod yul rnam par rtog pa dang bcas pa'i gzugs brnyan 'ba' zhig yid la byed pa'i lhag mthong gang yin pa'o zhes bya ba ni mtshan ma tsam gyis rjes su zhugs pa'i sgo yin te /
analyzed: // / ting nge 'dzin gyi spyod yul rnam par rtog pa dang bcas pa'i gzugs brnyan 'ba' zhig yid la byed pa'i lhag mthong gang yin pa'o zhes bya ba ni mtshan ma tsam gyis rjes su zhugs pa'i sgo yin te /
translated: Insight is the attention that is concerned only with the conceptual image that is the domain of samadhi.

original: de ni sbyor ba'i lam gyi yid la byed pas rab tu phye ba'i lhag mthong thos pa las byung ba dang / dmigs pa rnam par dag pas rab tu phye ba dang / ltos pa'i rigs pa dang / bya ba byed pa'i mtshan ma'i rigs pa las byung ba yin no //
analyzed: de ni sbyor ba'i lam gyi yid la byed pas rab tu phye ba'i lhag mthong thos pa las byung ba dang / dmigs pa rnam par dag pas rab tu phye ba dang / ltos pa'i rigs pa dang / bya ba byed pa'i mtshan ma'i rigs pa las byung ba yin no //
translated: This is the door of entry into the mere sign, for it is insight that is distinguished by the attention of the path of preparation, that is derived from hearing, that is distinguished by the purity of its object, and that is derived from the reasoning of dependence and the reasoning of efficacy.

original: de dang der shes rab kyis shin tu legs par ma rtogs pa'i chos de dag nyid shin tu legs par rtogs par bya ba'i phyir yid la byed pa'i lhag mthong gang yin pa'o zhes bya bas ni yongs su btsal ba'i rjes su zhugs pa'i sgo yin te /🔽de ni sbyor ba mthar thug pa'i lam gyi yid la byed pas rab tu phye ba'i lhag mthong bsams pa las byung ba dang / lam rnam par dag pas rab tu phye ba dang / 'thad pas bsgrubs pa'i rigs pas yongs su tshol ba las byung ba yin no //
analyzed: de dang der shes rab kyis shin tu legs par ma rtogs pa'i chos de dag nyid shin tu legs par rtogs par bya ba'i phyir yid la byed pa'i lhag mthong gang yin pa'o zhes bya bas ni yongs su btsal ba'i rjes su zhugs pa'i sgo yin te / de ni sbyor ba mthar thug pa'i lam gyi yid la byed pas rab tu phye ba'i lhag mthong bsams pa las byung ba dang / lam rnam par dag pas rab tu phye ba dang / 'thad pas bsgrubs pa'i rigs pas yongs su tshol ba las byung ba yin no //
translated: That insight which is attention in order to understand well those dharmas that are not well understood by wisdom in this and that context.🔽This is the door of entry into thorough investigation, because it is the insight distinguished by the attention of the path of conclusion of practice, distinguished by the pure path, and distinguished by thorough investigation through reasoning by proof.

original: de la de dang der zhes bya ba ni sbyor ba mthar thug pa'i lam gyi yid la byed pas rab tu phye ba'i gzugs brnyan de dang de la'o /
analyzed: de la de dang der zhes bya ba ni sbyor ba mthar thug pa'i lam gyi yid la byed pas rab tu phye ba'i gzugs brnyan de dang de la'o /
translated: In this context, “in this and that” refers to the images distinguished by the attention of the path of conclusion of practice.

original: shes rab kyis zhes bya ba ni bsams pa las byung ba dang / lam rnam par dag pas rab tu phye ba dang / 'thad pas bsgrubs pa'i rigs pas yongs su tshol ba las byung ba'i shes rab kyis so //
analyzed: shes rab kyis zhes bya ba ni bsams pa las byung ba dang / lam rnam par dag pas rab tu phye ba dang / 'thad pas bsgrubs pa'i rigs pas yongs su tshol ba las byung ba'i shes rab kyis so //
translated: By wisdom means by the wisdom that arises from reflection and from the wisdom that arises from the investigation of what is correct, which is the investigation of the path that is pure.

original: shin tu legs par ma @167b rtogs pa'i chos de dag nyid ces bya ba ni sems kyi ngo bo nyid la gnyis med pa'i don rang rig par ma gyur pa'i gzugs brnyan gyi chos de dag nyid do //
analyzed: shin tu legs par ma @167b rtogs pa'i chos de dag nyid ces bya ba ni sems kyi ngo bo nyid la gnyis med pa'i don rang rig par ma gyur pa'i gzugs brnyan gyi chos de dag nyid do //
translated: Those very phenomena that are not well understood means those very phenomena that are not the object of reflexive awareness, which is the non-dual meaning of the nature of mind.

original: de dang der shes rab kyis shin tu legs par rtogs pa'i chos rnams la rnam par grol bas shin tu legs par bde ba dang reg par bya ba'i phyir yid la byed pa'i lhag mthong gang yin pa'o zhes bya bas ni yongs su btsal ba la so sor
analyzed: de dang der shes rab kyis shin tu legs par rtogs pa'i chos rnams la rnam par grol bas shin tu legs par bde ba dang reg par bya ba'i phyir yid la byed pa'i lhag mthong gang yin pa'o zhes bya bas ni yongs su btsal ba la so sor
translated: The insight that is mental attention to those very phenomena that are well understood by wisdom here and there, in order to experience the bliss of complete liberation means that, following the discernment of each of the investigations, one should practice the mental attention of insight.

original: rtog pa'i rjes su zhugs pa'i sgo yin te /
analyzed: rtog pa'i rjes su zhugs pa'i sgo yin te /
translated: This is the door of entry.

original: de ni sbyor ba mthar thug pa'i 'bras bu'i yid la byed pas rab tu phye ba'i lhag mthong bsgoms pa las byung ba dang / dri ma med par rnam par dag pa dang / rang bzhin rnam par dag pas rab tu phye ba dang / chos nyid kyi rigs pas so sor rtog pa las byung ba yin no //
analyzed: de ni sbyor ba mthar thug pa'i 'bras bu'i yid la byed pas rab tu phye ba'i lhag mthong bsgoms pa las byung ba dang / dri ma med par rnam par dag pa dang / rang bzhin rnam par dag pas rab tu phye ba dang / chos nyid kyi rigs pas so sor rtog pa las byung ba yin no //
translated: It is born from the cultivation of insight distinguished by the attention of the result of the culmination of practice, and it is distinguished by stainless purity and natural purity, and it is born from the discernment by the principle of reality.

original: de la der zhes bya ba ni sbyor ba mthar thug pa'i 'bras bu yid la byed pas rab tu phye ba'i don rnam par rig pa tsam nyid kyis rab tu phye ba sems kyi ngo bo nyid de dang de la'o //
analyzed: de la der zhes bya ba ni sbyor ba mthar thug pa'i 'bras bu yid la byed pas rab tu phye ba'i don rnam par rig pa tsam nyid kyis rab tu phye ba sems kyi ngo bo nyid de dang de la'o //
translated: There means in that very essence of mind distinguished by the attention of the result of the culmination of practice, distinguished by mere representation-only.

original: shes rab kyis zhes bya ba ni bsgoms pa las byung ba dang / dri ma med pa rnam par dag pa dang / rang bzhin rnam par dag pas rab tu phye ba dang / chos nyid kyi rigs pas so sor rtog pa las byung ba'i shes rab kyis so //
analyzed: shes rab kyis zhes bya ba ni bsgoms pa las byung ba dang / dri ma med pa rnam par dag pa dang / rang bzhin rnam par dag pas rab tu phye ba dang / chos nyid kyi rigs pas so sor rtog pa las byung ba'i shes rab kyis so //
translated: By wisdom means by the wisdom born from cultivation, distinguished by stainless purity and natural purity, and by the discernment by the principle of reality.

original: shin tu legs par rtogs pa'i chos rnams la zhes bya ba ni sems kyi ngo bo nyid la gnyis med pa'i don rang rig pa'i chos rnams la'o //
analyzed: shin tu legs par rtogs pa'i chos rnams la zhes bya ba ni sems kyi ngo bo nyid la gnyis med pa'i don rang rig pa'i chos rnams la'o //
translated: With regard to the Dharma that is very well understood, the Dharma of self-awareness of the non-duality of the nature of mind.

original: rnam par grol bas zhes bya bas ni dri ma med pa rnam par dag pa sems rnam par grol ba dang / rang bzhin rnam par dag pa shes rab rnam par grol bas so //🔽shin tu legs par bde ba la reg par bya ba'i phyir zhes bya ba ni dngos po dang dgos pa yongs su grub pa'i dmigs pa thob pas rab tu phye ba spangs pa phun sum tshogs pa dang ye shes phun sum tshogs pa'i 'bras bu thob par bya
analyzed: rnam par grol bas zhes bya bas ni dri ma med pa rnam par dag pa sems rnam par grol ba dang / rang bzhin rnam par dag pa shes rab rnam par grol bas so // shin tu legs par bde ba la reg par bya ba'i phyir zhes bya ba ni dngos po dang dgos pa yongs su grub pa'i dmigs pa thob pas rab tu phye ba spangs pa phun sum tshogs pa dang ye shes phun sum tshogs pa'i 'bras bu thob par bya
translated: By means of liberation, the liberation of mind that is stainless and pure, and the liberation of wisdom that is naturally pure.

original: ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: ba'i phyir ro //
translated: In order to touch the bliss that is very well understood, in order to attain the object that is the accomplishment of both the thing and the purpose, in order to attain the fruit of the perfection of abandonment and the perfection of wisdom.

original: bar chad med pa'i sems zhes bya ba ni zhi gnas kyi sems te /
analyzed: bar chad med pa'i sems zhes bya ba ni zhi gnas kyi sems te /
translated: The uninterrupted mind is the mind of śamatha,

original: de la bar chad med par lhag par lhag mthong 'byung ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de la bar chad med par lhag par lhag mthong 'byung ba'i phyir ro //
translated: because vipaśyanā arises uninterruptedly from it.

original: de'i rjes su 'brang bas zhes bya ba ni zhi gnas kyi sems de'i rjes su lhag mthong 'brang bas so //
analyzed: de'i rjes su 'brang bas zhes bya ba ni zhi gnas kyi sems de'i rjes su lhag mthong 'brang bas so //
translated: Following that means that insight follows that mind of serenity.

original: de yang rnam pa gsum du brjod par bya'o zhes bya ba ni zhi gnas kyi sems de'i rjes su 'brang ba ltag mthong rnam pa gsum yod pas de'i sngon du 'gro ba zhi gnas kyi sems de yang rnam pa gsum du brjod par bya'o zhes bya ba'i tha
analyzed: de yang rnam pa gsum du brjod par bya'o zhes bya ba ni zhi gnas kyi sems de'i rjes su 'brang ba ltag mthong rnam pa gsum yod pas de'i sngon du 'gro ba zhi gnas kyi sems de yang rnam pa gsum du brjod par bya'o zhes bya ba'i tha
translated: It should be described as having three aspects means that since insight has three aspects that follow that mind of serenity, that mind of serenity which precedes it should be described as having three aspects.

original: tshig ste / zhi gnas dang mtshan ma las byung ba dang / yongs su tshol ba las byung ba dang / so @168a * //
analyzed: tshig ste / zhi gnas dang mtshan ma las byung ba dang / yongs su tshol ba las byung ba dang / so @168a * //
translated: The

original: sor rtog pa las byung ba rnam pa gsum yod par brjod par bya'o //
analyzed: sor rtog pa las byung ba rnam pa gsum yod par brjod par bya'o //
translated: word should is understood to mean that insight should be described as having three aspects.🔽It should be described as having three aspects: insight that arises from serenity, insight that arises from signs, and insight that arises from thorough investigation.

original: 'dir bstan pa dang bshad pas zhi gnas cung zad tsam gyis chog par 'dzin pa rnam par gzhig cing chud mi za bar bya ba'i phyir gdags pa gtan la dbab pa bstan pa yang lhag mthong las bzlog pa'i tshul gyis ci rigs par rig par bya ste ;
analyzed: 'dir bstan pa dang bshad pas zhi gnas cung zad tsam gyis chog par 'dzin pa rnam par gzhig cing chud mi za bar bya ba'i phyir gdags pa gtan la dbab pa bstan pa yang lhag mthong las bzlog pa'i tshul gyis ci rigs par rig par bya ste ;
translated: This presentation of the ascertainment of designations is taught in order to destroy the complacency of those who think that a little bit of serenity is enough and to prevent their wasting their lives. It should be understood that it is the opposite of insight.

original: de dag ni zhi gnas dang lhag mthong gi lam gyi ngo bo nyid gzhi gang las byung ba dang / rnam pa du yod pa bstan pa yin no //
analyzed: de dag ni zhi gnas dang lhag mthong gi lam gyi ngo bo nyid gzhi gang las byung ba dang / rnam pa du yod pa bstan pa yin no //
translated: These present the basis from which the paths of serenity and insight arise and the number of their aspects.

original: yang zhi gnas ni rnam pa brgyad de zhes bya ba dang / yang rnam pa bzhi ste zhes bya bas ni bsam gtan dang / gzugs med pa'i rab tu dbye bas nang du bsdus pa rnam pa brgyad yod pa'i phyir dang / tshad med pa bzhi yang gnod sems la sogs pa sems yongs su gdung ba'i zhi ba'i ngo bo nyid yin pa'i phyir zhi gnas gtso cher rnam par bshad par zad kyi /
analyzed: yang zhi gnas ni rnam pa brgyad de zhes bya ba dang / yang rnam pa bzhi ste zhes bya bas ni bsam gtan dang / gzugs med pa'i rab tu dbye bas nang du bsdus pa rnam pa brgyad yod pa'i phyir dang / tshad med pa bzhi yang gnod sems la sogs pa sems yongs su gdung ba'i zhi ba'i ngo bo nyid yin pa'i phyir zhi gnas gtso cher rnam par bshad par zad kyi /
translated: Again, serenity is eightfold and again, it is fourfold refers to the eight internal states subsumed by the classifications of the absorptions and formless states and the four immeasurables, which are explained as being primarily serenity since they are the nature of the pacification of mental torment such as malice.

original: de dag gi rjes su 'brang ba'i lhag mthong yang rnam pa de snyed yod pa yin pas /
analyzed: de dag gi rjes su 'brang ba'i lhag mthong yang rnam pa de snyed yod pa yin pas /
translated: However, the insight that accompanies them is also of that number.

original: de dag gis ni zhi gnas dang lhag mthong gi ngo bo nyid gnas skabs gang dag na yod pa bstan pa yin te /
analyzed: de dag gis ni zhi gnas dang lhag mthong gi ngo bo nyid gnas skabs gang dag na yod pa bstan pa yin te /
translated: Therefore this passage teaches the context in which the nature of serenity and insight exist.

original: de ltar cung zad tsam gyis chog par 'dzin pa de rnam par gzhig cing cung zad tsam gyis chog par mi 'dzin pas rab tu phye ba'i zhi gnas dang lhag mthong gi lam gyi ngo bo nyid de las rab tu nyams par mi 'gyur zhing /
analyzed: de ltar cung zad tsam gyis chog par 'dzin pa de rnam par gzhig cing cung zad tsam gyis chog par mi 'dzin pas rab tu phye ba'i zhi gnas dang lhag mthong gi lam gyi ngo bo nyid de las rab tu nyams par mi 'gyur zhing /
translated: Thus, since one does not hold that a little is sufficient, one does not lose the essence of the path of serenity and insight that is distinguished by the destruction of the view that a little is sufficient.

original: chud mi za bar bya ba'i phyir bstan pa dang bshad pa cung zad tsam gyis chog par mi 'dzin par gdags pa gtan la dbab pa bstan pa ni cung zad tsam gyis chog bar 'dzin pa rnam par gzhig cing chud mi za bar bya ba'i phyir gdags pa🔽gtan la dbab pa yin no //
analyzed: chud mi za bar bya ba'i phyir bstan pa dang bshad pa cung zad tsam gyis chog par mi 'dzin par gdags pa gtan la dbab pa bstan pa ni cung zad tsam gyis chog bar 'dzin pa rnam par gzhig cing chud mi za bar bya ba'i phyir gdags pa gtan la dbab pa yin no //
translated: In order to prevent the loss of the teachings and explanations, one does not hold that a little is sufficient. The teaching of the principles of designation is the principles of designation for the destruction of the view that a little is sufficient and for the prevention of loss.

original: de'i 'og tu dbang po yongs su nyams pa rnam par gzhig cing chud mi za bar bya ba'i phyir gdags pa gtan la dbab pa'i tshig gi don la sogs pa bshad par bya ste /
analyzed: de'i 'og tu dbang po yongs su nyams pa rnam par gzhig cing chud mi za bar bya ba'i phyir gdags pa gtan la dbab pa'i tshig gi don la sogs pa bshad par bya ste /
translated: After that, in order to destroy the degeneration of the faculties and to prevent their loss, the meaning of the words of the principles of designation should be explained.

original: dbang po yongs su nyams pa zhes bya ba ni mngon par shes pa dka' ba'i lam ste /
analyzed: dbang po yongs su nyams pa zhes bya ba ni mngon par shes pa dka' ba'i lam ste /
translated: The path that is difficult to penetrate is called the degeneration of the faculties.

original: skabs 'dir byang chub sems dpa' chos la mi gnas pa'i zhi gnas dang / lhag mthong la brten nas dad pas rjes su 'brang ba dbang po rtul por gdags pa gang yin pa'o //🔽rnam par gzhig cing chud mi za bar bya ba'i phyir gdags pa gtan la dbab pa zhes bya ba ni dbang po yongs su nyams pa de rnam par gzhig cing /🔽dbang po yongs su ma nyams pas rab tu phye ba'i zhi gnas dang lhag mthong gi lam gyi ngo bo nyid de las rab tu nyams par mi 'gyur zhing chud mi za bar bya ba'i phyir bstan pa dang @168b bshad pas dbang po yongs su ma nyams par
analyzed: skabs 'dir byang chub sems dpa' chos la mi gnas pa'i zhi gnas dang / lhag mthong la brten nas dad pas rjes su 'brang ba dbang po rtul por gdags pa gang yin pa'o // rnam par gzhig cing chud mi za bar bya ba'i phyir gdags pa gtan la dbab pa zhes bya ba ni dbang po yongs su nyams pa de rnam par gzhig cing / dbang po yongs su ma nyams pas rab tu phye ba'i zhi gnas dang lhag mthong gi lam gyi ngo bo nyid de las rab tu nyams par mi 'gyur zhing chud mi za bar bya ba'i phyir bstan pa dang @168b bshad pas dbang po yongs su ma nyams par
translated: In this context, it is the bodhisattva who is designated as a person of dull faculties, who is a follower of faith, in dependence on calm abiding and insight that do not abide in the Dharma.🔽The ascertainment of designation in order to destroy and not waste is the ascertainment of designation of the person of undiminished faculties, which is the essence of the path of calm abiding and insight that is distinguished by the undiminished faculties.

original: gdags pa gtan la dbab pa'o //
analyzed: gdags pa gtan la dbab pa'o //
translated: It is taught and explained in order to destroy the degeneration of the faculties and not waste the path of calm abiding and insight that is distinguished by the undiminished faculties.

original: de la mtshams sbyar ba ji lta bu zhe na /
analyzed: de la mtshams sbyar ba ji lta bu zhe na /
translated: What is the connection?

original: 'dir 'phags pa byams pas gzhan dag 'di snyam du rnal 'byor gyis yongs su bsdus pa'i zhi gnas dang lhag mthong gi lam gyi ngo bo nyid de la /🔽mngon par shes pa myur ba sla ba'i lam yang yod /
analyzed: 'dir 'phags pa byams pas gzhan dag 'di snyam du rnal 'byor gyis yongs su bsdus pa'i zhi gnas dang lhag mthong gi lam gyi ngo bo nyid de la / mngon par shes pa myur ba sla ba'i lam yang yod /
translated: Here, the noble Maitreya, having examined the thoughts of others who think, “In the essence of the path of serenity and insight that is included in yoga,🔽there is a path of quick higher perception that is easy,

original: mngon par shes pa bul ba dga' ba'i lam yang yod na /
analyzed: mngon par shes pa bul ba dga' ba'i lam yang yod na /
translated: and there is a path of slow higher perception that is difficult.

original: de dag gi bye brag ji ltar shes par bya snyam du sems pa rnams kyi bsam pa la brtags nas /🔽bcom ldan 'das zhi gnas dang lhag mthong ni chos la gnas pa zhes kyang bgyi /
analyzed: de dag gi bye brag ji ltar shes par bya snyam du sems pa rnams kyi bsam pa la brtags nas / bcom ldan 'das zhi gnas dang lhag mthong ni chos la gnas pa zhes kyang bgyi /
translated: How should we understand the differences between them?”

original: chos la mi gnas pa zhes kyang bgyi na /
analyzed: chos la mi gnas pa zhes kyang bgyi na /
translated: Maitreya, when you ask, “Serenity and insight are called ‘based on phenomena’ and also ‘not based on phenomena.’

original: chos la gnas pa ni gang lags /
analyzed: chos la gnas pa ni gang lags /
translated: What is based on phenomena?

original: chos la mi gnas pa ni gang lags zhes bya ba zhus par sbyar ro //
analyzed: chos la mi gnas pa ni gang lags zhes bya ba zhus par sbyar ro //
translated: What is not based on phenomena?”

original: byams pa ji ltar gzung ba dang bsam pa'i chos kyi mtshan ma'i rjes su 'brang bas /
analyzed: byams pa ji ltar gzung ba dang bsam pa'i chos kyi mtshan ma'i rjes su 'brang bas /
translated: Maitreya, when you follow the signs of phenomena that are apprehended and imagined,

original: don la zhi gnas dang lhag mthong gang yin pa de ni chos la gnas pa yin no zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni bstan pas dbang po yongs su nyams pa rnam par gzhig cing chud mi za bar bya ba'i phyir gdags pa gtan la dbab pa bstan
analyzed: don la zhi gnas dang lhag mthong gang yin pa de ni chos la gnas pa yin no zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni bstan pas dbang po yongs su nyams pa rnam par gzhig cing chud mi za bar bya ba'i phyir gdags pa gtan la dbab pa bstan
translated: The teaching of the summary verses is for the purpose of refuting the degeneration of the faculties and for the purpose of not wasting the teaching.

original: to // de la ji ltar gzung ba dang bsam pa'i chos zhes bya ba ni chos gdags pa rnam par gzhag pa ji skad bstan pa dag bdag nyid kyi rkyen gyi stobs kyis legs par thob pa la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: to // de la ji ltar gzung ba dang bsam pa'i chos zhes bya ba ni chos gdags pa rnam par gzhag pa ji skad bstan pa dag bdag nyid kyi rkyen gyi stobs kyis legs par thob pa la sogs pa'o //
translated: Therein, the Dharma that is apprehended and contemplated is the teaching of the Dharma that is presented, which is well obtained by the power of one's own conditions and so forth.

original: mtshan ma'i zhes bya ba ni tshig dang yi ge la sogs pa'i mtshan ma'i 'o //
analyzed: mtshan ma'i zhes bya ba ni tshig dang yi ge la sogs pa'i mtshan ma'i 'o //
translated: The sign is the sign of words, letters, and so forth.🔽Following means based on that, it is the meaning of that.

original: rjes su 'brang bas zhes bya ba ni de la brten nas zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go / don la zhes bya ba ni don rtogs par bya ba'i phyir zhes bya ba'i tha tshig ste /
analyzed: rjes su 'brang bas zhes bya ba ni de la brten nas zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go / don la zhes bya ba ni don rtogs par bya ba'i phyir zhes bya ba'i tha tshig ste /
translated: The meaning is for the purpose of realizing the meaning.

original: chos de'i don rtogs par bya ba'i phyir bsgoms pa las byung ba'i zhi gnas dang lhag mthong gi gang yin pa de ni chos gdags pa rnam par gzhag pa la gnas pa yin no zhes bya bar sbyar ro //
analyzed: chos de'i don rtogs par bya ba'i phyir bsgoms pa las byung ba'i zhi gnas dang lhag mthong gi gang yin pa de ni chos gdags pa rnam par gzhag pa la gnas pa yin no zhes bya bar sbyar ro //
translated: That which is the calm abiding and insight arisen from meditation for the purpose of realizing the meaning of that doctrine is the one who abides in the presentation of the designation of doctrine.

original: gzung ba dang bsams pa'i chos la mi ltos par zhes bya ba ni des bdag nyid kyi rkyen gyi stobs kyis chos gdags pa rnam par gzhag pa ji skad bstan pa de dag gzung ba la sogs par mi nus pas mdo'i sde la sogs pa'i chos gzung ba
analyzed: gzung ba dang bsams pa'i chos la mi ltos par zhes bya ba ni des bdag nyid kyi rkyen gyi stobs kyis chos gdags pa rnam par gzhag pa ji skad bstan pa de dag gzung ba la sogs par mi nus pas mdo'i sde la sogs pa'i chos gzung ba
translated: Not relying on the doctrine that is apprehended and contemplated means that, by the power of his own condition, he is unable to apprehend and so forth the presentation of the designation of doctrine as it has been taught.

original: dang bsams pa med par zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: dang bsams pa med par zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: The meaning of not apprehending and not contemplating the doctrine of the sutra collection and so forth is as follows.

original: gzhan gyis zhes bya ba ni gzhan gyi rkyen gyis 'jug pa yin gyi rang gi rkyen gyi stobs kyis ni ma yin pa'o //
analyzed: gzhan gyis zhes bya ba ni gzhan gyi rkyen gyis 'jug pa yin gyi rang gi rkyen gyi stobs kyis ni ma yin pa'o //
translated: Others means that he engages by the condition of others, but not by the power of his own condition.

original: gdams ngag ces bya bas ni rtogs par bya ba'i ngag ste /
analyzed: gdams ngag ces bya bas ni rtogs par bya ba'i ngag ste /
translated: Instruction refers to the words that are to be realized.

original: dang po lung phog pa'o //
analyzed: dang po lung phog pa'o //
translated: First, the transmission of scripture.

original: rjes su bstan pa zhes bya ba ni rtogs pa chud mi za bar bya ba'i phyir rjes su bstan pa'o //
analyzed: rjes su bstan pa zhes bya ba ni rtogs pa chud mi za bar bya ba'i phyir rjes su bstan pa'o //
translated: Subsequent instruction is instruction for the purpose of preventing the loss of realization.

The meaning is the meditative development of both serenity and insight.🔽Thus, the meaning of the instruction and subsequent instruction given by another is to be realized.
